PREPARATION OF SOIL SURFACES Revegetation and landscaping may follow on from new road works or be undertaken within an established roadside or borrow pit .
The management of the existing site vegetation and topsoil and weed control activities during clearing and earthworks can facilitate or make revegetation more difficult .
Where revegetation follows on from new road works it is critical to ensure that the specifications for CLEARING and EARTHWORKS are coordinated with and complement the REVEGETATION AND LANDSCAPING Specifications .
Where revegetation occurs within an established roadside the soil preparation and weed control occurs in response to the site conditions and reflected in the design drawings and Specifications. . WATERING Revegetation is like growing agricultural crops and subject to the local weather conditions .
Wherever practical watering in the first growing season to complement the rainfall should be used to promote the establishment of vegetation .
The Superintendent should confirm the water source quality potable if available and watering system proposed by the Contractor .
There are four general types of irrigation for possible use in revegetation works .
Sprinkler systems relatively costly need to be designed and good water supply .
Drip or Trickle system less cost temporary permanent above or below ground Watering hose limited and not very efficient .
Watering form a water truck limited access and use .
The selection of watering system is dependant on availability of suitable water and size of area to be treated .
If area is m then a drip or sprinkler system may be more efficient .
Regional advice should be sought on the most appropriate watering system for the project size and location . .
STEEP BATTER SLOPES Project Manager must ensure that the design of batters is suitable for the proposed revegetation measures .
Key locations for attention are steep batter slopes where subsoil rock and groundwater may cause instability of topsoil and vegetation .
Additional work in finishing of batters may be required to facilitate revegetationlandscaping works .
The risk of erosion is directly proportional to the length of time a disturbed soil area is exposed without vegetation cover or other surface protection .
Consideration shall be given to the need for batter protection and weed control during any interim period until the main revegetation work can be undertaken .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Revegetation Landscaping Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue The installation of temporary and or permanent control measures e.g .
erosion control matting hydro mulching may be required to control site surface runoff or wind erosion and minimise disturbance to areas of revegetation .
Steep and long slopes increase surface runoff and downslope transport of surface soil .
Surface roughening and benching of bare soil by creating furrows across slopes terracing or by surface roughing tracking the soil surface reduces erosion potential by decreasing runoff velocities trapping sediment and increasing infiltration of water into the soil and will facilitate effective mulching seeding and planting .
On accessible slopes mulch shall be anchored or tracked with suitable equipment to anchor the mulch into the soil .
On slopes that are inaccessible a suitable binding agent shall be applied in accordance with the manufacturers instructions to anchor the mulch .
If nominated for use as a binding agent bitumen emulsion shall be applied at a controlled rate nominal to litres per square metre of surface to match the soil moisture and site requirements .
If available brush rough cut site vegetation may be laid along the slope to provide a uniform cover thatch over the soil surface .
The brush shall be secured by mulch control netting wire strands running across the slope and secured to regular fixed stakes or equal method to prevent the brush from blowing away . .
PLANTING AND SEEDING It is important to allow leadtime for securing plants and any collection of seed or plant propagation .
At least one year is recommended before the required works are due to begin .
The propagation of plants and seed collection may be contracted out separately from the revegetation and landscaping works .
The pretreatment of seeds is necessary to improve germination and to assist to break dormancy .
The requirements for pretreatment should be nominated in Annexure B .
If not nominated the Contractor shall be required to treat all species of seed with pre treatment as per best horticultural practices .
In addition to smoke water hard seeded species shall be treated by scarification or hot water treatment .
A seeding rate should be specified within the design documentation .
In the absence of this information a default value of kgha can be used .
Hydromulch Unless specified otherwise in Annexure B the hydromulch shall consist of water cellulose fibre mulch tacifier e.g .
Gluon applied at ltr to ltr ha polygon a powder applied at kgha or equal and other materials paper mache or bulking agent as necessary to suit the size and location of the site area the slope and soil and local weather conditions .
Unless specified otherwise in Annexure B the hydromulch shall be applied at a nominal rate of litresha .
Rates can vary from up to litresha in response to project site conditions .
Soil conditions means that the application may involve several passes e.g .
on clay soils on sand batters .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Revegetation Landscaping Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue The critical measure is the depth applied .
The number of applications may vary due to the conditions. . WEED CONTROL Include any weed control requirements as part of Annexure B .
The control or removal of unwanted vegetation weed species is critical to ensure that planting and seeding operations are effective .
While eradication of all weed species may not be possible the objective is to control and reduce weed populations and to prevent their spread within the road reserve .
To make best use of available resources a listing of the weed species that pose the greatest risk should be identified and the weed control initiatives to target these priority species .
A weed control program must be developed for the contract area and implemented by the Contractor .
Nominated weed species should not be limited to the species identified in the design process .
The recommended approach is to require the Contractor to identify all weed species within the Contract area and to prepare a Weed Control Program and submit this to the Superintendent for approval prior to undertaking any works . .
PESTICIDES AND HERBICIDES The term pesticide as defined by the Department of Health DoH includes herbicides fungicides and all other specific forms of pest control agents .
Herbicides are used to control or remove the growth of unwanted vegetation .
Also refer to the draft Main Roads environmental guideline on Water Protection .
Approval to apply pesticides on road verges in proclaimed areas must be obtained from the DoE .
In water catchment areas managed by the Water Corporation mixing or spraying of pesticide must not occur within m of other water courses where water is flowing .
within m of any visible natural or artificial pool or storage .
If rain is falling or is likely to occur within four hours following application .
When herbicides are to be used in water catchment areas the DoE or Water Corporation should be advised at least weeks before the spraying programme .
Details supplied should include location type of herbicide rate of application and date when work is planned .
Advice on appropriate herbicide use within the project area selective and or non selective residual timing etc .
should be sought from specialist in the area .
A weed control plan should be prepared for the project area .
Residual herbicides are generally not recommended for use within the road reserve .
A sample general list of herbicides that may be nominated for a specific project is provided below a Glyphosate Biactive at manufacturers recommended rate non selective .
b Lontrel for broadleaf weeds at manufacturers recommended rate .
c Verdict or Fusilade for narrow leaf grasses at manufacturers recommended rate .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Revegetation Landscaping Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
BLEND AREAS The zone between all proposed and existing landscaping treatments shall be blended both visually and functionally .
Blended areas are undertaken to Reinstate an existing landscaping damaged by the road works Extend the existing landscaping treatment into an adjoining area altered by the road works Modify an existing landscaping treatment to integrate with the proposed landscaping .
Where blend areas overlap private property the nominal extent is metres beyond the cadastral boundary or metres beyond the limit of any road works which have extended into the property .
This work shall only proceed with the approval of the landowner .
This work shall be undertaken at the contract rates submitted by the Contractor .
The scope may be hard to define .
A Provisional Sum should be allowed to cover any additional costs or extra treatments. . CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS The Project Manager andor Designer must nominate the specific contract requirements for the Establishment Period and Defects Liability Period and Monitoring .

Some projects may include the retention of existing large trees in cut or fill .
Advice on the appropriate treatment is necessary and requirements should be checked for accuracy with the Landscape Architect .
Include a suitable payment items and note a HOLD POINT during earthworks .
Garden edging may be extruded concrete kerbing insitu concrete kerbs formed and precast kerbs paving units timber plastic or as specified otherwise in the Drawings .
Colour durability strip footings expansion joints fixings and other details shall be as specified .
Where appropriate transplanting of certain desirable vegetation e.g .
grass trees can be used to preserve a scarce or attractive native plant type local to the area .
Lifting and temporary storage of the target species is carried out prior to the main clearing operations and transplanting to final location can be made part of Specification REVEGETATION AND LANDSCAPING .
Requirements for other species would be similar but should be checked for accuracy with the Landscape Architect .
Include suitable payment items and note the HOLD POINT for temporary storage . .
LIFTING STORAGE OF GRASS TREES .
Existing grass trees within the road reserve that would be destroyed during clearing operations shall be retained where possible by lifting and temporarily storing before final transplanting into the landscaped areas . .
The Contractor shall lift store and maintain a sufficient number of grass trees Xanthorrhoea existing on site to provide the transplanting requirement before the commencement of any clearing operations . .
The Contractor shall select the required number of grass trees plus an additional quantity to allow for replacements during the Defects Liability Period .
The grass trees shall be selected on the basis of using the healthiest mature specimens that the Contractor considers are most suitable for transplanting .
Selection .
A storage site or sites of sufficient size cleanliness and security shall be confirmed with the Superintendent prior to the grass trees being removed .
Storage MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Revegetation Landscaping Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
The selected storage sites shall be suitably prepared to receive grass trees lifted from their original locations .
Site preparation shall include removal of weeds and other undesirable material levelling as required and general preparation of ground ready to receive the grass trees . .
Prior to lifting trim of all dead and mature foliage ensuring that the shoot and new leaves are retained undamaged. . Use suitable equipment to remove each plant with minimum disturbance to the aboveground growth and with sufficient undisturbed surrounding soil attached to the fibrous root system to ensure the plant will survive .
Removal .
Replant immediately into a suitably sized prepared hole in the storage area .
Settle the plant into the prepared hole so that it sits at the same level relative to the ground surface as it was originally .
Backfill as necessary with clean natural soil in mm lifts flooding with water between lifts to consolidate the soil around the rootball and to eliminate air pockets .
Storage .
Form a watering saucer a minimum of mm high around the trunk with a radius approximately mm greater than the trunk radius .
Thoroughly soak the root ball and surrounding soil and keep continuously moist until ready to transplant into final position .
Under watering should not occur .
Watering to the individual grass trees shall be maintained for two full summers seasons after transplanting .
Watering .
The individual grass trees shall be transplanted to their final locations in the Works in accordance with the clause Transplanting into place .
Transplanting .
The individual grass trees shall be shall be maintained for two full summer seasons after transplanting in accordance with good horticultural practices .
Maintenance .
Evidence of foliage growth is required to demonstrate that successful transplanting has occurred after two full summer seasons .

required to achieve the Works of this Contract including safety equipment and signage. . All plant and equipment shall be suitable for the requirements of this contract and shall be maintained in a safe and sound working condition at all times during the contract . .
The Contractor shall remove from the work site any plant or equipment considered by the Superintendent to be unsuitable for carrying out the work specified .

Steel Fabric .
ROCK PROTECTION .
Stone pitching and rock protection and any associated materials such as mortar shall be supplied and placed as specified in Specification ROCK PROTECTION .

. . NOT USED CONSTRUCTION .
GENERAL .
The location of the various types of surface drains levees and drainage basins shall be as shown on the Drawings .
Locations .
Clearing shall conform to the requirements of Specifications CLEARING .
Topsoil removal shall comply with Topsoil Removal Clauses of Specification EARTHWORKS .
Clearing .
Drains shall be excavated to provide an even grade with no obstructions or hollows which would impede the flow of water .
Drain Gradient .
Drains levees and drainage basins shall be constructed to conform to the crosssections and levels as shown in the Drawings and shall be neatly finished to a standard obtainable with blade grader operations .
Standard .
Batter slopes shall comply with the Finishing Of Batters And Ground Surfaces Clause of Specification EARTHWORKS .
Batter Slope .
Material excavated from drains and drainage basins which conforms to the requirements for embankment material as specified in Specification EARTHWORKS may be utilised to construct levees or as fill material more than mm below the subgrade surface .
Excavated Material .
TABLE DRAINS INCLUDING TYPE E . Table drains shall be constructed during excavation works as detailed in Specification EARTHWORKS and to the profiles and levels as shown on the Drawings .
Shape .
Batter slopes at culvert and bridge sites shall be smoothly transitioned over a length of m to match culvert wingwall or abutment wall slopes .
Batter Slopes .
The invert of the table drain shall be within mm vertically and mm laterally of the position shown in the Drawings .
Tolerances .
Where indicated on the Drawings shall be lined with rock protection as specified in Specification ROCK PROTECTION placed to the dimensions shape and extent as shown on the Drawings Rock protection .
Where specified on the Drawings rock protection shall be mortared in place as specified in Specification ROCK PROTECTION .
Mortar Specification Surface Drains and Levees Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
TABLE DRAIN BLOCKS AND DROP STRUCTURES .
GENERAL .
Table drain blocks and drop structures shall conform to the location cross section and levels as shown in the Drawings .
Table drain blocks and drop structures shall be installed level and within mm vertically and mm laterally and longitudinally of the position shown on the Drawings .
Tolerances .
Where indicated on the Drawings table drain blocks shall be lined with rock protection as specified in Specification ROCK PROTECTION placed to the dimensions shape and extent as shown on the Drawings .
Rock Protection .
Where specified on the Drawings rock protection shall be mortared in place as specified in Specification ROCK PROTECTION .
Mortar .. TABLE DRAIN BLOCKS USING NATURAL MATERIALS .
Suitable material excavated from earthworks operations or drains or from borrow pits may be utilised to construct table drain blocks .
Material Source .
Compaction of table drain blocks shall be as specified for embankment construction in Specification EARTHWORKS .
Compaction .. TABLE DRAIN DROP STRUCTURES .
Table drain drop structures shall be constructed to the requirements of clause ..
Concrete .
OFFSHOOT DRAINS TYPE A . Offshoot drains and diversion drains shall be constructed as shown on the Drawings or as required to direct water away from table drains or other works. . SIDE DRAINS TYPE B .
Side drains shall be constructed in accordance with the requirements of Specification EARTHWORKS and as shown on the Drawings. . CATCH DRAINS TYPE G . Catch drains shall be constructed in accordance with the requirements of Specification EARTHWORKS and as shown on the Drawings. . SPOON DRAINS .
Spoon drains shall be constructed as and where shown on the Drawings .
Locations .
The base of the excavation for spoon drains shall first be shaped and compacted as specified for embankment foundation in Specification EARTHWORKS .
Shaping Compaction .
Spoon drains shall be rock protected as specified in Specification ROCK PROTECTION .
Rock Protection Specification Surface Drains and Levees Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Rock protection work shall be mortared in place as specified in Specification ROCK PROTECTION .
Mortar .
CULVERT DRAINS TYPE F . Culvert inlet and outlet drains shall be constructed as shown on the Drawings and shall be neatly finished to a standard obtainable with blade grader operations. . LEVEES .
Levees shall be constructed as shown on the Drawings Construction .
Suitable material excavated from drains or material from borrow pits which conforms to the requirements for embankment material as specified in Specification EARTHWORKS may be utilised to construct levees .
Material Source .
The parallel levees associated with side drains diversion drains catch drains and other levees shall be neatly trimmed to conform to the shape and levels shown on the Drawings .
Type A B G . All levees including parallel levees associated with diversion drains and side drains shall be constructed and tested as specified for embankment construction in Specification EARTHWORKS except that three tests per lot shall be carried out .
Compaction .
Levees shall be installed within mm vertically and mm laterally and longitudinally of the position shown on the Drawings .
Tolerances .
Rock protection to levees shall be constructed as shown on the Drawings in accordance with the requirements of Specification ROCK PROTECTION .
Rock Lining .
DRAINAGE BASINS .
Retention basins compensating basins sumps and similar drainage features shall be excavated and formed to the dimensions slopes and levels shown on the Drawings in accordance with Specification EARTHWORKS .
Excavation .
Suitable material from excavations for drainage basins shall be incorporated into the Works .
Unsuitable material shall be disposed of to the Contractors spoil sites .
Suitability .
Associated culverts balance pipes and culvert headwalls and similar features shall be constructed in accordance with Specification CULVERTS .
Associated .
Levees associated with drainage basins shall be constructed in accordance with Section .. Standard . . The Custodian of this specification is Senior Road Engineer Rural. . TOPSOIL OPERATIONS refer to Clause .
below ..
This Specification has been developed on the basis of no respreading of topsoil in drains in order to discourage vegetation regrowth .
On some projects it may be desirable to respread topsoil and the Author should include Clause .
if this activity is required. . LANDSCAPING FOR DRAINAGE BASINS refer to Clause .
below .. Any specialised landscaping treatment required in association with the construction of drainage basins drainage sumps etc .
should be included with suitable references made to Specification REVEGATION AND LANDSCAPING .
..
Such work may include the placing of specialised materials such as silts and clays for the retention of water to promote vegetation and fauna species planting and other features .
Reference should always be made to the Environment Branch for assistance in this area .

Topsoil spreading shall comprise the respreading of suitable topsoil stockpiled from topsoil removal operations or the spreading of imported topsoil or a combination from both sources as provided for in Specification EARTHWORKS .
Source of Topsoil .

SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the supply and installation of subsoil drainage. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Acts and Regulations WorkSafe WA Occupational Safety and Health Regulations Australian Standards AS PVCU pipes and fittings for stormwater and surface water applications AS .
Part Perforated drainage pipe and associated fittings AS Geosynthetics Glossary of Terms AS Geotextiles Identification Marking and General Data AS .
Geotextiles Methods of Test General requirements sampling conditioning basic physical properties and statistical analysis AS .
Geotextiles Methods of Test Determination of burst Strength California bearing ratio CBR Plunger method AS .
Geotextiles Methods of Test Determination of puncture Resistance Drop cone method AS .
Geotextiles Methods of Test Determination of pore size distribution Drysieving method AS .
Geotextiles Methods of Test Determination of permittivity permeability and flow rate AS .
Geotextiles Methods of Test Determination of Durability Resistance to degradation by light heat and moisture Other Standards and Publications AUSTROADS Guide to Pavement Technology Part G Geotextiles and Geogrids Specification SubSoil Drains Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name MAIN ROADS Test Methods WA .
Particle Size Distribution Sieving and Decantation Method WA .
Particle Size Distribution of Aggregate MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification EARTHWORKS Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
GEOTEXTILE .
The geotextile lining shall be a nonwoven fabric consisting of long chain synthetic polymer fibres composed of at least by mass of polyester or polyolefins polypropylene polyethylene bonded by needle punching heat or chemical bonding processes or combinations thereof .
Bonded fibres must be capable of retaining their relative position in the geotextile .
The polymer fibres shall be rot proof chemically stable and have low water absorbency .
Geotextile Fibres .
The geotextile shall have a high ultraviolet resistance such that when tested in accordance with AS .
shall have retained strength of at least after hours of test exposure .
The geotextile shall be free of any flaws or defects that may adversely affect the mechanical or physical properties of the fabric .
UV Resistance .
Each roll of geotextile shall be provided with a suitable covering to protect the fabric against moisture and ultraviolet radiation and marked in conformance with AS .
Supply .
Prior to installation the geotextile rolls shall be stored on site under a protective cover and supported off the ground .
The Contractor shall take appropriate measures to protect the geotextile from damage .
This includes adhering to any other recommendations on method of storage set by the suppliermanufacturer .
Storage .
The geotextile shall comply with the mechanical and hydraulic requirements shown in Tables .
and .
below .
Properties TABLE .
MECHANICAL PROPERTIES Property Subsoil Drains Test Method Minimum Geotextile Strength Rating G as defined in AUSTROADS Part G Geotextiles and Geogrids AS .
AS .
Specification SubSoil Drains Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name NOTES i Geotextile Strength Rating G L . h. Geotextile survivability refers to the ability of the Geotextile to withstand the installation stresses during construction .
ii L in Newtons is the characteristic value of burst strength CBR Plunger Method for the batch tested determined in accordance with AS .
AS .. h in mm is the characteristic value of puncture resistance Drop Cone Method for the batch tested determined in accordance with AS .
AS ..
The characteristic values of L and h shall be calculated as the mean value less .
standard deviation. . TABLE .
MECHANICAL PROPERTIES Property Subsoil Drains Test Method Maximum Equivalent Opening Size EOS m AS .
Minimum Q lms AS .
NOTES i Maximum Equivalent Opening Size EOS and Minimum Q are mean values ii EOS Particle diameter for which of particles would be retained iii Q Flow rate under mm constant head determined using the Perpendicular Flow Test .
The Contractor shall certify that the geotextile delivered to site meet the specification requirements .
Sampling conditioning and statistical analysis of results for each batch of geotextile shall be carried out in accordance with AS .. Sampling frequency shall be in accordance with Appendix A of AS ..
The conformance testing shall include determining the mean weight mass per unit area of the geotextile in accordance with AS .. Sampling and Testing .
Prior to the use of the geotextile for drainage lining the Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent product certificates of compliance from the supplier showing that the geotextile complies with all the requirements of this specification .
Test results shall be reported on NATA endorsed documents .
HOLD POINT .
FILTER AGGREGATE .
Filter aggregate for use in backfilling trenches shall consist of hard durable clean gravel or crushed rock and shall be free from organic material clay or other deleterious substances .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings the aggregate shall have the Particle Size Distribution PSD as shown in Table .
as determined by WA .
Aggregate Specification SubSoil Drains Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name TABLE .

. . . . . . . . . .
Prior to the use of the aggregate material for filter aggregate the Contractor shall provide certification to the Superintendent that the aggregate conforms to the specified requirements .
Test results shall be reported on NATA endorsed documents .
HOLD POINT .
DRAINAGE LAYER .
Any required drainage layer over the aggregate backfill shall be a free draining cohesionless material free of clays organic matter and any other deleterious substances and shall conform with the requirements shown in Table .
as determined by WA .
Drainage Layer TABLE .
DRAINAGE LAYER AS Sieve Size mm Passing by Mass . . . . SLOTTED PIPE .
Drainage pipes and associated fittings and jointing procedures shall comply with the following requirements a AS .
Perforated Drainage Pipe and Associated Fittings b AS PVC Pipes PVC Pipe Specification SubSoil Drains Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Unless otherwise noted on the Drawings slotted pipe shall be nominal mm outside diameter Class Type PVC pipe with elbows as required. . FLUSHOUT POINTS .
The subsoil drain flushout point shall have a concrete cover of Class N concrete fitted with a removable cap .
Concrete shall be supplied in accordance with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS .
Flushout Points . . NOT USED CONSTRUCTION .
GENERAL .
Subsoil drains shall be constructed to the locations crosssectional shapes and dimensions as shown on the Drawings .
A typical cross section is shown at Figure .
to illustrate various components of the subsoil drain .
Extent FIGURE .
TYPICAL CROSS SECTION OF SUBSOIL DRAIN .
TRENCH EXCAVATION .
The trench for the installation of the subsoil drain shall be excavated to the width and depth shown on the Drawings .
The excavation shall have vertical sides throughout where the excavation is up to .m deep .
The bottom of the trench shall be not more than mm below the specified level of the invert of the pipe .
Excess trench excavation shall be made good by filling back to grade and lightly compacting with material of permeability similar to that of the surrounding material .
.m Deep .
Where the excavation is greater than .m deep the trench shall be excavated in accordance with the relevant requirements of Occupational Safety and Health Regulations .
Any loose or disturbed material shall be removed from the walls of the trench .
.m Deep .
Unsuitable material from excavations shall be disposed of in accordance with Specification EARTHWORKS .
Unsuitable Material FILTER AGGREGATE GEOTEXTILE SLOTTED PIPE TRENCH WIDTH TRENCH HEIGHT BEDDING BACKFILL Specification SubSoil Drains Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Trench excavations in rock shall be carried out in accordance with Specification EARTHWORKS .
Rock .
Trenches should be graded to have reasonably smooth side and bottom faces so that the geotextile lining will not bridge cavities or be damaged by protrudingsharp objects .
Cavities should be filled with granular material before placement of geotextile .
The minimum grade of subsoil drainage must be ..
Shape .
Prior to the placement of Geotextile as detailed in Clause .
the Contractor shall provide certification to the Superintendent that the trench excavation conforms to the trench shape grade line filling and light compaction for over excavated section and removal of any protrudingsharp objects .
HOLD POINT .
DRAIN LINING .
The Contractor shall take every reasonable care to ensure that the geotextile is not damaged during installation and backfilling operations .
Care .
Geotextile shall be placed in the excavated trench to cover the bottom and sides of the trench with sufficient free fabric to wrap around the completed drain as shown on the Drawings .
The geotextile should conform to the shape of the trench with minimal wrinkles folds or air voids between fabric and trench but not stretched on the soil .
Placement .
Unless otherwise specified on the Drawings the minimum overlap in longitudinal direction along the trench shall be mm .
Successive sheets of geotextile within the trench shall be overlapped with the upstream fabric overlying the downstream fabric .
Overlap .
Damaged areas of geotextile may be repaired by overlaying the damaged section with a patch .
The patch shall extend a minimum of m beyond the area of damage .
Repair .
with drainage backfill layer shall not exceed days .
Where possible and practical geotextiles shall be placed just ahead of associated advancing construction work and covered by relevant construction materials or suitable protective sheeting within hours of being placed .
Exposure .
Any fabric allowed to remain exposed to sunlight for a period greater than days shall be removed and replaced at no cost to the Principal .
Prolonged Exposure .
BEDDING .
Filter aggregate bedding in accordance with Clause .
shall be placed on the geotextile to the depth indicated on the Drawings and tamped level .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings the depth of the bedding shall be mm . .
INSTALLATION OF SLOTTED PIPE .
Slotted pipe shall be installed as shown on the Drawings and shall be placed centrally within the trench on the crushed aggregate bedding .
Placement Specification SubSoil Drains Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Any required joints in slotted pipe shall be made in accordance with the manufacturers instructions .
Joints .
Flushout points shall be constructed at the locations shown on the Drawings complete with concrete covers as described in Clause .. Flushout Points .
FILTER AGGREGATE AND BACKFILL MATERIAL .
Filter aggregate shall be placed over the slotted pipe to the depth shown on the Drawings and tamped to a level profile .
To avoid postconstruction settlement the filter aggregate material shall be compacted to its full depth to achieve effective mechanical interlock between particles .
The geotextile shall be wrapped over the top of the aggregate layer with sufficient overlap lesser of trench width or mm .
Aggregate Backfill .
Where shown on the Drawings any required drainage backfill layer shall be placed on top of the geotextile wrapped aggregate and shall be filled to the subgrade surface .
This layer shall be compacted as for embankment construction in accordance with Specification EARTHWORKS .
Backfill .
Prior to backfilling the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that compliance has been achieved with all specified requirements .
Hold Point .
FILTER AGGREGATE AND BACKFILL MATERIAL .
After completion of backfilling subsoils drains shall be flushed in the presence of the Superintendent with sufficient clean water until only clean water discharges at the outlet. . FILTER AGGREGATE AND BACKFILL MATERIAL .
Where a subsoil drain is provided for the drainage of the pavement layer outlets are to be provided as shown on the Drawings .
Subsoil drains shall discharge into gully pits and other stormwater drainage structures or outlets approved by the Superintendent. . NOT USED .
MARKER POSTS .
The Contractor shall supply and erect marker posts at all drain inlets and outlets .
They shall be galvanised steel box sections be capped and have the following dimensions mm in width mm in depth and mm in height .
They shall be driven into the ground leaving mm above the ground level .
The top mm of the posts shall be painted with white powder coating on all faces .
The powder coated width facing the road shall be marked S S DRAIN .
The letters shall be in black paint and of the following dimensions height mm and width mm .

SCOPE .
The work under this SPECIFICATION consists of the supply and installation of reinforced concrete pipes RCPs and reinforced concrete boxes RCBs culverts corrugated steel pipe CSP and corrugated aluminium pipes CAP culverts reinforced concrete end treatments for culverts and the supply and installation of RCP stormwater drains. . DEFINITIONS .
Where this SPECIFICATION refers to reinforced concrete box culverts they also include reinforced concrete link slabs .
Link Slabs .
Culvert end treatments shall include endwalls or headwalls wingwalls cut off walls and aprons .
End Treatments .
Stormwater drains consist of reinforced concrete pipes connecting drainage structures such as inlets manholes and catchpits as shown on the Drawings .
Stormwater Drains .
Unless otherwise stated Clauses within this SPECIFICATION that reference RCP culverts are also applicable to RCPs installed to carry stormwater from drainage structures .
RCP Stormwater Drains .
Where this SPECIFICATION refers to Aggressive ground conditions as defined in Annexure A it includes environmental conditions where additional protective measures to culverts are required in accordance with Table A .
Aggressive Ground Conditions .
Culway installations refer to culverts associated with traffic monitoring equipment .
Culway . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
REINFORCED CONCRETE PIPES .
Concrete pipes for culverts shall be precast reinforced concrete pipes RCPs to the Classes shown on the Drawings .
RCPs Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Concrete pipes shall be manufactured tested and inspected in accordance with the requirements of Annexure B .
Manufacture .
Concrete pipe shall be manufactured to suit the insitu ground conditions as specified in Annexure A Table A in accordance with the requirements of Table A. . Joint types shall be as specified in Annexure A .
Joint Types .
Rubber ring joints shall be provided for all spigot and socket pipes unless otherwise shown on the Drawings .
Rubber Ring Joints .
Rubber ring gaskets required for jointing spigot and socket concrete pipes shall conform to the requirements of AS .
Rubber Ring Gaskets .
CORRUGATED METAL PIPES .. GENERAL .
Corrugated metal pipes with diameter greater than mm or individual units that are to be joined to form a single barrel shall be supplied with a unique identifying number for post installation shape measurement and reassembly purposes where applicable . .
Corrugated metal pipes with diameter greater than mm shall be supplied with indelible markings defining the internal diameter vertically through the obvert and invert and horizontally at intervals as specified in SPECIFICATION QUALITY SYSTEMS .
The manufacturer shall provide internal measurements taken at each set of indelible markings to an accuracy of mm cross referenced to the unique identifying number detailed in this Clause . .
Corrugated metal pipe shall be manufactured to suit the insitu ground conditions as specified in Annexure A Table A in accordance with the requirements of Table A ..

The corrugated steel pipes shall be a spirally wound type .
Spirally Wound Corrugated steel pipes shall conform to AS .
. .
The steel thickness shall be .mm for mm diameter .mm for mm to mm diameter and .mm for mm to mm diameter .
Steel Thickness .
The corrugations shall be mm x mm for up to and including mm diameter and mm x mm for mm to mm diameter .
Corrugation .
All pipes shall be manufactured from Grade steel plate to AS .

CORRUGATED ALUMINIUM PIPES .
Corrugated aluminium pipe shall be fabricated from Alclad H in accordance with AASHTO M. Raw material coil width shall be mm or greater to maximise lock seam spacing .
CAP Base Material .
Manufacture shall be in accordance with AASHTO M to the tolerances shown in AS and shall incorporate a staked double offset lockseam joint .
Manufacture .
The structural design procedure shall be in accordance with AS modified to suit the aluminium section properties of Alclad H with regard to metal strengths and flexibility which are as follows Design a. Modulus of Elasticity E MPa b .
Yield Stress MPa c. Flexibility factor .
mmN .
The aluminium thickness shall be .mm for up to and including mm diameter .mm for mm to mm diameter and .mm for mm to mm diameter .
Aluminium Thickness .
The corrugations shall be mm x mm for up to and including mm diameter and mm x mm for mm to mm diameter .
Corrugation .
Dissimilar metals shall not be permitted to be in direct contact with aluminium pipe .
Dissimilar Metals .
REINFORCED CONCRETE BOXES .
Reinforced concrete box culvert units with spans up to and equal to mm shall be manufactured tested and inspected in accordance with Annexure C and AS .. RCBs Spans mm .
Reinforced concrete box culvert units with spans of mm and greater shall be manufactured tested and inspected in accordance with Annexure C and AS .. RCBs Spans mm .
Reinforced concrete box culvert units shall be manufactured to suit the in situ conditions as specified in Annexure A Table A in accordance with the requirements of Table A. . Joint sealant for masking external joints shall be a mm wide joint sealant complying with this SPECIFICATION .

.. INSITU CONCRETE .
The supply of insitu concrete for base slabs and end treatments shall conform to requirements of Annexure A Table A. .
The supply and placement of all N Class concrete shall be in accordance with SPECIFICATION CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS .
N Class Concrete .
The supply and placement of all S Class concrete shall be in accordance with SPECIFICATION CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES .
S Class Concrete .
CEMENT STABILISED BACKFILL .
Cement stabilised backfill material shall consist of basecourse material or other suitable material approved by the Superintendent stabilised in the proportion of kg of Type GP Cement to one cubic metre of uncompacted backfill material .
Mix Proportions .
Water for cement stabilisation shall be clean and potable .
Water .
SELECT BEDDING MATERIAL .
Select bedding material shall be basecourse material or other suitable material approved by the Superintendent containing less than by mass of material retained on the .mm sieve as determined by MRWA Test Method WA .. . JOINT SEALANT .
Acceptable joint sealant for masking external joints are Flash Tac Scotch Wrap No .
and Rock Wrap or a suitable equivalent approved by the Superintendent .
. . NOT USED INSTALLATION .
GENERAL .
The installation of pipes and box culverts shall include all trench excavations construction and backfill to the details shown on the Drawings and as described in this SPECIFICATION. . TRENCH EXCAVATION .
Trenches shall be excavated to the width shown in the Drawings with vertical sides throughout where the excavation is up to .m deep .
Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Where the excavation is greater than .m deep the trench shall be excavated in accordance with the requirements of the Drawings .
Any loose or disturbed material shall be removed from the walls of the trench .
Trench .m Deep .
All spoil material from excavations including excavations for end treatments and rock protection shall be disposed of as specified in SPECIFICATION EARTHWORKS .
Spoil Material .
Excavations shall be kept free from water until work below ground level is sufficiently set or protected .
Dewatering operations shall be undertaken in accordance with SPECIFICATION ENVIRONMENT and water discharged from trenches shall in no circumstances be disposed of to sanitary sewers .
Dewatering .
Trench excavations in rock including excavation for end treatments shall be carried out in accordance with SPECIFICATION EARTHWORKS .
Rock .
BLASTING .
Any requirement for blasting shall be carried out in accordance with SPECIFICATION EARTHWORKS .
Blasting .
PROTECTION OF FOUNDATION SURFACES .
The exposed surface at the bottom of the excavation shall be adequately protected from disturbance by the Contractors operations or by the action of storm water or ground water .
Where required dewatering shall be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of SPECIFICATION ENVIRONMENT .
Any disturbance shall be reinstated to the requirements of Clause .
Bedding by the Contractor at no cost to the Principal .
Exposed Surface .
BEDDING Culverts shall be bedded as detailed on the Drawings .
. . Excavation for culverts bedding and end treatments shall be undertaken to the extent shown on the Drawings .
Extent of Excavation .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings the culverts and end treatments shall be bedded on the insitu foundation material that has been compacted to the requirements specified for Embankment Foundation in SPECIFICATION EARTHWORKS with a frequency of testing in accordance with SPECIFICATION QUALITY SYSTEMS . .
Select bedding material shall be constructed to the dimensions shown in the Drawings .
Select bedding material shall be compacted to the Characteristic Dry Density Ratio specified for Embankment Construction in SPECIFICATION EARTHWORKS with a frequency of testing in accordance with SPECIFICATION QUALITY SYSTEMS .
Select Bedding Material .
Provisions shall be made to accommodate pipe socketconnections to ensure pipes are fully supported along the barrels .
Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
DAMAGE .
Precast concrete pipes and box culvert units shall be handled and installed in such a manner that no nonconforming cracking or other nonconforming defect occurs that is outside acceptable limits given in Annexure B and C as applicable .
Damaged pipe and box culverts shall be assessed and repaired or replaced in accordance with Annexure B or C as applicable at no cost to the Principal .
Damaged Concrete Units .
Corrugated steel pipe culvert units shall be handled and installed in such a manner as to prevent damage to the zinc coating .
Areas on culvert units where zinc coating has been damaged shall be cleaned of rust and painted with two coats of zincrich organic priming paint complying with ASNZS .. Where other coatings such as polymer precoats are used then damage to those coats shall be repaired in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
Such surface repairs shall be undertaken at no cost to the Principal .
Where damage occurs other than to the surface coating then the damaged units shall be replaced at no cost to the Principal .
Damaged CSPs .
Corrugated aluminium pipe culvert units shall be handled and installed with care to prevent damage to the pipe wall and seamed joints .
Damaged pipe units shall be replaced at no cost to the Principal .
Damaged Aluminium Pipes .
BACKFILL AND COMPACTION .. GENERAL .
Prior to backfilling the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that compliance has been achieved with all specified requirements .
HOLD POINT .
The backfill requirements for all culverts shall be as detailed in the Drawings .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings backfill material other than cement stabilised backfill shall be embankment material placed and compacted to the requirements specified for Embankment Construction in SPECIFICATION EARTHWORKS with a frequency of testing in accordance with SPECIFICATION QUALITY SYSTEMS .
Backfill levels on each side of any conduit shall not differ by more than mm .
The Contractor shall ensure that the backfill placement does not damage the end treatments .
Backfill .
The dimensional requirements relating to backfill shall be as shown on the Drawings .
Extent .
All sheeting struts braces and similar temporary supports shall be entirely removed from the trench prior to backfilling .
Removal shall be effected in such a way so as not to disturb or displace the culvert .
Removal of Bracing .
Appropriate precautions such as the use of holdingdown straps shall be taken to ensure that corrugated metal pipe culvert barrels do not float during the backfilling process particularly during vibration of the backfill .
Metal Culvert Float Precautions Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The Contractor shall ensure that the equipment used during compaction of backfill does not damage the culvert .
Limitations on the type of compaction equipment and cover to be provided to the top of the culvert shall be determined in accordance with ASNZS for reinforced concrete pipes AS for reinforced box culverts or AS for corrugated steel pipes .
Compaction Equipment .
No backfill shall be placed behind insitu wingwalls or headwalls within seven days of concrete being placed in the wingwalls or headwalls .
Concrete Strength .. CEMENT STABILISED BACKFILL .
Cement stabilised backfill material to culverts shall be as specified in Clause .
Cement Stabilised Backfill and shall be placed to the limits and dimensions as shown on the Drawings .
Material .
Only sufficient water shall be mixed with the stabilised material to facilitate compaction .
Water .
Cement stabilised backfill material shall be placed within minutes of mixing the cement with water .
The stabilised backfill shall be compacted during placement using pneumatic or mechanical rotary type immersion vibrators .
The cement stabilised material shall be vibrated until all excess water and air are expelled .
Placing .
During placing of cement stabilised backfill the backfill levels on each side of any conduit shall not differ by more than mm .
Backfill placement shall not damage the culverts or end treatments .
Placement .
Immersion vibrators shall be of the rotary out of balance type with a frequency of not less than cycles per minute .
Before the commencement of each backfill sufficient vibrators and spares shall be available and tested .
The number of vibrators required for a given rate of placing cement stabilised material shall be as specified in Table .
and shall be continuously used during the process .
Vibrators TABLE .
NUMBER OF VIBRATORS Rate of Placing Cement Stabilised Material m per Hour Working Vibrators Required Standby Vibrators Required Up to to .
PAVEMENT REINSTATEMENT .
Where a culvert is constructed under an existing road pavement the pavement on the existing road shall be reinstated by the construction of the appropriate pavement layers with thicknesses as shown on the Drawings .
Reinstatement Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The edges of the excavation shall be saw cut straight and parallel to the line of the culvert or stormwater drain and the excavation backfilled to the requirements of Clauses .
General and .
Backfill and Compaction respectively .
The pavement layers shall be constructed to the relevant requirements of SPECIFICATION PAVEMENTS .
Edges Pavement .
Bituminous surfacing and asphalt shall be applied in accordance with the requirements of SPECIFICATION BITUMINOUS SURFACING and SPECIFICATION ASPHALT SURFACING respectively with the top surface finished level with the surrounding existing sealed surface .
Surfacing .
A waterproof seal shall be provided between the new and the old surfaces .
Waterproof Seal .
TRAFFIC .
The Contractor shall repair or replace any culvert damaged by construction backfill or Public Traffic in accordance with the requirements of Clause .
Damage at no cost to the Principal .
Damage .
Construction traffic with greater than legal wheel or axle loading as defined by the Road Traffic Vehicle Standards Regulations shall not be permitted to travel over culverts. . CULVERTS .. GENERAL .
Batter slopes at culverts shall be evenly transitioned over a length of m from the edge of the wingwall to match culvert wingwall slopes. . All culverts shall be constructed to the correct alignment and cross sectional shape and shall conform to dimensions levels and other details specified or shown in the Drawings .
Alignment .
Inlet and outlet invert levels shall be as shown in the Drawings plus or minus mm .
Inverts shall be smooth and of uniform gradient throughout each culvert length .
Invert Levels Tolerance .
Any culvert which is not true to line level or grade or shows settlement after laying or which is damaged during backfilling compaction or subsequent operations shall be removed by the Contractor and replaced at no cost to the Principal .
Misalignment or Damage .
On completion of installation no diameter measured across the indelible markings on metal culverts shall differ from the supplied preinstalled dimension by more than percent .
Testing frequency shall be in accordance with SPECIFICATION QUALITY SYSTEMS .
Metal Culvert Diameter Tolerances .
Where shown on the Drawings metal culverts shall be anchored to an in situ concrete collar .
Metal Culverts Anchorage .
All culverts shall be flushed clean from end to end on completion of the installation and maintained in proper working order for the duration of the Contract .
Flushing Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Culverts shall be laid with the connections kept clean and shall be laid with the inverts true to the lines and levels shown on the Drawings and to the following tolerances a. Horizontal alignment mm mm b. Vertical level mm mm .
The Contractor shall seal the ends of the culverts with a temporary plug to exclude water sand or other deleterious materials caused from work under the Contract unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent .
..
CONCRETE PIPE CULVERTS .
Pipe laying shall proceed upgrade with the pipe sockets at the higher end of the pipes. . Rubber ring joints shall be lubricated in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
Pipe handling shall be carefully controlled to avoid disturbing the rubber ring and to ensure that it is free from dirt and other foreign materials .
Any rubber ring so disturbed shall be removed cleaned and relubricated before refitting .
Rubber Rings .
Care shall be taken to properly align the pipe before the joint is forced home .
During the jointing operation the pipe shall be partially supported in a suitable manner to minimise unequal lateral pressure on the rubber ring and to maintain concentricity until the rubber ring is properly seated .
Jointing .
Flush jointed concrete pipes shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations with the rubber jointing bands and pipe joints being kept free from dirt and foreign materials .
Flush Joints .
The installation and jointing recommendations provided by the pipe manufacturer shall be followed at all times .
Sufficient pressure shall be applied in making the joint to ensure proper seating and sufficient restraint shall be applied to ensure that the line does not creep until backfill material can be placed and thoroughly compacted around the pipe .
At the end of the work day the last pipe shall be blocked in an effective manner to prevent creep .
Manufacturers Recommendations ..
CONCRETE BOX CULVERTS .
Unless otherwise detailed in the Specification or Drawings installation of all precast reinforced concrete boxes shall comply with the requirements of AS Section Installation .
Concrete Boxes .
All box culverts shall be installed on a cast insitu concrete base slab .
Pre cast concrete bases shall not be used .
Insitu Base Slabs .
Reinforced concrete box culvert units including link slab units shall be placed in position on a mortar bed in accordance with the Drawings .
Unless specified otherwise on the Drawings cement mortar is to be .
water cement ratio by mass and sand cement ratio by mass .
Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Cement stabilised backfill shall not be placed until the cement mortar used to seal culvert crown units and link slabs has cured for hours .
HOLD POINT .
The base slab construction for Box Culverts shall comply with the following requirements Base Slab a. Dimensions shall be within mm of those shown on the Drawings .
Surface irregularities shall be less than mm abrupt and mm over a metre straight edge .
Tolerances b .
No construction equipment or public traffic is permitted to travel or work on or over the concrete base slab within seven days of the placement of concrete in the base slabs .
Traffic Use c. The Contractor shall not operate any plant directly on the concrete base slabs without prior approval from the Superintendent .
Plant Use d. Reinforced concrete box culvert units shall not be placed on concrete base slabs within hours of completing the concrete base slabs . .
Box Culverts with a span of mm or greater shall have shear keys as shown on the Drawings and constructed in accordance with this Specification .
Shear Keys .
Where link slabs are installed they shall be seated on continuous cement mortar pads as shown on the Drawings .
All surplus mortar shall be removed from the installation before the mortar hardens .
The space between link slabs shall be backfilled in accordance with the Drawings .
Link Slabs ..

EXISTING CULVERTS ..
REMOVAL BACKFILL .
Where detailed on the Drawings existing culverts shall be removed and if deemed suitable for reuse by the Superintendent can be used for sidetracks .
When the sidetrack is no longer in use or if there is no sidetrack removed culverts shall be stored or disposed of by the Contractor to the Contractors disposal site or an authorised waste disposal site or a site approved by the Local Government Authority .
Redundant Culverts Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Where damage to the concrete that exposes the reinforcement or any cracking which exceeds .mm wide occurs then those damaged culvert units shall be disposed of by the Contractor to the Contractors disposal site or an authorised waste disposal site or a site approved by the Local Government Authority .
Minor chipping of the concrete may be repaired by the Contractor using an approved epoxy mortar and the culverts will be considered to be undamaged .
Damaged Fittings .
If the removed culvert is not being replaced the void remaining shall be filled and compacted with embankment material .
Backfilling .
The embankment material shall be placed and compacted to the requirements for embankment construction in SPECIFICATION EARTHWORKS with a frequency of testing in accordance with SPECIFICATION QUALITY SYSTEMS .
.. LOW STRENGTH INFILL .
Where indicated on the Drawings redundant existing culverts and associated drainage structures located under roadways which are to be retained in their existing location shall be entirely filled insitu in accordance with SPECIFICATION LOW STRENGTH INFILL .
The open ends of any remaining pipe runs and apertures left in remaining drainage structures shall be permanently sealed off to exclude water sand or other material .
Low Strength Infill .. CULVERT EXTENSIONS .
Construction of culvert extensions to existing culverts shall be in accordance with the relevant construction requirements for new culverts except that extension of a culvert shall normally be completed before associated earthworks at the same location .
Culvert Extensions .
Trench excavation for the culvert extension shall be carried out as required .
Where the invert level of the culvert extension is lower than the existing ground level the insitu material shall be excavated to the width shown on the Drawings for new culverts . .
Existing culvert endwalls shall be broken out as required and the old endwall material removed to spoil areas .
Care shall be taken not to damage retained culvert conduit . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings the existing culvert barrel shall be excavated back to a minimum of mm from the end of the culvert .
Prior to backfilling the joint between the existing and the new conduit shall be masked with a suitable joint sealant in accordance with Clause .
Joint Sealant . .
The gradient of the culvert extension shall match the gradient of the retained portion of the existing culvert or where required the extension shall be laid to a specified invert level .
Culvert extensions shall be thoroughly jointed with the existing culvert so as to provide a continuous structure with no internal projections to impede the flow of water. . End treatments to extensions shall be constructed as for new culverts .
End Treatments Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
DAMAGE TO EXISTING STRUCTURES .
Any damage to any culvert end treatment or any other structure during the Contract shall be repaired by the Contractor at no cost to the Principal .
Damage .
PEGGING OF CULVERTS .
Prior to any clearing at culvert locations the Contractor shall peg the centreline of the culvert at the inlet and outlet inverts and peg the extent of the clearing required for associated Works for the Superintendents verification and adjustment as required .
HOLD POINT .
TRENCH EXCAVATION FOR CULVERTS .
Except for culvert extensions no culvert shall be laid until the embankment at the point of laying has been brought to a level mm above all points along the top of the culvert or to the subgrade level whichever is the lesser and compacted .
Where pipes with spigot and socket joints are used then measurement shall be taken from the top of collar .
Embankment Height .
END TREATMENTS .. INSITU CONSTRUCTION .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings all culvert end treatments shall be constructed of cast insitu concrete or where applicable of mortared rock pitching in accordance with the Drawings .
Construction .
The dimensions of the end treatments shall be within mm of those shown on the Drawings when measured in accordance with AS .
Tolerances .
Surface irregularities of the concrete end walls wing walls cut off walls and aprons shall be less than mm abrupt and mm over a metre straight edge .
Surface Irregularities .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings concrete shall be in accordance with Annexure A Table A and shall conform to the requirements of Clause .
Reinforcement and Insitu Concrete .
Concrete .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings mortar for mortared rock pitching shall comprise a to mix of builders sand and ordinary Portland cement with all sand being from the same source .
Mortar .. PRECAST CONCRETE END TREATMENTS .
The use of commercially available precast end treatments shall not be permitted .
Precast End Treatments .

Refer also to Guidance Note and delete this note Specification Culverts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ANNEXURE B PRECAST REINFORCED CONCRETE PIPES GENERAL B .
SCOPE .
This Annexure is for the supply and delivery of precast reinforced concrete pipes .
The Contractor must nominate the nominal effective length of the units with the tender .
B. TERMINOLOGY AND STANDARDS .
Unless otherwise specified material and manufactured articles and workmanship shall conform to the relevant Australian Standards .
Where conflict occurs between this Annexure and the relevant Australian Standard this Annexure shall take precedence .
PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS B. PRECAST UNITS .
The pipes shall be manufactured tested and accepted in accordance with the requirements of ASNZS except where otherwise varied by this Annexure . .
The pipes shall be manufactured to suit the insitu ground conditions as specified in Annexure A Table A in accordance with the requirements of Table A Ground Conditions .
The nominal internal pipe diameters to be supplied shall include those diameters between mm and mm given in the Culvert Schedule andor the Schedule of Rates .
Pipe Diameter .
This Annexure applies to the following load classes as described in ASNZS Load Classes a .
Standard pipe classes and are available as stock items .
b .
Extra strength pipe classes and are also available from pipe manufacturers as required .

CONCRETE GENERAL .
Concrete shall be cast and cured to produce a sound dense and durable concrete . .
Concrete shall have a surface finish equivalent to a steel trowel finish for internal surfaces .
External surfaces shall have as a minimum a Class finish in accordance with AS .
The internal and external surfaces of pipes shall not be coated unless otherwise specified .
Surface Finish .
Concrete shall be produced in accordance with the requirements of this SPECIFICATION .
B .. CEMENT .
Cement shall comply with the requirements of AS and Australian Technical Infrastructure Committee ATIC SP .
All sampling and testing of cement shall be in accordance with ASNZS .
The cement shall be dry to flow freely during application .
The Cementitious Material Registration Scheme CMRS shall be used to confirm that the cement complies with ATIC SP .
The standard application form for CMRS registration is given in Annexure D. The Contractor shall provide manufacturers test certificates showing Certification .
Prior to the manufacturing of culverts the Contractor shall confirm that the cement complies with ATIC SP and shall provide the CMRS registration number for the cement to the Superintendent for approval of the cement. . Cement shall contain less than .
per cent total alkali expressed as sodium oxide equivalent .
The method of testing to determine this figure shall be in accordance with ASTM C. .
The Contractor shall use cement in approximately the chronological order in which it is delivered from the manufacturer .
The Contractor shall demonstrate that transportation units and storage bins used for bulk cement have been constructed so that there is no dead storage .
If dead storage exists the bins shall be emptied completely at least once every three months .
Cement delivered in bags shall be stored in weatherproof structures having floors raised above the ground .
Cement that is more than three months old shall not be used. . B ..

C. TERMINOLOGY AND STANDARDS .
The term precast units where used in this Annexure shall include the pre cast reinforced concrete crown sections and link slabs . .
Unless otherwise specified material and manufactured articles and workmanship shall conform to the relevant Australian Standards .
Where conflict occurs between this Annexure and the relevant Australian Standards this Annexure shall take precedence .
PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS C. PRECAST UNITS For culvert units up to mm span the following shall apply .
a. precast units shall be manufactured tested and inspected in accordance with the requirements of AS .
except where otherwise varied by this Specification .

Figure ..
The effective waterways area shall not be less than .
m. c. the height of fill including pavement between the trafficable surface of the road and the top of the culvert unit or top of the link slab shall not be less than mm and not greater than mm. . For culvert units of mm span or larger with fill heights of up to .
metres the following shall apply a. precast units have been designed by Main Roads Western Australia and the minimum design requirements are detailed on Drawing Number .

The type of units required for the Contract are as listed in the Culvert Schedule or the Schedule of RatesBill of Quantities. . Information to be supplied by the purchaser and the supplier shall be in accordance with AS .. C. FORMWORK .
All formed concrete surfaces to the precast units shall have a smooth dense and dust free concrete finish. . Form joint marks shall be unobtrusive and concrete surfaces shall be free from blowholes deeper than mm .
The allowable extent of blowholes per unit area shall be as for Class formwork in AS .
Maximum allowable surface irregularities shall be nil abrupt or mm over the width of the surface. . Form lubricants used shall be of the nonstaining type and shall have no detrimental effects on the concrete . .
The unformed surface of the precast units shall be wood floated to produce a uniform surface without surface pitting or cavities .
Maximum allowable surface irregularities shall be nil abrupt or mm over the width of the surface. . For culvert units of mm span and larger the design of all formwork shall be in accordance with SPECIFICATION FORMWORK .
C. REINFORCEMENT AND CONCRETE C ..
CONCRETE GENERAL .

In its finished state concrete shall be sound and dense and durable and free from honeycombing and shall have the strength and other properties specified. . Precast reinforced concrete box culvert units shall be sampled and tested for water absorption in accordance with Appendix F of ASNZS .

percent. . All concrete shall be produced in accordance with the requirements of this Specification .

total alkali expressed as sodium oxide equivalent .
