TOLERANCES .
Signs shall be manufactured to the following tolerances a .
Length and Width mm b. Hole Diameters .mm c. Hole Centre Position Tolerances Laterally .mm d. Hole Centre Position Tolerances Vertically .mm e. Maximum allowable twist warp or departure from flatness mmm .
SHEET METAL WORKS .
Holes in unbraced signs shall be drilled or punched in the locations specified on Drawing No .
. . Burrs and rough and sharp edges shall be removed after cutting drilling and punching of holes. . SUBSTRATE PREPARATION .
After the completion of sheet metal works and prior to the application of paint or sheeting aluminium material shall be etched on both sides by acid etching in a phosphoric acid bath at a temperature in the range o oC followed by thorough rinsing in clean water .
As an alternative to acid etching the substrate shall be cleaned degreased and mechanically abraded in accordance with the reflective sheeting manufacturers recommendation . .
The sign face shall be treated in accordance with the paint or sheeting manufacturers published instructions as appropriate and in a manner to validate the manufacturers product warranty. . Steel material used for temporary information signs construction work zones and any other special purposes shall be prepared in accordance with the sheeting manufacturers published recommendations and in a manner to validate the manufacturers warranty as applicable .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
FLAT ALUMINIUM AND STEEL SHEET SIGNS BRACED .. SHEET SIZE AND JOINT LIMITATIONS .
Flat sheet signs that can not be manufactured from a single sheet of material and which exceed mm in length but do not exceed mm in height shall be manufactured from the least number of sheets possible. . Flat sheet signs that can not be manufactured from a single sheet of material and which are greater than mm in length may be fabricated as single multipiece signs using vertical joining of either mm mm or mm wide sheets and least number of sheets possible. . Flat sheet signs that can not be manufactured from a single sheet of material and which are greater than mm in height may be fabricated in horizontal modules with each module using the least number of sheets possible .
All horizontal joints shall be by using an approved interlocking stiffener system equivalent to types specified in Clause ..
JOINTS i General .
Joints shall be located so as to minimise the amount of legend directly over the joint. . Legend and background on either side of a joint shall be colour matched .
ii Horizontal Joints .
The top edge of a module that is to join the bottom edge of another module shall have a type A B or C aluminium stiffener attached as specified in Clause The bottom edge of a module that is to join the top edge of another module shall have a Z section stiffener attached as specified in Clause The aluminium stiffeners shall be attached to the aluminium or steel sheet by a single row of evenly spaced rivets or other fixings as specified in Clause .
As an alternative to the horizontal joint constructed in accordance with the above clause horizontal joints may be constructed using Type A Type B or Type C stiffeners together with a sign alignment bracket as detailed on Drawing No .
provided the maximum spacing of the stiffeners is less than mm .
The maximum spacing of the alignment bracket should be mm .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name iii Vertical Joints .
Before vertical joints are constructed the adjoining sheets shall be painted or covered with reflective sheeting .
Joints shall be covered with a backing strip of the same metal type as the sign mm wide terminating mm short of the edge of the sign and discontinued at each horizontal stiffening section with a gap not exceeding mm .
The backing strip for a joint may be omitted if the calculated length of the strip is less than mm .
The backing strip shall be attached to each aluminium sheet by a single row of evenly spaced rivets or by other approved fixings as specified in Clause The resultant gap between two sheets so butted shall not at any point exceed .mm .
Workshop assembly .
An approved joining tape may be used as an alternative method of constructing a joint the backing strip is to be fixed to the sign by mm wide Very High Bond VHB joining strips on both sides of the joint and running along the full length of the backing strip .
Such an approved tape is M VHB tape which shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers instructions. . For large gantry single sign spanning across more than one lane or other very large signs sign panels may be assembled on site in pieces to reduce the difficulty of handling and erecting .
The vertical joints along the full height of the sign shall be formed using preinstalled aluminium angles x x mm in accordance with Drawing No . .
The angles shall be bolted together with a galvanised M bolt and nut at mm spacing with equal distances from sign edges on both sides .
Onsite assembly .. EXTRUDED ALUMINIUM STIFFENERS .
Type A Type B Type C Type A Type B Type C and Type Z stiffeners are detailed on Drawing No .
They shall be affixed to the rear of a sign .
Type A Type B Type C Type A Type B and Type C stiffeners shall be affixed at interval specified on the sign drawings and Z stiffeners shall be used to brace the signs .
Where horizontal alignment brackets are used to brace the signs instead of Z stiffeners in terms of Clause .. ii maximum spacing shall be mm . .
Type A Type B Type C Type A Type B Type C and Type Z stiffeners shall be extruded from aluminium type T in accordance with ASNZS . . Stiffeners attached to signs less than or equal to mm in length shall be a continuous length of extrusion not joined in any way .
Where stiffeners longer than mm are required and the sign is to be manufactured as a single continuous horizontal unit and continuous lengths of extrusion are not available lengths of stiffener extrusion may be joined . .
The ends of the extrusions to be joined shall be machined to facilitate a general purpose full penetration butt weld and the extrusions shall be butt welded together .
Extended stiffeners shall be attached with the connections staggered so that the join in two adjacent stiffeners is separated by a distance exceeding m. . Stiffeners shall be attached to the aluminium or steel sheet by a single row of evenly spaced rivets or other fixings as specified in Clause Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. ROUTE NAME TAGS DISTANCE TAGS AND DROP TAGS .
Route name tags distance tags and drop tags shall be manufactured and fixed to signs using the methods shown on Drawing Nos and .
Where a sign is fabricated using modules then the tag shall only be fixed to the module immediately adjacent to the tag . .
The stiffeners and braces attached to the tags shall be the same type of stiffener section as used on the sign .
Braces shall be fixed to the stiffeners using a bolted connection as specified in Clause .
Signs to be delivered outside the Perth Metropolitan Area shall have their tags and braces removed after trial assembly to simplify packaging .
.. RIVETS AND OTHER FIXINGS .
Rivets for attaching stiffener sections and backing strips shall be mm in diameter and colour matched to the legend and background of the sign .
For signs other than temporary information signs rivets shall be monel or stainless steel pop rivets or selfpiercing riveting system .
For temporary information signs rivets may be manufactured from other suitable materials .
The distance between each rivet shall not exceed mm with the first and last rivets positioned at a distance not exceeding mm from the end of each backing strip or stiffener .
A minimum of two rivets shall be used on each side of a joint to fix a backing strip . .
The acceptance of fixings other than rivets for attaching stiffener sections and backing strips shall be by type approval in individual cases. . Bolted connections used to fix vertical braces to stiffener sections for route name and drop tag attachment shall use the components and the method shown on Drawing Nos and . .
BOX EDGE SECTION SIGNS .
Box edge section signs shall be a .
Formed from a single steel sheet and incorporate a formed mm box edge on all sides in accordance with Drawing No or b .
Constructed by fastening a single steel or aluminium sheet to a frame consisting of welded x SHS tubing in accordance with Drawing No .. . SIGN OVERLAYS .
Sign overlays shall have the reflective sheeting of the same colour and reflective class as stated on the sign drawings .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Aluminium sheet panel overlays shall be fastened to sign panels using monel or stainless steel pop rivets of size mm in diameter and colour matched to the legend and background of the sign .
The distance between each rivet shall not exceed mm with the first and last rivet positioned at a distance not exceeding mm from the edge of the overlay . .
If required protective overlay film compatible with and approved by the sheeting manufacturer shall be applied to the sign overlay prior to installation. . BACKGROUND SURFACES ..
PAINTED SURFACES .

A suitable exterior long life industrial quality matt finish acrylic paint shall be applied to the prepared surface in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
The paint shall be pigmented to give finished colours and specular gloss values in accordance with AS .
.. RETROREFLECTIVE SHEETING .
Retroreflective sheeting shall be applied to the prepared substrate in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
The sheeting shall be applied in one continuous piece without joints as far as possible and shall be in accordance with ASNZS .
and AS .
The retro reflective sheeting for box edge signs shall have the photometric performance of Class as defined in ASNZS .
and as specified on the Drawings. . SIGN BACKGROUND LEGEND SYMBOLS AND BORDERS .. REFLECTORISED A Colour .
The colour of retroreflective sheeting to be used for the sign background legend symbols and borders shall be as specified in AS or as shown on the Drawings for signs not included in AS .
These colours shall fall within the respective designated colour box defined in ASNZS .. B Class .
The class of retroreflective sheeting to be used shall be as follows i .
For Main Roads signs as per the drawings contained in the Main Roads Signs Index .
ii .
For project related signs as per the project sign drawings For all other signs including Australian Standards signs as per Main Roads Sign Standards on the website .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Retroreflective sheeting shall be applied to the prepared substrate in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
Typically the sheeting shall be applied in one continuous piece without joins and shall conform in all respects with the requirements of ASNZS .
and AS . . Coloured legends or backgrounds may be provided by using either transparent or opaque screen process colours or electronic cut films manufactured by the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting to ensure compatibility and durability with the retroreflective sheeting .
The screen process colours or electronic cut films shall be applied using materials and techniques recommended by the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting .
Where joins in the cut films are required they shall be of the butt join type and must not be overlapped. . Where joins in the sheeting are required for Class and retroreflective sheeting they shall be of the overlap type and shall not allow the ingress of moisture after the sign is installed .
Where joins in the sheeting are required for Class W and X material they shall be of the buttjoin type and must not be overlapped .
.. NONREFLECTORISED .
The colours of the nonreflectorised sign legend symbols and borders shall be in accordance with AS or as shown on the sign drawings . .
The nonreflectorised sign legend symbols and borders of flat aluminium unbraced signs may be applied by the silk screening process .
Silk screening inks shall be applied to the background surface in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations. . Nonreflective sheeting shall be applied in accordance with AS ASNZS .
and the manufacturers published recommendations .
Typically the sheeting shall be applied in one continuous piece without joins .
Where joins in the sheeting are required they shall be of the overlap type and shall not allow the ingress of moisture after the sign is installed .
The nonreflective sheeting for temporary signs shall be similar in appearance and have similar qualities as specified in AS and ASNZS .. .
PROTECTIVE OVERLAY FILM OR COATING .
In the Perth Metropolitan Area a protective overlay film or coating shall be applied to the face of all signs apart from Temporary Information Signs and Box Edge Signs .
In rural regions Protective Overlay Film shall only be used when specified . .
The overlay film or coating shall be compatible with and approved by the sheeting manufacturer and shall not affect the warranty of the retro reflective or nonreflective sheeting . .
Along the top of every individual sign or interlocking sign segment the overlay film or coating shall be extended over to the back of the sign for a distance of mm from the top of the sign to prevent ingress of moisture under the overlay film or coating .

H or H. f. AS Sign Number or MRWA Sign Number .

Signs shall be packaged and handled in accordance with the sign sheeting manufacturers recommendations to ensure delivery in an undamaged condition. . Signs manufactured with Class W X sheeting shall be packaged in accordance with the retroreflective sheeting manufacturers recommendations incorporating interleaves of thin foam sheeting .
Signs manufactured with Class retroreflective sheeting shall be packaged for delivery interleaved with the backing sheet of the retroreflective sheeting used. . Unbraced signs as specified in Clause .. shall be packaged in groups not exceeding signs .
Each package of signs shall contain signs of the same type with the quantity and description of the signs marked on each package. . Braced signs shall be packed face to face in packs of two .
The twosign packs shall be packed in groups not exceeding packs supported by timber framing for protection during transportation . .
The packaged signs shall contain a label with the sheeting manufacturers recommendations for handling and storage and shall be marked KEEP DRY on both faces with letters exceeding mm in height. . Signs shall be transported and stored in accordance with Clauses .. . . NOT USED SIGN SUPPORTS .
GENERAL .
Sign support dimensions shall be in accordance with Drawing Nos and and the post schedules shown on the sign drawings . .
The gauge of rectangular hollow section RHS and circular hollow section CHS sign posts for single post signs shall be as specified in Annexure D. . Circular Hollow Section CHS signposts must be secured using an approved fixing device and or sign mounting bracket as specified in Annexure G. Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Flexible sign posts and or mounting bases may be used for single post signs vulnerable to impact .
Normally the post mounting base and sign substrate would be designed to be flexible .
Approved fixing devices are specified in Annexure G. Flexible Sign Posts are defined as sign posts which deflects when impacted by a vehicle and then returns to a vertical position without maintenance intervention .
Flexible sign posts may only be used for the installation of signs that are mounted near the nose of a traffic island .
The height from the ground to the top of the sign shall not exceed .m .
This application may typically be applied to the following signs Flexible Sign Post a. RL or R Keep LeftKeep Right b. R No UTurn c. R UTurn Permitted d. MRGT L or R Cars Only e. MRHM Divisional Marker or D Bidirectional Hazard Marker The types of flexible posts and bases used shall be as specified in Annexure G. . Removable Sign Posts are defined as sign posts which enables the posts to be removed and reinstated from their base with specially designed tools or a lock and key arrangement without damaging either the base or post .
Removable sign posts shall be used where specified for all removable signs on HighWide Load corridor routes .
A PVC casing arrangement and footing details for a removable sign post located in a concrete or paved area is shown in Drawing No. . Removable sign posts may be also be used in locations where signs are frequently hit and the removable post design enables the post to be replaced using the existing footing .
Alternative types of removable sign posts used shall be as specified in Annexure G. Removable Sign Posts .
Frangible aluminium posts as specified in Annexure G and installed in accordance with the manufacturers requirements are also approved for use in WA. . MATERIALS .. NORMAL NONFLEXIBLE POSTS .
Materials used for the fabrication of the posts shall be of the following a .
Low carbon electric resistance welded ERW steel tube in accordance with AS .
b. Galvanised steel strip in accordance with AS .
c. Universal beams shall be BHP Grade in accordance with ASNZS .. Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name d. Base plates for breakaway posts shall be Grade in accordance with ASNZS .
e. Fuse plates for breakaway posts shall be Bisalloy .
f. Ground support stands for box edge section signs shall be MPa mild steel box section and rod .
g. Fluted aluminium poles and sleeves shall be aluminium grade T in accordance with ASNZS . .
The posts shall be saw cut not sheared .
Holes may be drilled or punched .
No deformation to posts shall result from cutting drilling or punching. . Drilling holes in the field on galvanised or powder coated posts shall be kept to a minimum .
If it is required to drill any holes in the field the drilled holes shall be coated with suitable galvanising paint prior to attaching the sign .
..
FLEXIBLE POSTS .
Flexible signposts shall be made with material which provide the properties of strength flexibility impact resistance and durability required .
The material used shall not shatter into multiple parts on impact and after being struck signposts shall not project a dangerous impaling section . .
The material shall be resistant to combustion if located in areas subjected to fire of intensity typical of roadside bush and grass fires .
The material shall not be affected by hydrocarbon solvents such as mineral turpentine kerosene and diesel which may be used for cleaning purposes .
Any metal component should be anticorrosive . .
The signposts shall be capable of retaining its colour appearance and physical properties for at least three years when exposed to weather conditions existing in Western Australia . .
The flexible post shall be capable of selferecting and remaining serviceable after being subjected to a series of direct impacts by a typical passenger vehicle at temperatures between C and C. The posts to be tested shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
The sign post shall be capable of withstanding a series of bumper bar impacts at a speed of kmh directed at degrees to the front face of the post .
The impacting vehicle shall suffer little or no damage during the impact tests .
The sign post shall return to within degrees of vertical within seconds of impact. . HOLES .
The following tolerances for holes shall apply a .
Diameter .mm b. Lateral hole centre position .mm c. Vertical hole centre position .mm Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
POST LENGTH .
CHS and RHS post lengths shall have a tolerance of mm .
Ground support stands for box edge section signs shall have a tolerance of mm. . Dimensions and tolerances of universal beams shall be in accordance with AS . .
SURFACE FINISHING .. POWDER COATED SIGN CHS AND RHS POSTS .
Posts fabricated from electric resistance welded ERW steel tube shall be either zinc coated mill finished or hotdip galvanised after cutting and drilling .
The galvanised coating mass requirement shall be as specified in AS Table for articles that are not centrifuged .
Holes and ends of posts shall have burrs removed prior to galvanising and powder coating .
.. GALVANISED SIGN CHS AND RHS POSTS AND COMPONENTS .
Steel components shall be galvanised to the requirements as specified in AS Table for articles that are not centrifuged .
All galvanising runs and beads shall be removed without exposing the underlying steel surface. . Posts and components shall be hotdip galvanised as follows a .
Posts and components shall be grit blasted to achieve a Class standard of surface preparation as specified in AS .. After grit blasting posts and components shall be pickled in dilute sulphuric or hydrochloric acid in accordance with AS .
and then washed in water to remove all traces of acid .
b. Galvanising of posts and components shall occur within hours of pickling and washing .
Posts and components shall be dipped in a bath of molten zinc not exceeding .
by weight of impurities to produce a minimum coating thickness specified in AS Table for articles that are not centrifuged. . Posts shall be galvanised inside and outside .
Areas of steel exposed during machining including holes and edges shall be touched up with a zinc enriched primer in accordance with ASNZS .. .. BREAKAWAY SIGN POSTS .
Steel components shall be hotdip galvanised in accordance with AS and the requirements of Clause .
Areas of steel exposed during machining including holes and edges shall be touched up with a zinc enriched primer in accordance with ASNZS .. . Where required in terms of Clause .
breakaway sign posts shall be painted with a suitable exterior long life industrial quality matt finish acrylic paint in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
The paint shall be pigmented to give finished colours and specular gloss values in accordance with AS .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Where posts are painted in terms of the above clause an undercoat that is suitable for galvanised surfaces and compatible with the finishing coat paint shall be applied to the prepared substrate in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
.. OTHER APPROVED SIGN POSTS .
The finished surface of all approved sign posts as specified in Annexure G shall be to the manufacturers requirements. . POWDER COATING .. GENERAL .
Where specified in Annexure D or on the sign drawings posts shall be covered with exterior grade lead free polyester powder coat .
The finished colour and specular gloss value shall be equivalent to Golden Yellow Y colour or Bottle Green G as specified in AS and as required in Clause .. ..
PREPARATION .
Zinc coated mill finished and galvanised surfaces shall be degreased using an Alkaline cleaning dip .
The Alkaline cleaning dip shall be removed with water prior to powder coating. . A zinc phosphate conversion coating in accordance with AS .
shall then be applied to zinc coated mill finishes or galvanised surfaces. . After completion of etching the posts shall be thoroughly rinsed with water and allowed to dry .
..
APPLICATION .
The powder coat shall be applied by an electrostatic powder spray to the coating manufacturers specifications to give a finished colour in accordance with Clause Coated surfaces shall be cured for a period exceeding minutes at a metal temperature exceeding C. . PACKAGING FOR DELIVERY .
Sign posts shall be packaged and handled to ensure delivery in an undamaged condition. . Each bundle of posts shall contain a label with recommendations for handling and storage and a description of the posts. . DESIGN OF POSTS .

. . FLAT ALUMINIUM AND STEEL SHEET SIGNS UNBRACED .. SIGN SUPPORT .

or as indicated on the post schedule drawings for the specific project .
.. POST HOLE EXCAVATION .
A square or circular hole as shown on drawing No .
or manufacturers drawing for flexible and removable posts shall be excavated to accommodate the sign post footing and any attachments .
The excavated soil shall be stockpiled adjacent to the hole for use as backfill or disposed of in an acceptable manner .
.. SIGN FIXING .
The signs shall be fixed to the sign post prior to installation using a M or M galvanised bolt a nylon washer between bolt head and the sign face and nut with a security washer manufactured in accordance with Clause .
or as specified otherwise in the contract .
..
INSTALLATION .
The sign post with the signs fixed in place shall be positioned in the centre of the post hole. . Compacted earth and concrete shall be used to backfill the hole in accordance with Drawing No . .
The top mm shall be filled using a similar material to the surrounding ground . .
The sign post shall be vertical as measured by a spirit level and the sign shall be orientated towards oncoming traffic in accordance with Clause .. . Each layer of backfill shall be compacted with six blows of a kg hand tamper .
The level of the completed backfill shall be within mm and mm of the surface level of the surrounding ground .
Excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site . .
Flexible and removable signs posts shall be installed in accordance with the Drawing No .
or manufacturers recommendation for approved products given in Annexure G. Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
A plastic or aluminium end cap shall be fitted to the top of the post to prevent the ingress of water . .
If an approved selflocking taper is used for installing the sign post the footing sleeves and bases for the installation of the sign post shall be in accordance with the manufacturers recommendation .
.. ERECTION .
Once signs have been transported to the road site they should not be laid flat on the ground .
Laying signs flat can result in damage to the reflective face through direct contact with the ground . .
When attaching signs to posts all connecting bolts should be tightened using offset spanners not socket wrenches .
The use of offset spanners minimise tool and hand contact with the sign face and avoids scratching or the surface as well as allowing the extent of tightening to be observed .
Only one end of the nut and bolt should be tightened preferably tightened from the rear of the sign . .
Tightening from both sides can transfer stress into the top film of reflective sheeting resulting in permanent pinwheel style wrinkles .
Avoid over tightening the connecting bolts as this can cause specular glare from dimples on the sign face. . Nylon washers shall be used between connecting bolt heads and the sign face to protect the reflective sheeting from the twisting action of the bolt heads. . A circle of diameter slightly larger than the bolt head may be scored in the reflective sign face around the bolt hole to minimise any fine cracking that may inadvertently occur during bolt tightening . .
When erecting large guide and information signs care must be taken to prevent lifting ropes cables and chains from contacting the sign surface .
These can cause permanent visible damage. . After installation and before leaving the road site inspect all signs to see that they have not been damaged during erection and are free of oil and dirt residue from fingers and tools .
.. TRAFFIC ISLANDS .
Rigid and Nonremovable Sign posts a .
During construction of concrete filled islands a circular hole mm mm in diameter or mm mm square hole and mm mm in depth shall be excavated to accommodate a mm long section of mm diameter PVC bore casing as shown in Drawing .
b .
The PVC bore casing shall be positioned centrally in the hole such that the top of the bore casing is within mm and mm of the proposed finished surface level of the concrete infill .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name c. The PVC bore casing shall be filled with clean sand up to a depth mm below the top of the bore casing within mm and mm limit .
d. When installing the sign any damage to brick paving or concrete infill shall be repaired with materials of the same type size and colour in accordance with the MRWA Kerbing and Concrete Infill Specification and the MRWA Brick Paving Specification .
e. Excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site . .
Flexible and removable Sign posts a. Footings sleeves and bases for flexible and removable posts shall be constructed in accordance with Drawing No .
or the manufacturers drawings .
..
ALTERNATIVE SIGN POST FIXING DEVICES .
For signs to be installed where a concrete surface can not readily be removed to excavate the post hole an approved galvanised post mounting bracket may be bolted to the surface .
Main Roads approved mounting brackets are listed at Annexure G. The taperlock method for fixing the sign post may be used as an alternative by core drilling the surface or removing the pavers to install the socket in the case of a paved area .
The method of installation shall be as recommended by the manufacturer .
.. ATTACHMENT OF SIGNS TO TRAFFIC SIGNAL POLES .
Mounting brackets for signs attached to traffic signal poles shall be as shown on Drawing No or an equivalent stainless steel banding strap .
Under no circumstances shall mounting brackets or any other fixing be used which necessitates drilling holes into the traffic signal pole. . EXTRUDED ALUMINIUM SECTION SIGNS .. GENERAL .
Extruded aluminium section signs are supported by one or two posts. . Street name signs mounted below an intersection warning sign shall be installed as part of the warning sign as specified in Clause .
for its lateral placement and height. . Other extruded aluminium section signs including street name blades shall be installed as specified in Clause .
for its longitudinal lateral placements and height. . Standard fingerboard signs brackets are shown in Drawing No .
. . FLAT ALUMINIUM SHEET SIGNS BRACED POST MOUNTED .. SIGN SUPPORTS .
Braced aluminium and steel sheet signs post mounted are generally supported by two or three posts .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The number type size and length of the posts required will be specified on the sign drawings .
In special circumstances braced signs may be installed on a single post provided that a .
The post is designed to withstand the bending moment caused by wind loading b .
The post meets frangibility requirements c. The post is restrained from rotating in the ground d. The sign is restrained from rotating around the post e. The stiffeners shall be designed in accordance with Drawing No. . f. The post is restrained from becoming a projectile in the event of it shearing off or becoming dislodged from its footing after a vehicle impact .
.. POST HOLE EXCAVATIONS .
The dimensions of post hole excavations shall be designed in accordance with Drawing No .
and specified on the sign drawings .
The excavated soil shall be stockpiled adjacent to the excavations for use as backfill or disposed of in an acceptable manner .
.. POST FOOTINGS .
The post footing dimensions shall be designed in accordance with Drawing No .
and specified on the sign drawings .
The associated steel reinforcing details shall be in accordance with Drawing No .
unless otherwise specified on sign drawings .
..
INSTALLATION .
The sign posts shall be positioned vertically in the centre of the post holes . .
The concrete post footings shall be poured with Class N concrete and compacted around the base of each post in accordance with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS . .
The sign posts shall be vertical as measured by a spirit level and the signs shall be orientated towards oncoming traffic in accordance with Clause .. .
Excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site. . Where applicable a plastic or aluminium end cap shall be fitted to the top of the post to prevent the ingress of water .
.. SIGN FIXING .
The sign post footings shall be allowed to cure for a minimum of hours prior to fixing the signs unless rapid hardening concrete is used in which case the cement manufacturers requirements shall be complied with .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The signs shall be attached to the posts using fixings manufactured in accordance with Clause .
and be level as measured by a spirit level. . Fixing and installation details for hazard markers and one way two way direction arrow markers on posts are show on the following drawings a .
Combination hazard markers Drawing No .
b .
Single hazard markers Drawing No .
c. One way Two way arrow direction signs Drawing No. . FLAT ALUMINIUM SHEET SIGNS BRACED GANTRY OR BRIDGE MOUNTED .. SIGN SUPPORTS .
The structure and support details for mounting overhead signs will be detailed on the sign drawings .
For large gantry signs assembled at the site with vertical joints constructed in accordance with Clause .. iii the spacing of supports shall provide any additional support required for the joints and shall avoid coinciding directly with the vertical joints . .
The final approval for the gantry design for large signs mentioned above shall not proceed until the Principal acknowledges in writing that the supports are positioned appropriately to support the sign assembly. . Signs fixed directly to bridge structures shall be in accordance with guideline Drawing No . .
HOLD POINT ..
INSTALLATION .
The sign support structure andor supports shall be installed in accordance with the details shown on the sign drawings and be level as measured by a spirit level .
.. SIGN FIXING .
The signs shall be attached to the sign supports using fixings manufactured in accordance with Clause .. . SIGN OVERLAYS .
Sign overlays shall be fixed to the sign panels in accordance with Clause .. . . NOT USED SIGN REMOVAL .
SIGN REMOVAL .
Signs shall be detached from the sign supports and either reused or disposed of at an authorised disposal site .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Traffic signs that are to be reused shall be transported and stored in accordance with Clauses .
.. . SIGN SUPPORT REMOVAL .
Sign supports fittings and footings shall be removed and disposed of. . Sign support holes shall be backfilled watered and compacted in layers not exceeding mm to within mm and mm of the surface level of the surrounding ground . .
The backfill shall be compacted until the final passes or blows of the compaction equipment leave no impressions on the backfilled surface . .
Excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site . .
SURFACE REINSTATEMENT .
Damaged brick paving or concrete infill shall be repaired with materials of the same type size and colour in accordance with Specification KERBING and Specification SEGMENTAL PAVING. . Grass verges shall be backfilled and reinstated to the same standard as the surrounds . .
Excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site .
. . NOT USED TRANSPORTATION AND STORAGE OF SIGNS .
TRANSPORTATION .
Traffic signs are intended to communicate information to the road user in a clear and concise manner . .
This can only be accomplished if the surface of the sign is free of damage abrasion dirt oil or other markings causing loss of legibility .
These problems are especially severe when dealing with reflective material since nighttime legibility is directly related to the quality and clarity of the reflective surface . .
This guide serves to highlight the important aspects of correct reflective sign storage and handling and is designed to be used by sign manufacturers sign users and erectors. . All finished signs should be handled transported and stored to prevent damage to the sign face or other components .
Signs should be stored vertically with their edges clear of the ground and in such a manner that the sign faces are not scuffed or marked making use of protruding stiffening members where possible. . Back to back storage of signs is permitted but pressure must not be transferred onto a sign face by any other sign or sign support .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
When transporting signs by truck or trailer it is imperative that signs be securely braced vertically and adequately supported and secured to avoid damage due to scuffing abrasion and load shifting. . Large guide and information signs should be braced using wooden stiffeners attached to the extensions at the back of the sign and transported with the stiffeners in place to avoid buckling and rivet popping. . INDOOR STORAGE .
Signs should be preferably stored indoors .
Signs required to be stored outdoors must have the packaging removed and be stored so as to permit free air circulation and normal moisture evaporation .
Moisture must be prevented from remaining in contact with the face of the sign at all times .
Packaging that has become wet or damp must be removed immediately and the signs permitted to dry completely .
Steps need to be taken to ensure that high temperature and high humidity conditions do not occur in either indoor or outdoor storage . .
OUTDOOR STORAGE .
Signs stored outdoors shall be unwrapped from their transport packaging and stored upright on edge using wooden battens on the floor or as vertical supports or both. . Signs stored outdoors especially large guide or information signs should be stored using a racking system that will provide vertical support for the stored signs that will avoid pressure points on sign faces and allow adequate air circulation between sign faces to prevent a buildup of moisture. . SIGN COVERING .
Covering signs is not good general practice due to the damage that can be caused to the sign face through the interaction of environmental conditions . .
If it is necessary to cover a sign face temporarily after erection caution must be exercised as some coverings may cause permanent damage to the sign face following exposure to moisture and sunlight .
Some porous materials have been used successfully for limited periods by folding the material over the sign and securing it at the back of the sign .
At the same time the material needs to have sufficient opacity to prevent the reflective face of the sign showing through at night . .
Covering signs with paper or plastic materials especially black is forbidden as it is known that these materials are responsible for severe and permanent damage within hours as a consequence of the high temperatures and humidity conditions that can be generated during entrapment. . Avoid the use of ropes wire fasteners or strapping that may abrade the sign surface .
Do not apply tape to the sign race because sunlight will cause it to bond permanently .
Masking or application tape must be removed prior to exposure to sunlight . .
Some specially formulated low tack pressure sensitive films are available that are suitable to mask signs .
For specific details on use refer to technical literature available from the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
It is important that suitable materials are selected for covering signs in order not to jeopardise Sign Performance Warranties provided by the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting .
. . NOT USED SIGN MAINTENANCE .
SIGN MAINTENANCE .. GENERAL .
All materials and application processes used for the maintenance of signs shall comply with this Specification . .
The level of service of all signs shall not fall below the minimum performance criteria as specified in Clause .. SIGN REPLACEMENT .
Signs to be replaced shall be removed in accordance with Clause .. .
Replacement signs shall be attached to the post using fixings manufactured in accordance with Clause .
and be level as measured by a spirit level . .
The replacement of signs shall be carried out in a single operation to ensure a minimum length of time during which the signs are not in use .
.. SIGN REMOVAL .
Sign removal sign post removal and surface reinstatement shall be in accordance with Clauses .
to .. .. SIGN CLEANING .
Traffic signs shall be cleaned without damage to the sign face and legend. . Traffic signs shall be cleaned to remove all dust grime and other loose or foreign material from the sign face legend and rear of sign panel . .
Typical cleaning methods include washing using a mild detergent agent mixed in water with soft bristle brooms or brushes and rinsing with potable water .
The sign surface shall be free from streaks after washing. . Graffiti shall be removed in accordance with the paint sheeting or protective overlay sheeting manufacturers instructions . .
The Contractor shall be responsible for ensuring the compatibility of the proposed cleaning method and medium without injurious effect to the sign sign face and legend .
Traffic signs damaged by the Contractors cleaning works shall be rectified at no cost to the Principal. . For maximum performance signs should be kept clean and free from dirt road tar oil bituminous material and mulch .
Primarily this means cleaning the surface of the reflective sheeting the essential characteristic of a sign .
Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
A wet detergent type nonabrasive cleaner suitable for high quality paint surfaces is recommended .
The cleaner must also be free or strong aromatic solvents or alcohols and be chemically neutral i.e .
pH of around ..
Following use of any cleaning agent the sign surface must be thoroughly and immediately rinsed with clean water .
In all cleaning operations care should be taken not to abrade the sign by use of stiffbristle brushes or by unnecessary scrubbing .
.. NORMAL CLEANING PROCEDURE .
Flush the surface with clean water to remove loose dirt particles .
A squeeze or triggered hose nozzle is convenient for this purpose. . Wash the sign face with a rag or sponge using detergent or any of several suitable commercial cleaners .
Wash thoroughly from the top down .
Once suds have been applied keep a steady stream of water flowing on the sign face to wash away dirt particles. . Rinse the entire sign face with clean water and allow the sign to drain dry. . Take extreme care in cleaning screened sign faces since some cleaning solvents may damage the screen printed area .
Use a mild solvent such as mineral spirits .
Follow with detergent and water then rinse with clean water .
Do not use high pressure sprayers .
Do not direct sprays at sign face edges .
..
PERFORMANCE CRITERIA A Colour Fade or Change .
When blue brown or green signs are viewed under either daytime or night time conditions the perceived colour shall be that commonly associated with that designated colour that is there shall be no degradation of appearance that would allow a sign using one of these colours to be confused with either of the other colours .
B RetroReflectivity and Luminance .
The retroreflectivity shall be measured in accordance with AS .
Appendix A at an observation angle of .o and at an entrance angle of o The value must be an average of five readings equally spaced across the width of larger signs or within the area of smaller signs and shall be greater than the minimum value specified in Table .. .
The luminance factor is measured in accordance with AS .
Appendix C using the Y function of the CIE colour system and shall be less than the maximum value specified in Table .. Specification Signs Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name TABLE .

The Contract documentation needs to a. make clear instruction to the type of signs required b. provide or refer to design details for all signs other than signs contained in the Australian Standard .

c. Provide information about sign location asset number for all two posted signs. . SIGN LEGEND Sign legend designs to be in accordance with a .

NOT USED ANNEXURE A Guide Post Schedule ANNEXURE B Approved Guide Post List ANNEXURE C Checklist for Flexible Guide Post Approval Submission Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name SPECIFICATION GUIDE POSTS GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the supply installation and maintenance of Guide Posts and Delineators. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Paints and Related Materials Methods of Test .
AS .
Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices Traffic Control Devices for General Use AS .
Retroreflective Materials and Devices for Road Traffic Control Purposes Retroreflective Sheeting AS .
Retroreflective Materials and Devices for Road Traffic Control Purposes Retroreflective Devices Nonpavement Application .
AS Timber Hardwood Visually StressGraded for Structural Purposes AS Timber Softwood Visually Graded for Structural Purposes AS .
Guide to the Properties of Paints for Buildings Primer Wood Solventborne Interiorexterior AS .
Guide to the Properties of Paints for Buildings Undercoat Solventborne Interiorexterior AS Guide to the Painting of Buildings SAA TR Part Specification for Full Gloss Paint Solvent Borne Exterior AS .
Guide to the Properties of Paints for Buildings Solventborne Interiorexterior Full gloss enamel Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
DEFINITIONS Flexible guide post A guide post which deflects when impacted by a vehicle and then returns to a vertical position without maintenance intervention .
Flexible Rigid guide post A guide post which either fractures or remains intact and straight but not vertical when Impacted by a vehicle .
Rigid . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
GENERAL .
The Contractor shall supply new guide posts delineators and fixings in accordance with this section of the specification .
An approved list of guidepost manufacturers for use in Western Australia is supplied in Annexure B. . GUIDE POST COLOUR .
All faces of the guide post shall be white in colour for at least a length of mm from the top of the guide post. . GUIDE POST SURFACE FINISH .
The guide post shall be free of sharp edges burrs discolouration or other defects which may affect its appearance andor serviceability .
The portion of the guide post that is white in colour shall have a surface finish that permits repeated easy cleaning. . GUIDE POST DIMENSION AND SHAPE .
The cross sections of the guide post are to be such that it permits the guide post to meet the requirements of this specification . .
The following dimensional requirements as shown in Figure must be satisfied a. Width guide post shall have a projected width of mm mm Width b .
Length guide posts shall be manufactured to a length that permits insitu above ground height and below ground depth in accordance with Figure .
Length c. Shape the shape of the guide post shall be such that approved delineators can be permanently and securely attached to the guide post .
Shape d. Tops the tops of timber guide posts shall be cut to an angle to promote water run off in accordance with Figure .
The tops of other types of guide posts may be cut square to the sides or may be angled .
The shape of the bottom face of the guide post can be made to suit the method of installation .
Tops Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
GUIDE POST WARRANTY .
The period of the warranty for guide posts shall be a minimum of years .
During the period of the warranty the Supplier shall without delay and at no cost to the Principal correct all defects and omissions covered by the warranty by way of repair replacement or modification or other means .
The Warranty must be in writing naming Main Roads Western Australia Principal as the product owner .
When a product fails this specification under the warranty period the supplier is required to replace the product at no cost to the Main Roads Western Australia .
Refer to Main Roads Special Conditions of Contract Warranties from Third Parties .
Warranty .
GUIDE POST MARKINGS .
To enable traceability of the guide post each post shall have legible markings for the duration of the warranty period containing the following information Traceability Marking a. name of the supplier b. date of manufacture c. batch number d. end of warranty date e. model identification number name .
The markings shall be placed on at least one side of the guide post and shall be between mm and mm from the top of the guide post .
The lettering size shall be between mm and mm high. . A horizontal depth indicator shall be marked across the rear face of the guide post mm from the top .
The indicator shall remain clear for the full life expectancy of the guide post .
Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name FIGURE GUIDE POST AND DELINEATOR .
RIGID GUIDE POSTS .. GENERAL .
Rigid guide posts shall not shatter into multiple parts on impact .
After being struck guide posts shall not project a dangerous impaling section . .
Rigid guide posts shall have a minimum bending strength of .kNm and a maximum bending strength of .kNm at yield .
..
TIMBER .
Timber guide posts shall be manufactured from mm x mm Structural Grade Timber being either Jarrah or treated Pine conforming to AS and AS respectively .
Timber Guide Posts Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Both mm faces shall be lightly dressed to remove all saw marks over of the face area .
Thicknessing is not required on any dimension . .
Timber may be unseasoned .
The guide post shall be free from compression failures and other fractures termite galleries end splits and bark . .
The entire exposed above ground surface area of the guide post shall be coated in paint either by brushing spraying or immersion in accordance with the paint manufacturers published requirements .
The exposed surface area shall be painted as follows Painting Timber Guide Posts a .
One coat of Primer to AS .
b .
One coat of white Undercoat to AS .
c. One coat of white Gloss to SAA TRI Part and AS .
Paint for rigid guide posts shall conform to the requirements of AS .
The perimeter of the guide post shall be finished in a durable gloss or semi gloss opaque white colour . .
The surfaces of the guide post to be painted shall be dry and free from all foreign matter including sawdust sand dust dirt or other material or substance that could prevent the paint adhering .
.. STEEL GUIDE POSTS .
All faces of steel guide posts shall conform to a smooth gloss white powder coat finish to a minimum coat thickness of .mm .
Rigid Steel Guide Posts .
Steel guide posts shall be free of rust or other defects for the duration of the warranty period. . Steel guide posts shall not have blunt edges exposed to passing motorists . .
FLEXIBLE GUIDE POSTS .
Flexible guide posts shall be manufactured from material that does not shatter into multiple parts on impact .
After being struck guide posts shall not project a dangerous impaling section .
Materials .
Details of the materials used in the manufacture of the guide post shall be supplied .
These may include but are not limited to plastic and rubber .
Details of the material properties including information relating to the use of recycled materials shall also be provided . .
The material shall not vary beyond commercially accepted limits from the composition stated by the manufacturer at the time of offering .
Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The guide post shall be made to a design and from material which provide the properties of strength flexibility impact resistance and durability required .
The guide post shall be capable of retaining of its colour appearance and physical properties for at least years when exposed to weather conditions existing in Western Australia .
The material shall be resistant to mould growth and shall not be affected by hydrocarbon solvents such as mineral turpentine kerosene or diesel which may be used for cleaning purposes .
The material shall be resistant to termites and resistant to combustion if subjected to fire of intensity typical of roadside bush and grass fires .
Any metal component shall be free of rust or other defects for at least years of the operational life of the guidepost . .
The guide post shall be installed in the ground such that it resists overturning or displacement by wind forces and does not work out of the ground due to oscillations .
Guide Post Anchorage .
All testing specified in this Clause shall be undertaken by a NATA accredited laboratory .
The vehicle impact test .. can be undertaken by a non NATA accredited laboratory .
A single submission of all the test results listed within this Clause shall be provided .
These results shall be less than years old unless approved otherwise by the Principal and shall be for the exact type of guide post offered .
Test Results .
If a warranty is not available for the guidepost then a sample of the guide post shall be subject to artificial weathering for a period of hours in either a. Atlas Twin Sunshine Carbon Arc Weatherometer or Weathering Resistance b. Xeon Arc Weatherometer at .
wattsm irradiance level with Boro Boro filters .
During the weathering of the sample it shall be subject to c. Light and dark alternating cycles of the testing time .
d. Temperature during light cycles shall be a minimum of degrees .
e. Humidity temperatures shall be cyclic and be of the testing time. . After exposure the surface shall be free from crazing or blistering .
The degree of chalking and colour change shall not fall below a rating of and the loss of gloss shall not exceed gloss units egg shell gloss when evaluated in accordance with AS Methods .
and .
Specular Gloss . .
The guide post shall demonstrate shape retention under the specified thermal tests within this Clause .
For each shape retention test the guide post shall be held in a clamp .
The jaws of the clamp shall be shaped to match the profile of the guide post .
Shape Retention Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The guide post shall be conditioned at C C for hours in an oven prior to being clamped .
The conditioned guide post shall be capable of straightening itself to within of vertical within seconds of being bent at the midpoint .
This test is to be performed four times for both directions and each test shall be completed within minutes of removal from oven .
Heat Resistance .
The guide post shall be conditioned at C C ice bath for hours prior to being clamped .
The following tests shall then be performed Cold Resistance a .
The conditioned post shall be capable of straightening itself to within of vertical within seconds of being bent at the midpoint .
This test is to be performed four times for both directions .
The post shall be reconditioned for seconds between bend tests .. b .
The conditioned post shall show no signs of fracturing cracking or splitting when a steel ball weighing kilogram is dropped a distance of mm through a vertical frictionless guide to impact the surface of the post .
The surface of the post being struck by the ball shall be in a horizontal position with the post supported and clamped in position at both ends .
The length between supports shall be mm .
This impact test shall be carried out five times and concentrated near the middle of the post .
The post shall be reconditioned for seconds between impact tests .
Impact Testing .
The guide post shall be capable of self erecting and remaining serviceable after being subjected to a series of direct impacts by a typical passenger vehicle at temperatures between C and C. A minimum sample of three guide posts shall be tested .
The testing of the guide posts shall be conducted in a single run .
The guide posts to be tested shall be installed in accordance with the recommendations of the manufacturer and shall be furnished complete with delineators .
The guide posts shall be capable of withstanding a series of bumper bar impacts at a speed of kmh followed by bumper bar impacts at a speed of kmh directed at degrees to the front face of the guide post .
The impacting vehicle shall suffer little or no damage during the impact tests .
The guide post shall return to within degrees of vertical within  hour of impact .
Test results which show the guide posts are capable of withstanding the above vehicle impacts are to be provided .
This shall include video footage evidence .
The video footage shall be uninterrupted and show the guide posts returning to within degrees of vertical within  hour of impact .
Ending the video footage before the guide posts return to vertical is not acceptable .
The video footage requires a time and date stamp .
Vehicle Impact .
The design and composition of flexible guide posts shall be such that they conform to the requirements of Test A and Test B of the Guide Post Rigidity Tests drawing as shown in Figure .
The rigidity tests are to be performed at a temperature of C. Rigidity Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name FIGURE GUIDE POST RIGIDITY TESTS Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
DELINEATORS .
Delineators supplied for attachment to guide posts shall meet the following requirements A Corner cubed delineator Type A Type A Delineators Comply with AS .
Red and white delineators shall be nominally mm in diameter B Retroreflective sheeting delineator Class A Class A Delineators Comply with requirements of Class A material as defined in AS .
Red and white delineators shall be mm mm for height and width respectively . .
FIXINGS FOR DELINEATORS .
The following fixings shall be provided for installing delineators to guide posts .
a. Screws or nails shall be supplied to affix Class A delineators to guide posts .
SelfAdhesive delineators may be used on guide posts that have a surface finish that permits adequate bonding of the delineator to the guide post .
b. Vandal proof screws shall be supplied to affix Type A delineators to RIGID guide posts .
. . NOT USED INSTALLATION .
REMOVAL OF EXISTING GUIDE POSTS .
Any existing guide posts that need to be removed prior to or during works are to be removed by the Contractor .
The guide posts shall be disposed of by the Contractor and a new guide post shall be installed .
If the guide posts are suitable for reuse or refurbishment the Contractor may either reuse or refurbish the guide posts in accordance with this specification .
Existing Posts Removed .
Redundant treated pine guide posts shall be removed to a hazardous materials disposal area .
Hazardous Materials .
TIMING .
Guide posts shall be installed on new works after completion of bituminous surfacing and final trimming of batters or as soon as practicable .
Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
LOCATION OF GUIDE POSTS .
New guide posts with appropriate delineators shall be located in accordance with the Guide Post Schedule at Annexure A. . Guide posts shall be installed in conjunction with road safety barriers in accordance with AS .
clause b .
Road Safety Barriers .
POSITIONING .
On unkerbed roads guide posts shall be positioned so that the inside face of the posts line up with the outside edge of the road shoulder Refer to Figure .
Position from Shoulder .
On kerbed roads the setback from the kerb face to the roadside face of guide posts shall be m Refer to Figure .
Position from Kerb .
BURIED GUIDE POSTS .
Guide post holes shall be drilled or dug with vertical sides and having depth as per Figure .
The material excavated shall be used for backfilling around the guide post. . Once the guide post has been put in place the hole shall be backfilled and compacted with the guide post vertical when measured with a spirit level such that the top of the guide post is within mm of the guide post at ground .
The density of the compacted backfill shall be not less than that of the material in the adjacent shoulder .
Backfill and Compaction .
Surplus material shall be disposed of by the Contractor . .
DRIVEN GUIDE POSTS .
Driven guide posts shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements to a depth as per Figure .
Installed Depth .
Manual guide post rammers shall not be used for driven guide post installations. . GUIDE POST SLOTS .
Guide posts installed in floodways shall be installed in guide posts slots .
If the slot is to be located in the concrete floodway edge wall care shall be taken when installing the slot so as not to damage the edge wall .
A wedge shall be used to secure the guide post in the slot .
Floodways .
INSTALLATION HEIGHT .
On unkerbed roads guide posts shall be installed so that the top of the guide post is mm above the level of the adjacent outside edge of the road shoulder with a tolerance of mm or mm as shown in Figure .
Unkerbed Roads .
On kerbed roads guide posts shall be installed so that the top of the guide post is mm above the adjacent seal edge level with a tolerance of mm or mm as shown in Figure .
Kerbed Roads Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
ORIENTATION .
All guide posts shall be installed with the mm face at right angles to the carriageway such that the face is directed at the approaching vehicles. . Guide posts with a curved cross section shall be installed with the convex face front towards approaching traffic in the lane nearest the guide post .
Curved Cross Sections .
Guide posts with angled tops shall be installed such that the highest point at the top of the guide post is nearest to the carriageway as shown in Figure .
Angled Tops .
DELINEATORS .
Delineators shall be fitted to guide posts as follows Refer also to Figure a. when viewed in the direction of travel along the carriageway RED delineators shall be on the left side and WHITE delineators shall be on the right side of the carriageway .
Delineator Colour b .
On undivided roads delineators shall be provided on both sides of each guide post .
Undivided Roads c. On divided roads where guide posts are used delineators shall be provided only on the side of the guide post seen by a driver on that carriageway .
Divided Roads .
Rigid guide posts shall be fitted with delineators meeting either Type A or Class A requirements .
Where guide posts are installed on both sides of the carriageway the same delineator type shall be used .
Delineator Type Rigid Posts .
Flexible guide posts shall be fitted with delineators meeting Class A requirements .
Type A delineators shall not be fitted to flexible guide posts .
Delineator Type Flexible Posts .
Delineators shall not be fitted to road safety barriers .
Delineation of road safety barriers shall be by way of guide posts in accordance with Clause .. Road Safety Barriers .
Mounting Location a .
If corner cubed delineators Type A are to be attached to the guide post a flat area at least mm in diameter shall be provided in the centre of both mm faces of the guide post .
For timber posts this flat area shall be recessed to the depth of the delineator .
The centre of these flat areas shall be mm from the top of the guide post as per Figure .
Delineator Mounting Location b .
If retroreflective sheeting Class A delineators are to be fitted to the guide post an essentially flat area mm long by mm wide shall be provided in the centre of both mm faces of the guide post .
The centre of the flat areas shall be mm from the top of the guide post as per Figure .
If the surface of the guide post has a curvature the radius of the curvature is to be no less than mm .
Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name FIGURE DELINEATOR LOCATIONS .
INSTALLATION TOLERANCES .
The following tolerances shall apply to the installation and maintenance of guide posts Post Height above ground level mm Offset from outside of shoulder mark mm Longitudinal Position from chainage mark mm Deviation from vertical measured at top of post mm Painted Length of Guide Post mm Delineator position mm . . NOT USED MAINTENANCE .
REFURBISHMENT OF GUIDE POSTS .
Refurbishment of guide posts with faded or peeling paint shall be carried out in accordance with this Specification .
Painting Specification Guide Posts Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
REALIGNING GUIDE POSTS .
Guide posts not vertical shall be realigned to the vertical .
The material around the base of the post shall be compacted so that the density of the material retaining the guide post is not less than that of the material in the adjacent shoulder . .
REPLACING MISSING OR DAMAGED GUIDE POSTS .
Missing or damaged guide posts shall be replaced at their previous location in accordance with this Specification. . Damaged guide posts shall be removed and disposed of by the Contractor .
Treated pine guide posts shall be disposed of in accordance with Clause .. .
TEMPORARY REMOVAL OF GUIDE POSTS .
Where guide posts are temporarily removed to facilitate roadworks they shall be reinstated in their previous locations in accordance with this Specification. . DELINEATOR REPLACEMENT .
Damaged or nonreflecting delineators shall be removed and disposed of by the Contractor. . Damaged or missing delineators shall be replaced with delineators of the same type and colour as used by adjacent guide posts for consistency. . Guide posts shall not be left without delineators overnight . .
WASHING DELINEATORS INSITU .
Existing delineators that still have adequate retro reflectivity shall be washed clean so that they are free of all road grime dust and dirt .

All edits to downloaded Specifications shall be made using Track Changes to clearly show addeddeleted text . .
If all information relating to a clause is deleted the clause number should be retained and the words NOT USED should be inserted . .
The proposed documents with tracked changes shall be submitted to the Project Manager for review prior to printing the final batch of documents .
When this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off. . Before printing accept all changes in the document turn off Track Changes and refresh the Table of Contents . .
The Custodian of this specification is Road Engineer. . mm INSTALLATION HEIGHT Clause . . Guide posts have previously been installed to a height of mm above the adjacent edge of shoulder and kerb invert for unkerbed and kerbed roads respectively .
The current standard is mm and as such this document has been written with reference to mm only .
Where there are no other feasible alternatives guide posts manufactured to the previous standard may be used .
In such cases Clause .
shall be added to Contract Specific Requirements. . WARRANTY .
Warranty .
for guide post approval submission shall be in the format as shown in Figure .

After inserting the clause change the clause number and heading to style H SP so it appears in the Table of Contents . .
INSTALLATION HEIGHT .
On unkerbed roads guide posts shall be installed so that the top of the guide post is mm above the level of the adjacent outside edge of the road shoulder with a tolerance of mm mm. . On kerbed roads guide posts shall be installed so that the top of the guide post is mm above the adjacent seal edge level with a tolerance of mm mm .

NOT USED ANNEXURE A Specification Safety and Traffic Barrier Systems Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name Approved Wire Rope Safety Barrier Systems ANNEXURE B Road Safety Barrier Systems Requirements ANNEXURE C Concrete Class for Concrete Barriers ANNEXURE D Approved Solid Blockouts ANNEXURE E Principals Storage Area ANNEXURE F Principal Supplied Items Specification Safety and Traffic Barrier Systems Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name SPECIFICATION SAFETY TRAFFIC BARRIER SYSTEMS GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the supply fabrication protective treatment and installation of permanent road safety barrier systems and traffic barriers for structures as shown on the Drawings and in accordance with ASNZS . .
Except where this Specification states otherwise where this Specification refers to road safety barrier systems the requirements shall also apply to traffic barriers for structures. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS ISO Metric Hexagonal Bolts and Screws AS ISO Metric Hexagon Nuts AS Structural Steel Hollow Sections AS Hot Dipped Galvanized Coatings on Threaded Fasteners AS Flat Metal Washers for General Engineering Purposes Metric Series AS High strength steel bolts with associated nuts and washers for structural engineering AS Steel wire for tendons in prestressed concrete AS Steel Tendons for Prestressed Concrete Wire Stress Relieved Steel Strand for Tendons in Prestressed Concrete AS Steel tendons for prestressed concrete Coldworked hightensile alloy steel bars for prestressed concrete AS Specification and Supply of Concrete AS .
