SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of all work standards materials and workmanship required for the supply installation removal andor replacement of lighting and related equipment power connection focusing testing and maintenance of Roadway Lighting. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .

of Western Australia Office of Energy WA Electrical Requirements Australian Standards AS Degrees of Protection Provided by Enclosures for Electrical Equipment AustralianNew Zealand Standards ASNZS .. ELECTRICITY REGULATIONS AND AUTHORITIES .
The Works shall be carried out in accordance with the Office of Energy WA Electrical Requirements ASNZS AustralianNew Zealand Wiring Rules the requirements of Western Power Synergy Horizon or any other authority having jurisdiction over the installation Power Supply Authority .
Electricity Act .
The Contractor shall submit all notices and applications required by the Power Supply Authority and pay any fees required .
Notices .
The power supply is as detailed on design Drawings .
The Contractor shall ensure all equipment is designed to operate at the correct voltages prior to installation .
The Contractor shall ensure all equipment installed is suitable for the maximum prospective short circuit current found at the point of installation .
Power Supply Voltage supply .
CONTRACTORS DRAWINGS .. MANUFACTURING DRAWINGS .
Pole fabrication Drawings assembly and erection instructions shall be prepared in accordance with ASNZS Clause .
prior to commencing manufacture .
Pole Fabrication Drawings .
Switchboard Design Drawings showing elevation and section details equipment layout materials schedule and label details shall be prepared prior to commencing manufacture .
The Switch Boards Design Drawings shall comply with the Main Roads Design Drawing presentation and Typical Standard Drawings for switchboards .
Switchboard Drawings Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Drawings shall be prepared on the Principals Standard Drawing templates for borders and title blocks and shall comply with Main Roads numbering system .
Drawing Number .
STAGED CONSTRUCTION WORKS .
The contractor shall advise Main Roads if they intend to stage the construction phase where affecting existing lighting asset .
. . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
GENERAL .
A summary of required electrical material requirements is provided at Annexure A. . CABLE PITS .
Cable pits shall be plastic and fitted with heavyduty wellfitting concrete lids with MRWA ELECTRICAL CABLE moulded into the surface in accordance with Drawing No . .
Pit Type .
To ensure that the lid can not be easily removed without the aid of tools only one lifting hole shall be cast into the lid .
Pit Lids .
An industrystandard plastic plug shall be used to plug the lifting hole when lifting is not required to alleviate most water and sand ingress .
Plastic Plug .
An industrystandard gasket shall be fitted to the pit lid to alleviate water and sand ingress .
Gasket .
Concrete surround to cable pits shall comply with the requirements of Standard Drawing No . .
The concrete surround may be pre cast .
Concrete Surround .
CONDUITS .
All conduits whether rigid or flexible shall be in accordance with ASNZS series .
ASNZS .
All rigid electrical conduits shall be heavy duty suitable for underground use and shall be orange in colour .
Conduit Type .
Only rigid PVC fittings shall be used .
All joints shall be cemented .
Where a thread is required on a conduit a suitable adaptor shall be cemented to the conduit .
Jointing .
Conduits for casting within bridge decks shall be rigid with the use of sweep bends where necessary .
Right angled bends are not to be used .
Bridge Decks Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All necessary precautions shall be taken during construction to protect conduits from damage ingress of water and dirt or movement from position due to any other work processes .
If conduits are found to be damaged contain water or dirt they shall be replaced .
Precautions .
All external conduits and fittings shall have adequate protection against external influences .
Their classification should be as per ASNZS series .
External Influences .
WIRING AND COLOURS .
All cables shall have copper conductors and double insulated PVC with an insulation rating of .kV .
Colour coding shall be Colour Coding a .
Active conductors Red white blue as specified on the Drawings Active b .
Neutral conductors Black Neutral c. Earth conductors YellowGreen Earth d. The colour of insulation tape shall match the colour of the cable insulation .
Insulation .
All multistrand conductors shall be terminated with crimp lugs .
Joints with or without connectors shall not be accepted except within cable pits .
Termination .
SWITCHBOARDS .
There are two types of Single or Double Door Switchboards to be installed based on the application and roadway lighting design requirements .
Double and Single Door Switchboards .
For general arrangement and internal wiring lay out refer to MRWA standard Drawings for each type .
..
ACCESSIBILITY .
The arrangement and layout of all equipment shall provide adequate and safe means of access and working space for installation and maintenance purposes .
Access .
All equipment shall be installed such that removal replacement or repair of each and every component may be carried out with standard electrical trade tools .
Standard Tools .
Particular attention shall be given to the location and clearance of handles levers switches etc .
in respect to the safety of personnel operating the equipment .
Location Clearances .
To allow for ease of maintenance in darkness a fluorescent light shall be installed in the top front of the singledoor switchboard that is automatically operated when the door is opened .
The light shall adequately illuminate all internal components of the singledoor switchboards .
Lighting for Maintenance Single door .
Two or more fluorescent lights shall be installed in the top front of the doubledoor switchboard that is automatically operated when the door is opened in such a manner that provides adequate illumination for all internal components of the doubledoor switchboard .
Lighting for Maintenance Double door Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. MATERIAL .
The cubicle and escutcheon shall be fabricated from marine grade aluminium sheet of not less than .
mm thickness .
Cubicle ..
FABRICATION AND WELDING .
The cubicle dimensions shall be as shown on the design Drawings .
Dimensions .
All joints shall be full length welded and ground to a smooth square finish .
The exterior of the cabinet shall present a smooth surface without any bolt heads or the like projecting outside the cubicle .
Joints .
Doors and escutcheon panels shall be fitted with suitable internal stiffeners .
Horizontal escutcheon edges shall be folded through a right angle to offer rigidity .
Stiffeners .
Escutcheon fixing bolts shall be made captive to the escutcheon and shall be mm plated steel with nylon washers .
In addition four fixed guide pins per escutcheon shall be fitted to the cubicle to locate the escutcheon .
Fixings .
A pocket for keeping drawings or other documents shall be fitted to each switchboard door .
The document pocket shall be of minimum size mm wide x mm high x mm capacity .
Pocket .. WEATHERPROOFING .
Neoprene door seals shall be fitted to ensure that water moisture and dust can not enter the interior of the cubicle giving IP degree of protection .
The seals shall be such that new seals can be fitted at a later date without the necessity of removing any equipment other than the old seals .
Neoprene Seals ..
DOOR LOCKS AND HINGES .
Each of the doors shall be fitted with two flush mounted Lockwood Series night latches .
The locks on the door shall be capable of being operated by both Western Power nominated key MKL lock and Main Roads Western Australia Electrical Master Lighting Key No available from Harry Armstrong Pty Ltd Locksmith Queen Street Perth .
Lock .
Any keys held by the Contractor as a result of purchasing the latches shall be provided to the Superintendent .
Keys .
A locking arm shall be fitted to each of the doors to hold it firmly in the or more open position .
Locking Arm .
Each of the doors shall be fitted with two night latches one fitted near the top and another near the bottom of the opening side of the door to provide four adequate fixing points with the three hinges for the door .
The doors shall only be capable of being lifted off the hinges when in the open position .
Door .
The doors shall close positively against the gasket with no slack movement .
Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. CUTOUTS .
Particular care shall be taken to provide stressfree panels where cutouts are required so that no distortion of the cutouts will occur .
Rough edges shall be removed and all cutouts shall be accurate to .
mm .
StressFree Panels .. EARTHING .
A drilled copper bar providing a separate hole for each connected earth conductor shall be fitted near the bottom of the cubicle .
Each hole shall have two fixing screws .
Earthing Bar ..
RESIDUAL CURRENT DEVICE .
A msdelayed type residualcurrent device RCD shall be installed with the appropriate overcurrent protection .
These shall be Clipsal RCG or similar and shall comply with ASNZS .
RCD .. WIRING .
All insulated wiring within the cubicle shall be run in horizontal and vertical lines .
Each group of wiring shall be strapped at short intervals with black nylon cable ties .
Wiring Runs .
Each wire shall be terminated by crimp type terminal lugs fitted by the lug manufacturers recommended crimping tool .
Terminations .
All conductors shall be standard sizes with PVC insulation minimum voltage rating .
kV and temperature rating V. Conductors .
Internal conductor sizes shall be of adequate crosssection .
The minimum size permissible shall match the full current rating capacity of the connected equipment .
Conductor Sizes .
Where more than one item is connected to a common feed such as fuses or circuit breakers the minimum conductor size of the common feed shall match the arithmetic sum of the connecting equipment full current rating capacities .
In any case the smallest conductor shall be not less than mm .
Common Feed .. NAME PLATES AND LABELS .
All equipment labels shall be manufactured from whiteblackwhite Traffolite with engraved black letters on a white background or redwhite red with white letters on a red background .
Letters .
As far as practicable all labels shall be of the same overall dimensions with identical mounting holes .
The minimum size of letters shall be .
mm upper case .
Sizes .
All final subcircuit circuit breakersfuses shall be labelled with Industrial Products Australia IPA coloured and numbered markers .
Labelling Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The switchboard number shall be clearly shown on the outside of the door of each cabinet .
The switchboard number shall be made up of mm black characters on a mm x mm background of adhesive class yellow retroreflective material as per ASNZS Part .
A further label of the same material consisting of lines of mm black characters shall be placed mm below the switchboard number .
Line shall read and line MAIN ROADS WA .
Numbers .
Manufacturers name plates shall not be affixed to the switchboards housings .
Manufacturers Name Plates ..
FINISH .
All internal and external panel surfaces shall have an orbital sanded finish with a clear antigraffiti coating applied in accordance with Specification ANTIGRAFFITI .
Orbital Sanded Finish ..
MOUNTING .
Metering shall be as per the design Drawing and in accordance with Western Power requirements .
Meter Height .
The plinthcable pit shall be as shown on the Drawings .
Mounting bolts shall not be accessible from outside the switchboard .
Plinth Mounting .
The finished top surface of the concrete plinth shall be graded away from the switchboard to prevent water accumulating on the plinth .
Plinth .. CONTROL EQUIPMENT .
Each switchboard shall have a selector switch to enable selection of the type of control to be used to operate the lights .
Selector Switch .
Each switchboard shall have a selectable HPMPE or similar light sensing relay for the control of lighting fixed to an external panel using a minimum of four concealed bolts .
The sensing unit shall be fixed with suitable nonferrous screws to the south side of the panel where possible using nutserts and sealed with RTV silicon sealant .
Control Switch .
Each switchboard shall have a connection for a Western Power pilot signal where such a Pilot is accessible from the switchboard location .
Western Power Pilot .
Each switchboard shall have a selectable digital electronic timer for control of lighting where a Western Power Pilot signal is not provided .
Digital Timer .
All equipment shall be hard fixed to the enclosure via screws or other mechanical fixings .
Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
ROADWAY LIGHTING POLES DESIGN MANUFACTURE ..
SHAPE OF POLE .
The pole with outreach arm shall conform to the shape shown in the Standard Drawing Nos .
and with a vertical continuously tapered pole with or without a continuously tapered outreach arm .
Poles shall be fitted with pole caps and bird guards .
Shape .. CROSS SECTION OF POLE .
Tubular cross section of the pole and outreach arm shall be octagonal shape in cross section with equal sides in accordance with Main Roads Standard Drawing Nos .
and .
Cross Section ..
STRUCTURAL DESIGN OF POLES .
The structural design of the poles shall be in accordance with ASNZS .
ASNZS .
Under the design wind speed loading the horizontal displacement of the luminaire resulting from any combination of flexural and torsional deflection shall not be greater than of the mounting height .
Horizontal Displacement .
The vertical pole and outreach structure shall be constructed and pre cambered in such a manner as to ensure that in the erected position with the luminaire installed the outreach spigot is at an angle above the horizontal of . . degrees and such that the outreach is at right angles to the true road delineation degree .
Angle of Outreach Spigot ..
FABRICATION .
Poles shall be fabricated in accordance with ASNZS .
Fabrication of slip base pole shall include slip base fixing system .
ASNZS .
The column shall be sufficiently sealed to ensure that moisture running down the side of the column or vermin can not enter the column .
Sealing .
The column of the pole shall be fabricated in no more than three lengths .
The outreach arm section of the pole shall be fabricated in a single length .
Number of Pieces .
The vertical section shall be structurally and mechanically capable of accepting any outreach arm of sizes . . . . and .
metres .
Any outreach arm must fit onto the top of the vertical section of the pole .
Outreach Size .
Any two column sections shall telescope together with a lap length not less than .
times the column section dimension as measured at the lap joint .
The minimum and maximum overlap required for the lap joint shall be painted or otherwise clearly marked on the pole prior to assembly .
Lap Length .. GALVANISING .
Steel poles and outreach arms shall be hot dip galvanised in accordance with ASNZS .
Steel Poles Outreach Arms Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The complete holding down bolt and slip base assembly but excluding the mesh cage shall be galvanised .
Galvanising is to be carried out after all fabrication welding and cleaning have been completed .
.. OUTREACH ARM .
The outreach arm shall be continuously tapered and fitted with a . OD x . CHS tube spigot .
The spigot shall be mm long and have a luminaire lock welded to the end as shown in the Standard Drawing numbers and .
Tapered Arms .
The outreach arms may be fixed to the vertical pole by bolts as shown in the Drawings .
The outreach arm shall have an uplift of degrees .
Uplift Angle .
The outreach arms may be bolted or welded to a short upper section of vertical pole which is fixed to the vertical section using the functional fit due to taper .
If this method is used the requirements specified under Clause .. apply .
Fixing .
If the outreach arm is made from a material of a thickness different to the vertical section of the pole the vertical section shall be reinforced .
Reinforcing .
The opening between the outreach arm and the vertical section of the pole shall be such that if any restriction exists the restriction will not impede the installation of a cable from the luminaire end of the outreach arm .
All sharp edges shall be removed to prevent damage to the cable .
Restrictions ..
DOOR .
The pole access door opening shall be a minimum size of mm by mm with one captive door fastening bolt located at the top of the door .
Dimensions .
Doors shall be interchangeable and in accordance with Standard Drawing No . .
Above the door and external to the pole a weather strip shall be welded to reduce the possibility of water entering the pole at the door .
Weather Strip .. GENERAL FINISH AND APPEARANCE .
All holes and surfaces shall be free of burrs and sharp edges to allow the installation of electrical cables into the pole without damage .
All sections shall be smooth and free of kinks ripples and galvanising defects .
Surface Surfaces .
When the pole is installed vertical sections of the pole shall not deviate from the straight by more than mm in any metre length .
Verticality .. SLIP BASE .
A slip base complete with slip joint washer bolts nuts and washers as per the Drawings shall be considered as part of the pole .
Slip base Components .
The slip joint washer flat washers and the load bearing faces of the bolt head and nut shall be flat and even .
Any excessive warping or uneven galvanising shall be rectified at no cost to the Principal .
Flat Even Surfaces Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Prior to delivery on site the pole shall be attached to the slip base with M slip base bolts tightened to a torque of Nm .
Bolt Torque .. FIXING BOLTS .
Apart from the footing holding down bolts and slip base bolts all fixings and bolts shall be stainless steel grade M in accordance with AS .
Stainless Steel .. HOLDING DOWN BOLT ASSEMBLY .
The holding down bolt assembly shall include the mesh cage and shall be complete with eight nuts and eight washers per assembly as per Standard Drawing No . .
Mesh Cage and Bolt Assembly .
All bolts shall be the same length with respect to the vertical axis of the assembly .
Bolt Length .
The bolt arrangement shall be such that the pole may be mounted with the access door in any of four positions which are apart .
Bolt Arrangement .
The bolts shall be mm threaded rod and have a minimum Fy MPa .
Bolt Grade .
All fittings shall be of a material which does not promote electrolytic corrosion .
Electrolytic Corrosion .. IMPACT ABSORBANT LIGHT POLE AND FOOTING .

and standard typical drawing .

ROADWAY LIGHTING LUMINAIRES .. GENERAL .
Luminaire details make and model shall be as shown on the design Drawings .
Luminaire Details Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Alternative luminaires other than those specified on design Drawings may be used subject to the Principals prior approval .
The granting of this approval is at the absolute discretion of the Principal .
The Contractor shall at its cost submit revised design Drawings as per the Roadway Lighting Design guidelines .
The Contractor shall provide complete revised photometric data manufacturers detail Drawings and sample luminaire to the Superintendent for evaluation by the Principal .
The new design shall conform to the requirements of Main Roads Roadway Lighting Design Guidelines .
HOLD POINT .
Luminaires shall comply with Main Roads Roadway Lighting Policy .
Lighting Policy .. CONSTRUCTION AND FINISH .
The luminaire shall be type tested and demonstrated to comply with Type Tests a. ASNZS .
b. ASNZS .
c. ASNZS .
The luminaire shall be provided with a positive long life seal between reflectorrefractor and socketreflector junctures to prevent the entry of moisture and foreign matter giving at least IP degree of protection .
Seal Housing Ring .
The housing and the refractor ring shall each be a one piece aluminium casting .
The refractor holder assembly shall hinge open at least to give easy access to the optical system .
Holder Assembly .
Access to the terminals shall be by a hinged one piece cast aluminium door .
Any hinged parts shall be secured such that they will withstand high velocity wind in the open position .
Door .
The luminaire shall consist of housing slipfitter reflector refractor holder lamp socket and mounting pipe stop .
Luminaire .
All catches cotter pins clamps adjustment screws and accessories shall be made of corrosion resistant metals equal to stainless steel grade M. Accessories .
All other external metal parts shall be protected with a baked enamel finish .
Finish .
The slipfitter shall have provision to be adjusted between five degrees up and three degrees down from the horizontal plane .
Adjustment .. REFLECTOR .
The reflector shall be of aluminium sheet of such grade and quality as to meet the following requirements Reflector Requirements a .
The reflecting surface shall be specular and contour designed .
Reflecting Surface b .
The reflection factor as determined by a suitable Reflectometer shall not be less than .
Reflection Factor c. The reflecting surface shall have a protective coating of oxide no less than one milligram per square centimetre .
Oxide Coating Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name d. The reflector shall be given a sealing treatment such that there will be no staining when subjected to a water solution gmcc of Anthraquinone Violet R at room temperature .
One drop of the solution shall be allowed to remain in contact with the surface for five minutes and washed away with running water .
Sealing Treatment .. REFRACTOR .
The refractor shall be of clear heatresisting borosilicate glass having prisms to redirect the light from the lamp and reflector into the required light distribution .
Refractor Specification .. LAMP HOLDER .
The lamp holder shall be GES type porcelain enclosed fitted with lamp grips and be suitable for use with high pressure sodium lamps .
Type ..
WEIGHT AND SAIL AREA .
The weight of the luminaire complete with lamp shall not exceed kg .
The sail area shall not exceed .m .
Sail Limits .. BIRD GUARD .
A bird guard shall be provided with each luminaire to prevent birds entering the housing when the luminaire is installed on the outreach arm .
Bird Guard .. LAMPS .

Lamp Requirements .

Date Coding .
CONTROL GEAR BALLAST CAPACITORS AND IGNITOR .. GENERAL .
All control gear components shall be suitable for operation on either Volt phase to phase or Volt phase to neutral Hz as applicable and conform to the requirements of ASNZS .
Operating Voltage .
The control gear shall be quiet in operation and suitable in every aspect for mounting in the base of the pole .
The control gear shall be mounted on a base plate .
Ballast capacitors and igniter shall be adequately sealed against the ingress of moisture and vermin .
Mounting .
For Roadway Column Mounted Luminaires the dimensions and form shall be suitable for mounting on the gear tray as detailed on drawing .
Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. BALLAST .

Windings shall be weather proof so as to inhibit the effects of moisture and humidity .
.. IGNITER .
Igniters shall be designed and constructed so as to comply with the requirements of ASNZS The igniter shall be the superimposed type suitable for igniting a lamp up to metres from the igniter and shall cease to pulse on lamp ignition. . Should the lamp fail to ignite the igniter shall time out after approximately seconds and not restart until the power has been turned off and then on again .
Time Out .
The igniter must supply a voltage range of to V Hz and be suitable for use with standard nontapped ballasts and connection via flying leads Supply Voltage .. CAPACITOR .
Capacitors shall be metallised polypropylene designed and constructed so as to comply with the requirements of AS .
Features required a. Voltage rating V Hz b .
Temperature rating to C c. Discharge resistor inbuilt d. Connection via flying leads e. Stud mounting .
Capacitors shall be used to correct the control gear lamp circuit power factor to a minimum of .
lagging .
Power Factor Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Capacitors shall be used to ensure that the emission radiated and conducted of ratio frequency disturbances from the control gear lamp circuit is within the limits required by ASNZS CISPR Interference Suppression .. FUSE HOLDER AND FUSE .
Fuses of correct rating shall be fitted for protection and isolation purposes .
Generally the fuses are complete with Red Spot type fuse holders fitted to the gear tray except where street light cutouts are used details for which are given in clause Fuses and fuse holders shall comply with the requirements of ASNZS Features required a. Voltage rating V Hz b .
Type NIT fuse class gG c. Black flame retardant thermoplastic fuse holder d. Fuse holder rating A e. Insulating terminal shrouds f. Terminal capacity mm .. STREET LIGHT CUTOUT .
Where column mounted luminaires are fitted with integral control gear a street light cutout shall be mounted in the column base as detailed on drawing .
Where the luminaires is fused the cutout shall be fitted with a copper link otherwise a fuse of the correct rating shall be fitted .
Fuses shall comply with the requirements of ASNZS .
Features required a. Voltage rating V Hz b .
Current rating A c. Type LST fuse class gG d. Moulded GRP body with detachable fuse holder and terminal cover e. Insulating terminal shrouds f. Tin plated brass tunnel with mm conductor capacity .

Ambient Temperature .. TERMINALS .
Terminals shall be provided for the incoming conductors and the lamp socket connections .
The terminals shall be of adequate size for wire sizes up to mm and must be of the type which does not provide connection directly between the terminal screw and the conductor .
Terminal Type Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name Features required a. Voltage rating V Hz b .

POLES AND LUMINAIRES ..
POLE BASE FOOTING .
The light pole footing shall be located as shown on the design Drawings .
Where the pole footing is to be located at embankments pole setback and location to be as per Design Drawings and ASNZS series and drawings and .
Location .
The pole footing size shall be in accordance with the dimensions shown on Drawing Nos .
and for terrain category and winds in region A to ASNZS .. Where other conditions exist alternative designs shall be produced by the designer for the approval of the Superintendent .
Size Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Each pole base shall be within mm of its location and mm of its final level as shown on the design Drawings .
The slip joint washer shall be mm above the finished ground level .
The ground level would depend on the pole location and pole setback as identified on the design Drawings .
Tolerance .
A circular hole mm in diameter and mm deep for single outreach or mm in depth for double outreach shall be excavated to accommodate the pole base footing .
Depth .
Prior to the installation of the pole base footing the excavated hole shall be presented to the Superintendent for approval to proceed .
HOLD POINT .
The holding down bolt assembly shall be orientated so that when erected the outreach arm is at right angles to the kerb or edge of seal .
Orientation .
Concrete shall be Class N in accordance with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS .
Concrete .
Footing reinforcement shall be SL mesh in accordance with ASNZS .
Reinforcement .
Should the water table be such that the concrete can not be placed in a dry hole it shall be placed by tremie .
Water shall not be allowed to flow through the space in which the concrete is to be cast .
Should the walls of the hole be likely to collapse before pouring the concrete a simple sheet metal Spirolock or plastic sleeve shall be inserted to prevent the collapse .
The tremie shall consist of a sheet metal hopper with a metal pipe leading out of the bottom that has a simple outlet valve at its lower end .
It shall be water tight with a minimum diameter of mm .
The tremie shall be kept filled with concrete at all times during placing .
Should the concrete charge be lost the tremie shall be withdrawn and refilled .
The tremie shall be operated in such a manner as to discharge below the surface of the fresh concrete and to maintain as nearly as practicable uniform flow .
Concrete shall not be dropped through water .
No agitation or vibration of the concrete shall be permitted during placing .
Compaction shall take place after concrete pouring has been completed and the water displaced .
Tremie .
Prior to the drilling of any bridge or other structural element the Contractor shall accurately identify to the Superintendent all locations sizes and depths of the penetrations and of any reinforcement likely to be affected by the drilling operations for approval by the Superintendent to proceed .
HOLD POINT ..
POLE ASSEMBLY .
The access door shall face away from the carriageway for slip base mounted poles and shall face the carriageway for bridge mounted poles .
Access Door Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The slip base shall be removed from the pole and firmly bolted to the footing then levelled using a spirit level with a minimum of two levels taken at right angles to each other .
All electrical connections for the cable between the cable pit and the Anderson Connectors shall be made prior to installing the pole on the slip base .
The placement of the slip base assembly shall be as shown on the Standard Drawing Nos .
and to achieve correct orientation of the pole on the upper slip base flange .
Slip Base .
After the installation of the slip base and prior to the erection of the pole the Contractor shall present the slip base plate slip base washer and pole base plate to the Superintendent for inspection to ensure that they are clean flat and free from deformation and for approval to proceed with the pole erection .
HOLD POINT .
Poles shall be erected in accordance with the manufacturers published procedures .
Poles shall be lifted using a sling or chain formed into a noose at approximately two thirds column height from the base .
To prevent poles from falling andor the dislodgement of pole segments lift poles into position using a temporary attachment between the poles lifting lug located at the poles base and noose preventing the noose from slipping up the pole while also transferring the lifting force via the lifting lug back to the pole base .
Care must be taken when handling the poles so that the galvanising is not damaged .
Metal Slings if used shall have adequate protection so that metal to metal contact does not occur .
Pole Erection Procedure .
The bolts used to attach the pole to the slip base shall be fitted with the nuts uppermost .
Bolt Torque .
Each slip base bolt shall initially be tensioned to Nm upon installation of the pole to remove any minor deformation in the slip joint base washer with the full sized nut .
One nut at a time shall be removed and a thin nut shall be installed and tensioned to Nm .
The full sized nut shall be installed on top of the thin nut and tensioned to Nm whilst the thin nut is held in place with an open ended spanner. . Bolts shall be tensioned with a calibrated torque wrench in the presence of the superintendent .
HOLD POINT .
Each slip pole shall be bolted truly vertical on its footing .
Verticality .
The luminaire lamp holders shall be adjusted to the nominated distribution .
Luminaire .
The luminaire spigot clamp shall be set to the correct angle .
Spigot Clamp .
The lamp bases shall be date coded .
Date Coding .. GROUTING OF THE SLIP BASE POLE . .
The holding down nuts and bolts shall be covered with bituminous paint .
Bituminous Paint .
A drain shall be installed at the base of the slip base as shown on Drawing No . .
Drain .
A mortar dry pack mix shall be forced under the slip base .
Mortar Pack Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
A concrete mix shall be poured around the holding down bolt assembly as shown on Drawing No . .
Concrete Mix ..
FOCUSING OF LUMINAIRES .
After the poles have been plumbed each luminaire shall be focused using a digital spirit level to the correct angle in accordance with the requirements of the Pole Schedule .
Focusing Luminaire .
The top of the luminaire shall be horizontal .
Horizontality ..
POLE NUMBERS .
Numbers as per the design Drawings shall be attached to each pole .
The numbers shall be made up of mm black characters on a mm x mm background of adhesive class yellow retroreflective material as per ASNZS Part .
Pole Numbers .
The numbers shall be fixed vertically to the pole be read from top to bottom and be at a height of approximately metres from the ground .
The numbers shall be placed in such a position that they can be readily seen from a vehicle travelling along the carriageway .
Fixing .
ELECTRICAL INSTALLATION .. SWITCHBOARD INSTALLATION .
The switchboard shall be installed on a concrete base as detailed on Drawing No .
such that the doors open away from the roadway and that adequate and safe access is provided for removal replacement and repair .
The switchboard base shall be located so that the Photoelectric cell is on the south facing side of the switchboard .
Location .
Concrete for the base shall be Class N in accordance with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS .
Concrete ..
CONDUITS .
All conduits shall be installed at a depth not less than .m below finished surface level at the locations shown in the Drawings .
Installation Location .
Conduits shall be run to enable cables to be drawnin after installation with sufficient accessible cable pits to be used for this purpose .
Draw in Cables .
The conduits shall be installed such that water which may enter the conduits always drains into the cable pits .
Drainage .
Conduits with foreign material inside shall be deemed to be nonconforming and conduits shall be thoroughly cleaned or removed and replaced with new conduit .
Non Conforming .
A core polyethylene or polypropylene cable haul rope with .mm nominal diameter and blueyellowblue in colour shall be installed in each conduit and suitably anchored at each end .
Draw rope Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ..
CONFLICT WITH DRAINAGE PIPES AND OTHER SERVICES .
In the areas where drainage pipes and other services are in close proximity to conduit and pole foundations manual excavation shall be undertaken .
Manual Excavation ..
EXISTING CONDUITS .
Care must be taken not to damage existing conduits that are to remain in service .
Where necessary manual excavation shall be carried out to avoid damage .
Damage .. ROAD CROSSINGS .
Road crossings shall terminate in a cable pit at each end of the conduit on either side of the roadway .
The cable pits shall be installed a minimum of m measured from the rear face of the kerb or from the edge of the seal on unkerbed roads such that their lids are flush with the surrounding finished surface level .
Road Crossing Details .
Where a crossing is under the road pavement the crossing shall be installed by directional drilling .
Under no circumstances shall the pavement or surfacing be cut to install the crossing .
Directional Drilled Crossings .
The road crossing conduits shall be installed as per the design Drawings .
The crossings shall comprise either a single mm diameter PVC conduit run between respective cable pits or a single mm diameter RCP or mm diameter PVC pipe .
One or more mm diameter conduits shall be installed in the mm and mm diameter crossings as detailed in the design Drawings .
Conduits for Crossings By Trenching .. CABLE PITS .
Each cable pit shall be located behind the light pole as shown in PoleCable Pit Orientation on Standard Drawing No . .
Location .
The cable pits shall be installed such that their lids are flush with the surrounding finished surface level .
Flush installation .
Where the conduits enter the cable pits a neat hole shall be cut in the pit using a hole cutter or similar tool .
Pits with holes knocked in with a hammer or similar tool will be rejected .
Conduit Entry .
All cable pits shall have a preformed or drilled hole of minimum mm diameter in the bottom to facilitate drainage .
Drainage .
The conduit shall be sealed at the point of entry through the cable pit wall with Silastic .
Only one hole for each conduit entering the cable pit shall be cut .
A bellmouth shall be fitted to the end of each conduit within the cable pit except the conduit to the pole .
Sealing .
A mm wide x mm deep concrete surround with a reinforcement bar as per Standard Drawing shall be cast and trowelled to a neat finish around each cable pit .
Alternatively a precast surround may be used .
Concrete Surround Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All cables in the pit whether joined or not shall be taken over the conduit wedged into and across the top of the pit and securely fixed with a nylon cable tie to the conduit as detailed in Drawing No. . Cable Ties .
All foreign material shall be removed and sand and dirt vacuumed from the pit after all electrical connections have been made .
Cleaning .
The pit gasket shall be installed directly under the lid and rest on the pit lip .
Gasket .. CABLE ROUTE MARKERS AND ORANGE DANGER TAPE .
The location of all underground cables shall be indicated by means of cable route markers set securely in the concrete surround to the cable pits .
The markers shall be set flush in the concrete surround of the cable pits .
Cable Route Markers .
The mm diameter aluminium cable markers with the words Electric Cable MRWA embossed into the disk and x mm long hooks for casting into concrete shall be cast into the concrete surround using the embossed arrow to identify the direction of all conduit runs in accordance with Standard Drawing No. . Dimensions .
The Contractor shall install mm wide orange danger tape in accordance with ASNZS .
mm above all installed cables and conduits .
Orange Danger Tape ..
POLE CONDUITS .
One mm heavy duty corrugated flexible PVC conduit shall be run between the pole base and the cable pit .
The conduit shall finish a minimum of mm above final ground level .
..
POLE CONNECTIONS .
Single core mm stranded copperPVC insulated PVC sheathed .kV cables in the appropriate colours shall be run between the control gear in the base of the pole and the cable pit .
Cables .
In the base of the pole the cables shall be cut and fitted with Anderson Power pole modular connectors .
The correct crimping tool as specified by the manufacturer shall be used for the Anderson connectors .
Connectors .
Between the main cables and the connectors the earth cable shall be at least one metre longer than the supply cables which shall be cut to equal lengths .
Between the connectors and the control equipment base gear plate the earth cable shall be at least as long as the incoming supply cables .
Earth Cable .
The incoming supply cables shall be securely clamped to the control equipment base gear plate and the earth firmly attached to earth studs on the plate and the support bar in the pole .
The incoming supply cables shall be securely fixed to the support bar in the slip base with nylon cable ties or similar so that in the event the pole is hit by a vehicle the Anderson connectors disconnect leaving the incoming supply cables and the bottom connectors below the top of the slip base .
Incoming Supply Cables Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The excess earth cable shall be loosely coiled up .
The Anderson connectors for the supply cables shall be assembled together with a dummy connector separating the two supply connectors .
The earth connector shall be left free .
Cables Connectors .
It is essential for the safe operation of the slip base in a crash that the pole connections shall be carried out strictly in accordance with Drawing Nos .
and including installing the correct length of the cables in accordance with Drawing No .
and the design Drawings .
Safety Considerations .. TEE CONNECTIONS SLIP BASE POLES .
Tee connections in the cable pits shall be made by carefully stripping sufficient insulation from the main cables to use a split bolt clamp or a rising main tee off connector .
Tee Connection .
The joint shall then be completely covered with GECHenley yellow or green plastic compound minimum thickness mm .
Joints .
The covered joint shall then be wrapped with Scotch high voltage splicing tape taking care to eliminate air spaces .
The tape shall be wrapped far enough to completely enclose the ends of the cable sheath .
The outer layer of tape shall have the same colour as the cable insulation so as not to confuse with the cable sleeve colour .
Splicing Tape .
Finally the joint shall be wrapped with Scotch insulation tape of the same colour as the cable .
Wrapping .
The cable joint shall then be securely fixed with a nylon cable tie to a conduit wedged into the top of the pit so as to be held above the level of any water that may accumulate in the pit .
Cable Fixing .. INTERNAL POLE WIRING .
Generally a three core .
mm stranded copperPVC insulated PVC sheathed .
kV TPS cable shall be provided from the base of the pole to the luminaire .
However cable selection shall suit the temperature rating required by the luminaire terminal temperature .
At the top of the pole a loop shall be formed in the cable using a nylon cable tie as shown on Drawing No . .
The cable shall then be attached to the pole cap using this loop .
Cable .
The control gear plate complete with all necessary equipment shall be installed at the base of the pole .
The cables from the pole base shall be connected to the terminal strip and firmly clamped to the plate .
Control Gear Plate .
Earth studs shall be fitted to the slip base the control gear plate and on one of the mounting straps for bonding the plate the pole and slip base support bar to earth .
The luminaire shall also have an earth stud and be earthed .
Earth Studs Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. CABLE RUNS .
Although it is desirable for the main cables to be continuous this is not always practical .
When joints are necessary they shall be made adjacent to a Tee off joint using the appropriate crimp link .
The joint shall then be insulated and supported at the top of the cable pit .
Under no circumstances shall cable joints in conduits be permitted .
Joints .
When pulling cables through the conduits extreme care must be exercised to ensure that the cable is not damaged by the bellmouth at the ends of the conduits .
Where there is evidence of excessive wear on the bellmouth caused by the pulling of the cables into the conduit the cables shall be removed made available for inspection by the Superintendent and replaced with new cable if the insulation is damaged or otherwise replaced .
Cable Damage .. CABLE IDENTIFICATION .
All cables shall be clearly identified with permanent water resistant cable markers showing each outgoing cable in the switchboards in each cable pit and in the base of each pole .
The markers shall identify each circuit for example L L etc .
In the cable pits one marker for each circuit is acceptable providing the circuit cables are firmly tied together where the marker is attached .
Cable Markers .. EARTHING .
The installation shall be earthed in accordance with Section of ASANZ and the requirements of the Power Supply Authority and Office of Energy .
Earthing ..
RESIDUAL CURRENT DEVICES .
Residual Current Devices RCDs shall be installed in accordance with ASNZS .
RCDs .. POINT OF ATTACHMENT OF SUPPLY AUTHORITY MAINS .
Underground power is the preferred method of mains supply from the Power Supply Authority to the switchboards .
Underground Power .
Where used the point of attachment pole shall be hot dip galvanised in accordance with ASNZS after all fabrication drilling and welding has been completed .
All cables shall be run inside the pole .
Exterior conduits shall not be permitted .
Overhead Mains .
TESTING .. ELECTRICAL INSTALLATION .
After cables have been installed and connected the Contractor shall carry out an insulation test of all cables using a Volt insulation tester .
The test voltage shall be applied for a minimum of seconds .
Prior to carrying out the tests all fuses shall be removed circuit breakers opened and neutrals disconnected .
Insulation test Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
In accordance with ASNZS Section the following tests shall be made ASNZS Mandated Tests a. Continuity of the earthing system earth resistance b .
Insulation resistance between all live conductors and earth c. Polarity d. Correct circuit connections e. Verification of earth faultloop impedance f. Correct operation of RCDs .
All control circuits and devices shall be functionally checked to verify correct operation .
Function Checks .
Prior to and as a prerequisite to obtaining Practical Completion all new or modified installations shall be inspected and tested in accordance with section of ASNZS and a copy of the test results shall be submitted to the Superintendent .
HOLD POINT .
Any part of the installation found to be nonconforming shall be replaced with new materials andor components or corrected to the satisfaction of the Superintendent .
Street lighting circuits with an insulation resistance lower than M shall have the faulty cable sections replaced and retested to confirm that acceptable insulation resistance values have been attained .
Faulty Sections .
Prior to the Power Supply Authoritys approval of the installation and connection to the supply mains the Contractor shall have completed all tests to the Superintendents satisfaction .
HOLD POINT .
IMPACT ABSORBENT LIGHT POLE .. IMPACT ABSORBANT LIGHT POLE .
Impact absorbent light pole shall be designed and manufactured as per clauses .
and .
and typical standard drawing .
Drawing .. TEE CONNECTIONS .
The TEE connections for impact absorbing light poles shall be as per clause .. items to .
.. INTERNAL FRANGIBLE POLE WIRING .
Generally a three core .mm stranded copperPVC insulated PVC sheathed .kV TPS cable shall be provided from the base of the pole to the luminaire .
However cable selection shall suit the temperature rating required by the luminaire terminal temperature .
At the top of the pole a loop shall be formed in the cable using a nylon cable tie as shown on Drawing No . .
The cable shall then be attached to the pole cap using this loop .
Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The control gear plate with drip shield and complete with all necessary equipment shall be installed at the base of the pole .
The cables from the Tee connection shall be connected to the terminal strip and firmly clamped to the plate. . Brass or stainless steel M earth studs shall be fitted to the control gear plate and on the support strap for bonding the plate and the pole to earth. . SWITCHBOARD DOCUMENTATION AND SWITCHING .
Upon commissioning the installation the Contractor shall place in each switchboard document pocket a copy of the relevant As Constructed Drawings and a copy of all tests required under this specification in a durable sealable plastic document holder .
Documentation .
When work under this specification involves modification work to an existing installation the Contractor shall at the conclusion of each day leave in the switchboard a log of the pertinent activities undertaken for the day and the details of any circuits isolated and the reasons for this to prevent electrocution .
Log Sheet .
When work under this specification involves modification work to an existing installation the Contractor shall keep to a necessary minimum the time that it requires to switch the installation or any part of it off .
Switching Off .
When work under this specification involves modification work to an existing installation the Contractor shall contact the Maintenance Contractor prior to switching the installation or any part of it on or off for a significant period .
Significant periods include all overnight periods .
Details of the Maintenance Contract can be provided by the Superintendent .
Maintenance Contractor .
For the purposes of this clause existing installations includes new ones after the date of commissioning .
Definition of Existing Installations .
REMOVAL OF POLE MOUNTED LIGHTING .
Poles shall be removed from the site and disposed off site by the Contractor unless otherwise directed by the Superintendent. . Poles that are to be reused shall be properly handled and stored during transit and upon delivery .
Luminaires shall be removed from the pole and disposed off site by the Contractor unless otherwise directed by the Superintendent. . Light pole bases and foundations shall be removed and disposed off site by the Contractor unless otherwise directed by the Superintendent .
Light Pole Base Removal .
If light pole bases foundations andor Luminaires are to be reused the Contractor shall ensure that all luminaires poles control gear switchboards and any other material is properly packaged stored and handled during dismantling transit storage and upon delivery .
Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
PEDESTRIAN SHARED PATH LIGHTING ..
POLE INSTALLATION .
The design Drawings details specific location of all Pedestrian Shared Path lighting poles. . Where hinged lighting poles are required by the design care shall be taken to ensure that the alignment of the pole is such that it can be hinged down to a suitable position for maintenance purposes .
Each pole base shall be within mm of its location and mm mm of its final level .
Pole Installation .
The pole shall be orientated so that when erected the pole is true and vertical and the outreach arm is at right angles to the path carriageway or edge of seal . .
The pole access door shall face towards the path . .
The luminaire lamp holders shall be adjusted to the nominated distribution and the luminaire spigot clamp shall be set to the correct angle .
..
POLE ASSEMBLY .
Poles shall be erected according to the manufacturers published procedures and Drawing No. . Care shall be taken when handling the poles so that the galvanising is not damaged .
Metal slings if used shall have adequate protection so that metal to metal contact is not possible. . A circular hole mm minimum diameter shall be augured to accommodate the pole base .
Poles shall be lowered into position using a crane or other lifting device poles shall not be slid into their foundation excavation .
..
POLE NUMBERS .
Numbers as detailed in the design Drawings shall be affixed to each pole .
The numbers shall be made up of mm black characters on a mm x mm background of adhesive class yellow retroreflective material as per ASNZS .. .
The numbers shall be fixed vertically to the pole be read from top to bottom at a height of approximately .
metres from the ground and face towards the path .
..
POLE CONDUIT .
One incoming and one outgoing mm heavy duty corrugated flexible PVC conduit shall be installed to a height of mm above ground level inside the lighting pole .
Couplings shall be used to attach the corrugated conduits to the in ground mm heavy duty rigid conduits .
..
FOCUSING OF LUMINAIRES .
Each luminaire shall be focused with a digital spirit level to the correct angle in accordance with the requirements of the Pole Schedule .
Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. BIRD GUARD .
A bird guard shall be provided with each luminaire to prevent birds entering the housing when the luminaire is installed on the outreach arm . .
INSTALLATION OF UNDERPASS LIGHTING .
Prior to any modification or attachment to any bridge andor other structure the Contractor shall notify and receive approval for the proposal from the Superintendent before commencing any such work .
HOLD POINT .
Luminaires shall be Thorn Panther FVC DB or similar approved by the Superintendent and shall be installed in accordance with the PSP Underpass Lighting Drawing No .
. . Luminaires shall be fixed to the concrete structure using four size x mm stainless steel mushroom headed screws into plastic masonry plugs .
Luminaire Fixing .
Each luminaire shall be protected against vandalism by a .mm thick sheet of General Electric Lexan MRAC sheet or similar approved by the Superintendent drilled with .mm diameter holes as indicated on Drawing No. . Vandal Resistant Cover .
A moisture and insect resistant gasket shall be fabricated from mm x mm cross section selfadhesive dense grade neoprene foam rubber strip and affixed to the rear side of the Lexan MRAC sheet . .
The Lexan MRAC sheet shall be fixed in place by eight gauge mm long pan head hex socket selftapping stainless steel screws complete with stainless steel washers to suit . .
The concrete rebate shall be accurately drilled to a diameter of mm and a depth of mm to align with the Lexan MRAC sheet fixing screws and to suit the mm plastic masonry plugs that shall be installed to accept the Lexan MRAC fixing screws . .
Circuit wiring shall be single core stranded copperPVC insulated PVC sheathed .kV SDI cables that shall not be looped into the luminaires .
Wiring .
Conduit cabling shall be Teed off at the junction box behind the luminaire to flexible three core copper double insulated cable using blue point connectors of suitable size taped with PVC insulating tape of a similar colour . .
The flexible cable shall be brought into the luminaire through the base of the luminaire and sealed with RTV silicone sealant so as to maintain IP rating. . RETROFITTING OF UNDERPASS LIGHTING .
Prior to any modification or attachment to any bridge andor other structure the Contractor shall notify and receive approval for the proposal from the Superintendent before commencing any such work .
HOLD POINT Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Where underpass lighting is to be installed in a structure where no previous allowance for such lighting has been allowed for then installation shall generally be in accordance with this Specification. . Thorn DB Bulkhead luminaires or similar approved by the Superintendent complete with proprietary wire guards shall be installed at the locations shown on the design Drawings. . Luminaires shall be fixed to the concrete structure using four size x mm stainless steel mushroom headed screws into plastic masonry plugs .
The four screws shall be accessed from within the luminaire .
Luminaire Fixing .
Cabling shall be completely contained within a conduit system complying with this Specification . .
Circuit wiring shall be single core stranded copperPVC insulated PVC sheathed .kV SDI cables .
Wiring .
Cabling may be looped through the luminaire where cabling size and temperature rating is compatible with the luminaire terminals .
Where this is not possible junction boxes shall be installed adjacent to the luminaires and these shall be used to Tee off flexible three core copper double insulated cable and this shall be taken to the luminaire inside conduit. . Tee terminations shall be made using blue point connectors of suitable size. . BRIDGE MOUNTED INSTALLATION .
Prior to any modification or attachment to any bridge andor other structure the Contractor shall notify and receive approval for the proposal from the Superintendent before commencing any such work .
HOLD POINT .
Bridge mounted poles and underbridge lighting shall be in accordance with Drawing Nos .
and and shall generally be installed according to the requirements of this Specification .
. . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS .

Record Changes .

Amendments .

Certify AsBuilt Specification Roadway Lighting Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .

Submission to Superintendent .
MAINTENANCE DURING DEFECTS LIABILITY PERIOD .
During the Defects Liability Period the Contractor shall inspect the installation fortnightly at night and record all defects .
Night Inspections .
The Contractor shall provide the Superintendent with a report detailing such defects together with actions taken to remedy the defect at regular intervals not exceeding one fortnight .
All defects shall be repaired in accordance with Main Roads Repair Time .
Defect Repair .
The Superintendent shall provide the contractor a copy of Main Roads Repair Time .
Main Roads Repair Time .
Incidence of graffiti attack shall be dealt with in accordance with Specification ANTIGRAFFITI .
Graffiti .
MAINTENANCE AND HANDOVER .
The Contractor shall liaise as required with the Maintenance Contractor to ensure a smooth handover at the conclusion of the Defects Liability Period with no outstanding defects left unresolved. . All records logs and other documents relative to the operation of the installation shall be provided to the Maintenance Contractor through the Superintendent or direct to the Maintenance Contractor if agreed with the Superintendent prior to the issue of a Certificate of Practical Completion .

CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS TO ADD OR DELETE The following clauses are to be placed under the CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS as required . .
SCOPE .
This Specification primarily covers the requirements for new street lighting installations on Controlled Access Highways CAHs using slipbased lighting poles. . Where modifications to existing CAH lighting is proposed then the scope Clause .
will need careful editing to clearly outline the extent of the Works . .
This Specification is not suitable for street lighting installations undertaken by Western Power Corporation .
In such cases the Project Manager should define the Contractors obligations under the terms of the Contract .
A common arrangement is that such lighting installations can be organised by the Contractor in liaison with Western Power using sub contractors accredited by Western Power .
Payment is then made from a Provisional Sum provided in the Contract for the purpose. . SUPPLY OF ELECTRICAL MATERIALS Annexure A . Annexure A represents a summary of electrical materials required to be supplied by the Contractor .
Complete as necessary. . ROADWAY LIGHTING CONTRACTS .

SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of a The supply and installation of Roadside help phones including the anchor bolt assembly the reinforced concrete pad and final grouting of the phone pillar base .
b The testing of Roadside help phones in the field .
c The configuration of Roadside help phones to Main Roads existing MRWA help phone tester at Main Roads Maintenance Contractors Workshop as per Annexure A. d The commissioning of the installation .
e The forwarding of the Phone Configuration Schedule and a copy of the design location drawings to the Main Roads Western Australia f The forwarding of the Phone Commissioning and post commissioning Notices to the Main Roads Western Australia Contract Downer EDI Engineering and a copy to Main Roads Customer Contact Centre .
g All other works required to commission help phones as per projects specifics and design requirements. . DEFINITIONS AND MODE OF OPERATION .. GLOSSARY OF TERMS .
Refer to Main Roads Glossary of terms for ITS for full list of terms and definitions .
Glossary of Terms ITS ..
DESCRIPTION OF HELPHELP PHONE OPERATION .
The principle of this operation is that when a call is initiated in the field the Help Roadside Phone automatically calls the phone number unique to that particular phone .
This unique called number is known as the Voice Call Number .
Principle of Operation .
The Voice Call Number is connected to Main Roads Customer Information Centre CIC at the Don Aitken Centre . .
The MRWA CIC is programmed to display on a screen the pillar ID number of the calling Roadside help phone the Pillar location and Any other information as required. . From the pillar number and other information programmed into the PABX the CIC operator answering the call is able to identify the location of the phone being used including which side of the carriageway without the caller giving any details . .
The CIC operators and the caller are able to communicate clearly in a two way duplex manner . .
In the event of a failure the Roadside help Phone can detect the listed defects and will automatically initiate a call to the Help programmed Phone Manager number and log the details of the defect .
Automated Fault Detection and Reporting MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Roadside Help phones Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
The Roadside Help Phone must have facilities for it to be called remotely to perform the listed selfdiagnostics and report the results accordingly .
.. LIAISON WITH OTHERS .
The Contractor must liaise with all parties involved in the operation of the Help Phone system .
Liaison a MRWA Maintenance Contractor b Main Roads Maintenance Contract Manager c Customer Information Centre Clause .
d MRWA Asset Manager e Network provider .
.. SUPPLY OF NETWORK FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT NETWORK SUPPLIER .
Selection of a provider for telecommunications services is governed by whole of government Common Use Agreements CUAs. . At the time of initial publishing of this specification these CUAs are known as Basic Telecommunications Carriage Services for Voice and Data .
Mobile Telecommunications Services and Equipment for mobile services .
Under these CUA arrangements GSM OptusMobile network Operation PSTN services are provided by TelstraFixed Line Operation .
It is mandatory that these providers be used for the services .
PHONE CONFIGURATION SCHEDULE .
Each Help Roadside Phone is to have a unique series of numbers Unique Numbers a Pillar ID number .
b The Voice Call Number programmed to call Main Roads Customer Contact Centre phone number c WayPhone manager phone number MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Roadside Help phones Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue d Phone service number SIM Card e Serial Number .
f A fourdigit Pin Number as the Identification Number ID . .
The Pillar Number shall be allocated based on Main Roads Guidelines for Design of Help Phones which is available on Main Roads website .
In accordance with instructions contained in Annexure A the Contractor shall complete Part of the Configuration Schedule listing pillar numbers .
The schedule together with copies of relevant design location drawings shall be forwarded to Main Roads Maintenance Electrical Contractor and Main Roads Electrical Maintenance Contract Manager .
Pillar Number .
The phone supplier will forward the individual phone ID number Serial number and PIN number with the completed Schedule to the Main Roads Electrical Maintenance Contractor .
ID Serial and PIN Numbers ..

Subject to the Defect Liability provisions of this contract and suitable equipment handover arrangements the Roadside Help Phones will be maintained by Main Roads Electrical Maintenance Contractor .
Phone Maintenance .
Main Roads Project Manager should provide the latest contact details to the contractor .
Contact Details ..

NOT USED MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Roadside Help phones Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
PILLAR DESIGN AND MANUFACTURE .
The Roadside Help Phone shall be handsfree vandal resistant and weather resistant .
HandsFree .
The Roadside Help Phone shall be housed in a pillar with only the solar cell being pole mounted . .
The Roadside Help Phone shall be housed in a plinth mounted pillar of dimensions described in Clause .. .
The Roadside Help Phone shall have as a minimum the following features a Button to initiate a call to Main Roads Customer Contact Centre .
Button Initiated b Button to annunciate recorded information .
c A Speaker to clearly broadcast the ring tone and voice communications .
Speaker d One or preferably two microphones to clearly record and monitor voice communication respectively .
Two Micro phones e IrDA interface with InfraRed port for programming the phone features in the vicinity of the unit optional requirements .
IrDA Interface f Two locks to secure the Help Roadside Phone module to the enclosure pillar .
Keying must be keyed alike across the manufacturers phones .
Lockskeye d alike .
PILLAR DIMENSIONS AND WEIGHT .
The pillar dimensions shall be Maximum Size a Height mm mm b Width mm mm c Depth mm mm .
The pillar weight including the phone equipment shall be less than Kg .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Roadside Help phones Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
FRANGIBILITY .
The pillar and solar cell support combination shall be so designed as to be frangible in the event that it is hit by an errant vehicle .
The frangibility requirements must comply with the requirements of Design Documents .
Frangibility .
PILLAR MATERIALS AND COLOUR .
The pillar shall be constructed from marine grade aluminium with a minimum thickness mm or extruded aluminium with a minimum thickness mm .
Materials .
The pillar shall be polyester powder coated to AS S Rich Blue B excluding the area containing the phone buttons and speakers .
Colour .
IP RATING .
The pillar shall be designed to IP AS .
AS .
The electronics enclosure shall be designed to IP AS .
Electronics to IP .

The help phone must remain operable under the following conditions of vibration Three axes to .mm Hz andg Hz tested to AS .. Vibration AS .. . WIND .
The Help Phone must remain operable after withstanding wind speeds of up to kmh .
Wind .

AS .
b A minimum start up temperature of C .
AS .
c An operating temperature range C to C continuous .
AS .

LIGHTNING PROTECTION FOR PSTN HELP PHONES .
Primary protection shall be provided using fitted gas arrestors .
PSTN Lightning .
Secondary protection shall be provided using fitted Metal Oxide Varistors .
ACIF S . Earth stake shall be fitted with a conductor no less than mm bonding the earth stake to the base of the phone pole and to an earth point within the electronics enclosure ASNZS and ASNZS .
Earth Stake .
VERMIN INGRESS .
The pillar shall be pest insects and vermin proof including termites ants bees rats and mice .
Vermin .
VANDALISM .
The pillar shall be vandal and impact resistant to prevent unauthorised access to the internal equipment .
Vandal and impact resistant can be defined as being able to remain functional while withstanding moderate to severe blows by hand held objects in most circumstances without suffering more than cosmetic damage .
Vandalism .
The pillar shall be fitted with an automatic tiltvandalism alert feature with configurable sensitivity settings with provision for the Roadside Help Phone to make maintenance call and log its location and condition .
Vandalism Alert .
Access to the fixing bolts attaching the phone to the concrete pad shall only be obtained from inside the help phone pillar .
Access .
PILLAR IDENTIFICATION .
International phone symbols and pillar numbers shall be installed on each side of the pillar as per drawing .
Pillar Identification MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Roadside Help phones Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
The International phone symbols and Help Phone pillar number shall be manufactured using Australian Standard Class reflective White adhesive vinyl sheeting .
Material .
The phone symbol shall be mm in height with a spacing of mm from the top of the pillar to the top of the phone symbol .
Spacing .
The pillar number shall consist of D N numerals installed vertically down the pillar with a spacing of mm from the bottom of the phone symbol to the top of the first pillar numeral .
The legend shall be Class M and the background shall be Class M sheet .
Dimensions .
CONCRETE .
All concrete and reinforcement for the bases and anchor bolt assemblies shall be Class N concrete supplied and placed in accordance with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS .
Concrete Class .
STEELWORK .
All steelwork for the anchor bolt assemblies shall be hot dipped galvanised in accordance with ASNZS ASNZS and ASNZS .
Galvanising . . NOT USED HELP PHONE COMPATIBILITY .
