AS CONSTRUCTED DRAWINGS .
The Contractor shall be responsible for Record Changes a Updating existing As Constructed Drawings to reflect the site and all changes to the installation for existing sites .
b Compile As Constructed Drawings for all new installations .
c Compile As Constructed Drawings for site where there are no As Constructed Drawings . .
The As Constructed Drawings shall be amended and completed in accordance with MRWA design and drawing presentation and the MRWA Electrical Infrastructure Asset Drawing Guidelines and forwarded to the Superintendent within twenty days of practical completion of works . .
The supplied As Constructed Drawings shall be in a electronic in AutoCAD format and b A hard copy in accordance with Main Roads requirements .
Available on Main Roads Website. . WORKMANSHIP AND LICENSING REQUIREMENTS .
All works carried out under the contract shall comply with the requirements of ASNZS and the local Supply Authority and EnergySafety Regulations .
ASNZS EnergySaftey .
All workmanship shall comply with all lawful directions and requirements under the Trade Practice Act and shall be carried out by duly qualified personnel holding an appropriate electrical or cabling licence where required. . POWER SUPPLY .
The Contractor shall submit all necessary notices required by the local Supply Authority to supply power to commission the traffic signals at the site .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
The Contractor shall make all arrangements with the local Supply Authority for the location of Point of Attachment and determine whether it is to be above ground or underground electricity supply .
The requirements of the Drawing shall be met. . Where power supply from nearest street light switchboard is available it shall be the preferred supply where practicable .
The underground point of attachment shall be at an underground service pillar supplied and installed by the local Supply Authority .
The Contractor shall install the consumer mains from the controller into an underground isolation fuse pit within the controller apron area and on to the underground service pillar ready for the local Supply Authority to connect .
The consumer mains shall be mm red black and earth double insulated round orange cable and shall be enclosed in a mm orange PVC conduit .
The isolation fuse pit shall be an un metered supply pit meeting the requirements of the local Supply Authority may be sourced from the local Supply Authority enclosing a amp authority and amp customer HRC fuse .
The fuses shall be housed in separate waterproof fuse holders labelled as Western Power Isolating Point A Fuse and Customer Isolating Point A Fuse respectively .
The labels shall be waterproof .
An underground pillar is not necessary in the event that an UMS pit is installed whether the supply originates from the local Supply Authority or a lighting switchboard . .
The Contractor shall forward copies of the local Supply Authority Preliminary Notice and Notice of Completion to the Superintendent within days of submission of notices to the Service Authority. . COOPERATION WITH OTHERS .
The Contractor shall cooperate with other Contractors working on site .
The Contractor shall not delay other Contractors works while working on site . .
TEMPORARY WORKS .
Where the Contractor is to modify the existing traffic signals the existing traffic signals shall be kept in an operational state for traffic management for the duration of the works . .
The existing traffic signal detection system or alternative detection system shall be fully operational for the duration of the works unless prior written approval to dispense with this requirement has been obtained from Main Roads Traffic Operations Centre . .
The traffic control signals shall maintain an operational connection to the Main Roads Traffic Control Network for the duration of the works unless prior written approval to dispense with this requirement has been obtained from Main Roads Traffic Operations Centre .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
The existing traffic signals shall have the minimum number of signal faces maintained as per AS .
Section for the duration of the works unless prior written approval to dispense with this requirement has been obtained from Main Roads Traffic Operations Centre. . Electrical and operational safety shall be maintained at all times . .
The Contractor shall liaise and coordinate all Works with any associated sign road marking and road works to maintain the safety and integrity of the traffic control system at the work site . .
Some signal layout changes may be necessary to accommodate some of the staged construction activities .
..
The Contractor shall advise the Superintendent five days notice in writing of any temporary modifications to the existing signal installation . .
The Contractor shall advise the Superintendent in writing of any changes made to the controller timings. . All works shall comply with ASNZS and WA Electrical requirements. . COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS .
The Contractor shall coordinate all Works associated with the installation of the communication systems and associated connections required at each site with the Systems Development Manager or Traffic Engineering Officers from the Main Roads Traffic Operations Centre on . .
The traffic signal controller IS required to communicate with the Traffic Operations Centre TOC by way of an APPROVED communication system . .
Arrange and pay all costs associated with installing the communications cable to the controller and connect it to the assigned equipment terminals on the appropriate hardware inside the controller cabinet. . Purchase all necessary communication hardware equipment and install it inside the controller cabinet . .
Ensure the site is communicating with TOC at least business days prior to the signals being commissioned .
. . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
CABLES .
Multicore power cables shall comply with AS .
and shall be of the following types Power Cable AS .
a cores consisting of x . mm and x . mm MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue copper conductors of .KV PVC insulated PVC sheathed .
b cores consisting of x . mm and x . mm copper conductors of .KV PVC insulated PVC sheathed .
c cores consisting of x mm and x . mm copper conductors of .KV PVC insulated PVC sheathed . .
Vehicle detector feeder cables shall comply with ASNZS .
and shall consist of screened Twisted balancedtwin Feeder cable .mm .mm plain annealed copper core conductors each polyethylene insulated tinned annealed copper drain conductor all polyethylene insulated and PVC sheathed .
ASNZS . .
Vehicle detector loop cables shall comply with ASNZS .
and consist of one conductor .
mm .
mm tinned annealed copper polypropylene insulated .
ASNZS . . Other cables shall have copper conductors double insulated with V PVC insulation rated for .kV .
Colours of cable cores shall be in accordance with Table .
of ASNZS for recommended identifying colours except for ASNZS a Identifying colours for active wires to Pedestrian Push Buttons and Audio Tactile driver unit shall be brown the supply power for the walk signal cable shall be orange and the neutral cable shall be blue .
The cable shall comply with the requirements of AS .
Push Buttons AS b Identifying colours for active wiring to the red yellow and green aspects shall be red orange and white respectively .
Colour c All conductors shall have adequate cross sectional areas to match the full current ratings of the connected equipment with less than voltage drop as measured at the load .
The voltage drop to comply with the requirements of ASNZS wiring rules .
Voltage Drop .
Core identification shall be colourfast permanent non conducting compatible with the colour of the cable insulation and suitable for the location .
Cable Insulation .
CONDUIT AND FITTINGS .
Conduit and associated fittings shall be manufactured from orange rigid heavy duty unplasticised polyvinyl chloride UPVC material in accordance with ASNZS .
ASNZS .
The conduit interior shall be kept free from obstructions and sharp edges likely to damage electrical cables upon introduction or withdrawal from the conduit .
Jointing surfaces shall be free from defects .
Sharp Edges .
The dimension form and entry of conduit fittings such as couplers and bends shall be in accordance with AS .
Conduit bends shall only be used and elbows shall not be used .
The supplied lengths and diameters shall be in accordance with ASNZS ..
Size ASNZS . . All conduit lengths and fittings shall be clearly marked with Marking MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue manufacturers name nominal size and heavy duty HD in accordance with the requirements of AS . . One end of the conduit shall be formed or fitted with a socket to enable connection to conduit of the same design .
The dimensions for sockets and plain conduit entries shall be as specified in ASNZS .. Conduit Ends and Sockets .
All conduit and associated fittings shall comply with the requirements of ASNZS SAA Wiring Rules and the requirements of EnergySafety Western Australia .
ASNZS .
TRAFFIC SIGNAL CONTROLLERS .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall either be an Aldridge or Tyco TSC Traffic Signal Controller or an equivalent to be approved by MRWA .
Controller Types .
The Traffic Signal Controller electrical and physical compatibility shall be as stipulated in AS .
AS .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall operate with SCATS Sydney Coordinated Adaptive Traffic System .
SCATS .
The Traffic Signal Controllers shall operate on all voltages within the range V AC to V AC and frequencies within the range Hz to Hz .
Operating Voltage .
Should the voltage subsequently fall correct operation is to be maintained to approximately V. Below this voltage the controller shall go into power fail mode i.e .
FLASHING YELLOW .
A restart shall not occur until the voltage is within the specified range as per clause .. where the controller shall restart .
Control Failure .
The startup sequence shall be as follows FLASHING YELLOW STARTUP ALL RED A PHASE GREEN or any other phase as programmed COMPLETE ONE FULL CYCLE as per the intersection personality If any fault is detected in the control logic the FLASHING YELLOW is to be displayed and the startup sequence terminated .
After a mains failure the startup sequence is to be automatic on the restoration of power to within the tolerances given in clause Start Up Sequence .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall be capable of operating continuously within the ambient temperature range C to C and at up to relative humidity .
Ambient Temperature .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall be immune to radio frequency interference transients and surges on the mains supply in accordance with ASNZS .. ASNZS .. .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall maintain all timings and the status of essential circuits e.g .
clock in the event of a power fail .
Where battery backup is necessary to achieve this a minimum of twentyfour hours reserve shall be provided .
An automatic battery charger must be fitted to maintain this reserve .
Batteries where needed shall be supplied as part of the controller .
Battery Backup .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall provide the following MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue components Main Switch Neutral and earth links x Twin SSO with integral mA Type RCD Circuit breakers to protect the following Lamps A Detectors A GPO A Flashing yellow A Ancillaries A Spare A A suitable surge device shall also be provided . .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall contain a generator supply kit to enable the connection of an external power generator comprising x x position switch A rotary IP rated cw x LED indicators .
Switch to be marked MAINS GEN OFF x amp appliance inlet flat pins Amp IP Hz grey ClipsalAI or approved equivalent with hinged clear Perspex cover ..
Generator Plug .
All Spare cables inside the controller shall be earthed as per Annexure D. Earthing of Spare cables .. CONTROL FUNCTIONS .
The minimum number of phases required is seven and each phase shall be capable of conditionalalternative signal group displays producing a capability of at least sixteen options .
Minimum Number of Phases .
Each phase shall be made up of a number of independently timed periods as detailed in Annexure A and it shall be possible to specify the colour of each signal group during each of these periods e.g .
late startminimum greenVIGRESTEarly Cut Off ECO yellowyellowall red .
Each timed period shall have the minimum timing ranges and increments as detailed in Annexure A .
The accuracy of all timings shall be .
Phase Periods .
Signal groups shall be arranged for Vehicle Bicycle or Pedestrian displays .
The power feed to each signal display aspect shall be a nominal V AC Hz potential .
Each vehicle signal group shall be capable of displaying only RED or YELLOW or GREEN or OFF .
Transitions from one display to any other may occur except GREEN to RED .
Each pedestrian signal group shall be capable of displaying only DONT WALKCYCLE steady or DONT WALKCYCLE flashing or WALKCYCLE or OFF .
Transitions from one display to any other may occur except WALKCYCLE to DONT WALKCYCLE steady .
Signal Groups .
The controller shall be able to record traffic counts on a detector by detector basis in minutes intervals and transmit this data on request via a serial communication link .
Traffic Count MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
Other information which shall be available from an operating controller is as follows a Current or running phase b Position of a controller within a phase c Next phase to be serviced d Which phases have been demanded e Which detectors are producing demands f Operation of pedestrian movements g Timings which have been set in the controller h Which timers are operating at any given time i Operational status of all power supplies j Status of external lamps ..
CONTROLLER HOUSING The enclosure shall be fully equipped for a minimum of twelve signal groups expandable to a minimum of sixteen signal groups .
All equipment necessary to switch a minimum of eight signal groups shall be fitted .
The controller shall have facilities for an integral twentyfour channel detector complement as a minimum .
All equipment necessary to operate a minimum of sixteen detector channels shall be fully fitted .
The housing shall be suitable for mounting on a flat concrete surface having four M studs set in a rectangular pattern with mm x mm centres and protruding mm from the concrete base .
Each of these studs shall be grade stainless steel and come complete with nuts spring washers and flat washers of the same grade .
Housing The enclosure shall be fabricated from marine grade aluminium sheet of not less than .mm thickness .
All internal and external panel surfaces shall have an orbital sanded finish .
The controller housing shall be thoroughly cleaned etched primed and finished to a smoke Blue No .
T in accordance with AS .
Neoprene door seals shall be fitted to ensure that water moisture and dust can not enter the interior of the enclosure giving IP degree of protection .
The seals shall be such that new seals can be fitted at a later date without the necessity of removing any equipment other than the old seals .
A clear antigraffiti coating shall be applied in accordance with Specification .
Finish Colour AS AntiGraffiti .
The access door shall be hinged and it shall be possible to lock it in the  or more open position .
The door shall be secured in the closed position by two triangular headed bolts which shall fit the key shown on MRWA standard drawing .
The head of these bolts shall be fully recessed into the door .
Access Door .
A document pocket minimum size of mm wide x mm high x mm capacity shall be fitted to the inside of the door .
Document Pocket .
A three position vehiclepedestrian detector control switch to select SIMULATED PERMANENT DEMAND or OFF or Control Switch MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue NORMAL shall be provided. . A two position Arterial Switch shall be provided for each Phase to select ON or OFF or via user friendly interface facility .
Arterial Switch .
An Australian Communications and Media Authority ACMA approved cabling line termination unit complete with isolation transformer and a separate access door shall be fitted to the controller housing .
A xmm white conduit and xmm white conduit for the communications service provider line shall be installed between the base of the controller and termination unit .
All equipment such as a communication card necessary to operate the controller from the SCATS computer shall be provided with the controller .
Where controllers are connected to a dial up interrogation facility the appropriate public switching network communication card is required .
The hardware and software shall provide a compatible interface with the SCATS Regional computer through the SCATS Dial In system .
The SCATS communications channel shall comply with RTATC requirements and requirements of clause .. Comms .
Link RTATC .
All terminal strips components detectors etc .
shall be accessed from the front .
Adequate provision shall be made for the outgoing lantern supply cables feeder cables and incoming power supply cable .
A separate access door shall be provided for a communications connection .
Access .
Terminal blocks shall be KLIPPON type SAK or equivalent .
The terminals shall be capable of accepting a minimum of x . cables per aspect and x . cables per loop feeder end .
The terminals for the loop feeders shall be separated from the other terminals .
Each terminal shall be permanently and clearly labelled .
Terminal Block .
A durable diagram showing the layout function and type number of all equipment within the housing shall be firmly attached and clearly displayed inside the housing .
Layout Diagram .
If the signals are starwired and more than posts are required a dummy controller housing is required to provide space for the connections .
Dummy Controller Requirements ..
DETECTORS .
Detectors shall be in accordance with AS as qualified hereunder .
AS .
The output shall be either a relay or a solid state device suitable for switching Volts AC or shall be integrated into the central processing system .
Output Voltage .
Loop isolation transformers shall be used to individually isolate each loop .
Loop Isolation Transformer .
The detector must be capable of being set to a presence time of at least minutes if connected to SCATS .
If the controller is isolated i.e .
not connected to SCATS then the presence time shall be MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue set to a time of at least minutes. . All racks power supplies and other equipment necessary for the operation of detectors are to be supplied and fitted .
Fitted Equipment .
One continuous Detector Loop Feeder Cable shall be installed between the Controller and the assigned Loop Pit .
.. LAMP SWITCHING .
Lamp switching shall be solid state .
The current rating of each individual lamp circuit each colour of each signal group shall not be less than amps continuous .
Lamp Switching .
For any allocated group or groups which conflicts with another conflict monitoring shall ensure that only one group or groups can display green or yellow at any one time except when the flashing yellow facility is in use .
Conflict interlocks shall be applied in both software and hardware .
Conflict shall require that all Red and Green signals will be switched off within ms .
Conflict Monitoring .
The controller shall monitor the failure of any one lamp of any colour in any signal group and indicate the wattage before and after failure as a pointer to the size of lamp that has failed .
Lamp Failure Monitoring .
The controller shall be capable of monitoring the supply voltage and within the range V to V shall regulate the lamp supply voltage to V . Voltage Regulations .
The controller shall suitably reduce the lamp supply voltage for dimming the traffic signal lamp output produced at night .
The dimming shall be initiated by either condition set in the personality or via SCATS .
A light sensor shall differentiate between night and day .
Lamp Dimming .
A flashing yellow facility shall be provided which can be initiated by either the controller logic or the FLASH position of the facility switch .
The circuitry to generate this flashing yellow is to be self contained and separate from the controller logic .
It shall be possible to remove the controller logic module and still maintain the flashing yellow display .
Flashing Yellow ..
PROGRAMMING AND OPERATION .
The Traffic Controller shall be programmed in accordance with Specification Traffic Control Equipment Software . .
The controller shall have the ability to reset detectors via the SCATS system without the need for special personality provisions .. Railway Crossings .
At rail crossings the applicable rail authority shall supply the cable to connect between the Traffic Control Signal and the Railway Signal Equipment .
The connection details shall be provided in the Controller documentation .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
When a new traffic signal controller is to be installed at an existing site the railway interface device should be completely upgraded to current applicable technology i.e .
Omron relays type LYN with LED Powertran type ML transformer all of which shall be housed in a suitable enclosure with a transparent front cover .
The front cover shall also incorporate x RDA Switch with onoff escutcheon and a metal operating lever x RDB switch with onoff escutcheon and a metal operating lever x V A fuse x V A fuse .
The use of old existing technology such as Sprecher and Schuh relay based systems are not to be reused .
UNINTERRUPTED POWER SUPPLY .
Uninterrupted power supply UPS shall be supplied and installed in locations selected by Main Roads as per Main Roads Specification Uninterrupted Power Supply .
UPS .
LANTERNS .. GENERAL .
Lanterns shall be complete with Volt Light Emitting Diodes LED and transformers .
Where indicated on the Drawings directional arrow masks and louvres shall be fitted to the relevant aspects .
Two mounting straps shall be supplied and fitted to each lantern .
Visors shall be fitted to each lantern as per the design drawings .
The lanterns shall comply with the requirements of ASNZS and this Specification .
LED Lanterns ASNZS .
All lanterns on new traffic control signals sites shall only be fitted with LED lanterns .
New Sites .
All lanterns are to be replaced with LED lanterns where any work at the site involves work fitting or refitting existing lanterns .
Modifications .. LANTERN TYPES .
General purpose vehicular lanterns shall have a lens or apparent light source nominal signal diameter of mm .
Vehicular Lanterns .
Pedestrian lanterns shall have two aspects of a nominal signal diameter of mm .
Pedestrian Lanterns .
Lanterns shall be capable of being supplied with one two or three aspects .
Aspects .. OPTICAL SYSTEM .
Lanterns shall meet the requirements of ASNZS for colour luminance intensity chromaticity and sun phantom .
Photometric Tests ..
MECHANICAL AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS .
The lantern and constituent components shall have a service life in excess of years when operated within the ambient temperature range C Degrees Celsius to C Degrees Celsius .
This does not include the lamps and gaskets .
Life .
Plastic components must be constructed from first grade ASNZS MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue material which in turn must be moulded from pure nonrecycled or non reground stock .
The plastic shall be ultra violet stabilised as per ASNZS for a minimum of years life where the component is partly or fully exposed to sunlight. . Gaskets where used shall be of a resilient material having a continuous temperature rating of not less than C Degrees Celsius and be capable of being replaced in the field with the lantern installed .
Gaskets .
The door of each aspect shall be capable of being unlatched and latched from the front by a simple onehanded operation .
For doors secured by screws it shall not be necessary to use a tool or to turn the screws more than half a turn to secure or release the door .
The door shall be such that it can be hinged both on the left or right .
Doors shall be fitted with antitamper inserts .
Door AntiTamper Inserts .
Lanterns shall be provided with facilities to enable them to be effectively secured between two parallel mounting straps spaced apart as shown in Figure .
of ASNZS .
Two mounting straps top and bottom shall be supplied with each lantern .
Mounting ASNZS .
The straps shall be manufactured from marine grade austenitic stainless steel grade to AS and shall have a good quality surface finish free from protrusions sharp edges and abrasive surface blemishes .
Mounting Straps AS .
Target boards visors and arrow masks shall be in accordance with ASNZS and Main Roads Standard Drawings .
Aluminium target boards shall be made from mm thick aluminium .
Blanking plates shall be made from .mm thick aluminium .
The aluminium shall be of grade H matt face .
It shall be from mill cut sheets and not from coils .
ASNZS Accessories ..
LED ASPECTS .
LED arrays and the print circuit boards they are mounted on shall be in accordance with ASNZS . . .LED circuit boards as per clause including those encapsulated in removable aspects shall be separately removable from the lantern . .
The maximum operational power consumption of LED aspects will be as follows Red aspect W Yellow aspect W Green W . All other operational requirements of LED aspects shall be in accordance with ASNZS .
.. LANTERN WIRING .
Wiring shall be terminated with crimp lugs and insulated boots .
The connecting wires shall be .mm with V PVC insulation or better and be colour coded as follows Active Red aspect Red Cable Colours Active Yellow aspect Orange Cable MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue Active Green aspect White Cable Neutral Black Cable Earth GreenYellow Cable .
Terminals shall be provided in an accessible position in the upper most aspect of the lantern assembly .
The terminals shall be legibly and durably identified either on or immediately adjacent to the terminals .
For screw type terminals the strands of the conductors shall not be clamped directly by the terminal screws .
Terminals .. TRANSFORMERS .
Transformers shall operate on a Volt hertz single phase supply .
The secondary voltage shall be Volts with Volts input when supplying the nominated load .
The transformers shall comply with ASNZS .
Insulation shall be minimum Class H and the vacuum impregnation method shall be used to impregnate the transformer windings with the insulating resin .
The transformers secondary voltage shall not compromise luminous intensity .
ASNZS .
Transformers shall be accommodated within the lantern body with one transformer per aspect .
Each transformer shall be mounted such that it can be removed mechanically and disconnected electrically and replaced in the field without the necessity to remove the lantern from its normal position .
All connections to the terminal block must be accessible and the removal and replacement of leads to the transformer or incoming supply must be able to be made without removing the transformer .
The mounting shall be such that in the event of a vehicle colliding with a traffic signal post the transformer will remain attached to the body of the lantern and the mounting bracket and not become a projectile .
The transformer shall be earthed .
Transformer Mounting Earthing Transformer .
PEDESTRIAN PUSH BUTTONS .
The Pedestrian Push Buttons shall comply with Australian Standard AS and generally conform to the requirements of the Roads and Traffic Authority NSW traffic signal equipment specification No .
ATS and specification No .
PB except where qualified in this specification .
AS .
Pedestrian Push Buttons shall be capable of being mounted to the traffic signal post and shall allow manual operation by pedestrians using a nonlocking jam proof push switch .
It shall contain a maximum of extra low voltage .
Mounting .
Audio tactile units shall be capable of being mounted near the top of the traffic signal post and shall contain the driver circuitry for the detector .
Audio tactile units shall provide a suitable audible locating tone when the walk signal input is inactive to allow pedestrians to locate the unit .
The fundamental tone frequency shall be Hz .
The tone shall pulse with a repetition rate of .
.Hz .
Audio tactile units shall change tone at the commencement of the walk signal input becoming active to alert pedestrians of the commencement Audio tactile units MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue of the crossing period .
The change tone frequency shall decay exponentially from Hz to Hz .
The duration of the change tone shall be ms ms .
Following this the unit shall provide an audible crossing tone for the duration of the walk signal input being active to alert pedestrians of the duration of the crossing period .
The fundamental crossing tone frequency shall be Hz .
The tone shall pulse with a repetition rate .
.Hz .
The unit shall provide a touched sense crossing when the walk signal input is active to alert visually impaired pedestrians to the cross period. . Audible signal levels shall be automatically adjusted for consistent movements in ambient noise level .
In addition a three position switch labelled Normal High and Low shall be provided within the unit to allow the output audible signal level to be increased or decreased respectively .
Signal levels .
The design for generating the crossing signal shall be fail safe to ensure that the signal can not be emitted unless the walk signal input is active Interlocking .
The pushbutton shall provide a switch mechanism normally off and actuated when depressed .
The button shall be a minimum of mm in diameter .
The buttons travel shall be mm mm .
The activating and restoring forces of the pushbutton shall comply with AS .
The push button shall be actuated by movement of the button through of its travel from its rest state to its fully depressed state .
The push button shall be deactuated by movement of the button through of its reverse travel from its fully depressed state to its rest state .
The switch shall have a minimum mA current rating .
The switching shall be compatible with an MRWA approved Traffic Signal Controller .
Button .
A combination visualtactile single head arrow shall be displayed on the front of the push button assembly indicating to the pedestrian the direction of the associated crossing .
The arrow shall be distinctive both visually and by touch .
The arrow shall be able to rotate in the vertical plane .
The arrow shall provide the tactile signals .
Arrow The Pedestrian pushbutton assembly shall be attached to the post using the predrilled holes provided in the post or by drilling and tapping new holes in an existing post such that the height of the push button places the centre of the button mm above ground level .
Height Except for medians the Pedestrian Push Button face shall be either parallel with the kerb of the associated crossing or parallel with the pedestrian crossing road markings as shown on the Drawing and to suit the intended design of the crossing .
The Pedestrian Push Button face shall be parallel with the pedestrian crossing road markings where fitted on posts within median islands as shown on the Drawing .
The single headed arrow disc shall point in the direction of pedestrian travel .
Where pedestrian pushbutton assemblies are installed on median island posts the standard singleheaded arrow disc shall be replaced Push Buttons on MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue with a twoheaded arrow disc pointing to each direction of pedestrian travel as indicated on the Drawing .
the medians On each post where a pedestrian pushbutton assembly is installed a selfadhesive explanatory label shall be affixed above it .
Care is to be taken to ensure the correct label is fitted JPED type for exclusive pedestrian movements JPED for combined vehiclepedestrian movements and JPED for combined pedestrianbicycle movements .
Selfadhesive labels .
The components shall be housed in durable weather proof housing with an IP protection rating .
The housing shall be of sufficient mechanical strength to withstand vandalism .
The housing shall be manufactured from corrosion resistant materials .
The unit shall be designed to be aesthetically pleasing .
It shall be arranged to prevent any injury to pedestrians and maintenance staff .
The Pedestrian Push Button assembly shall not exceed kg .
The audio tactile driver shall not exceed kg.The driver unit shall be capable of being securely mounted to the post using a single U bolt M x mm thread arrangement supplied with the unit .
The U bolt shall be supplied with x M hex nuts x M thin hex nuts and x  flat washers all of which are hot dip galvanized in accordance with AS .
Housing Mounting Tactile Driver Unit AS .
The Pedestrian Push Button shall have a service life in excess of ten years with a minimum of ten million actuations when operated continuously in the Western Australian environment .
Design Life .
The audio tactile driver shall provide the following wiring connections .
When parallel walks with time delay protection are installed new or upgraded sites .
MRGT Turning Vehicles Give Way to Pedestrians signs to be installed as primary displays on posts nearest to the left or right turn movement where the rule applies .
Signs to be removed after three months .

PITS AND CABLE MARKERS .
The design and construction of the pits and lids shall prevent the ingress of rain and surface water when installed .
The pits and constituent components shall give a service life in excess of years when installed in a temperature range of C degrees Celsius to C degrees Celsius and within the environment condition of Western Australia .
The preferred material for all pits is polymer plastic however glassfibre reinforced concrete pits will be accepted for termination pits and double lid cable pits .
The sides of the pit shall have sufficient strength to resist soil pressures of minimum kpa .
The pit shall have a maximum mm deformation when installed and surrounding soil suitably compacted .
The termination pit shall have Material MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue sufficient mechanical strength and stability to withstand vehicular traffic when installed .
The termination pit and lid shall be rated at a minimum kg wheel load .
Other Pits shall have sufficient mechanical strength and stability to withstand pedestrian traffic load of minimum kg when installed .
The pits and Lids shall not be deformed and disturbed when compacting the surrounding soil . .
The pit walls shall be of uniform thickness and shall facilitate the installation of up to eight mm with outside diameter of mm in accordance with ASNZS .
HD PVC conduits .
Limits of conduit cut outs shall be marked on the pit walls .
Conduit entries .
The preferred material for all lids is polymeric plastic however precast concrete lids will be accepted .
All pit lids shall be fitted with suitable lifting arrangements designed to resist tampering by the general public .
An industry standard plastic plug shall be installed to plug the lifting hole to help alleviate water and sand ingress .
Each Pit shall also be fitted with an industry standard plastic gasket under the lid to reduce the entry of foreign material into the pit .
Any pit lid shall fit all pits of the same type of pit .
There shall be no gaps between the lid and edge of the pit that cause hazards for members of the public wearing high heels or similar footwear .
Lids .
Termination pits shall conform to the form and dimensions shown in MRWA Drawing .
The termination pit lid shall be constructed extending past pit sides and to fit securely over the pit opening with a suitable water seal .
For termination pits two opposing pit walls shall provide a shoulder or fixture for the termination box and support tray .
The support tray and termination box shall be easily removed from the pit .
Termination Pit .
Double Lid cable pits shall conform to the form and dimensions shown in MRWA Drawing .
The double lid cable pit shall be designed for a double lid assembly supported by a T bar as detailed in the Drawings .
The T bar shall be aluminium and designed to suit the pit and lid .
The double lids shall sit flush with and be contained within the pit surrounds .
Double Lid Cable Pit .
Cable draw pits shall be a Viscount Vipit range model P cable pit or similar .
Cable Draw Pit .
Loop and Earth pits shall be a Viscount Vipit range model P cable pit or similar approved .
Communication pits shall be Viscount Vipit model or similar approved P cable pit .
Loop earth and Comms Pit .
All conduit locations shall be marked at their ends at footpath level with cable Route Markers set in concrete .
The Cable Marker shall be embossed with MRWA Electric Cable and an arrow showing the direction of the conduit and cable .
mm diameter aluminium cable markers with the words MRWA Electric Cable embossed into the disk and x mm long hooks for casting into concrete shall be cast into the concrete surround to identify the direction of all conduit runs using the embossed arrow .
Conduit and Cable Markers .
To identify the location of underground electric cables mm wide orange danger tape shall be installed mm above the conduits .
Orange Danger Tape .
The pits shall have a good quality surface finish free from Finish MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue protrusion and abrasive surface blemishes .
All edges shall be rounded with a nominal radius of mm .
Polymer plastic pits or lids shall have a uniform black colour .
Glassfibre reinforced concrete pits shall have a uniform grey colour .
Colour .
For all Termination Double Lid Cable Cable Draw and Loop Pits the wording MRWA ELECTRIC CABLE shall be moulded into the top of the pit lid and shall be centrally located .
The height of lettering shall be mm .
Lid Identification .
For all earth pits the wording MRWA EARTH shall be moulded into the top of the Pit lid and shall be centrally Located .
Earth Pit Lid .
For all communications pits the wording MRWA COMMS or MRWA COMMUNICATIONS shall be moulded into the top of the Pit lid and shall be centrally located .
Comm .
Pit Lid .
Controller base Mouldings shall conform to the form and dimensions shown in the Drawings .
Controller Base .
Where steel work is used it shall be hot dip galvanised in accordance with AS NZS and all welds shall comply with ASNZS part .
ASNZS ASNZS .

Traffic signal posts mast arms and all accessories shall be of the form dimensions material and finish specified in AS and ASNZS .
Mast arms shall be designed in accordance with AS .
The posts shall be hotdip galvanised inside and outside with a minimum coating of grams per square metre in accordance with AS .
All areas of steel exposed during machining including holes and edges shall be touched up with a zinc enriched primer complying with ASNZS .
AS ASNZS AS AS ASNZS . .
Mounting brackets and accessories shall be designed to fit a traffic signal post of nominal outside diameter between .mm and .mm with thickness of .mm in accordance with AS AS and MRWA Standard Drawing .
Size AS AS .
Mounting brackets and accessories shall be designed to fit a traffic signal mast arm in accordance with AS and MRWA Standard Drawing .
Mast Arm AS .
Traffic signal posts shall be powder coated with exterior Traffic Signal MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue grade lead free polyester .
The finished colour and specular gloss value shall meet requirements of AS colour Golden Yellow Y with antigraffiti finish applied in accordance with Specification ANTI GRAFFITI .
Minimum coating thickness shall be microns .
Post Colour AS .. TERMINAL ASSEMBLY .
The terminal assembly shall allow the termination of core traffic signal cable and traffic signal lantern cabling associated with traffic control signals including pedestrian push buttons no leftright turn signs and audible pedestrian push button tactile drivers .
The terminals shall be divided into four sections .
Each section shall be separated by a Klippon AP end section or approved equivalent .
a Section commencing at the top of the rail shall consist of earth terminals .
b Section shall consist of terminals dedicated for signal lantern active conductors .
The terminals shall be clearly numbered from top to bottom to and GRY with terminal labels c Section shall consist of terminals dedicated for signal lantern neutral conductors .
Both terminals shall be electrically connected by a two way jumper bar .
The terminals shall be clearly identified with a blue terminal labels .
d Section shall consist of a single earth terminal. . Terminals shall be Klippon AST TS Mounting Polymide .
with Pushon Tab Connections or equivalent consisting of spade terminals horizontally oriented .
The spade terminals shall be tin nickel plated brass or copper alloy angled and compatible with Utilux female connectors type H and Utilux insulators type H. Earth terminals shall be Klippon Earth Terminal EK or approved equivalent .
The terminals shall be secured by a terminal strip locking bar .
.. FINIAL CAP .
The finial cap material shall be polymer plastic .
The finial cap form dimensions and degree of protection shall conform to Clause .
and figure of AS .
Two mounting slots mm wide shall be located apart at the base of the finial cap .
These slots shall be mm deep .
The cap shall have a ridge around its base to allow the cap to be secured by suitable clamps .
Finial Cap .
The finial cap shall be provided with a plastic coated multi strand wire arrestor strap .
The arrestor strap shall be of suitable strength to resist breaking should the traffic signal post be struck .
The arrestor strap shall be mm long .
The arrestor strap shall be fitted with a connection at either end designed to be secured by an M bolt .
Arrestor Strap .
The arrestor strap shall be securely fitted to the finial cap and located mm from one of the mounting slots along the circumference of the finial cap .
The fitting shall be an M bolt complete with flat washer shake proof washer and a dome nut . .
The arrestor strap connections and cap fitting shall be marine grade stainless steel .
Finish MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
The colour of the finial cap shall be black .
Colour .
TERMINATION ENCLOSURES .
The enclosure shall be of rigid and robust plastic material .
The enclosure shall have a clear lid that is removable through bayonet type captive screws .
The screws shall be operated by a quarter turn of a coin or similar tool .
The enclosure shall provide a sealed and suitable environment for terminations and prevent the ingress of water or dust .
Silica gel bags or similar shall be provided suitable to absorb moisture .
The Silica gel bags mm x mm shall contain grams of Silica Gel Self indicating mesh .
The bags shall be made of fabric called Calico .
For terminating core cable a Klockner Moeller box Part No MRXJP and for terminating core cable a Klockner Moeller box Part No MRJP .
Any other equivalent terminating core cable used to be approved by the Principal .
Enclosures Silica Gel Bags .
The support tray shall be mm thick marine grade aluminium plate suitably moulded to fit into the termination pit and rest securely on the lip provided .
The tray shall allow the enclosure to be fixed and be located appropriately within the pit .
Support Tray .
mm Mounting Rails TS Klippon Part No .
or similar shall be used .
