NOT USED SURVEY .
SETTING OUT .
The Contractor shall mark out the position of all signal components in accordance with the Drawings .
Contractor to Mark Out .
The Contractor shall in the course of the works verify by careful excavation the location of all services and objects likely to conflict with the works and if necessary modify the post conduits pits and controller locations .
Contractor to Verify Location .
The Contractor shall advise the Superintendent in writing of any modifications to the location of posts conduits pits and controller from the Drawing . .
The Contractor shall further check with the service authorities that the modified positions of components are clear of underground or overhead services .
The marked location of each post and controller approved by the Superintendent prior to excavation of foundations shall constitute approval to the sitting of the post or the controller position only and shall in no way relieve the Contractor from his obligations under this Clause .
Contractor to Check . . NOT USED MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue UNDERGROUND WORKS .
EXCAVATIONS .
The excavation depth shall be such that all conduits have a minimum cover from top of the conduit to the finished surface of mm and a maximum cover of mm .
The minimum excavation depth for consumer main shall comply with WA Electrical requirements .
Conduit Cover .
All excavations shall be kept to a minimum .
The excavation width shall not exceed mm .
All open pits excavations trenches and bores shall be fenced off or protected from vehicular traffic and pedestrians during the progress of the work .
Excess spoil shall be removed at the end of each day .
Extra care must be taken not to damage the sides of trenching .
Excavation width kept to Minimum .
The lines of trenches shall be as shown on Drawings .
Before any pavement excavation is commenced the limits of the trench shall be precut with a diamond concrete saw to a depth of not less than mm .
Line of Trenches .
Where excavation of reinforced concrete areas is carried out care shall be taken not to damage the steel reinforcing rods or mesh which shall be cut through only at the centre of the trench .
In the course of excavation the steel reinforcing may be bent aside but shall be replaced and bars lapped in their original positions when the trench is backfilled .
Reinforced Concrete .
Prior to any excavations on bridges or structures the Contractor shall notify the Superintendent in writing .
HOLD POINT .
Where shown on the Drawings conduit junction pits and detector pits shall be provided .
Any subsoil drains disturbed during the excavation or laying of conduits shall be reinstated to the satisfaction of the responsible Authority .
Pits Drains .
Conduits to be installed so that they enter through the side of cable pits .
Conduit Entry .
PAVEMENT REINSTATEMENT PROCEDURE .. BACKFILL MATERIAL .
Backfill shall be excavated material free from rocks clay stones sections of pavement material or organic and perishable matter and shall be of uniform composition and moisture content .
Under trafficable paved areas clean sand shall be used as backfill .
Backfill .. BEDDING .
Prior to backfilling the conduits shall be bedded on and surrounded by an mm layer of clean yellow sand .
..
PLACING .
Backfill materials shall be placed in layers not exceeding mm loose thickness prior to compaction .
Layer Thickness MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .. COMPACTION .
The material shall be compacted to the bottom of the pavement under trafficable areas or natural surface in other areas to a Characteristic Dry Density Ratio CDDR of or blows using the Perth Sand Penetrometer .
In the event that other than Perth sand is used for fill compaction shall be Characteristic Dry Density Ratio .
Compaction .
If a penetrometer is used a calibration certificate from a NATA registered laboratory shall be provided in respect to the material tested .
The maximum test depth of the penetrometer is not to exceed .
metres .
Where fill depths exceed .
metres multiple testing shall be carried out during the backfilling operation with clear documentation provided detailing such testing .
Testing .
The Contractor shall provide compaction certificates showing the location number of tests and depth ranges for each line .
The dry density ratio shall be determined at six locations per line .
The locations shall be selected in accordance with MRWA Test Method WA .
Random Sample Site Location and the characteristic dry density ratio calculated in accordance with MRWA Test Method .. .. PAVEMENT .
The Sub Base shall be mm laterite gravel or mm single layer limestone compacted to CDDR .
Sub Base .
The Base Course layer shall be mm laterite gravel or Bituminised Stabilised Limestone compacted to CDDR .
Base Course .
The primerseal shall be a two coat seal using CRS cationic rapid setting class bitumen emulsion covered with granite aggregate in the following combination Primerseal a st coat .
lm covered with mm aggregate .
b nd coat .
lm covered with mm aggregate .
Primerseal width is to be set out so as to allow for any insitu kerbing to be cast on the primerseal surface . .
The asphalt shall be mm thick dense graded granite mm Intersection Mix for intersections or mm dense graded granite mm mix for other areas .
The Contractor shall ensure not to damage the side of trenching .
Asphalt .
The finished surface shall be between mm to mm above the existing surface .
Finished Surface If the final asphalt is not placed the same day as backfilling BSL shall be used laid to mm above the pavement surface .
Same Day Asphalt .
CONTROLLER FOOTING INSTALLATION .
The Traffic Signal Controller shall be installed on a concrete footing or smooth pavement material that matches the surrounding pavement .
The orientation of the base shall be such that the back of the controller when mounted shall face into the intersection .
Orientation .
The top of the controller base shall be smooth and level to prevent twisting of the controller frame and poor door alignment .
The walls of the pits shall be left in a smooth finish to prevent damage to Level MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue electrical cables. . A double lid cable pit shall be installed in front of the controller .
The number of conduits to be installed between the double lid pit and the controller footing shall be eight .
They shall be installed in two rows each consisting of x minimum mm orange conduits .
The main earth electrode shall be installed in its own earth pit and connected directly to the controller earth link .
Cable Pit .
After installing the controller footing the pit opening shall be capped and adequate barricading to be maintained until the controller housing is installed . .
The concrete apron around the Controller shall be mm x mm minimum and shall be installed in one of the following ways a Slabbed concrete apron comprising minimum mm thick slabs .
b Poured concrete apron .
The concrete shall be laid in one continuous pour of mm thickness and with a broomed finish .
If this method is chosen the Contractor shall be responsible for making sure that any Communications provider that gains access to the communications pit to install its conduit and cable without disturbing the concrete hardstand .
c Smooth pavement material that matches the surrounding area .
Dimensions .
The finished concrete surface shall comply with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS . .
CONDUITS NOT UNDER ROADS .
Trenches shall be backfilled as per Clause .
except that clean yellow sand shall be used as the backfill .
Backfill .
The top mm of backfill material in unpaved areas is to be of selected material from the site of the same soil composition as the original surface material or material of a type approved by the Superintendent as suitable .
Top mm .
In footways paved with paving blocks or slabs no asphaltic material shall be used but the Contractor shall replace the paving blocks or slabs on sand compacted and levelled .
Footways . . NOT USED ELECTRICAL AND COMMUNICATIONS CONDUITS .
INSTALLATION OF CONDUITS .
The completed underground electrical conduits with cable installed shall comply with the requirements of Australian Standard ASNZS for Category A Underground Wiring Systems in addition to any other requirements contained in this Contract .
Conduit Compliance .
Couplings and bends used for PVC conduit shall be of sufficient length to allow the pipe to be inserted with a penetration Couplings Bends MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue equivalent to the nominal bore of the pipe .
Couplings shall have a moulded stop in the centre to ensure equal engagement of conduits from both ends .
Before insertion the interior of the fitting and the end of the conduit shall be thoroughly cleaned then liberally coated with a conduit manufacturers approved bonding agent . .
Conduits shall be installed generally in the locations as shown on the Drawings .
Conduits shall be installed so that they enter the cable pit from the side within the specified depth .
Installation Details .
Conduit ends shall be capped at the time of installation to reduce the possibility of sand or other foreign material entering the conduits . .
These conduits shall cross the centre islands in the locations shown on the Drawings .
When crossing slip lanes the in conduits shall be laid above the out conduits. . Where conduit is cut for median island posts the end not used shall be plugged with a conduit manufacturers approved cap glued in place to ensure dirt or sand does not enter the conduit .
If there are three or more lanes the right and centre lane loop detector cable shall be run to the median and a loop pit installed .
The single mm conduit for the loop detector cable shall then be cut and both ends terminated in the loop pit .
Conduits to be Plugged .
All conduit locations shall be marked at their ends at footpath level with Cable Route Markers set in concrete. . STAR SYSTEM OF WIRING .
The standard arrangement for conduit installation using the star system of wiring requires each traffic signal post to be individually connected with mm conduits to the controller .
Star Wiring system Conduit .
For loop pits there shall be one loop feeder mm conduit per direction linked in and out of the Loop Pits .
Maximum of loop feeder cables in a single mm conduit .
Install additional x mm conduit for next set of loop feeder cables. . From the controller to the first intermediate pit x mm spare orange conduits and x mm spare white conduit shall be laid .
From the intermediate pit to the last post x mm spare conduit shall be laid .
Spare Conduits .
The conduits shall be laid out side by side in a common trench in the following order a Outer conduit x mm white for communication cables linked from controller to each immediate pitpost .
b Second outer conduit x mm for loop feeder cables linked in and out of the Loop Pits .
c Third and fourth from outer conduits x mm orange spare conduit .
d Inner conduits x mm for post cables in ascending order of each post number .
e Dummy controller shall be installed next to main controller subject to sites constraints .
Install conduits Dummy controller MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue between the main and dummy controller as per below i Install minimum of x mm conduit between the controller and dummy controller including feeder loop cable requirements .
ii Install minimum of one core cable between the two controllers .
f Install x mm spare orange conduit for each corner island under the Give Way signs . .
PIT SYSTEM OF WIRING .
The standard arrangement for conduit installation using the pit system of wiring requires x mm and x mm conduits to be laid in a ring around the intersection .
The ring shall start in a clockwise direction leaving the Controller as the out conduits and finish at the Controller as the in conduits .
The conduits shall be laid side by side in a common trench in the following order Pit wiring system Conduit Installation a Outer conduit x mm white for communication cables linked in and out of the Termination Pits to form a ring back to the controller b Second from outer conduit x mm for Loop Feeder cables linked in and out of the Loop Pits .
c Third from outer conduit x mm for Ring Main cables linked in and out of all Termination Pits .
d Fourth from the outer conduit x mm for Spare linked in and out of all Termination Pits .
e Inner conduit x mm for Post cables linked in and out of all Termination Pits. . POST CONDUITS .
Between the conduit and the traffic signal post an orange mm corrugated flexible conduit shall be used .
The corrugated conduit shall be pushed inside the mm conduit for a minimum of mm and into the post so as to be mm above ground level .
Corrugated Conduit .
CLEANING OF CONDUITS .
All conduits must be thoroughly cleaned internally prior to installing cables in the conduit .
This shall be done by pulling a swab or similar through the conduit .
Cleaning of Conduits .
All conduits must have smooth edges to prevent cable damage when pulling cable through the conduit .
Smooth Edges . . NOT USED CABLE INSTALLATION .
INSTALLATION AND TERMINATION OF CABLES .. GENERAL .
All cable sizes and wiring arrangements shall comply with Cable Sizes MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue the provisions listed below unless otherwise specified on the Drawings Wiring Arrangements a At intersection traffic signals using a star system of wiring the posts shall be connected by a core cable direct to the controller through the cable draw pits in accordance with the Drawings .
Star System b At intersection traffic signals using a pit system of wiring the controller termination pits and all cable pits adjacent to the traffic signal posts shall be connected by a or multicore ring main circuit as detailed on the Drawings .
A core cable shall be used to connect the post to the cable pit .
Pit System c At intersections with bad drainage where the main road is floodway and where pits hold water for a long time Posts shall be connected to the controller using Post Top Ring Main assembly and the installation shall be in accordance with the Drawings .
Post Top Ring Main Assembly d At all installations Pedestrian Push Buttons shall be connected to the terminal strip by multicore V cable having two core and earth .
.mm .
e For all works one continuous detector feeder cable for each detector loop shall be drawn through conduits from the loop detector pit near the detector loops to the controller .
The use of inline cable joints or repairs is unacceptable .
An approved cable joint is only allowed for loop cables in the loop pit. . Interconnecting cables shall be drawn through conduits .
It shall be possible to remove and replace any cable without the need for the disconnection of other cables with the exception of Loop feeder cable .
Cable Replacement .
Any cables in which the insulation or sheathing is damaged before or during installation shall be replaced by the Contractor at his own expense .
Powdered soapstone talc or other approved lubricant may be used as required when pulling the cable into conduits .
Particular care must be taken when the outer or inner sheath is being removed and only appropriate stripping tools shall be used at all times .
Damaged Cable .. TERMINATIONS .
The following terminals or similar shall be used .
a Earth terminals EK Klippon Part No .
Terminals b End Bracket EWK Klippon Part No .
c Terminals SAKR Klippon Part No .
d Partition HP Klippon Part No .
e Cross Connect QB Comb Klippon Part No .
f End Plate AP Klippon Part No .
g Terminal Markers Klippon Part No Dekafix .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
Cable glands shall be QED STB STB or STB or similar .
Cable Glands .
The .mm and .mm cable cores shall be connected using the following crimplugs Crimp Lugs a Black bootlace crimp No size DIN .mm individual type or No size DIN .mm magazine type .
b Red bootlace crimps No size standard .mm individual type or No size standard .mm magazine type .
c Blue bootlace crimps No size .mm magazine type . .
The following colour coding for Bootlace Crimps shall apply a All .mm ring main out cores black bootlace crimps .
Lug Colours b All .mm ring main in cores red bootlace crimps .
c All .mm post cable out cores at controller and termination pits black bootlace crimps .
d All .mm cable cores blue bootlace crimps . .
The crimplugs shall be applied using the crimping tool stipulated in this specification or alternatively one specified by the crimplug manufacturer for the particular crimplug .
Crimping .
Cable Cores that are mm namely the neutral the grey and the Earthwires contained in the core cable may be directly terminated without the use of crimplugs .
mm Cable Cores .
All Earth Stud connections shall be made using .mm x mm hole earthing lugs .
Earthing .
Alternative methods of electrical connection will not be accepted unless the Superintendent gives prior written approval .
.. CABLE JOINTS .
The use of inline cable joints or repairs is not acceptable .
Joins in the and core cables are not permitted .
Similarly joins are not permitted in loop cables or loop feeders except where the loop detector cable joins the loop feeder cable .
Joints .. CABLE TIES .
Only black UV stabilised cable ties shall be used .
Colour .. CABLE CHART .
The Controller shall contain a copy of the Cable Chart .
It shall show the connection details for controller all Pits and Posts .
All Termination pits shall contain a copy of the Cable Chart .
It shall be laminated and fixed to the inside of the Termination Box lid so as to be visible without removing the lid .
For existing Post Top Ring Main sites one copy of the wiring chart shall be placed in the Controller .
Cable Chart MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue ..
DIRECTION OF RING MAIN CABLE .
All out cable cores shall be loomed in black spiral wrap and all in cable cores shall be loomed in white spiral wrap for identification .
All cores of individual cables shall be contained in one loom and shall be separate to the cores of other cables .
Each individual core of cables shall be brought out of the loom separately .
Only non flammable mm spiral wrap shall be used .
Spiral Wrap .
CABLE PITS .. GENERAL .
All Termination Pits shall be mounted sufficiently below ground level so that their lids sit flush to ground level when fitted .
Double Lid Cable Pits Loop Pits Earth Pits and Communication Pits shall be installed with the top of their walls flush to ground level .
All pits that are not set within a concreted area shall have a concrete surround .
The Termination pit and double lid draw pit shall have steel reenforced concrete surround .
The surface of the concrete skirt surround shall be flush to ground level .
The dimensions of the concrete skirt shall be mm wide and mm thick .
A mm clearance shall be allowed between the lid and surround to permit removal of the lid during maintenance .
Pits that are not set within a concreted area shall have a concrete surround mm wide and mm thick .
Loop Pits shall be mounted one metre back from the kerb face to provide maintenance workers with a safe working distance from the carriageway .
Pits to be Flush Reenforced concrete surround .
Termination pits shall be installed in accordance with the Drawings .
Termination Pits .
Where the conduits enter the cable pits a neat hole shall be cut using a hole cutter or similar tool .
Pits with holes knocked in with a hammer or similar tool are not acceptable .
Prior to backfilling around the pits the conduits are to be sealed to the outside of the pit using a sandcement mortar .
Any excess mortar inside the pit must be removed .
Alternatively the conduit may be sealed to the inside of the pit using Silicone Sealant .
Holes and fractures in the pit wall are not acceptable .
Conduits to be terminated to the side of the pits without use of conduit bends and elbows .
Conduits shall enter the pit with mm of conduit penetrating into the pit .
Making Holes ..
TERMINATION BOX PREPARATION .
The Contractor shall prepare and install in all Termination Pits a termination box of the size specified in the Cable Chart .
Termination Pit .
The termination box assembly shall include the installation of the following bridging wires Termination Box a Earth wire An Earth wire bridge same size conductor as the ring main Earth cable core shall be connected between the A rail Earth terminal and the B rail Earth terminal in the core termination box and between the X rail Y rail and Z rail Earth terminals in the core termination box .
Earth Wire b Neutral A Neutral bridge wire same size conductor as the ring main Neutral cable core between the X rail Neutral Wire MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue and Z rail neutral terminals in the core termination box . .
The termination box shall be fitted to the aluminium support tray using four only mm x mm cadmium plated screws .
The support traytermination box assembly shall be placed on the ledge provided within the Termination Pit .
Support Tray .
IP rated waterproof cable glands shall be used where a cable enters and exits a termination box .
Cable Glands ..
TERMINATION BOX RING MAIN CONNECTION .
Ring main cables shall enter and exit the termination box from the underside. . For core ring main cables the in cable shall enter the termination box under the right side of the X terminal rail and the out ring main shall exit under the left side of the Z terminal rail .
Ring Main Core Cable .
For core ring main cables the in cable shall enter the termination box under the right side of the A terminal rail and the out ring main cable shall exit under the left side of the A terminal rail .
Core Cable .
The cable cores within the termination box shall be neatly formed and laced to allow individual conductors to be connected and disconnected to the appropriate numbered terminal in accordance with the cable connection chart .
The cores of different cables shall not be laced together in the same loom .
The cores of the in ring main cable shall be wrapped with white Spiral wrap and the cores of the out ring main cable shall be wrapped with black Spiral wrap .
The numbered or colour coded in core shall be connected to the left most hole of its assigned terminal the corresponding out core shall be connected to the next hole to its right of the same terminal number .
In the core termination box it leaves the right most terminal of the same terminal number empty .
The bunching and tying of cores shall be arranged such that all terminal labelling remains visible allowing individual cores to be conveniently disconnected from any terminal for subsequent maintenance .
Cable Cores .
All cables shall have sufficient slack to enable the completed termination box to be lifted out of the termination Pit and placed on the ground without placing undue strain on the cables .
The surplus cable shall be coiled inside the pit in such a manner that it shall not prevent the support tray from sitting in its correct position or cause the cables to kink .
Slack Cable NOTE All Ring Main cable cores shall be connected in the Termination Pits regardless of the controller type .
However for controllers with lamp conflict monitoring only the cores specified on the Cable Chart shall be connected to the controller Terminals .
To complete the ring main circuit at the Termination Pits the incoming and outgoing terminals shall be bridged using a two pin bridging link e.g Weidmuller QS or similar approved pin Bridging Link .
Where there are three posts per signal group connected in one termination box a pin bridging link e.g Weidmuller QS plug or similar shall be used .
The use of two QS plugs in this situation is not acceptable .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue ..
TERMINATION BOX POST CONNECTIONS .
Post cable entries into the termination box Post Cable a Each post cable shall have metres of slack cable coiled in the bottom of the Termination Pit .
b The post number shall be clearly labelled with Brady Cable Markers or similar approved by the Superintendent around the sheathing close to the entry of the termination box .
c Post cables shall enter core termination boxes from the sides .
d Post cables shall enter core termination boxes from the front .
e Each post cable shall be separately loomed using black Spiral wrap and each core exits the loom separately .
f The post number shall be marked on each core of the post cable close to the terminal using Brady Cable Markers or similar approved by the Superintendent. . Post cable connections in the terminations box a The terminations shall be made according to the cable chart .
b The grey common on all post cables shall be connected for maintenance test purposes even if it is not required for Pedestrian Push Buttons .
c Unused post cable cores shall be kept to a sufficient length for future connection insulated and contained within the same post cable loom .
d There are three terminals for each output in the core termination box and two terminals for each output in the core termination box .
.. CABLE CONNECTIONS .
Annexure B shows typical connections in the terminal box for a core cable ring main system and core post cable .
The core cable ring main system is similar but uses six terminals for each signal group that is two red two yellow and two green .
Terminal Box .
Detector cables are connected in a Loop Pit as detailed in Clauses ..
Detector Cable .. TELECOMMUNICATIONS CABLES .
An insulated drawwire shall be installed in the telecommunications conduit between the terminal box on the side of the controller housing and the Communications Pit .
.. EARTHING .
All posts lanterns transformers and controller shall be earthed as required by AS and EnergySafety Western Australia .
An earth stake for the Main Earth shall be driven through the Earth Pit AS MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue into the soil and connected to the earth bar in the controller .
..
CLEANING OF PITS .
Pits are to have all foreign material removed and be cleaned by vacuum cleaner prior to all tests being completed and accepted by the Superintendent .
. . NOT USED VEHICLE DETECTOR LOOPS .
GENERAL .
Vehicle detector loops shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of the Drawings in the positions indicated .
Loops .
Detector loops are normally set to the Presence mode .
Passage mode will be specified in the controller documentation when required . .
CUTTING OF SLOTS .
The road pavement shall have slots cut to a depth of mm minimum using a single mm wide diamond saw .
The use of two thinner blades to cut the slot is not permitted under any circumstance .
Cutting Loops .
The slots shall be overrun so as to be full depth at all corners .
The corners shall be rounded full depth minimum radius mm so as not to present a sharp edge to the loop cables .
Before cables are placed the slot shall be clean and dried so that no moisture detritus dust and other foreign matter remains in the slot. . A mm grey corrugated conduit shall be installed between the end of the saw cuts in the pavement and the loop pit behind the kerb .
At the point where the loop cables enter the corrugated conduit at road level the surplus room in the conduit shall be plugged with an easily removable filler for future reuse and then sealed over . .
INSTALLATION OF LOOP CABLE .
Cables shall not be placed until the Superintendent has inspected the slot .
HOLD POINT .
Loop cable shall be installed at the bottom of the saw cut so that there are no kinks curls or stretching of the cable .
Care shall be taken not to damage the insulation when placing the cable .
Metal implements such as screwdrivers shall not be used to seat the cable down .
The ends of the loops are brought into a Loop Pit located near the kerb. . A conduit must be installed between the end of the saw cuts in the pavement and the Loop Pit .
Before the loop cables are jointed and before application of sealant to the sawslots the Contractor shall carry out a wiring check .
Wiring Check .
When it has been determined that the loop cable has been Retainers MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue correctly installed the cable shall be retained in the slot at approximately mm spacing and mm from each corner with suitable plastic retainers such as plastic wall plugs .
Each cable end in the Loop Pit shall be labelled with Brady cable markers or approved equivalent cable marker .
The convention in labelling shall be that the loop cable shall be labelled S A for start of loop section A and F A for finish of the same loop .
Similarly S B is the start of loop section B .
The A section of the loop is that section closest to the Stop Line in accordance with drawing . . LOOP SEALING .
SCOTEC or a suitable bitumen emulsion e.g .
THORMAC applied strictly in accordance with manufacturers instructions may be used for loop sealing .
Loop Sealing .
LOOP CABLES AND LOOP FEEDERS .
The loop cables should be cut to length such that they shall be no shorter than mm and no longer than mm above ground level .
The Loop cables shall be twisted in pairs as below inside the loop pit at the rate of about turns per metre . .
Connection of the loop and the loop feeders is as follows Loop Feeder Connection a The finish of section A is connected to the finish of section B. b The start of section A is connected to the white core of the loop feeder .
c The start of section B is connected to black core of the loop feeder . .
Detector loop cables and feeder cables shall be joined using Utilux H Insulated End Crimp connectors crimped using a GS Crimping Tool Model No .
YYT on the Yellow setting .
These joints may be housed in an AMP Catalogue No grease pot connector or individually sealed in Raychem or approved equivalent mm PD caps hot glue heat shrink end caps .
Where PD caps are used a separate heat shrink sleeve shall be installed to seal the end of the Loop Feeder Cable sheathing .
After completing the joints the slack cable shall be coiled and cable tied .
The AMP connector shall be screwed firmly to the wall of the Loop Pit approximately mm from the top or alternatively if the connectors can not be screwed to the pit wall the joints are sealed individually and they shall be cable tied to a plastic conduit mounted mm below the top of the Loop Pit . .
Detector loop feeder cables shall be individually wired back to the controller to enable traffic to be detected in each lane separately .
All feeder cables shall be run in the one mm conduit and cables other than loop feeders shall not be run in the same conduit .
Cables shall be terminated with sufficient length to allow for all necessary connections plus an additional one metre of surplus cable at each end .
The surplus cable shall be neatly coiled in the pit adjacent to the controller and in the Loop pits .
Detector Feeder Cable MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
CONNECTION OF ELECTRICAL SUPPLY .
The Contractor shall make all necessary arrangements with the Local Supply Authority for the electrical inspection and electrical supply connection of the installation .
Application Notices . . NOT USED ABOVE GROUND WORKS .
INSTALLATION OF TRAFFIC SIGNAL POSTS AND MAST ARMS .
Unless otherwise directed by the Superintendent no signal posts shall be erected until all other equipment needed for the completion of the signal installation is available to the Contractor and until the necessary channelization has advanced to a stage where all components can be installed without creating a traffic hazard .
HOLD POINT .
The Contractor shall provide a minimum mm by mm sized level hardstand area around all traffic signal posts and mast arms to allow safe ladder access to the post tops .
Where posts are installed in paved concreted bituminised or other hard finished surfaces these surfaces shall serve the purpose as long as the area is at least the same size as the specified size area .
If the existing paved area is too small or if no type of paving exists the Contractor shall add to it or install the specified size hard stand area using mm x mm x mm concrete slabs and half slabs laid on compacted yellow sand .
Alternatively the Contractor may extend an existing type of finish rather than extend it with concrete slabs .
The Contractor shall leave all ground area around the posts in good condition and to the satisfaction of the Superintendent and the Local Government Authority .
Hardstand to be Provided .
Unless otherwise indicated on the relevant Drawing the post height shall be .m above ground level .
Posts shall be erected so as to be vertical and the orientation shall be such that when pedestrian push buttons are installed they will be as detailed in Clauses ..
The orientation must also suit the slot at the bottom of the post for cable entry .
Traffic Signal Post Height .
Posts shall be installed at a standard distance of m behind the kerb face .
The minimum acceptable clearance for extenuating circumstances is mm .
Prior approval must be gained from the Superintendent before any posts are installed at distances less than m. Posts installed in islands narrower than m shall be centred between the two kerb faces . .
Unless otherwise indicated on the relevant Drawing the mast arm must have a .m clearance from the lowest part of the traffic signal lantern mounted on the mast arm outreach and the top of the roadway directly underneath it .
Mast arms shall be erected so as to be vertical and the orientation shall be such that when pedestrian push buttons are installed they will be as detailed in Clauses ..
The orientation must also suit the slot at the bottom of the post for cable MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue entry .
Each post shall be identified with two sets of post numbers according to the numbering on the Drawing .
The numbers shall be fixed to the primary and the secondary approach positions on each Traffic Signal Post at a height no more than mm below any lantern or no more than mm below the signs in the case where a sign is also fixed to the post and must be easily seen from both approaches .
The numbers shall be made up of mm black letters on a mm x mm background of selfadhesive class yellow retroreflective material as per AS Part Retroreflective Materials .
Prior to installing the numbers the surface of the Traffic Signal Post shall be thoroughly cleaned with methylated spirit or similar .
Numbers to be Attached AS .
When the connections at the top of each traffic signal post are completed the Contractor shall cover the Terminal Block using a clear plastic bag at least microns thick and with at least ten mm breather holes .
The Finial Cap shall be installed with the two clamps and with the arresting wire secured in place .
Post Top Finial cap .
Installation of posts shall be in the soil with a concrete surround as shown on the Standard Drawings .
The concrete surround shall be mm x mm and mm thick .
The concrete surround area shall be installed separate to the rest of paved area .
If the post is installed within a slabbed area the concrete that surrounds the post may be equal to the size and shape of a half slab with a half slab installed adjacent to it .
Concrete shall be added at the peg level to ensure that the post is locked .
Concrete Surround .
The following concrete Mpa ratings shall apply when installing Traffic Signal equipment a Traffic Signal Posts Mpa b Small Pit surrounds and slab fill in sections Mpa c Mast Arms Mpa d Controller Base Mpa e Termination Pit and Double Lid Cable Pit surrounds Mpa f Aerial Supply Pole Mpa .
LANTERN INSTALLATION .
Lanterns shall be installed complete with accessories at the locations designated on the Drawings .
Where designated signal aspects shall be fitted with symbolic masks andor white lenses .
All primary lanterns are to be fitted with short open primary visors and secondary lanterns fitted with secondary or long closed visors in accordance with Standard Drawings .
Lanterns .
Lanterns shall be vertically mounted with red aspects uppermost yellow aspects in the centre and green aspects lowermost .
A maximum of two lanterns may be joined side by side to form a double lantern arrangement consisting of four five or six aspects .
The arrangement of such signal faces shall always comply with AS .
Table .. All coloured symbols such as Arrows Bicycles etc .
must never be mounted alongside an aspect of a different colour but must AS .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue retain the standard orientation for Red Yellow and Green .
Target boards shall be fitted to the requirements of the Drawings. . For LED aspects all individual LEDs must be the same nominal colour for each aspect . .
The top and bottom of each lantern must be firmly attached to the mounting straps which in turn must be firmly attached to the mounting brackets on the designated post .
Each lantern shall be attached to its supports so as to achieve the least obstructed line of sight to the traffic which it controls .
Lantern Attachment .
Lanterns mounted on mast arms shall be mounted on the appropriate lugs provided on the vertical section of the pole to achieve the correct orientation and mounting heights .
Lanterns mounted on the mast arm outreach shall be fixed to the lugs on the vertical section of the outreach .
Lanterns on mast arm outreach .
Lanterns and ancillary attachments shall be mounted a maximum distance back from the kerb alignment .
The minimum clearance from the lantern equipment to kerb face must be mm irrespective of the post location .
Distance from Kerb .
All brackets must be spaced correctly to prevent any stress on the plastic body or section joints of the lantern .
Standard length mounting straps shall be used unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent .
The Contractor shall use where necessary extra lower mounting brackets spacers or offset straps to satisfy this requirement .
Brackets .
LANTERN MOUNTING HEIGHTS .
Signal lanterns shall be mounted at the heights specified on the Standard Drawings unless otherwise specified on the Drawings . .
The following also applies a aspect and aspect lanterns shall be mounted at a height equal to the mounting height of the same colour aspect of an equivalent size aspect lantern .
b aspect bicycle lanterns shall be mounted to the right and at the same height as pedestrian lanterns .
c Lanterns fitted with white lens aspects shall be mounted at the same height as an equivalent size lantern with a green lens aspect in place of the white lens aspect .
d Internally illuminated signs shall be mounted at the height as detailed on the Drawings .
e Traffic signs attached to traffic signals posts shall be mounted at the height as detailed on the Drawings .
f Where indicated on Drawings the Contractor shall make associated arrangements with the owner of the veranda and the Local Government Authority to accommodatemodify the veranda to accommodate the lanterns posts .
g All other traffic signal equipment excluding push buttons shall be mounted such that there is at least .m from MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue the underside of the traffic signal equipment to the final pavement or ground surface at the post or supporting structure .
The mounting heights set out above may be varied with the approval of the Superintendent but there must always be at least .m from the underside of the target board or any other traffic signal item to the final pavement or ground surface at the post .
Where local obstructions preclude mounting of lanterns in the stipulated manner the Contractor shall refer the matter to the Superintendent for a direction. . LANTERN AIMING .
Every vehicle lantern shall be attached to the post so as to enable it to be aimed at a point located at a height of .m above the pavement surface .
The aiming distances from the stop line towards the centre of the approach lanes for stopping and for warning function are as detailed in Table .
and shall be in accordance with ASNZS .
After aiming all aiming bolts shall be securely locked in position .
The upper and lower mounting bracket bolts shall be tightened sufficiently to prevent the lantern from becoming missaligned during heavy winds .
If missalignment can not be prevented through normal means then the Contractor shall install the Locking Mechanism detailed in AS Appendix C. ASNZS AS MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue TABLE .
LANTERN AIMING DISTANCES Approach Speed kmh Metres From Stop Line Primary Lantern Secondary Lantern Stopping Warning m m metres behind Stop Line at centre of approach .
m m metres behind Stop Line at centre of approach .
m m metres behind Stop Line at centre of approach .
m m metres behind Stop Line at centre of approach .
m m metres behind Stop Line at centre of approach. . Every pedestrian lantern shall be attached to the post so as to enable it to be aimed at the centre of the appropriate foot crossing at the opposite side of the roadway. . POST TOP CONNECTIONS .
The core cable shall be run from pit system terminal block in the termination pit or the controller and brought up the interior of the traffic signal post and terminated on the terminal assembly .
The cable shall be firmly supported in such a manner that the weight of the cable shall not impose mechanical strain on the electrical connections .
This cable shall be attached to the terminal rail between the terminal strips and the post with two heavy duty nylon cable ties such that the outer sheathing is above the top of the post but below the lowest terminal .
Cable .
In terminating the cables white Spiral wrap is to be used with two cores being taken through each turn of the Spiral wrap .
Cores are to be cut at approximately mm long to allow for future re terminations .
The numbered cores are to be connected to the corresponding number on the terminal strip starting at number at the top .
The grey core is to be connected to the grey terminal the black neutral to the blue terminal at the bottom of the strip .
All Star and Pit System posttop terminal connections shall be made using Utilux H clear insulating boots and Utilux H crimps. . For standard star and pit system posts the cores shall be loomed to their allocated positions using white spiralwrap .
Each core shall be connected to its matching right side terminal according to its number or colour code .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
For old Post Top Ring Main system and Spur post installations the in cores shall be loomed to their allocated positions up one side of the terminal strip using white spiralwrap and using Utilux H clear insulating boots and the out cores shall be loomed up the other side of the terminal strip to their allocated positions using black spiralwrap and Utilux HA black insulating boots .
The two looms shall be kept separate .
Each core shall be connected to its matching right or left side terminal according to its number or colour code. . Each core shall be left with sufficient slack at the terminal to allow for three reterminations. . TARGET BOARDS .
Target boards shall be fitted where shown on the Drawings in accordance with MRWA standard drawings and the requirements of AS .
In this regard specific attention shall be paid to the requirements of Clause .
of AS as to the gap between the lantern body and the internal edge of the target board .
Cutting .
Where there are lanterns installed with other than three aspects the target boards shall be fitted with matching blanking plates .
These plates are to be pop riveted in place using aluminium pop rivets. . Target boards shall be installed flush with the front of the lantern and a minimum clearance of m below any target board shall apply .
Minimum clearance from target Board .
PEDESTRIAN PUSHBUTTON ASSEMBLIES .
The Pedestrian pushbutton assembly shall be attached to the traffic signal posts and mast arms using the predrilled holes provided in the post or by drilling and tapping new holes in an existing post such that the height of the push button places the centre of the button mm above ground level .
Pedestrian Push Button Height .
The Contractor shall orientate the arrow disc on pedestrian pushbutton assemblies to point in the direction of pedestrian travel .
In the case of pushbutton assemblies on median island posts the Contractor shall replace the standard supplied singleheaded arrow disc with a special supply twoheaded arrow disc as indicated on the Drawings .
Orientation .
On each post on which a pedestrian pushbutton is installed selfadhesive labels shall be affixed in the manner shown on the Standard Drawings .
Before fixing the labels to the post the surface shall be thoroughly cleaned with methylated spirit or similar .
SelfAdhesive Labels .
When parallel walks with time delay protection are installed new or upgraded sites MRGT Turning Vehicles Give Way to Pedestrians signs are to be installed as primary displays on posts nearest to the left or right turn movement where the rule applies .
Signs to be removed after three months .
Give Way to Pedestrians Signs .
AUDIOTACTILE FACILITIES .
Where indicated on the Drawing the Contractor shall Equipment MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue install audiotactile facilities . .
The Audio Tactile Driver Unit shall be mounted to the same post as the Pedestrian PushButton that it is driving in the area between the upper and lower mounting brackets .
The access door shall face away from the road and not be obstructed by any other hardware .
The Audio Tactile Unit lead shall enter the post top terminal assembly excess lead shall be removed prior to connection .
The conduit shall be clamped at the upper mounting bracket and cable tied at mm spacings on the post .
The two core cable white figure flex shall be taken down the inside of the signal post and connected directly to the transducer in the audio tactile pushbutton assembly .
The remaining cable cores from the AudioTactile DriverUnit shall be connected to the post top terminal rail .
For electrical connections refer to the Drawing .
Installation .
Where type short push button posts are used for Audio Tactile Push Buttons the white and blue cores of the PPB post cable shall be connected directly into the Audio Tactile Driver Unit in place of the white figure flex .
The standard core allocation shall be as follows a Red Pedestrian Push Button Active b Black Pedestrian Push Button Return c White Audio Tactile Transducer d Blue Audio Tactile Transducer e GreenYellow Earth The supply cable and flexible conduit from Audio Tactile Driver Unit shall enter the post top terminal assembly and excess cable and conduit shall be removed prior to connection .
The flexible conduit shall be clamped at the upper mounting bracket and cable tied to the post at mm spacing along the post .
The white and blue cores of the type post cable shall be connected into the Audio Tactile Driver Unit in place of the flex via the terminations in the assigned pit for the type post and via the post cable for the separate post with the relevant Audio Tactile Driver Unit .
The supply cable from the Audio Tactile Driver Unit shall be connected to the Post Top Terminal Rail using the appropriate terminals .
For electrical connections refer to the Drawings. . Where an AudioTactile Push Button assembly is installed on a type or type post the twocore audible signal cable white figure flex shall be run down the inside of the post and connected directly to the transducer in the AudioTactile Push Button assembly. . An Induce Voltage Suppressor IVS shall be installed on PSC Controllers where LED lanterns are used in conjunction with audiotactile facilities .
IVS .
EARTH CONNECTIONS . .
The Earth wire from the core cable shall be directly connected to the Upper Mounting Bracket Earth Stud .
Earth Wire .
A second Earth wire from the Upper Mounting Bracket MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue Earth Stud shall be connected to the body of the post. . A third Earth wire from the Upper Mounting Bracket Earth Stud shall be connected to the Earth Terminal on the core Post Top Terminal Rail . .
The Earth wires from all post mounted electrical attachments such as Lanterns Pedestrian Push Buttons Audio Tactile Driver Units and Flashing No Right Turn signs shall be connected into individual entries of the Earth Terminal on the core Post Top Terminal Rail .
Pedestrian Push Buttons .
LANTERN CONNECTIONS .
The lantern cables shall be connected to the terminal strip fitted to the top of the post as shown on the cable chart .
The cables have been precut fitted with lugs and installed in flexible conduit .
The flexible conduit is to form a loop below the entry point into the lantern .
The flexible conduit is clamped firmly in place by the cable clamp provided ensuring that mm of the end of the conduit is covered by the finial cap .
No part of any flexible exposed conduit shall be less than .m above pavement level .
When installing Audio tactile Driver units cables ties shall be used to tie the flexible conduits .
The cable not enclosed by the flexible conduit is to be plaited and any excess cable shall be neatly pushed into the post .
Flexible Conduit .
COVERING OF LANTERNS .
Immediately after the signal lanterns and those for Advanced Flashing Signals AWFS are installed and until the signals are commissioned the Contractor shall fit lantern covers on all lanterns neatly attached and securely tied to ensure that they remain in position under all weather conditions .
The entire AWFS sign shall be covered The covers shall be made from a material complying with AS and shall be black colour in accordance with AS .
Covers AS AS .
SIGNALS NOT IN USE signs bolted on the primary and secondary post of each signal display if left unattended .
The signs shall be Main Roads sign number MRTP as detailed on MRWA standard drawing .
Not in Use Signal Sign .
Upgrades and traffic signal improvements at existing Signalised intersections Existing sites .
Any modification to existing traffic signals shall comply with the requirements of this specifications and Main Roads improvements program for signalised intersection .
Details could be sought from Main Roads Asset Manager Traffic Systems Electrical .
This applies to Traffic signal controllers UPS and Finial Caps .
Modificati on and improvem ent works . . NOT USED MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue INSTALLATION OF CONTROLLER .
CONTROLLER PREPARATION .
Controller Decals Each of three sides of the Controller which most face that roadway shall be fitted with a standard controller decal each with the site number and the freecall fault reporting phone number . .
Pit System Controller Terminal A controller pit terminal assembly Weidmuller part no .
A shall be installed in the vacant D rail position when required .
A loom shall be made and installed to provide connections to this block and shall be fed from the relevant controller field terminals .
The connections shall be made in accordance with the controller wiring chart. . Star System Controller Terminal A controller pit terminal assembly Weidmuller part no .
A shall be installed in the vacant E rail position when required .
A loom shall be made and installed to provide connections to this block and shall be fed from the relevant controller field terminals .
The connections shall be made in accordance with the controller wiring chart. . Earthing Extra earthing over and above the manufacturers earthing shall be supplied as follows a Convert the common Link terminal for cable screens on the Loop Feeder Board into an Earth Terminal by wiring a mm Earth wire between the Link terminal and the chassis Earth Stud below the switchboard .
b Install an MEN Link in mm Earth wire between the bottom terminal of the Neutral Link and the bottom terminal of the Earth link .
One end of this link must be left disconnected during workshop tests to prevent false tripping of the In House Safety Switch .
The Contractor shall be responsible to reconnect the MEN Link and to remove the manufacturers MEN link not fitted tag from the Controller Switchboard panel .
c Rearrange if necessary the existing Earth wires in the Earth link to leave the second and third entries vacant .
The second entry is for the Main Earth wire and the third entry for the Aerial P.O.A Supply Post Earth wire . .
Controller Test The prepared controller complete with all the necessary software and hardware shall be thoroughly tested prior to commissioning .
All inputs outputs conflict matrix time settings detector functions and program operations shall be tested .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
Controller Documentation The prepared controller documentation shall be placed in the document pocket provided in the controller housing inside a clear plastic document holder complete with clear plastic inserts and each page of the documentation visible through the insert without taking it out of the insert. . Antigraffiti Coating An antigraffiti coating shall be applied to the controller housing in accordance with Specification ANTIGRAFFITI . .
CONTROLLER .. GENERAL .
Groundmounted controllers shall be installed on the concrete footing .
The Contractor shall make sure that the controller is mounted level so that the door sits square in the frame .
The details of anchor bolts for the controller footing are shown on MRWA standard drawings .
Footing .
The Consumers Mains shall be brought directly into the controller base pit and sleeved with corrugated plastic conduit from the base entry to the cable support bar .
The Main Earth shall be brought directly into the controller base pit and sleeved with corrugated plastic conduit from the base entry to the cable support bar .
Install x mm conduit for Telstra or approved communication carrier and x mm white communications conduit for Fibre .
All conduits shall pass through the controller concrete base and directly to a communications pit in the controller apron .
The conduit shall include a draw wire from the communications pit to the communication access box in the side of the controller housing .
All other cables shall pass through the double lid cable pit in front of the controller minimum x mm conduits or equivalent .
metres of neatly coiled slack for each cable shall be provided in the double lid pit .
The cables shall then enter the controller base and run to the cable support bar .
Cable Entries .
All cables shall be supported by the cable clamp bar using large crosstied cable ties over the double insulation .
The controller manufacturers metal clamping arrangement shall not be used to clamp the cable but may be used to form a support by releasing one of the anchoring points and swinging the bar down .
The Ring Main the Consumer Mains the Post Cables and the Main Earth conduit shall be fixed to the controller cable clamp bar below the field terminal rails .
The Loop Feeder Cables shall be fixed to the Loop Termination Panel Cable Clamp .
Cable Clamping .
The Post cables shall have their respective post numbers indelibly marked on the sheathing immediately below the cable clamp bar .
Loop Feeder cables shall have their respective loop numbers marked with Brady cable markers on the sheathing immediately below the cable clamp bar .
Cable Labelling MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
The consumer mains active shall be connected to the Mains Fuse .
The consumer mains neutral shall be connected to the main neutral link behind the controller switchboard panel .
The mains earth shall be connected to the earth link behind the controller switchboard panel .
The M.E.N .
connection shall be in mm earth wire and shall be connected directly between the earth link and the neutral link behind the controller switchboard panel . .
The orientation of controllers base shall be such that the back of the controller when mounted is facing the intersection .
Orientation of Controller housing .
.. STAR SYSTEM SITE CONTROLLER .
All Core cables shall be enclosed in the cable duct between terminal strips and shall be formed into separate looms .
Each individual cable shall connect direct from the cable duct to the terminal block .
The individual cores shall be neatly formed with a loop of sufficient length to make three reterminations .
All cores shall be tied and positioned such that access to the terminals is not obstructed and terminal designations are not obscured .
Individual cores sized .mm or less shall be fitted with bootlace crimps and cores mm and above may be terminated without lugs but with cores twisted .
All spare cores shall be wrapped in the appropriate branch of the loom and taken past the top of the terminal strip insulated and firmly fixed to prevent movement .
Each core shall be labelled with its own post number at the entry point to its designated terminal .
Cable Connections .
When a star system site includes a dummy controller it shall be connected by a minimum of core cable to the controller .
The standard branching for cable looms at the Controller is as follows Cable Cores Branch Location to left of A Block to left of B Block to left of C Block to left of D Block Each core shall be labelled with its corresponding signal group at the dummy controller end at its designated terminal . .
The Loop Feeder cable screens shall be separated from their cables and suitably connected to the Earth Link on the Loop Termination Panel .
The earth link shall be connected to main earth to comply with ASNZS .
Each pair of Loop Feeder cores shall be twisted together for their entire length then formed in a cable tied loom with the others .
Each twisted pair shall be numbered according to its loop number immediately before the termination point using Brady or Cabac cable markers on each core .
Sufficient slack shall be left at the termination point to allow for three reterminations with bootlace crimps used .
Loop Feeder Cable .
The combined loop and feeder insulation resistance at the Controller has to be greater than M Ohm measures at a MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue V setting .
..
PIT SYSTEM SITE CONTROLLER .
The ring main cables shall be located in between terminal strips and shall be formed into separate looms .
The in cable using white spiralwrap and the out cable using black spiral wrap .
The individual cores shall be neatly formed with a loop of sufficient length to make three reterminations .
All cores shall be tied and positioned such that access to the terminals is not obstructed and terminal designations are not obscured .
Individual cores sized .mm or less shall be fitted with bootlace crimps and cores mm and above may be terminated without lugs but with cores twisted .
All spare cores shall be wrapped in the appropriate branch of the loom and taken past the top of the terminal strip insulated and firmly fixed to prevent movement . .
The standard branching for ring main cable looms at the Controller is as follows Cable Cores Branch Location to left of A Block to left of B Block to left of C Block to left of D Block .
The post cable connections in the controller shall be located between the C block and the Pit System terminal strip .
The cable cores shall be loomed in black spiralwrap and shall be run between the terminal strip and the C block .
The cable cores shall be connected to the Pit System terminal strip located in the vacant D terminal position and shall be connected to terminals specified in the cable chart .
Each core shall be labelled with its own post number at the entry point to its designated terminal .
Post Cable .
The Loop Feeder cable screens shall be separated from their cables and suitably connected to the Earth Link on the Loop Termination Panel .
Each pair of Loop Feeder cores shall be twisted together for their entire length then formed in a cable tied loom with the others .
Each twisted pair shall be numbered according to its loop number immediately before the termination point using Brady or cable markers on each core .
Sufficient slack shall be left at the termination point to allow for three reterminations with bootlace crimps used .
Loop Feeder Cable .
TEMPORARY SINAGE Removal timeframe shall be consulted with the project team . .

GENERAL All works carried out at signalised intersections whether new or improvement works shall be inspected and tested to the following minimum requirements specified under Clause .. ..
CONTRACTORS TESTS TO ACHEIVE PRACTICAL COMPLETION .
The Contractor shall carry out all such inspections and electrical tests as are necessary to ensure that the installation complies fully with the requirements of the Contract and Western Australian Electrical requirements and ASNZS .
The results from all inspections and tests shall be forwarded to MRWA Project Manager and MRWA Lead Point of Delegate .
The Contractor shall carry out the following inspections and tests producing documentary evidence of the test results Insulation Check a Check that all hardware is positioned according to the Drawings .
b Measure and record the mains voltage at the controller main switch .
c Measure and record at the controller the insulation MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue resistance of each loop whilst disconnected from the logic module .
d Measure and record at the controller the inductance of each loop .
e Check operation of all pedestrian push buttons from the controller .
Check that the orientation of the pedestrian pushbutton arrows is correct .
f Check that all lantern aiming complies with all applicable drawings .
g Check that all signals visors louvres arrow masks and other symbolic masks comply with the Drawing .
h Check that all signal displays operate according to the Drawing during maintenance mode flash testing .
i Check that the controller and associated circuitry operates according to the specified controller documentation .
j Check that all signal displays and other facilities operate correctly .
k Check that all vehicle detectors and pedestrian push buttons function according to the Drawing .
l Annexures A and B to be completed and signed off for all construction stages m As far as practicable ensure that the site has been left in a clean and tidy condition . .
In accordance with ASNZS Section the following mandatory tests shall be made documented and made available to MRWA upon hand over a Continuity of the earthing system earth resistance .
Each traffic signal post shall be measured from the earth connection at the MEN to the bare metal of each post .
b Insulation resistance between all live conductors and earth .
c Polarity .
d Correct Circuit connections .
e Verification of earth fault loop impedence .
f Correct operation of RCDs. . All control circuits and devices shall be functionally checked to verify correct operation .
Any part of the installation found to be nonconforming shall be replaced with new materials andor components or corrected to the satisfaction of the MRWA Lead Point of Delegate and MRWA Project Manager the faulty cable sections replaced and retested to confirm that acceptable insulation resistance values have been attained .
MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue .
Prior to the Power Supply Authoritys approval of the installation and connection to the supply mains the Contractor shall have completed all tests to the MRWA Lead Point of Delegate satisfaction .
On completion of the Contractors own testing and inspection and rectification of any deficiencies found the Contractor shall inform the MRWA Lead Point of Delegate that the supply has been connected and that the installation is ready for tests on practical completion as nominated by the MRWA Electrical representative and submit all documents to MRWA Project Manager .
HOLD POINT ..
INSPECTION AND TESTS ON Final COMPLETION .
The Contractor shall give at least three working days notice that the site is ready for final inspection and shall be present during the inspection .
Any change can be agreed upon in consultation with superintendent . .
Upon receipt of Annexure C Commissioning Checklist from the Contractor the MRWA Lead Point of Delegate will carry out an inspection of the final installation .
The inspection will include the following Superintendents Inspection a The layout of signal hardware is in accordance with the Design and Standard Drawings b The operation of circuitry in the manner prescribed c Verification of correct operation of all signal displays push buttons detectors and other facilities .
dAlignment and aiming of lanterns e Check all signage exist on site and aligns with the LMB drawing f All Line markings have been completed and aligns with the LMB drawing g All as Constructed Drawings and Inventory is completed and is available on site h Any other inspection as identified by the MRWA Lead Point of Delegate .. ASSET HANDOVER CHECKLIST a Backfilling and Reinstatement excavated areas b Concreting .
c Site cleanliness d Lay out signal hardware is in accordance with the design and standard drawings e Check all signage has been completed and align with the onsite Drawings f Any other inspection as identified by the Superintendent or MRWA Lead Point of Delegate or MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification Traffic Signals Page of Contract xxxxx Document Issue Project Manager .. TRAFFIC SIGNAL SITE INVENTORY .
The Contractor shall make a complete inventory of all site equipment at the conclusion of works in order to record any change to the type or quantity of equipment installed .
A copy of the approved inventory sheet shall be left on site in the controller cabinet when the site is commissioned .
The original document shall be forwarded to the MRWA Lead Point of Delegate within seven days of commissioning .
..
STAGED WORKS DURING TRAFFIC SIGNAL UPGRADES .
It is a requirement prior to commencing any traffic signal upgrades for the electrical contractor to contact Traffic Systems Staff at the Traffic Operations Centre to advise when work will be commencing on site and the duration of works. . All staged works forming part of an upgrade to traffic signals will require the following I .
The electrical contractor must provide a Traffic Management Plan with associated drawings indicating all stages of the works these plans must be endorsed by a Roadworks Traffic Manager as per the requirements of Traffic Management for Works on Roads Code of Practice .
II .
The approved plans shall be forwarded to the Local Government Authority for their records and a copy of the plans shall be forwarded to Main Roads three weeks prior to the works commencing .
III .
At the completion of all works on commissioned traffic signals the electrical contractor is required to complete a controller log book entry indicating the activities completed and the conformance to the relevant Traffic Management Plan at the end of each days work .

A copy of the installation records inventory and the As Constructed Drawings prepared shall be placed in the controller housing .

SCOPE .
This Specification primarily covers the requirements for new Traffic Signal Software. . Where modifications to existing Traffic Signals are proposed then the scope Clause .
will need careful editing to clearly outline the extent of the Works . .
This Specification is not suitable for Traffic Signals Installations undertaken by Westrail. . TRAFFIC SIGNAL CONTRACTS .
