Not Used ANNEXURE A DATA SHEET ANNEXURE B UPS ARRANGEMENT SINGLE LINE DIAGRAM MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue SPECIFICATION UNINTERRUPTABLE POWER SUPPLY FOR TRAFFIC SIGNALS GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the supply and delivery of an uninterruptible power system UPS with battery backup capability designed for power supply to traffic signal lights and its control panel. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Acts and Regulations Title of Act Regulation etc .
Occupational Safety and Health Act Australian Standards ASNZS Electrical Installation ASNZS Electric Cables Polymeric Insulated for Working Voltages up to and Including .kV ASNZS Electromagnetic Compatibility EMC Limits ASNZS Lowvoltage Switchgear and Control Gear Assemblies Type Tested and Partially Type Tested Assemblies AS The Control of Undesirable Static Electricity AS Conductors in Insulated Electric Cables and Flexible Cords AS Lightning Protection AS Electroplated Coatings on Threaded Components AS Installation Maintenance Testing and Replacement of Secondary Batteries in Buildings AS Colour Standards for General Purposes AS Approval and Test Specification Miniature Over current Circuit Breakers AS Stationary Batteries Leadacid AS Battery Chargers for Stationary Batteries AS Semi Conductor Converters AS Low Voltage Fuses MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue AS Degrees of Protection provided by Enclosures for Electrical Equipment IP Code AS .. Uninterruptible power systems UPS General and safety requirements for UPS used in operator access areas AS .. Uninterruptible power systems UPS General and safety requirements for UPS used in restricted access locations AS .
Uninterruptible power systems UPS Electromagnetic compatibility EMC requirements AS .
Uninterruptible power systems UPS Method of specifying the performance and test requirements Other Standards Office of Energy WA Electrical Requirements RTATC SCATS Communications Reference Manual MAIN ROADS Standards MRWA Traffic Management requirements for Works on Roads MRWA Electrical Infrastructure Asset Drawing Guidelines Part General Part Traffic Control Signals Traffic Management for Works on Roads Code of Practice MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification Occupational Health and Safety Specification Environment Specification Quality Specification ANTIGRAFFITI Examples of previous solutions used by MRWA MRWA Standard drawing numbers .
ELECTRICITY REGULATIONS AND AUTHORITIES .
The works shall be carried out in accordance with the Office of Energy WA Electrical Requirements ASNZS AustraliaNew Zealand Wiring Rules the requirement of Western Power Synergy Horizon or any other authority having jurisdiction over the installation Power Supply Authority .
Electricity Act .
All notices and application required by the Power Supply Authority shall be submitted and any required fees paid Notices .
The power supply is as detailed on the datasheet attached .
All equipment shall be designed to operate at the correct voltages prior to installation .
All equipment shall be suitable for the maximum prospective short circuit current specified on the datasheet and confirmed for the specific application at the point of installation .
Power Supply MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue .
UPS GENERAL REQUIREMENT .
Engineering design supply manufacture testing and delivery of a UPS system rated in accordance with the data sheet in Annexure A and in compliance to the environmental and site meteorological data set out in the data sheet .
General Requirement .
Automatic Voltage Regulated Power to the load shall be maintained while losing input power and its return within specifications or until the batteries have been discharged to the level specified in datasheet .
A reliable UPS arrangement shall be provided to ensure correct operation in all modes as specified in Clause .
below .
Continuity of Supply .
The complete UPS system shall be enclosed inside a naturally ventilated outdoor cabinet as specified in the datasheet and in Clause .
below .
Enclosure .
The UPS module shall be rack mounted and the protection control and alarm circuitry shall be wired on a chassis below the UPS module .
Circuit breakers control switches and indication shall be laid out on a control panel providing ease of operation and fault finding .
The batteries shall be housed on telescopic rail mounted drawers providing ease of maintenance and replacement .
General layout .
The supplier shall provide detailed cabinet general arrangement and internal layout drawings as well as schematic and wiring diagrams for review before commencement of fabrication and assembly of the UPS system .
Design drawings .
The UPS circuit shall be designed and equipped with all necessary internal circuits protection and alarm outputs as well as manual transfer and bypass control switches .
Circuit .
The UPS shall be equipped with RSRS and Ethernet communication capabilities for programming access and remote monitoring of operation diagnostics and event recorder data .
Communication capability .
OPERATION MODES Refer to the proposed UPS arrangement single line diagram in Annexure B .
Single line diagram .. NORMAL .
The UPS shall continuously supply Automatic Voltage Regulated power within the voltage frequency and harmonic distortion limits specified in the data sheet in Annexure A to the traffic signal controller and all supplied loads .
Continuous power .
The charger unit shall supply temperature compensated DC power to batteries .
It shall maintain the batteries in a fully charged state while the input supply is within specified range .
Normal Operation MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue ..
INPUT POWER FAILURE .
Upon failure of incoming mains and with generator power not connected the UPS shall switch automatically over to battery power and when mains return the UPS shall switch automatically back to mains .
There shall be no perceptible interruption to the loads upon failure or restoration of the input AC power source Input Failure .
The UPS shall have the facility for connection of a portable generator to supply power to the UPS during extended mains outage .
With the UPS operating from generator power and on return of mains power the UPS shall switch automatically over to mains .
Generator backup supply .. RECHARGE .
Upon restoration of the input AC power source the UPS shall automatically return back to its normal operation specified in Clause The UPS shall have the facility to set a time delay before returning to normal operation upon restoration of input power supply .
Time Delay Return .
If the batteries were discharged to the DC cutoff point before input source restoration the UPS shall automatically restart to normal operation including recharging the batteries .
DC cutoff ..
MAINTENANCE BYPASS MODE .
If the batteries or UPS are to be taken out of service for maintenance the UPS shall be manually switched to the Standby input and then a makebeforebreak transfer switching by closing the Maintenance bypass switch and opening the Standby Input switch .
Manual switch over .
With the load supplied via the maintenance bypass it shall enable removal and replacement of the UPS without shutting down the traffic control system i.e .
hot swap capability .
Hot Swap . . NOT USED MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
MAIN UPS COMPONENTS .
Surge diverters The UPS shall be protected from power surges introduced either from the input power grid supply or from the load circuits connected to the output of the UPS .
Surge and lightning protection .
ChargerRectifier The charger shall rectify the input AC power to a regulated DC wave form to provide the charging power for discharged batteries .
The chargerrectifier shall be rated in accordance to the specification in the data sheet attached .
The manufacturer shall provide comments on the data sheet indicating conformance to the specified values or propose alternative data for evaluation .
Charger Rectifier .
Inverter Upon losing Input AC power the inverter shall supply the needed AC power of the loads by converting DC power from the batteries .
The inverter shall be rated in accordance to the specification in the data sheet attached .
The manufacturer shall provide comments on the data sheet indicating conformance to the specified values or propose alternative data for evaluation .
Inverter .
Generator input The generator supply kit shall enable the connection of an external power generator comprising position switch IP MainsOffGenerator with LED indicators Appliance inlet flat pins Amp IP V Hz grey .
The appliance inlet shall be mounted inside a separate compartment on the side of the cabinet accessible without opening the cabinet door and provided with a dedicated lockablehinged cover .
Generator Connection .
Display The UPS shall include a front panel screen and navigation pushbuttons to show real time measurement of various parameters and also status of the system as specified in more detail in Clause ..
Display Screen .
BATTERY PACKAGE .
The battery strings shall be comprised of extreme temperature withstand rechargeable maintenance free type batteries .
The batteries shall be rated in accordance to the specification in the data sheet attached .
The manufacturer shall provide requested data for its proposed batteries and comments on the data sheet indicating conformance to the specified values or propose alternative data for evaluation .
The batteries shall be arranged on withdrawable racks inside the UPS cabinet and designed to facilitate replacement of a faulty battery without disturbing the remaining batteries in the battery bank .
Batteries MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue .
ENCLOSURE CABINET ..
LAYOUT .
The arrangement and layout of all equipment shall provide adequate and safe means of access and working space for installation and maintenance purposes .
Access .
All equipment shall be installed such that removal replacement or repair of each and every component may be carried out with standard electrical trade tools .
Standard Tools .
Particular attention shall be given to the location and clearance of handles levers switches etc .
in respect to the safety of personnel operating the equipment .
Location Clearance .
To allow for ease of maintenance in darkness a fluorescent lead light shall be installed in the cabinet .
The light shall be switched on via a limit switch when the door is opened .
The light shall adequately illuminate all internal components .
Alternative lighting arrangements would be subject to approval .
The lighting shall be RCD protected .
Lead Light .
Minimum off general purpose outlets supplied from the mains input power shall be mounted inside the cabinet for use of maintenance tools and test equipment on site .
The GOPs shall be RCD protected .
GPO .. MATERIAL AND STRUCTURE .
The enclosure structure and mounting shall generally be in accordance with AS clauses and .
Note that clauses .. .. and .. are not applicable . .
The door shall be secured in the closed position by two triangular headed bolts which shall fit the key shown on Main Roads Drawing .
The head of these bolts shall be fully recessed into the door .
. . NOT USED DESIGN CONSIDERATION .
PROTECTION .
Overcurrent and short circuit protection shall be provided to the UPS system by input and output circuit breakers suitably rated .
Main Circuit Breakers .
The UPS system shall be protected against lightning and have surge suppression in accordance to AS requirements .
Lightning .
The Battery banks strings shall be protected with circuit breakers suitably rated for use in DC applications .
Battery Circuit Breaker MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue .
The batteries shall be protected against over charging by a dedicated temperature sensor to provide the battery temperature feedback for UPS .
Temperature Sensor .
METERING AND STATUS MONITORING .
The UPS shall include a front panel screen to show real time measurement of various parameters and also status of the system .
As the minimum it shall cover Display Measurement a The Input AC parameters including Voltage Frequency Current Power .
b The Inverter OutputLoad AC parameters including Voltage Frequency Current Power .
c The Battery parameters including Voltage Current CapacityCharging Level . .
The operation status of the UPS shall be indicated on the front panel either on the screen or with LED indicators .
As a minimum they shall cover Display Status a InputBypass power availability b ChargerInverter units operational c Battery power is available d Batteries on boost charge e UPS in maintenance mode f Internal fault .
The LEDLCD indications shall be clearly visible and readable at all times .
LEDLCD display .
The UPS shall be capable of providing the above mentioned measurementparameter and operation status to remote control and monitoring system via the Ethernet communication .
Remote indication .
ALARMS INDICATIONS AND CONTROLS .
As a minimum the following alarm conditions shall initiate an audible alarm single failure output and be displayed on UPS front panel screenindication lights Display Alarm a Overload b Over temperature c Inverter not Synchronised d Battery Circuit is open e Charger Off or Failed f Maintenance mode g Load on Batteries h Main Input Failure MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue i Loads on Bypass j Battery capacity below k Low Battery l Emergency Shutdown .
Alarm and warning indications shall automatically reset when condition returns to normal .
Alarm Reset .
The UPS shall be capable of providing the above mentioned alarms to remote control and monitoring system via the Ethernet communication .
Communicating Alarms .
The following control switches shall be available on the UPS front panel Control Switch a Alarm ResetSilence shall cancel an audible alarm but leave actuated alarm indications illuminated until rectified b Inverter ONOFF switch .
c The transfer control switch for manual source selection and switching. . EARTHING .
A dedicated xmm copper earth bar with minimum length of mm shall be installed in the cabinet located close to the gland plate and all earth wires shall be terminated to this earth bar .
Each hole shall have two fixing screws .
Earthing .
The earth bar shall have suitable provision for the installation of the MEN link .
All non current carrying conducting parts like doors battery trays etc .
shall be connected to earth bar . .
PROGRAMMABLE CONTACTS .
The UPS shall include a set of programmable voltfree changeover contacts to be wired to a terminal block in order to assign different alarms as required for remote monitoring and future controls .
The contacts shall be rated VDC or VAC A for continuous loads .
Output Contacts .
As the minimum requirement they shall cover a UPS On b Battery below charge c Low battery d Any cabinet door open .
WIRING AND TERMINATION .
All conductors shall comply with ASNZS requirements .
Cables Material .
Wiring for control protection metering alarm and indication shall be not be less than mm strand copper conductors Control Cables MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue .
Cable sizes for power circuits shall comply with the ratings specified in AS .
Cable Size .
Where more than one item is connected to a common feed such as fuses or circuit breakers the minimum conductor size of the common feed shall match the arithmetic sum of the connecting equipment full current rating capacities .
Common Feed .
The insulation and colour coding of wires shall be as follows Colour Coding a Coloured grey for voltages below V AC .
b Coloured red white or blue for active phase .
c Coloured black for all neutrals .
d Coloured greenyellow for earth wiring .
e Any colour not previously allocated for DC voltages. . All wiring shall be terminated by crimp type terminal lugs fitted by the lug manufacturers recommended crimping tool .
spare terminal space shall be considered for possible future modifications .
Termination .
Numbered ferrules corresponding to wiring diagram numbering shall be fitted to each end of all wires .
They shall be weatherproof and not be affected by damp or corrosion and shall be clearly and permanently marked .
Cable Numbering .
All insulated wiring within the cubicle shall be run in horizontal and vertical lines .
Each group of wiring shall be strapped in neat bundles with nylon cable ties or plastic wire trunking .
Wiring Runs .
Wiring shall comply with the following Wiring Rules a No joins between terminal blocks .
b No tee off branches between terminal blocks .
c Only one wire per terminal .
If there is a requirement for more than one jumper pins shall be used .
d Pin crimped terminations shall be used for tunnel type terminal blocks .
e Wiring or cable larger than mm shall be terminated with appropriately sized terminal lugs using a hydraulic crimper. . All D.C. service wiring shall use tinned stranded copper conductors. . NAME PLATES AND LABELS .
All equipment labels shall be manufactured from white blackwhite Traffolite with engraved black letters on a white background or redwhitered with white letters on a red background .
Alternatively metal photo type labels shall be used with black print on photographic anodised aluminium substrate .
Letters MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue .
All equipment labels shall be firmly fixed using suitable non ferrous rivets or threaded fasteners self tapping screws are not suitable. . As far as practicable all labels shall be of the same overall dimensions with identical mounting holes .
The minimum size of letters shall be .mm upper case .
Sizes .
All final subcircuit circuit breakersfuses shall be labelled with IPA coloured and numbered markers .
Labelling The cabinet number shall be clearly shown on the outside of the door of each cabinet .
The main cabinet number shall be made up of mm black characters on a mm x mm background of adhesive class yellow retroreflective materials as per ASNZS Part .
A further label of the same material consisting of lines of mm black characters shall be placed mm below the switchboard number .
Line shall read and line MAIN ROADS WA .
Numbers .
NOISE LEVEL .
Noise levels of the assembly under normal operation shall be within limits set in the National Standard for Occupational Noise NOHSC and shall not exceed an eighthour equivalent continuous Aweighted sound pressure level LAeqh of dBA .
The LAeq h is to be determined in accordance with ASNZS .. .
INSPECTION AND TESTING .
Factory testing of the UPS system shall be performed in accordance with ASNZS .
which details the testing requirements for UPS units to make sure achievement of the kW and kVAr and load steps necessary to demonstrate and verify the designated steady state and transient frequency and voltage responses. . MRWA reserves the right to examine the equipment at any time during manufacturing or use the services of a third party inspection service. . A site acceptance test shall be witnessed that shall prove the correct functioning of all indicators and alarms minimum four hour UPS site support without mains supply available and main functional requirements .
A SAT procedure shall be provided for MRWA review and approval at least four weeks prior to UPS commissioning. . All test reports shall accompany the equipment at time of delivery .
Maintenance and Operation Manuals shall be provided as two hard copy and one pdf soft copy containing .
All main component data sheets .
UPS unit manufacturer maintenance and operation manual .
Wiring Diagrams .
Recommended maintenance schedule MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue . . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS .
AS BUILT DRAWINGS .
The test results shall be recorded and all test reports shall be included in the design drawings .
Test Result .
As Built drawings shall comply with Main Roads As Constructed Drawings presentation requirements. . As Built drawings shall be signed certifying that the drawings accurately depicted the installations .
Certify As Built .
As Built drawings shall be submitted at the latest two weeks after goods delivery .
As Built Submission . . NOT USED CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS . . SCOPE .
This Specification primarily covers the requirements for new Uninterruptible Power Supplies at existing traffic signals . .
This Specification is not suitable for Traffic Signals Installations undertaken by Westrail TRAFFIC SIGNAL CONTRACTS .
Where this specification is used in a contract that is solely or predominantly for the installation of traffic signals inclusion of and crossreferencing to other relevant specifications is likely to be required such as Specification GENERAL REQUIREMENTS Specification EARTHWORKS Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS Specification ANTIGRAFFITI MAIN ROADS Western Australia Specification UPS for Traffic Signals Page of Contract XXXXX Document Issue SPECIFICATION AMENDMENT CHECKLIST Specification No Revision Date _________Title UPS for TRAFFIC SIGNALS Project Manager Name ______________Signature _____________Date________ Checked By Name _______________Signature____________ Date ________ Contract No _______Contract Description __________________________________ ITEM DESCRIPTION SIGN OFF Note All changesamendments must be shown in Tracked Change mode until approved. . NOT USED ANNEXURE A Construction Staging Specification Excavation Backfill for Structures Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name SPECIFICATION EXCAVATION BACKFILL FOR STRUCTURES GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work to be executed under this specification covers general earthworks associated with bridgeworks and highway structures including road and pedestrian bridges underpasses noise walls and standalone retaining walls .
This includes all earthworks required for the construction of abutment and pier and retaining walls and for the approach embankments all as detailed on the Drawings. . Earthworks for roadworks are covered under Specification EARTHWORKS. . Backfill for Mechanically Stabilised Earth Walls is covered under Specification MECHANICALLY STABILISED EARTH WALLS. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Methods of Testing Soils for Engineering Purposes Soil Strength and Consolidation Tests Determination of the Penetration Resistance of a Soil with a Perth Sand Penetrometer Test .
MAIN ROADS Test Methods WA .
Particle Size Distribution Sieving and decantation Method .
MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification GENERAL REQUIREMENTS Specification ENVIRONMENT Specification CLEARING Specification EARTHWORKS Specification MECHANICALLY STABILISED EARTH WALLS Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS Specification Excavation Backfill for Structures Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS . . NOT USED OPERATIONS .
CLEARING .
Clearing shall be undertaken in accordance with Specification CLEARING .
Clearing .
SURVEY .
Survey shall be undertaken in accordance with Specification SURVEY CONTROL .
Survey .
Prior to excavation a survey of the existing ground surface shall be carried out and approved by the Superintendent .
HOLD POINT .
Prior to excavation in rock a survey of the rock surface shall be carried out and approved by the Superintendent .
HOLD POINT .
EXCAVATION IN GENERAL .
Excavation in general shall include Scope a. bulk excavation at bridge site b. local excavation for installation of substructures retaining walls and footings c. excavation for protection works d. excavation for river channelisation works all as shown on the Drawings. . Excavation in rock shall comprise excavation of material in place whether solid or not that can not be ripped and excavated by a tracked excavator with an operating mass not less than tonnes and net engine power not less than kW in good condition .
The excavator shall be capable of exerting a minimum breakout force of kN at the bottom of the excavation with a mm wide bucket fitted with rock teeth .
Definition of Rock Excavation .
Excavation in all other classes of material shall be termed common excavation . .
Bore Information Drawings included as Information for Tenderers give indications of materials to be excavated .
They also show ground water levels at the date of drilling .
The Contractor must expect and allow for seasonal variations to these levels .
Information for Tenderers Specification Excavation Backfill for Structures Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The Drawings show approximate locations of services in the vicinity of the Works .
The Contractor shall contact all service authorities to confirm location before commencing earthworks .
All excavation works shall be carried out with caution and shall comply with all requirements of the service authorities .
Services .
In general the actual dimensions for excavation shall be no more than that required for the placement of protective works if necessary and any working space required .
Dimensions .
Unless otherwise specified all surplus excavated material shall become the property of the Contractor and shall be disposed off site to the Contractors spoil sites or other authorised waste disposal sites .
Disposal of Surplus Excavation .
The Contractor shall give the Superintendent hours notice on completion of common excavation for confirmation of the rock surface levels .
HOLD POINT .
FOOTINGS ON ROCK .
The pier and abutment footings have been designed to be founded on sound rock .
The founding levels given on the Drawings are based on available borehole information and are subject to confirmation by the Superintendent .
Founding on Rock .
Excavations for pier and abutment footings shall be to the net projected area of the footings .
Overbreak shall be kept to a minimum and the adjoining material disturbed to the least possible extent. . Footing concrete below the level of the rock surface shall be poured directly against the sides of the excavation so as to completely fill any overbreak which may exist . .
The Contractor shall complete all excavation in common material down to rock over the entire area of the footings and clean the rock surface of all loose andor compressible material for inspection and direction by the Superintendent before commencing any rock excavation operations or placing any concrete .
HOLD POINT .
Where the bottom of the excavation is generally on undisturbed solid rock but has local soft seams or pockets such soft seams or pockets shall be excavated to sound undisturbed rock and backfilled with makeup concrete . .
Makeup concrete may be used to accommodate surface irregularities below accepted founding levels .
The makeup concrete where used shall extend to the sides of the excavation and shall comply with Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES . .
Mechanical rock breaking equipment only shall be used in the excavation of rock .
Blasting will not be permitted . .
Final trimming of the excavation shall be by hand held equipment .
Specification Excavation Backfill for Structures Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
FOOTINGS ON SOIL .
Unless otherwise shown on the drawings soil shall be finished horizontally care being taken to avoid disturbing material below foundation level .
All loose material shall be removed before placing the blinding concrete . .
The Contractor shall compact the bottom of the excavation to of Modified Maximum Dry Density Ratio to a depth of .m below the base of the footing .
The geotechnical engineer may require overexcavation where loose sand or fill is encountered .
Compaction .
When foundations in Perth sands have been excavated the Contractor shall compact the bearing surface and test the compaction with a standard Perth falling weight penetrometer in accordance with AS .
The penetrometer shall be calibrated to the soil being tested at each bridge site by using a laboratory registered with the National Association of Testing Authorities to carry out the penetrometer calibration tests . .
The minimum acceptable blow count shall be the number of blows that correspond to Modified Maximum Dry Density Ratio . .
The minimum acceptable blow count determined in the calibration test shall be achieved for the whole of the soil depth from mm to mm below all footings. . For bridge foundations and underpass base slab the specified compaction shall be achieved for a horizontal distance of m beyond the edge of the footing .
Perth Sands .
DEWATERING .
Where excavation for foundations is at or below insitu water table levels the excavation shall be dewatered by pumping or well point dewatering in accordance with Specification ENVIRONMENT .
Water Table Level .
ACCEPTANCE OF FOUNDATION SURFACE .
Prior to carrying out any work on the pier or abutment footings the Contractor shall certify that the foundation complies with specified levels dimensions and compaction requirements .
Superintendent approval is required before any concrete blinding or makeup operations are commenced .
HOLD POINT .
MAKE UP AND BLINDING CONCRETE .
The exposed bearing surface at the bottom of each excavation shall be adequately protected from disturbance by the Contractors operations or by the action of storm water or ground water .
Specification Excavation Backfill for Structures Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
For footings founded on soil immediately after the foundation bearing surface has been trimmed it shall be covered with a layer of blinding concrete .
The blinding layer shall be formed and placed and screeded off to the level of the underside of the footing. . For the abutment and pier footings blinding or makeup concrete shall be placed as required and agreed by the Superintendent and as referenced on the Drawings. . Blinding and makeup concrete shall be as specified in Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS and shall be the class specified on the Drawings. . BACKFILL .
The Contractor shall backfill around piers abutments retaining walls including footings to the levels shown on the Drawings using selected granular fill material .
Backfill in General .
All fill shall be placed in continuous horizontal layers of not more than mm uncompacted thickness . .
Selected granular fill shall be supplied by the Contractor and shall be cohesionless sand or sandy limestone complying with the following requirements Fill Material a .
Particle Size Distribution WA .
TABLE .
PARTICLE SIZE DISTRIBUTION SELECTED GRANULAR FILL Sieve Size Passing .
. . . . . . . . b .
Linear Shrinkage The portion of the sample which passes the .mm sieve soil mortar shall have a linear shrinkage not exceeding .. Specification Excavation Backfill for Structures Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name c. Oversize Material The material shall be free from boulders having any dimension greater than mm .
Excavated material shall not be suitable to use as selected granular fill. . Backfill shall be placed on all sides of piers abutment and retaining wall footings so as not to damage the concrete. . All fill including embankment fill material shall be selected granular fill compacted to a minimum of Modified Maximum Dry Density Ratio for its full depthor as shown on the Drawings .
Compaction .
Within metres of structural members including abutment walls piers retaining walls and footings only hand operated vibratory compacting equipment shall be used .
Hand Operated Equipment . . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED ANNEXURE A CONSTRUCTION STAGING .

PRELOADING .
Preloading shall be in accordance with the following Insert text to suit .
PASSIVE ANCHOR TESTING .
The Contractor shall test a minimum of anchors on each footing to a proof load as specified on the Drawings .
Anchors to be tested will be nominated by the Superintendent .
In the event of an anchor failing the test it shall be replaced and the Contractor shall test a further anchors in that footing at no expense to the Principal .

NOT USED ANNEXURE A Borehole Information Specification Mechanically Stabilised Earth Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name SPECIFICATION MECHANICALLY STABILISED EARTH WALLS GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work to be executed under this specification consists of the design manufacture and construction of Mechanically Stabilised Earth MSE Walls Reinforced Earth Walls for use in bridge abutments and associated retaining walls. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Methods of Testing Soils for Engineering Purposes Soil Strength and Consolidation Tests Determination of the Penetration Resistance of a Soil Perth Sand Penetrometer Test AS Earthretaining Structures AS Bridge Design MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification QUALITY SYSTEMS Specification ROCK PROTECTION Specification EXCAVATION AND BACKFILL FOR STRUCTURES . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
COMPONENT MATERIALS .
Only MSE systems composed of precast concrete facing panels shall be considered for acceptance .
Facing Panels .
All metallic reinforcing strips shall be galvanised .
Metallic Strips .
Polymeric material used as reinforcing strips for load bearing reinforced soil structures shall satisfy the following conditions Polymeric Strips Specification Mechanically Stabilised Earth Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name i The Reinforced Soil Wall RSW System shall be a Roads and Maritime Services NSW approved system available from httpwww.rms.nsw.gov.aubusinessindustrypartners supplierstenderscontractsapprovedrswsystems.html ii There shall be mm minimum clear cover from the front of the concrete panel to the geosynthetic reinforcement embedded in the panel and iii The material shall be demonstrated by testing as sufficiently strong stable and durable to satisfy the performance and design requirements .
Refer Specification QUALITY SYSTEMS for details of the required testing .
iv The reinforced soil wall system shall be approved by the Main Roads Western Australia Senior Engineer Structures .
No less than weeks prior to the installation of any polymeric strips the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that the Contractor has met all the requirements of clause HOLD POINT .
CEMENT STABILISED LAYER .
Where specified the cement stabilised layer below the abutment sill beams shall be selected granular fill complying with the BACKFILL Clause of Specification EXCAVATION AND BACKFILL FOR STRUCTURES with the addition of kg cement per cubic metre of fill .
The cement stabilised layer shall be uniformly mixed and compacted to a minimum of of maximum dry density. . ELECTROCHEMICAL PROPERTIES OF REINFORCED FILL MATERIALS BACKFILL .
The reinforced fill material shall meet the electrochemical requirements specified in Table .
Table .
Soil Property Allowable Limits pH Chloride Content mgkg dry land submerged Sulphate Content mgkg dry land submerged Resistivity saturated ohm.cm dry land submerged Notes Submerged values shall be used where the structure is permanently or regularly submerged .
Otherwise dry land values shall be used .
Submergence does not include marine environments .
Specification Mechanically Stabilised Earth Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name . . NOT USED DESIGN .
GENERAL .
The MSE System shall be designed in accordance with AS to support the loads from the abutment as shown on the Drawings and in accordance with the requirements of AS .
Borehole information is provided in Annexure A. .
The bridge superstructure shall be independently supported on piles or columns founded below the reinforced soil block so as to support the bridge in the event of loss of MSE wall backfill due to washout or any other event .
Piers and columns shall be fully fixed at the connection to the sill beam if used and in all cases designed to carry full abutment bending and axial loads with provision for up to .m loss of MSE wall backfill under the top of the piles or columns for the full width of the superstructure . .
The top of all MSE walls and the area adjacent to the abutment including associated wingwalls shall be mortar limestone pitched in accordance with Specification ROCK PROTECTION for .m width to prevent ingress into the reinforced soil block. . Geotextile or equivalent membrane approved by the Superintendent shall be used to prevent loss of MSE wall backfill through facing panel joints .
The membrane design life shall be at least that of the bridge years minimum. . TENDER SUBMISSION .
Tenderers shall submit with their tenders sufficient details of their proposed MSE System to enable a full technical and aesthetic assessment to be made of its suitability .
In particular this should address a. anticipated design life years minimum required b. anticipated movements over the life of the structure vertical and horizontal c. safety factors adopted for the design d. requirements for fill material e. proposed shape and surface finish of facing panels and f. proposed reinforcing elements with independent supporting evidence as appropriate. . FULL DESIGN DOCUMENTATION .
The Contractor shall be responsible for the design and preparation of all detailed specifications and Drawings for the manufacture and construction of the MSE structures .
Specification Mechanically Stabilised Earth Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name . . NOT USED INSTALLATION .
COMMENCEMENT .
At least weeks prior to carrying out any work on the MSE abutments or walls the Contractor shall supply to the Superintendent full details of the proposed system including four copies of all Drawings and specifications together with certification that the design has been checked and verified by an independent geotechnical engineer experienced in this form of construction .
HOLD POINT .
INSTALLATION .
The MSE system shall be installed in accordance with the approved documented design .

SCOPE .
The work to be executed under this specification consists of demolition or dismantling of existing bridges and associated highway structures including services .
For detailed scope of the work under the Contract refer to the notes on the Bridge Drawings. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Acts and Regulations Building Act Occupational Safety and Health Act Explosives and Dangerous Goods Act Building Regulations Occupational Safety and Health Regulations Australian Standards AS .
Explosives Storage transport and use Storage AS .
Explosives Storage and use Use of explosives AS The demolition of structures Main Roads Specifications Series GENERAL REQUIREMENTS Series MANAGEMENT REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED PLANNING AND PREPARATION FOR DEMOLITION .
PERMITS .
Prior to commencement all required permits for the dismantlingdemolition shall be sort by the Contractor and received Specification Dismantling Demolition Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Under the Western Australian Building Act Western Australian Building Regulations the required approvals must be received through a Municipal Building Surveyor prior to demolition commencing . .
The Contractor shall notify Worksafe of all Class Class and Class demolition in accordance with AS at least working days prior to commencement and provide the Superintendent with a copy of the notification . .
HAZARDOUS MATERIALS AUDIT .
A Hazardous Materials Audit must be completed by a competent person on the structure prior to demolition .
The Hazardous materials audit shall a. identify and assess the presence and condition of asbestos containing materials b. identify and assess other potentially hazardous materials could include the presence of Synthetic Mineral Fibres Polychlorinated Biphenyls lead based paint smoke detectors gas cylinders etc .
c. provide recommendations to prevent or minimise the risk of exposure to hazardous materials during the proposed works .
The Contractor is to use the Hazardous Materials Audit when developing their method proposal as per .. .
PRESENCE OF ASBESTOS .
All asbestos containing materials identified through the Hazardous Materials Audit must be removed in accordance with the Occupational Safety and Health Regulations prior to commencement of demolition . .
The contractor shall engage appropriately Licensed Asbestos Removalists in accordance with recommendations details in the Hazardous Materials Audit .
The process for removal is to be documented as a sub clause of the Work Plan as per .. . A clearance certificate must be issued by a competent person which con firms that an area where asbestos removal has taken place has been cleaned satisfactorily and is safe to be reoccupied prior to demolition work commencing. . Worksafe Western Australia must be notified at least days prior to the commencement of asbestos removal works via their Notification of Asbestos Removal form which can be found on www.worksafe.wa.gov.au .
. . NOT USED OPERATIONS .
METHOD OF DISMANTLINGDEMOLITION .
The Contractor shall dismantledemolish the existing bridges andor as sociated highway structures to the horizontal and vertical limits as shown on the Drawings .
Specification Dismantling Demolition Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
At least weeks prior to commencement of dismantlingdemolition the Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent detailed proposals of the method of dismantlingdemolition for the Superintendents approval .
HOLD POINT .
The method of demolition shall comply with AS . .
STRUCTURE REMOVAL .
The substructure shall be dismantleddemolished down to the final excavated ground level as shown on the Drawings .
Dismantlingdemolition of substructure shall include piles pilecaps and footing foundation supports to substructure components .
Substructure Cut Off Level .
Where substructure is in permanent water cut off level for dismantlingdemolition may be under water at river bed level or at low water level refer details on the Drawings .
Cut Off Level in Permanent Water .
PUBLIC UTILITIES AND STAKEHOLDERS .
The Contractor shall liaise with Public Utility Authorities which are affected by the demolition operations . .
The Contractor shall obtain written confirmation from each Public Utility Authority that disused services on the existing bridge or other structure have been made safe and can be demolished along with the structure .
Disused Services .
Prior to dismantlingdemolition operations the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that the above written confirmation from each Public Utility Authority that disused services on the existing bridge or other structure have been made safe and can be demolished along with the structure has been received .
HOLD POINT .
Prior to dismantlingdemolition operations the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that all affected public utilities have been protected or relocated .
HOLD POINT .
Prior to dismantlingdemolition operations the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that all stakeholders have been notified and environmental andor waterway regulations will be complied with .
HOLD POINT .
EXPLOSIVES .
Explosives shall only be permitted for use in demolition operations where explicitly specified on the Drawings .
Authorisation .
Demolition using explosives shall comply with AS .
and AS .
and the Western Australia Explosives and Dangerous Goods Act .
Regulations .
Explosive operations shall only be carried out by certified qualified personnel .
Certified Personnel Specification Dismantling Demolition Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Prior to carrying out demolition operations using explosives the Contractor shall provide written evidence of certification of the explosives operator to the Superintendent and provide a detailed plan of the method of demolition using explosives .
HOLD POINT .
DISPOSAL OF MATERIALS .
All dismantleddemolished material with the exception of that material identified by the Superintendent as Salvageable Material shall become the property of the Contractor and shall be disposed off site to the Contractors spoil sites or other waste disposal site .
Disposal Off Site .
UNDERWATER INSPECTIONS .
Where cut off level of the dismantleddemolished structure is below the permanent water level an underwater inspection shall be carried out to confirm compliance with specified cut off levels .
Cut Off Below Water Level .
CLEANING UP .
The Contractor shall clean up any spillages at the Site or dust contamination to the Site or adjacent properties or any other environmental contamination within week of completion of the demolition and disposal operations .
Clean Up of the Site . . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED Specification Dismantling Demolition Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ANNEXURE A Insert as required .

BP Oil Pipeline c. etc. . HERITAGE ISSUES .
The timber superstructure is listed as Heritage Significance by the Shire .
Prior to any dismantlingdemolition a full photographic record of these elements shall be taken by the Contractor .
Specification Dismantling Demolition Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
SALVAGEABLE MATERIALS .
All dismantled material including deck timber corbels and stringers shall be inspected by the Superintendent to identify any Salvageable Material .
All Salvageable Material identified by the Superintendent shall remain the property of the Principal and shall be delivered to a site to be advised by the Superintendent .
All loading transport to the nominated site and unloading shall be the Contractors responsibility .
All other material shall be disposed of as specified at Clause ..

SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the construction of prestressed concrete bridge superstructures by the incremental launching pushout method including the design and construction of any necessary temporary works associated with this form of construction. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Steel Structures AS Earthretaining Structures AS Bridge Design MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification STRUCTURAL STEELWORK Specification BRIDGE BEARINGS .
TENDER SUBMISSION .
The bridge has been designed for the superstructure to be constructed by the incremental launching method. . Tenderers shall submit with their tenders sufficient details of their proposed method of launching to enable a full technical assessment to be made of its suitability .
This should include as a minimum Launching Method Details a. name and relevant experience of consultant who will carry out required design work and independent verification b. method of launching c. method of braking including the secondary braking method in case of failure of the primary one d. form of temporary piers including any special requirements such as piling Specification Incremental Launching Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name e. details of any changes required in the Principals design assumptions and f. source and availability of launching girder .
. . NOT USED DESIGN .
DESIGN OF TEMPORARY WORKS .
The Contractor shall be responsible for the design of all temporary works including but not limited to the casting bay launching girder temporary piers launching bearings jacking systems braking system and side restraint systems .
All design forces which will react onto the permanent structure and the means of ensuring they are not exceeded shall be clearly identified in the calculations andor on the drawings .
Design of Temporary Works .
At least weeks prior to carrying out any work on the deck launching system the Contractor shall supply to the Superintendent full details of the proposed method of construction including copies of all drawings specifications and procedures and certification that the proposal has been independently verified by an engineer experienced in this form of construction .
HOLD POINT .
DESIGN ASSUMPTIONS .
Use of the Incremental Launching Method requires the designer to make a number of assumptions about the construction method .
These are detailed on the Drawings .
Any proposal to vary these could require redesign of the permanent works .
The Principal will take account of these costs when assessing tenders .
Design Assumptions .
Supports for the casting bay temporary supports and the launching procedure shall be such as to restrict differential settlement between adjacent longitudinal supports to the following Differential Settlement a .
Casting bed and temporary support mm b .
Temporary support and abutment mm c. Abutment and pier mm d. Any two piers mm .
LAUNCHING GIRDER .
The properties of the launching girder shall be as shown on the Drawings .
The connection between the launching girder and the end of the deck shall be as detailed on the Drawings. . Any changes proposed by the Contractor to either the details of the launching girder or the connection between the launching girder and the deck must be approved by the Superintendent .
Any changes required to the Drawings will be carried out by the Principal at no cost to the Contractor .
Specification Incremental Launching Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Fabrication of the launching girder shall generally be in accordance with AS and the following specific tolerances .
Fabrication Tolerances Variation along underside of the bottom flange i Transversely a .
From connection end to .L where the bottom flange is rigidly restrained by web stiffeners the variation in level from the specified plane shall not exceed mm .
b .
Where the bottom flange is not rigidly restrained by web stiffeners and the web is free to flex the variation in level from the specified plane shall not exceed of the total width of flange or mm whichever is greater .
ii Longitudinally a .
Variation in level from straight connection end to .L .mm remainder .mm b. Nil abrupt c. Maximum deviation in level from specified plane measured over a length of metre connection end to .L .
remainder .
d. Variation along side guide Variation from horizontal alignment connection end to .L mm remainder mm .
The launching girder welds shall be tested in accordance with the requirements of Specification STRUCTURAL STEEELWORK .
Testing .
The launching girder shall receive suitable and adequate surface protection to prevent any staining of the permanent work .
Surface Protection .
The nose of the launching girder shall include some form of jacking arrangement to enable jacking up of the girder as it reaches the launching bearings to ensure a smooth run on to the bearing .
Nose Jacks .
CASTING BAY .
Tolerances on the top surface of the casting bay shall be in accordance with the following specific tolerances Casting Bay Tolerances a .
Variation in level from straight .mm b. Nil abrupt c. Maximum deviation in level measured over a length of metre .
Specification Incremental Launching Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
LAUNCHING BEARINGS .
Launching bearings and associated lateral guides installed on the permanent works shall be installed to the following tolerances Installation Tolerances i Position mm on specified dimensions relative to actual transverse centreline of pier or abutment mm on specified dimensions relative to true longitudinal centreline of structure ii Level .mm relative to specified levels generally but at any pier or abutment the difference between any two levels on adjacent bearings shall be within .mm of the difference in the specified levels and on any individual bearing the maximum deviation from the specified plane both longitudinally and transversely shall be .
measured over a minimum length of mm .
Transverse tolerance at vertical guides .mm . .
The maximum bearing pressure on the permanent work from the launching bearings shall be as given on the Drawings . .
The maximum longitudinal friction shall be . .
The top layer of the bearing elastomer shall be treated to avoid marking of the bridge soffit . .
LAUNCHING JACKS .
The abutments have been detailed to accommodate special launching jacks as detailed on the Drawings .
Any changes proposed by the Contractor must be approved by the Superintendent .
Any changes required to the Drawings will be carried out by the Principal at no cost to the Contractor .
Launching Jacks . . NOT USED OPERATIONS .
LAUNCHING PROCEDURE .
The detailed planning and execution of the launching operations shall be the responsibility of the Contractor .
To prevent damage to the permanent works the following shall be incorporated in the launching procedure Launching Procedure i .
There shall be one person in overall control of the launch who shall be in twoway communication with each pier or launching bearing location .
ii .
During the launch the Contractor shall carefully control and continuously monitor the horizontal jacking force and launching shall be immediately stopped if this force suddenly increases .
Specification Incremental Launching Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The Contractor shall ensure the deck is adequately restrained against uncontrolled movements at all times before during and after the launching operation .
Deck Restraining .
Launching shall not be carried out during strong winds as specified on the Drawings .
Wind Load .
Ply or similar formwork shall be reused a maximum of times before being replaced .
Any treatment painting or recoating of formwork shall not be permitted. . At least days prior to any launching operation the Contractor shall provide to the Superintendent full details of the proposed launching procedure in the form of drawings and detailed methodology including temporary bearing details .
HOLD POINT .
CASTING BAY .
The levels on the casting bay surface shall be taken prior to any launching operations and rechecked after each launch segment .
Adjustments shall be made if tolerances from Clause .
are exceeded at any stage of the launching operations .
Casting Bay .
The casting bay must be removed at the completion of launching . .
TEMPORARY ANCHORAGE .
On completion of launching the bridge superstructure shall be temporarily restrained against all movement until the permanent bearings and abutment tiebacks can be installed .
Temporary Restraint .
INSTALLATION OF PERMANENT BEARINGS .
On completion of launching operations and before continuity prestress is applied the weight of the bridge shall be transferred from the launching bearings to the permanent bearings .
The bearings shall be installed as specified on the Drawings and to the tolerances given in Specification BRIDGE BEARINGS .
Permanent Bearings .
The installation of permanent bearings shall comply with the following requirements a .
The bearings shall be replaced at each abutment and pier in turn commencing with the launching abutment .
b .
The permanent bearings at the launching abutment shall only be installed after the concrete in the diaphragm has attained its design strength .
c. The tieback at the launching abutment shall be installed prior to removal of the temporary restraint .
Specification Incremental Launching Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name d. Jacking of the structure shall be carried out under the beams .
At the piers the structure shall be jacked on both sides of the launching bearings .
Approved mechanical collars shall be fitted to the jacks andor packing shall be used which shall follow closely and be capable of supporting the structure without dropping in the event of sudden hydraulic failure or prolonged support of the jacks .
At no time shall the backup system lag more than mm behind the load .
Jacking .
Jacking of the structures shall be carried out with strict observance of the following tolerances Jacking Tolerances Maximum longitudinal differences in level between adjacent piers mm .
Maximum transverse differences in level across any pier mm . .
The Contractors system of jacking shall make provisions for both longitudinal movements and rotation of the bridge deck . .
The Contractor shall install survey platesmarkers on the deck slab over the launching bearing locations to enable accurate monitoring of the levels to be carried out during bearing installation. . DECK DIAPHRAGMS .
At the completion of launching operations and after stressing of continuity prestress the Contractor shall cast diaphragms to both ends of the superstructure to the details as shown on the Drawings .
Deck Diaphragms . . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED Specification Incremental Launching Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name GUIDANCE NOTES FOR REFERENCE ONLY DELETE GUIDANCE NOTES FROM FINAL DOCUMENT .
All edits to downloaded Specifications shall be made using Track Changes to clearly show addeddeleted text . .
If all information relating to a clause is deleted the clause number should be retained and the words NOT USED should be inserted . .
The proposed documents with tracked changes shall be submitted to the Project Manager for review prior to printing the final batch of documents .
When this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off. . Before printing accept all changes in the document turn off Track Changes and refresh the Table of Contents . .
The Custodian of this specification is the Structures Design and Standards Engineer . .

NOT USED ANNEXURE A Pile Driving Design Assumptions ANNEXURE B Pile Driving Test Sample ANNEXURE C Acceptance of Piles ANNEXURE D Pile Driving Data Specification Driven Steel Piles Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name SPECIFICATION DRIVEN STEEL PILES GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of all operations for the steel piling of bridge foundations including the surface treatment of steel piles welding splices all pitching and driving. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Arc welded Steel Pipes and Fittings for Water and Waste water AS Piling Design and Installation AS Non destructive Testing Radiography of Welded Butt Joints in Metal AS Non destructive Testing Ultrasonic Testing of Fusion Welded Joints in Carbon and Low Alloy Steel AS Bridge Design AustralianNew Zealand Standards ASNZS .
Structural Steel Welding Welding of Steel Structures ASNZS Structural Steel Hotrolled Plates Floorplates and Slabs ASNZS .
Structural Steel Hotrolled Bars and Sections ASNZS .
Structural Steel Welded I Sections ASNZS Welding consumables Covered electrodes for manual metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels Classification ASNZS ISO Welding consumables Tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels Classification ISO MOD Specification Driven Steel Piles Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ASNZS ISO Welding consumables Tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded metal arc welding of creepresisting steels Classification ISO MOD ASNZS ISO Welding consumables Tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of highstrength steels Classification ISO MOD MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification STRUCTURAL STEELWORK Specification PROTECTIVE TREATMENT OF STEELWORK . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
STEEL H PILES .. HOTROLLED STEEL PILES Piles .
Steel piles shall be Universal Steel Columns Grade ASNZS .
manufactured in accordance with AS .
and as shown on the Drawings. . Certification Test certificates shall be issued with the columns in accordance with ASNZS .
relating to tests performed by the manufacturer to establish compliance with the Standard. . Dimensions and Tolerances The Universal Steel Columns shall conform to the manufacturing tolerances specified in ASNZS .. . During the storage the columns shall be resting on timber supports in a horizontal plane .
Any steel columns damaged or distorted in excess of the above specified tolerances prior to pile driving shall be replaced at the sole expense of the Contractor .
.. WELDED STEEL PILES Welded Steel Piles .
Steel piles shall be Welded Steel Columns Grade ASNZS .
manufactured in accordance with ASNZS .
and as shown on the Drawings. . Certification Test certificates shall be issued with the columns in accordance with ASNZS .
relating to tests performed by the manufacturer to establish compliance with the Standard. . Dimensions and Tolerances The welded steel columns shall conform to the manufacturing tolerances specified in ASNZS .. Tolerances Specification Driven Steel Piles Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ..
CORROSION PROTECTION TO H PILES .
Steel H piles shall be prepared and hot dipped galvanised as specified in Specification PROTECTIVE TREATMENT OF STEELWORK .
Extent of corrosion protection shall be as shown on the Drawings .
Corrosion Protection .
STEEL CIRCULAR PILES .
Steel circular piles shall be designed supplied and fabricated by the Contractor .
Steel Circular Piles .
The steel circular piles shall be fabricated in accordance with AS from Grade steel plate conforming to ASNZS .
Plate thickness and size of steel circular piles shall be as specified on the Drawings .
The steel circular piles shall be fabricated to the tolerances specified in AS except for the length of the piles which is to a tolerance of mm . .
The thickness shall be chosen to account for the proposed driving methodology .
..
CORROSION PROTECTION STEEL CIRCULAR PILES .
Steel circular piles shall receive corrosion protection as specified in Specification PROTECTIVE TREATMENT OF STEELWORK and to the extent indicated on the Drawings .
Corrosion Protection . . NOT USED INSTALLATION .
TRANSPORTATION HANDLING AND STORAGE .
The methods of transport handling and storage shall be such as to prevent damage to the steel piles as a result of impact or deflection or the application of load. . During the storage the columns shall be resting on timber supports in a horizontal plane .
Any steel piles damaged or distorted in excess of the above specified tolerances prior to pile driving shall be replaced at no cost to the Principal. . WELDED SPLICES .
End preparation for welded butt pile splices in the steel piling shall be in accordance with the details shown on the Drawings .
The Contractor shall cut off the top mm of the pile already driven to facilitate welding of the new length. . Welding of splices shall comply with the welding requirements of Specification STRUCTURAL STEELWORK . .
When welding steel circular piles the vertical seams in adjoining section shall be offset a minimum of mm. . Welded pile splices shall be tested by radiographic andor ultrasonic examination carried out in accordance with AS or AS .
Specification Driven Steel Piles Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All welds shall be examined by radiography except that if it can be shown to the satisfaction of the Superintendent that ultrasonic testing is satisfactory then of welds shall be examined by both test methods and the remainder by ultrasonic testing only .
The selection for the different tests shall be made by the Superintendent . .
The Contractor shall allow for any preparatory work including cleaning the piles by wire brushing for mm above and below each splice to remove all mill scale and for all delays resulting from examination and approval of the welds. . All weld testing shall be carried out by a NATA registered company. . All damage to protective coatings caused by site welding shall be repaired by the Contractor in accordance with the requirements of Specification PROTECTIVE TREATMENT OF STEELWORK .
Damage to Protective Coatings .
PILE DRIVING EQUIPMENT .
Piles shall be held in fixed leads such that the hammer and a braced follower follow the pile and provide support throughout the entire driving period .
The use of swinging leads shall not be permitted .
Equipment .
In general the choice of the hammer shall be in accordance with the recommendations of Clause .. of AS and shall develop a rated energy of not less than that specified in Annexure A. . A helmet and packing to suit the approved hammer and pile shall be used at all times during driving .
The specification for the driving dolly and packing is given in Clause .. . At least days prior to driving of piles the Contractor shall submit details of the proposed Hammer to be used including HOLD POINT a .
Energy rating of hammer b .
Details of helmet and dolly c. Mass of ram and total mass of hammer d. Method of determining the efficiency of the hammer during pile installation . .
PITCHING AND DRIVING .
Piles shall be pitched accurately in position prior to the commencement of driving . .
Prior to driving any piles the Contractor shall supply to the Superintendent certification that the piles comply in all respects with the requirements of the Specification .
HOLD POINT .
Prior to driving any piles the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that the plan position and batter of the piles comply with the requirements of the Specification and the Drawings .
HOLD POINT Specification Driven Steel Piles Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Prior to driving any spliced piles the Contractor shall supply to the Superintendent certification that the splice complies with the requirements of the Specification .
HOLD POINT .
The driving has been designed assuming the details shown in Annexure C. The Contractor should note that the packing requirement is for a minimum thickness at the conclusion of driving .
To ensure compliance excess will need to be inserted at the commencement of driving and it may be necessary to replenish the packing during driving .
In any event the packing shall be replaced after driving each pile or more frequently if necessary. . To avoid the possibility of premature settingup pile driving shall be continuous in the latter stages without deliberate stops except as directed by the Superintendent .
Delays of as little as minutes may lead to significant setup in piles .
Where premature setup has occurred the Contractor shall be required to overcome this by continued driving where resistance to penetration may be significantly greater than normal . .
The Superintendent may direct that certain selected piles be subject to a setup test .
These piles shall be driven as specified and subsequently re driven hours after completion of initial driving .
A Provisional Sum is allowed for this operation . .
The Contractor shall record the number of blows for each mm of pile penetration .
Details of each pile driven shall be kept on pile driving record forms as shown in Annexure D. . DRIVING STEEL CIRCULAR PILES .
The Contractors attention is drawn to the special requirements for driving steel circular piles in particular the varied nature of the foundation material as indicated by the bore logs Drawings and the possible need to drive and excavate within and ahead of the steel circular piles to attain the specified penetration .
Where the bore logs show layers of hard rock it may be necessary to drill and blast before piles are driven to achieve the penetration .
Blasting shall be carried out in such a way that overbreak is kept to a minimum .
Driving Steel Circular Piles .
Blasting shall not be carried out inside steel circular piles .
Piles which can not be driven to the required penetration without exceeding a set of blowsmm using the hammer specified in Annexure A shall be excavated within the pile or ahead of the pile toe as necessary and redriven .
Repeated excavation and redriving may be necessary to achieve the minimum penetrations specified. . Excavation ahead of the pile toe shall be such as to keep overbreak to a minimum .
Where excessive overbreak occurs within .m from the minimum penetrations specified piles shall be extended to the required penetration by socketing as detailed on the Drawings. . Where the toe of a pile reaches sound rock at a level above the minimum penetration specified and where the bore information indicates that a minimum depth of m of sound rocks exists below the pile toe then the pile can be anchored into the rock by means of a rock socket as detailed on the Drawings .
Specification Driven Steel Piles Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
DYNAMIC PILE TESTING .
As an audit the Superintendent will select piles as described in Annexure B for dynamic pile testing when the piles are close to the minimum specified set .
The Contractor shall cease driving when directed by the Superintendent and provide all necessary assistance for attaching the dynamic test recording equipment to the pile .
The pile shall then be re driven .
Dynamic Testing .
The Contractor shall allow in the rates for pile driving for all necessary assistance required to carry out the dynamic pile tests and for a delay of up to five days for the tests to be carried out and the results analysed before further piles are driven. . All dynamic testing shall be undertaken by the Superintendent and all costs met by the Principal . .
The Contractor shall give the Superintendent weeks notice of when pile driving the test sample as described in Annexure B is scheduled to commence . .
TEMPORARY COMPRESSIONS .
The Contractor shall take temporary compressions on a minimum of piles at each pile cap during pile driving .
Temporary compressions will normally be taken when the pile is close to final set .
The Contractor shall allow for any delays incurred in taking temporary compressions .
Alternatively the Contractor may use other means of testing in lieu of temporary compressions .
Temporary Compressions .
ACCEPTANCE OF PILES .
Minimum toe RLs for the piles are shown on the Drawings .
The actual driven length may vary based on the driving performance of the piles in each particular foundation .
The main criteria in the acceptance of the piles are that the minimum penetration pile toe RL and the minimum set as shown in Annexure C shall both be attained .
Acceptance Criteria for Driving .
TOLERANCES ON PILES .
Piles shall be driven to comply with the following tolerances Tolerances a .
Variation from specified position in plan mm b .
Variation from vertical in a m template mm c. Variation from specified batter other than vertical in a m template mm d. Variation in specified cutoff level mm .
CUTTING OFF .
On completion of driving piles shall be cutoff to the levels as determined from the Drawings .
Specification Driven Steel Piles Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Prior to cutting off any installed pile the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that all the acceptance criteria of the pile and the tolerances on the pile comply with the requirements of the Specification and the Drawings .
