QUALITY CONTROL AND WORKMANSHIP .. PREQUALIFICATION OF FABRICATORS .
The Fabricator must be third party certified under a recognised scheme to the level Construction Category in accordance with ASNZS .
.. CONSTRUCTION CATEGORY .
Unless otherwise noted on the design drawing Construction Category CC applies to all major steel structures and components supplied fabricated and erected in conformity to this Specification .
For a listing of current certified companies refer httpwww.scacompliance.com.aucertifiedcompanies HOLD POINT ..
TREATMENT GRADES .
Unless required otherwise Treatment Grade P applies to structures and components fabricated in accordance to this Specification .
Details of Treatment Grade P are to be found in ASNZS Clause .. .. GEOMETRICAL TOLERANCES .
Unless required otherwise Essential Tolerances shall be Class in conformity with ASNZS Appendix F for all structural steel structures and structural members . .
Unless required otherwise Functional Tolerances shall be Class in conformity with ASNZS Appendix F for all structures and structural members. . Where the Designer allocates an Essential andor Functional Tolerance Class other than Class to a fabricated component or structural element this will be noted on the Design Drawing .
.. QUALITY ASSURANCE .
The Contractor is responsible for the development maintenance and implementation of all quality documentation to comply with ASNZS Clause .. .
The Contractor shall lay out and arrange the individual members or units to be inspected so that identification marks on each may be readily distinguished and so that each member or unit is accessible for audit inspection by the Superintendent .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The Contractor shall assist the Superintendent by turning the members or parts to permit examination of all sides .
The Contractor shall supply all labour plant tools and scaffolding required to facilitate full inspection . .
The WSP shall a .
Establish and maintain a certified quality management system to ASNZS ISO ASNZS and ASNZS ISO .
and to ensure that any Subcontractors comply with this requirement .
b .
Be responsible for all quality control and assurance activities necessary to ensure that the completed Works comply with the specified requirements .
c. Provide prior information to the Superintendent in respect of any proposed subcontract works to enable the Superintendent to assess and approve their suitability for that work .
d. Submit a Quality Plan to the Superintendent detailing how the Quality Assurance requirements are to be applied to each element of the Works in accordance with ASNZS Clause e. Provide an Inspection Test Plan to the Superintendent detailing the inspection and testing of welds in accordance with ASNZS Clause .. PURCHASING STEEL .
The Contractor shall maintain a documented purchasing procedure in accordance ASNZS Clause .. .
The Contractor shall ensure that all materials or parts conform with the tests required by the Standards and to other tests specified in this Specification. . All parties to the steel procurement must provide a Supplier Declaration of Conformity SDoC conforming to AS ISOIEC .
as specified in ASNZS Clause ..
IDENTIFICATION MARKS MARK NUMBER Each item of structural steelwork shall have its own unique item mark number which shall be used on all related schedules and documents .
This mark shall be clearly indicated on all members by durable identification marks to enable accurate identification on site .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
STORAGE AND HANDLING ..
STORAGE .
All members components and fasteners shall be stored in accordance with the relevant manufacturers instructions in such a way that damage and permanent deformation is not caused to them during preparation fabrication and assembly. . All steel whether fabricated or not shall be stored in such a manner that corrosion is minimised .
Generally storage at least mm above the ground on timber gluts under cover shall be satisfactory .
Rusted or bent or damaged steel shall be rejected .
.. HANDLING AND STACKING .
All structural steelwork shall be handled and stacked in such a way that it is not damaged or permanently deformed before and after fabrication and during transit and on the Site .
Storage handling and stacking of painted steel members shall comply with ASNZS Clause Storage handling and stacking of galvanised steel members shall comply with ASNZS Clause .
All bolts and nuts and washers and plates under mm maximum dimension and small articles generally shall be packed separately in watertight containers . .
Identification marks as specified in Clause .. shall be stencilled on each package in a noticeable position. . All materials or parts used in the Works shall be traceable to the Test Certificates .
The Contractor shall establish and maintain a comprehensive system of identification records .
Copies of all these records shall be forwarded to the Superintendent on request and shall form part of the MDR. . TRACEABILITY .
Unless otherwise noted full traceability in accordance with ASNZS Clause .. is required for all structures and components supplied fabricated and erected in conformity to this Specification. . Test certificates showing the results of mechanical tests and chemical analysis where applicable of the material or parts used in the Works shall be retained by the Contractor and shall form part of the MDR. . All materials or parts used in the Works shall be traceable to the Test Certificates .
The Contractor shall establish and maintain a comprehensive system of identification records .
Copies of all these records shall be forwarded to the Superintendent on request and shall form part of the MDR .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The steel in the fabricated components must be traceable to the Mill Certificate issued by the steel manufacturer in conformity to the relevant product Standard at all stages from supply and manufacture to incorporation into the works. . All welders must clearly identify their work either through the use of weld maps or by marking their identification symbol adjacent to the each weld .
Chalk crayons or other marking substances that may interfere with the application adherence or final appearance of any protective coating must not be used. . STEEL IN PLATES SECTIONS AND BARS New Steel Standards .
All materials of steel plates bars and sections supplied by the Contractor shall be new and shall conform to the Standards specified below unless as varied by this Specification .
Identification .
Steel shall be identified in accordance with Clause of ASNZS Clause of ASNZS Clause of ASNZS .
or Clause of ASNZS .
as appropriate .
This identification shall be maintained during all phases of fabrication. . Steel shall comply with the requirements of the following standards a. Hotrolled steel bars and sections ASNZS .
b. Hotrolled steel plates ASNZS c. Hollow sections ASNZS Grade L d. Welded Isections ASNZS . .
Structural steel hollow sections with Silicon content greater than .
shall not be used when steelwork is to be hot dip galvanised to ASNZS . .
ACCEPTANCE OF STEELS IN PLATES SECTIONS AND BARS .
Acceptance of steels for the standards listed in Clause .
shall be through product certification by ACRS . .
In the event of a dispute as to the compliance of the steel with any of the standards listed in Clause .
the reference testing shall be carried out by independent laboratories accredited by signatories to the ILAC MRA or the APLAC MRA .
The cost to carry out the independent testing and the cost for subsequent reporting shall be borne by the Contractor .
HOLD POINT .
The fabrication of steel shall not commence until the Superintendent has reviewed and approved the acceptance of steels in plates sections and bars by the method in Clause .. Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
TESTING OF STEEL PLATES GREATER THAN MM .
Prior to fabrication the contractor shall test all plates of thickness in excess of mm using continuous ultrasonic testing along all lines where welding shall be carried out and to establish that the plates are free from laminations and defects .
The method of testing shall be in accordance with AS . . A written report on each line tested shall be forwarded direct from the NATA registered testing laboratory to the Superintendent within hours of completion of the test .
The location and extent of inclusions andor laminations shall be detailed and sketched in the report . .
The welding of plates with thickness in excess of mm shall not commence until the Superintendent has reviewed and approved the acceptance of report described in Clause ..
HOLD POINT .
BOLTS NUTS AND WASHERS New Fasteners Standards .
All bolts nuts and washers supplied by the Contractor shall be new and shall conform to the relevant Australian Standards unless as varied by this Specification . .
The hardness of hotdip galvanised washers for use with high strength bolts shall have a hardness of HRC. . High strength bolts with associated nuts and washers shall comply with AS .
The length of the bolt shall be as shown on the Drawings or if no length is shown shall be in accordance with the requirements of AS . . All screw threads shall conform to the ISO coarse pitch series thread in accordance with AS .
Identification .
All high strength bolts nuts and washers shall have the identification marks as detailed in Clause .
of AS .. . Before the application of corrosion protection tolerance of screw threads for a. bolts conforming to ASNZS .
shall be Class g and b. bolts conforming to AS .
shall be Class g. . Before the application of corrosion protection tolerances of nut threads for a. nuts conforming to ASNZS .
shall be class H and b. nuts conforming to AS .
shall be Class H. .
The galvanising of fasteners is to be in accordance with AS .
After galvanising the galvanised nuts shall be tapped oversize in accordance with AS . .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings nuts other than those for high strength bolts shall be normal size .
The strength grade of normal nuts to be associated with each strength grade of the bolt Ubolt or other threaded component shall be as follows Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name Table .
ASSOCIATED STRENGTHS OF NORMAL GRADE NUTS Grade of Bolt Ubolt etc Strength Grade of Nut . . . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings the following types of washers shall be used a. with precision bolts bright metal washers normal series and b. with commercial bolts black metal washers normal series . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings washers are generally not required under socket head cap screws . .
ACCEPTANCE OF BOLTS NUTS AND WASHERS .
Acceptance of bolts nuts and washers for the standards listed in Clause .
shall be through test certificates that state that the bolts nuts and washers comply with all the provisions of ASNZS ..
These test certificates shall be provided by the manufacturer or bolt importer and these certificates shall be supported by test reports from an independent laboratory accredited by signatories to the ILAC MRA or the APLAC MRA .
Alternatively the test certificates with supporting test reports can be provided by the testing laboratory on behalf of the manufacturer importer or customer . .
The installation of bolts nuts and washers shall not commence until the Superintendent has reviewed and approved the acceptance of bolts nuts and washers by the method in Clause ..
HOLD POINT .
SUPPLY OF WELDING CONSUMABLES .
All welding consumables shall conform to the requirements of the relevant Standard as listed in the relevant part of ASNZS and ASNZS .
. . NOT USED Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name FABRICATION .
GENERAL .
All structural steelwork shall be fabricated as shown on the Drawings and in accordance with the requirements of ASNZS and ASNZS .
SP quality except as varied by this Specification . .
The steelwork shall be fabricated where applicable with all necessary temporary brackets straps gussets cleats fixings lifting eyes and the like necessary for erection and assembly. . SHOP DRAWINGS .
The Contractor shall prepare shop drawings for the fabrication of all members to conform to ASNZS Clause .. . Shop drawings shall show details of fabrication which are not explicit in the Drawings .
Details required include dimensions angles and weld preparation details and any contract specific requirements specified in Clauses .
to .. .
The details shown on the shop drawings shall be consistent with the Drawings and shall comply with the following a. complete information regarding the member conforming to ASNZS Clause .. b. the marking plan shall show the location of each part in the structure c. shop drawings shall conform to the AS Series d. welding and cutting definitions shall conform to AS e. welding symbols shall conform to AS .
f. complete information regarding the location type size and extent of all welds shall be clearly shown on the shop drawings .
These shop drawings shall clearly distinguish between shop and field welds g. joints or groups of joints in which it is especially important that the welding sequence and technique of welding be carefully controlled to minimise shrinkage stresses and distortion shall be noted on the shop drawings .
Joints where no welding is permitted shall also be clearly indicated .
Weld lengths specified on the Drawings shall be the required effective lengths h. each member shall be clearly identified with the identification marks shown on the Drawings .
Each type of component shall be further identified to readily distinguish it from all other types and i. for assemblies all associated bolting accessories andor joining details shall be shown on the shop drawings .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Four copies of the shop drawings certified by the Contractor as complying with the above requirements shall be submitted to the Superintendent working days before fabrication commences. . Variations of details shown on the shop drawings shall not be made without resubmission of appropriately amended shop drawings at least working days before fabrication of any affected component of the Works . .
The Contractor shall be responsible for the correctness of the shop drawings .
Acceptance of the shop drawings by the Superintendent shall not relieve the Contractor of any responsibility. . PRECAMBER AND DISTORTIONS .
The Contractor shall be aware that the specified construction tolerances require making due allowance for precamber and distortions due to fabrication and erection processes and for careful matching of angles and dimensions at field joints . .
The Drawings show precamber allowance for dead load .
The Contractor shall allow for all other aspects of the construction method affecting pre camber. . STRAIGHTENING AND CORRECTION OF DISTORTIONS .
All plates shall be flattened and all sections shall be straightened and made free from twist before any work is done on them to ensure assembled surfaces are flat within specified tolerances and adjacent surfaces are in close contact throughout .
The methods adopted for such flattening and straightening shall be such as not to damage or mark the material .
Heating of plates and all sections shall not be permitted unless written approval is obtained from the Superintendent prior to any heat application and at no time is heating to exceed C . .
CUTTING AND EDGE TREATMENT .
Steelwork shall be cut only by sawing thermal cutting machining abrasive water jet cutting or laser cutting .
After cutting cut edges shall be ground to remove burrs dross and slag and to clean up any roughness including gouge marks and unintentional bevel .
The maximum allowable surface roughness shall comply with ASZNS Table .. .
Unless required otherwise for welding or where shown differently on the Drawings any surfaces produced by cutting shall be finished square unless a bevelled edge is called for and smooth and true to the required dimensions. . Ends of web stiffener plates shall be cut and finished to fit snugly and uniformly to girder flanges unless otherwise shown on the Drawings. . Cut edges shall be finished as specified in Clause .
of ASNZS .
Guillotined plates shall be cut to an oversize sufficient for the correct dimensions to be achieved after edge finishing as per Clause Where galvanising is specified the edge surface preparation shall conform to the requirements of this Specification .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings all corners on cut edges shall be rounded to a radius of approximately .
mm except where such edges are subsequently to be welded .
Rolled edges need not be rounded provided the corners have a similar radius. . A reentrant corner shall be shaped notch free to a radius of at least mm by drilling a hole at the corner and cutting to the hole unless stated otherwise in the Contract Specification .
A reentrant cut shall be free of overcut. . SPLICES .
The location of any splices required in the flanges or webs of the box girder additional to those shown on the Drawings shall be suitably staggered and away from zones of high stress typically not within m of beam bolted splice connection points and located near the contraflexure points away from pier centrelines as approved by the Superintendent. . HOLES FOR BOLTING .
All bolt holes shall be drilled to a diameter mm larger than the diameter of the bolt for bolts not exceeding mm and mm larger than the diameter of bolt for bolts exceeding mm diameter unless otherwise shown on the Drawings. . Drilled holes shall be cylindrical and perpendicular to the face of the member .
Drilling shall be done by mechanical means. . Punching of holes shall be restricted to sub punching mm undersize followed by reaming. . WELDING .. GENERAL .
All welding shall comply with Clause of ASNZS .
All welding shall be category SP Structural Purpose in accordance with ASNZS .. .
Unless otherwise stated all welding shall comply with the requirements set out in ASNZS Table .
for Construction Category .
Welding works shall be carried out and managed under a Quality Management System QMS in accordance with ASNZS ISO .. .. WELDING PLAN .
A welding plan shall be provided as part of the planning process .
The welding plan must comply with the requirements in ASNZS Clause .. ..
QUALIFICATIONS OF WELDING PERSONNEL Welder .
Welding shall only be carried out by welders meeting the requirements of ASNZS and ISO .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Not less than working days prior to planned commencement of welding the following information on each welder shall be provided to the Superintendent a. documentary evidence of the qualificationcertification currently held b. trade training background c. duration of employment with current employer d. nature of current employment duties and e. documentary evidence confirming each welder is qualified for each welding procedure that they shall apply to the Works . .
The WSP shall a. maintain records clearly identifying the welders to each completed weld weld repair andor fabricated assemblyunit .
All records shall be available to the Superintendent and b. on completion of the welding work a weld map showing the welds completed by each welder shall be part of the MDR .
Responsible Welding Coordinator .
All welding shall be carried out under the supervision of the Contractors Responsible Welding Coordinator who shall meet the requirements of Clause .
of ASNZS .
and Clauses and of ISO . . Not less than working days prior to commencement of welding the WSP shall identify the Responsible Welding Coordinator who shall be responsible for the coordination of all operations in respect of the welding work .
The WSP shall provide to the Superintendent details of the Responsible Welding Coordinators qualifications certification and experience .
The Responsible Welding Coordinator shall have delegated authority to deal directly with the Superintendent on all issues relating to the welding work including a. welding procedure management b. welding quality management c. inspection and testing activities and d. signoff of completed work .
Welding Supervisor .
All welding shall be carried out under the supervision of the Contractors Responsible Welding Supervisor who shall meet the requirements of Clause .
of ASNZS .. Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Not less than working days prior to commencement of welding the WSP shall identify the Responsible Welding Supervisor who shall be responsible for ensuring that all welding is carried out in accordance with drawings plans welding procedures and other documentation .
The WSP shall provide to the Superintendent details of the Responsible Welding Supervisors qualifications certification and experience .
The Responsible Welding Supervisor shall have delegated authority to deal directly with the Superintendent on all issues relating to the welding work including a. welding procedure management b. welding quality management c. inspection and testing activities and d. signoff of completed work .
Welding Inspector .
All welding work shall be inspected by a suitably qualified Welding Inspector in accordance with Clause .
of ASNZS . . Not less than working days prior to commencement of welding the WSP shall identify the Welding Inspector who shall be responsible for the inspection of the welding work .
The WSP shall provide to the Superintendent details of the Welding Inspectors qualifications certification and experience .
.. EQUIPMENT .
Welding equipment and plant shall conform to AS .
and ASNZS and shall be maintained at all times in good condition .
It shall be of an appropriate type for the intended purpose and shall only be used in the circumstances and in the manner recommended by the manufacturer for size of electrodes currents voltages speeds of travel position of welding and fixtures and jigs shall be as laid down for the particular class of work . .
The type of machine and method used shall be written on the welding procedure qualification and welding plan. . Where welding is required to be done in conditions of a high risk of electric shock the welding equipment shall be fitted with a Voltage Reduction Device VRD . .
The WSP is required to maintain a list of essential equipment and their capacities in accordance with Clause of ASNZS ISO .. Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. WELDING CONSUMABLES .
All welding consumables to be used in welding procedures and for the Works shall comply with the relevant Standards .
Electrodes used for manual welding shall conform to ASNZS .
Tubular cored electrodes used for gas shielded and nogas shielded metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels shall conform to ASNZS ISO .
Solid wire electrodes tubular cored electrodes and electrodeflux combinations for submerged arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels shall conform to ISNZS ISO .
Fluxes for submerged arc welding shall conform to ASNZS ISO .
Wire electrodes for gas shielded metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels shall conform to ASNZS ISO . .
The WSP shall produce and implement procedures for storing handling identification and the use of welding consumables in particular hydrogen controlled electrodes in accordance with manufactures specifications .
If no manufacturers specifications are available then the recommendations in WTIA TN shall be adopted .
.. WELDING PROCEDURES .
Welding procedures for all fillet and butt welds or any combination of either shall be complied as per ASNZS .
Section by the WSP who shall submit to the Superintendent all Welding Procedure Specifications WPS and Procedure Qualification Records PQR not less than working days prior to the planned commencement of welding work to which the procedures shall apply . .
Prior to the commencement of any welding procedure where the essential variables vary outside the limits specified in Table .A of ASNZS .
the Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent a copy of the new procedures proven qualified by the WSP .
HOLD POINT .
Suitable runon and runoff tabs shall be used for all butt welds .
The tabs shall have the same thickness and preparation as the parts to be joined .
Each weld pass shall terminate at least mm beyond the edges of the parts to be joined .
Welds shall be continuous for the full length. . All welding for the work shall be shown in a detailed Welding Procedure Specification in accordance with ASNZS .. Each welding procedure shall be qualified by way of test pieces andor assemblies in accordance with ASNZS .
SP or as specific joint geometries not met by the Standard. . Test pieces andor assemblies shall represent the actual conditions in the work in regard to location weather environment geometric arrangement plate thickness joint preparation and equipment and be of a minimum size recommended by ASNZS .
but of adequate size to carry out all testing . .
The Superintendent shall be given at least working days notification of the time and place where the welding and testing of all test pieces andor assemblies shall be carried out .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The WSP shall obtain any test andor Inspection Certificates from a laboratory with appropriate NATA registration with all relevant results shown and a statement that the results comply with ASNZS .. .
The WSP shall develop and maintain a document control procedure for all welding documentation including welding procedure specifications procedure qualification records welder qualifications and supporting documentation .
..
CLEANING OF FINISHED WELDS .
All runon and runoff tabs shall be removed after the joint has cooled and the ends of the welds shall be finished smooth and flush with the faces of the abutting parts. . Slag shall be removed from completed welds .
The weld and adjacent base material shall be cleaned by brushing or other suitable means to remove spatter and foreign material .
Welded joints shall not be painted until after the welds have been inspected and tested in accordance with Clause .
Where butt welds form part of a faying or contact surface the surfaces of the butt welds shall be dressed in accordance with Clause .
of ASNZS .. ..
INSPECTION AND TESTING OF WELDS .
Inspection of welds shall be carried out in accordance with Clause of ASNZS Clause of AS .
and Section B B and B of ISO .
The WSP shall produce an Inspection and Test Plan ITP for all welding work which shall contain the necessary elements and hold points to ensure the completed welding work complies with ASNZS .
and Clause of ASNZS ISO .
requirements .
The WSP shall submit ITPs to the Superintendent not less than working days prior to commencement of the welding work . .
The WSP shall ensure that testing of all welds is carried out in accordance with Clause of ASNZS .
Inspection is required before during and after welding .
Visual scanning and visual inspection to be completed by a suitably qualified welding inspector as per ASNZS .
Clause .. Test Certificates issued by a NATA registered laboratory for testing c to h shall be available to the Superintendent and shall be part of the MDR .
The testing procedures to be used are a. visual scanning b. visual inspection c. radiographic testing d. ultrasonic testing e. magnetic particle inspection f. dye penetration testing Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name g. hardness testing and h. microstructure replica examination . .
The extent of testing and inspection of welds shall generally be in accordance with the recommendations in Table BA of ASNZS but also as follows a. visual inspection of all weld preparations prior to welding b. inspection of all weld quality using testing procedures a and b c. testing of all full strength butt weld splices in tension and compression using testing procedure c d. for all other butt welds test of the length of all welds longer than m and one in twenty of all welds which are less than m long using a combination of testing procedures c and d e. of fillet welds tested using testing procedures e andor f and f. testing procedures g and h shall be used where directed by the Superintendent . .
The Contractor shall allow for all labour and plant required to lay out and arrange items for inspection and testing and carry out any necessary weld preparation including allowance for lost production time. . Should any welds not comply after testing they shall be repaired as per ASNZS .
Clause .. . All repaired welds shall be retested and for welds tested under Clause d above retest three nonoverlapping samples each of the length of all welds longer than m and retest three in twenty of all welds which are less than m long using a combination of testing procedures c and d. All repairing and retesting defective welds and additional testing shall be at no cost to the Principal . .
The WSP shall only employ or contract Australian Institute for Non Destructive Testing AINDT certified NDT operators and qualified procedures . .
The WSP be responsible for the appropriate calibration or validation of measuring inspection and testing equipment used for assessing the quality of the construction .
ISO is to be used as the guideline document .
.. NONCONFORMING WELDS .
Any welds not meeting the requirements of this Specification shall be rejected .
The WSP shall document all NCRs and shall submit proposals to the Superintendent for correcting defective welds .
All corrective work shall be in accordance to ASNZS .. Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Repairing or correcting defective welds and any additional work or material required to repair defective welds shall be at no cost to the Principal. . STUD SHEAR CONNECTORS .. GENERAL .
Stud shear connectors and stud welding shall comply with the requirements of ASNZS .
except as varied by this Specification .
..

All welding shall be carried out under the supervision of the Contractors Responsible Welding Coordinator who shall be qualified in accordance with Clause .
of ASNZS .
and meets the requirements of Clauses and of ISO .
..
OPERATOR QUALIFICATION .
Operators shall be qualified in accordance with Section .
of ASNZS .. .. WELDING .
After stud welding all beams shall comply with the tolerances given in Clause .
Construction Tolerances .
Quality control for all stud welding shall be maintained in accordance with ASNZS .. Distortion ..
TESTING .
The testing of welded studs shall be in accordance with Section ASNZS ..
In addition the Superintendent shall select an additional five per cent of the remaining studs which shall also be tested .
All other studs shall be ring tested as per Clause .. ASNSZ .. ..
INSPECTION .
Inspection of welds shall be carried out in accordance with ASNZS ..
The WSP shall produce an Inspection and Test Plan ITP for all welding work which shall contain the necessary elements and hold points to ensure the completed welding work complies with ASNZS .
and Clause of ASNZS ISO .
requirements .
The WSP shall submit ITPs to the Superintendent not less than working days prior to commencement of the welding work .
..
CORRECTION OF DEFECTIVE STUD WELDS .
Any stud welds not meeting the requirements of ASNZS .
shall be rejected .
Repairs to defective welds except where allowed for in ASNZS .
shall not be allowed .
Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
BOLTING .
All bolts nuts and washers are to be hotdip galvanised unless otherwise noted .
Use one nut only to each bolt unless other noted on the Design Drawings .
Project the threaded portion of the bolt a minimum of one thread and a maximum of five threads through the nut .
Use washers tapered where necessary to give nuts and bolts satisfactory bearing .
All nuts and washers in each joint shall face in one direction and away from the general view .
General .
The minimal nominal diameter of a bolt used for structural bolts shall be at least M. The length of the bolt shall be such that at least one clear thread shows above the nut and at least one thread plus the thread run out is clear beneath the nut after snugtightening . .
The following types of bolts with their tightening procedures are designated on Structural Drawings when required .S .S .TF .TB .XTF and .XTB Where .
bolts are designated the washers and nuts shall also be hardened as for the bolt .
Where .X bolts are designated the thread portion of the bolt shall be kept outside the shear plane of the parts being joined .
Types of Bolts .
The tightening of bolts shall be carried out to the following procedures according to the grade of bolt Bolt Tightening a. bolting procedure .S refers to commercial bolts of strength grade .
manufactured to AS .
tightened using a standard wrench to a snugtight condition .
All bolts shall be installed and tightened in accordance with procedures detailed in the Drawings .
and b. bolting procedure .S refers to any bolt of strength grade .
tightened using a standard wrench to a snugtight condition in the same way as for procedure .S .
The bolts used shall be high strength structural bolts of grade .
manufactured to ASNZS .
c. Bolting procedure .TF and .TB refers to commercial bolts of strength grade .
manufactured to ASAZS .
fully tensioned with a calibrated torque wrench part turn tensioning or using load indicated washers in accordance with Clause .
of ASNZS .
All bolts shall be installed and tightened in accordance with procedures detailed in the Drawings .
d. The torque wrench shall be calibrated to ensure that the appropriate bolt tension is achieved .
HOLD POINT .
HOLDING DOWN BOLTS .
All holding down bolts shall wherever applicable be welded into a cage to ensure accurate placement .
Bolts nuts washers and cage assemblies shall be hotdip galvanised to give a coating of zinc of not less than microns thick .

CERTIFICATION OF FABRICATION .
Prior to dispatch of work from the shop the Contractor shall provide the Superintendent with certification that each item fabricated conforms to the requirements of the Drawings and the Specification .
HOLD POINT . . NOT USED ERECTION .
GENERAL .
Where applicable erection procedures shall comply with the requirements of Clause of ASNZS .
The erection sequence assumed in the design is shown on the Drawings . .
Upon completion of erection all temporary bracing shall be removed and holes plugged and steel made good in accordance with ASNZS .
Clause .. . During erection no steel shall be cut or heated or welded or drilled .
Drifting may only be used for bringing parts into position and not to match unfair holes or enlarge holes or distort metal . .
Permanent bolting of box girders shall not be carried out until the correct alignment and level has been obtained including any precamber allowance necessary. . BOLTED JOINTS .. GENERAL .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings all bolts and nuts for field joints shall be High Strength Friction Grip Bolts complying with ASNZS .
Grade .. .. BOLT INSTALLATION AND TIGHTENING .
High Strength Bolts shall be installed and tightened in accordance with Clause .
of ASNZS and all bolts shall be installed and tightened in accordance with procedures detailed in the Drawings. . CONSTRUCTION TOLERANCES .
Measurements of length shall be checked with a standard steel measuring tape or band corrected to a standard temperature of C. .
The Contractor shall allow in the fabrication of the girders for all weld distortion so that on completion of erection the dimensions of the fabricated members shall be correct within the tolerances specified in accordance with Appendix F of ASNZS and in addition shall not exceed the following a. Deviation from flatness and straightness of all exposed plate surfaces and edges or from specified surface in the case of curved surfaces .
mm in m straight edge in any direction Specification Structural Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name b .
Length of beam mm c. Deviation from specified alignment at points of support mm d. Deviation from specified alignment elsewhere mm e. Deviation from specified profile measured along edge of box girder mm f. Maximum permitted angular rotation of any crosssection relative to its specified location .
degrees .
CALIBRATION AND VALIDATION .
The Contractor shall be responsible for the appropriate calibration or validation of measuring inspection and testing equipment used for assessing the quality of the construction .
e . QUALITY RECORDS .
All records specified as part of the MDR shall be retained by the WSP for a minimum period of years . .
Inspection of the erection shall comply with ASNZS Clause .. An inspection report is to be prepared including the details of the competent person the date of inspection identification of the item to be inspected and the results of the inspection .

and complete Annexure A. .

or unfabricated .

is included unaltered . .
Clause .
should generally be retained unless the Contract is for erection only .

SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the supply fabrication protective treatment and delivery of steel expansion joint protection angles roadside furniture signage and poles and associated steel items including dowels bolts nuts screws and washers. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS ISO Metric Hexagon Bolts and Screws Product Grades A and B AS ISO Metric Hexagon Bolts and Screws Product Grades C AS ISO Metric Hexagon Nuts Including Thin Nuts Slotted Nuts and Castle Nuts AS Hotdip Galvanised Coatings on Threaded Fasteners ISO Metric Coarse Thread Series AS Plain Washers for Metric Bolts Screws and Nuts for General Engineering Purposes AS Metric Screw Threads for Fasteners AS ISO Metric Hexagon Socket Head Cap Screws AS Electroplated Zinc Electrogalvanised Coatings on Ferrous Articles Batch Process AS Fasteners Electroplated Coatings AS Wrought Alloy Steels Stainless Steel Bars and Semi finished Products AS Steel Structures Australian New Zealand Standards ASNZS Coldformed Structural Steel Hollow Sections Specification Minor Steel Items Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ASNZS .

QUALITY CONTROL AND WORKMANSHIP .. CONSTRUCTION CATEGORY .
Unless otherwise noted Construction Category CC applies to all minor steel components supplied fabricated and erected in conformity to this Specification. . Where the Designer allocates a Construction Category other than CC to a fabricated component or structural element this will be noted on the Design Drawing .
. . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
STRUCTURAL STEEL FOR PLATES BARS AND SECTIONS .
Structural steel for plates bars and sections shall conform to the requirements of ASNZS Grade and ASNZS .
grade unless noted otherwise on the Drawings or the Specification .
Specification Minor Steel Items Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Structural steel hollow sections shall conform to the requirements of ASNZS .
Unless noted otherwise on the drawings sections with a nominal thickness less than mm shall be Grade and sections with a nominal thickness equal to or greater than mm shall be Grade L. . BOLTS NUTS SCREWS AND WASHERS .
All bolts nuts screws and washers shall conform with the relevant Australian Standards listed in Clause .. . High strength bolts with associated nuts and washers shall be manufactured in accordance with ASNZS .
and installed in accordance with ASNZS .
The length of the bolt shall be as shown on the Drawings or if no length is shown shall be in accordance with ASNZS . . All screw threads shall conform to the ISO coarse pitch series thread in accordance with AS . . Before the application of corrosion protection tolerance of screw threads a. for bolts conforming to ASNZS .
shall be Class g and b. for bolts conforming to AS .
shall be Class g. . Before the application of corrosion protection tolerances of nut threads for a. nuts conforming to ASNZS .
shall be Class H and b. nuts conforming to AS .
shall be Class H . The galvanising of fasteners is to be in accordance with AS .
After galvanising the galvanised nuts shall be tapped oversize in accordance with AS . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings nuts other than those for high strength bolts shall be normal size .
The strength grade of normal nuts to be associated with each strength grade of the bolt Ubolt screw stud or other threaded component shall be as follows Specification Minor Steel Items Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name Grade of bolt Ubolt etc .
Strength Grade of Nut . . . .
The strength grade required for grades A and B precision bolts and screws shall be as shown on the Drawings . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings the stainless steel used in the manufacture of nonhigh strength bolts nuts and dowels shall conform to ISO Grade L for welded components or Grade for nonwelded components .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings the stainless steel used in the manufacture of high strength bolts and nuts shall conform to American Iron and Steel Institute Grade Mo and have a minimum ultimate tensile strength of MPa . .
Prevailing torque locknuts also known as selflocking nuts shall be the insert type having a nylon or similar plastic insert such as Nyloc nuts or similar approved by the Superintendent .
Those used with commercial grade bolts or Ubolts shall strength grade or higher . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings the following types of washers shall be used a .
With precision bolts bright metal washers normal series b .
With commercial bolts black metal washers normal series c. With stainless steel bolts stainless steel washers Grade normal series. . Washers are generally not required under socket head cap screws . .
Acceptance of bolts nuts and washers shall be through test certificates that state that the bolts nuts and washers comply with all the provisions of ASNZS ..
These test certificates shall be provided by the manufacturer or bolt importer and these certificates shall be supported by test reports from an independent laboratory accredited by signatories to the ILAC MRA or the APLAC MRA .
Alternatively the test certificates with supporting test reports can be provided by the testing laboratory on behalf of the manufacturer importer or customer .. .
TESTING AND IDENTIFICATION OF MATERIAL .
The Contractor shall ensure that all materials or parts conform with the tests required by the standards and with other tests specified in this Part of the Specification. . Test certificates showing the results of mechanical tests and chemical analysis where applicable of the material or parts used in the Works shall be retained by the Contractor .
Specification Minor Steel Items Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All materials or parts used in the Works shall be identified with the tests .
The Contractor shall establish and maintain a comprehensive system of identification records .
Copies of all these records shall be forwarded to the Superintendent on request. . DAMAGED STEEL .
Steel which is bent except as required for fabrication damaged or excessively rusted shall not be used in the Works . .
STORAGE OF MATERIALS .
All steel whether fabricated or not shall be stored in such a manner that corrosion is minimised .
Generally storage at least mm above the ground on platforms slabs or other supports under cover will be satisfactory. . Bolts nuts screws and washers not promptly incorporated in the work shall be stored in a waterproof shelter clear of the ground and protected from damage . .
ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES .
Details of the procedures for assembly and fabrication shall be submitted with the Contractors Quality Plan .
These procedures shall be comprehensive and shall cover all aspects of the work .
The procedures shall include but not be limited to Quality Plan a .
Assembly procedures including dimensional control and details of manufacturing jigs b. Welding procedures c. Qualification of welds including stud welding d. Qualification and identification of welders e. Qualification of welding supervisors f. System of identification of welders with work g. Quality control measures h. Quality control check lists and forms i .
System for identification of components j .
Procedures for trial assembly k. Procedures for repair of nonconforming materials components and assemblies l. Procedures for transport handling and storage including measures to prevent distortion and damage to the steelwork and its protective coating Specification Minor Steel Items Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name m. Procedure for curving .
At least one week prior to commencing fabrication the Contractor shall submit a programme to the Superintendent showing the proposed sequence of operations .
HOLD POINT .
ACCEPTANCE OF PROTOTYPE COMPONENTS .
The Contractor shall give working days notice in writing before commencing work and this shall be allowed for in the programme .
For the first item of any component fabricated the Contractor shall make a thorough dimensional check .
The Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent details of this dimensional check and certification that the dimensions are in conformity with the requirement of the Drawings and the Specification .
No further fabrication work on similar items shall be carried out until submission of this certification .
HOLD POINT .
IDENTIFICATION MARKS .
Each component shall be metal stamped with an identification mark which remains recognisable after protective treatment but which is located in a hidden or inconspicuous position after erection .
Each type of component shall be designated with a mark which is readily distinguishable from the marks for all other types .
Identification . . NOT USED FABRICATION .
CUTTING AND EDGE TREATMENT .
Steelwork may be cut by flame cutting sawing machining or guillotining unless specified otherwise .
Surfaces produced by such cutting shall be finished square unless a bevelled edge is called for and true to the required dimensions .
Shearing by nibbling action shall not be permitted. . Cut edges shall be finished as specified in Clause .
of ASNZS .
Guillotined plates shall be cut to an oversize sufficient for the correct dimensions to be achieved after edge finishing .
Where galvanising is specified the edge surface preparation shall conform to the requirements specified in Clause .
of the Specification . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings all corners on cut edges shall be rounded to a radius of approximately .mm except where such edges are subsequently to be welded .
Rolled edges need not be rounded provided the corners have a similar radius. . SPLICES .
Except where shown on the Drawing splices shall not be permitted. . HOLES FOR BOLTING .
The diameters of the bolt holes shall be mm greater than the diameters of the bolts shown on the Drawings unless otherwise specified .
Specification Minor Steel Items Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Holes may be either drilled fullsize or reamed to fullsize after subdrilling or subpunching .
In all cases subdrilling may be substituted for sub punching and holes may be drilled from the solid metal instead of being subpunched or subdrilled and reamed provided such drilling is done with the material assembled in the same manner as is required for reamed work. . Subpunched and subdrilled holes shall be smaller in diameter than the nominal diameter of bolts by mm. . For subpunched holes the diameter of the die shall not exceed the diameter of the punch by more than mm .
Holes shall be clean cut without torn or ragged edges .
Reamed or drilled holes shall be cylindrical and perpendicular to the face of the member .
Reaming and drilling shall be done by mechanical means . .
Connecting parts shall be assembled and held securely while being reamed or drilled and shall be matchmarked before separating the parts .
Burrs on the outside surfaces shall be removed. . Holes for field connections may be subpunched or subdrilled and reamed or drilled from the solid to a hardened steel template not less than mm thick and all corresponding holes in the members to which they connect shall be reamed or drilled to the same template .
Alternatively these connections may be reamed or drilled with the members assembled. . WELDING .
All welding shall conform to Clause of ASNZS for Construction Category unless otherwise specified. . Weld quality shall be as nominated on the Drawings .
All weld spatter shall be removed before protective treatment is applied. . STUD SHEAR CONNECTORS .
Stud shear connectors and stud welding shall comply with the requirements of ASNZS .
except as varied by this Specification . .
Operators shall be qualified in accordance with Section .
of ASNZS ..
Operator Qualifications .
Any stud welds not meeting the requirements of ASNZS .
shall be rejected .
Repairs to defective welds except where allowed for in ASNZS .
shall not be allowed . .
FABRICATION COMPLIANCE AND TRACEABILITY .
Prior to dispatch of work from the fabrication shop the Contractor shall provide the Superintendent with certification that each item fabricated conforms to the requirements of the Drawings and the Specification .
HOLD POINT .
All steel items shall be fabricated by steel manufactures that have certified quality systems to ISO or ASNZS .
Specification Minor Steel Items Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Steel items shall be traced from the point of manufacture to its final location in accordance with ASNZS for Construction Category . .
PROTECTIVE TREATMENT .. GENERAL .
All minor items of steelwork shall be hot dip galvanised unless otherwise specified .
Galvanise .
All protective treatment including hot dip galvanising shall be in accordance with Specification PROTECTIVE TREATMENT OF STEEL WORK unless otherwise specified .
..
PROTECTIVE TREATMENT FOR BOLTS NUTS ETC . .
Stainless steel items do not require protective treatment . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings all other bolts Ubolts screws nuts and washers shall be protected with the following protective treatment Item to be Protected Protective Treatment High strength bolts and associated nuts and washers and Commercial bolts screws and Ubolts and associated nuts and washers Hotdip galvanised in accordance with AS Precision bolts and screws and associated nuts and washers Prevailing torque locknuts Electroplated with zinc in conformity with the principles of AS or for sizes over M of AS Classification FeZn c Type C Socket head cap screws Blueblack or chemical black finish plus a residual coating of light oil .
Prior to placing into position in the bridge socket head cap screws shall be degreased and coated with approved zinc rich epoxy based primer. . TRANSPORT HANDLING AND STORAGE .
The Contractor shall ensure that loading transport unloading stacking and handling operations are carried out in such a way that the items are protected from distortion and that galvanised surfaces are protected from damage .
The Contractor shall store components in such a manner that the freshly galvanised surfaces are protected from the attack of white rust .

Specification Bridge Balustrades Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name SPECIFICATION BRIDGE BALUSTRADE GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the supply fabrication protective treatment and erection of steel handrailing and balustrading. . Minor steel items are covered in Specification . . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Technical Drawings AS .
Graphical Symbols for General Engineering Welding and Nondestructive Examination AS ISO Metric Hexagon Bolts and Screws Product Grade Commercial AS ISO Metric Hexagon Nuts Including Thin nuts Slotted Nuts and Castle Nuts AS Structural Steel Hollow Sections AS Plain Washers for Metric Bolts Screws and Nuts for General Purposes AS Steel Structures AustralianNew Zealand Standards ASNZS High Strength Bolts with Associated Nuts and Washers for Structural Engineering ASNZS .
Structural Steel Welding Welding of Steel Structures ASNZS .
Structural Steel Welding Stud Welding steel studs to steel ASNZS Structural Steel Hot Rolled Plates Floorplates and Slabs ASNZS Structural Steel Hot Rolled Bars and Sections Specification Bridge Balustrades Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ASNZS Welding consumables Covered electrodes for manual metal arc Of nonalloy and fine grain steels Classification ASNZS ISO Welding consumables Tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and ongas shielded metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels Classification ISO MOD ASNZS ISO Welding consumables Tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded Metal arc welding of creepresisting steels Classification ISO MOD ASNZS ISO Welding consumables Tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded And nongas shielded metal arc welding of highstrength steel Classification ISO MOD MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification MINOR STEEL ITEMS Specification PROTECTIVE TREATMENT OF STEEL WORK . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
SPECIFICATIONS FOR STEEL .. GENERAL .
All materials supplied by the Contractor shall be new and shall conform to the standards specified below .
New Steel .
Unless otherwise specified all structural steel sections shall be Grade in accordance with ASNZS .
Standards .. RHS RAILS AND POSTS .
Structural steel hollow sections shall conform to the requirements of AS and shall be Grade unless noted otherwise on the Drawings .
RHS .
TEST CERTIFICATES .
The Contractor shall ensure that all materials conform to the tests required by the standards .
Certificates .
Test certificates showing the results of mechanical tests and chemical analysis where applicable of the material used in the Works shall be retained by the Contractor .
Specification Bridge Balustrades Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
IDENTIFICATION RECORDS .
All materials used in the Works shall be identified with the test certificates .
The Contractor shall establish and maintain a comprehensive system of identification records .
Copies of all these records shall be forwarded to the Superintendent on request .
ID Records .
IDENTIFICATION MARKS .
Each item of steelwork shall have its own item mark number which shall be used on all related schedules and documents .
This mark shall be clearly indicated and remain recognisable after protective treatment on all members by durable identification marks to enable accurate identification on site .
Each type of component shall be designated with a mark which is readily distinguishable from the marks for all other types .
ID Marks .
STORAGE .
All steel whether fabricated or not shall be stored in such a manner that corrosion is minimised .
Generally storage at least mm above the ground on platforms slabs or other supports and under cover will be satisfactory .
Excessively rusted or bent or damaged steel shall be rejected by the Superintendent .
. . NOT USED FABRICATION .
GENERAL .
All steelwork shall be fabricated as shown on the Drawings and in accordance with the requirements of AS except as varied by this Specification . .
The Contractor shall supply fabricate transport and erect all railing to the deck and approaches of the bridge as shown on the Drawings .
The railing shall be fabricated from steel sections. . SHOP DRAWINGS .
The Contractor shall prepare Shop Drawings to show details of fabrication which are not explicit on the Drawings .
Details required include dimensions angles cambering profiles splice locations weld preparation details and any CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS. . Four copies of the shop drawings certified by the Contractor as complying with the above requirements shall be submitted to the Superintendent working days before fabrication commences .
HOLD POINT .
The Contractor shall be responsible for the correctness of the shop drawings .
Acceptance of the shop drawings by the Superintendent shall not relieve the Contractor of any responsibility .
Specification Bridge Balustrades Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
VERTICALITY OF POSTS AND BALUSTERS .
All balusters and posts shall be vertical as shown on the Drawings .
The Contractors attention is drawn to the need to detail individually angled brackets and joints to ensure that this requirement is met. . CURVING OF RAILS .
Where the rails are shown on the Drawings to be curved they shall be curved to form that shape without excessive springing forces being applied to the posts .
The methods adopted for curving the rails shall be such as not to excessively distort the section or damage the material . .
CUTTING AND EDGE TREATMENT .
Steelwork may be cut by flame cutting sawing or guillotining unless specified otherwise .
Surfaces produced by such cutting shall be finished square unless a bevelled edge is called for and true to the required dimensions .
Shearing by nibbling action shall not be permitted. . Cut edges shall be finished as specified in AS .
The edge surface preparation shall conform to the requirements specified for galvanising . .
Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings all corners on cut edges shall be rounded to a radius of approximately .mm except where such edges are subsequently to be welded. . SPLICES .
Posts shall not contain splices . .
The location of any splices required in the rails additional to those shown on the Drawings shall be subject to approval by the Superintendent. . BOLTING .. HOLES FOR BOLTING .
All bolt holes shall be drilled to a diameter mm larger than the diameter of the bolt unless otherwise shown on the Drawings. . Reamed or drilled holes shall be cylindrical and perpendicular to the face of the member .
Reaming and drilling shall be done by mechanical means .
.. BOLT SPECIFICATION .
Manufacture Grade .
bolts shall comply with AS and nuts shall comply with AS .
Plain washers shall comply with AS .
Grade .
bolts and associated nuts and washers shall comply with ASNZS . .
Installation Bolt installation shall be in accordance with AS . . WELDING .
All welding shall be in accordance with ASNZS .. All welds shall be Category SP unless otherwise shown on the Drawings .
Specification Bridge Balustrades Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All electrodes used for manual welding shall conform to ASNZS .
Flux cored electrodes used for semiautomatic welding shall conform to AS . . All weld spatter shall be removed before protective treatment is applied . .
PROTECTIVE TREATMENT .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings all steel components covered by this Specification shall be hotdip galvanised in accordance with Specification PROTECTIVE TREATMENT OF STEELWORK. . TRANSPORT HANDLING AND STACKING .
The Contractor shall ensure that loading transport unloading stacking and handling operations are carried out in such a way that all steelwork shall be protected from distortion and that galvanised surfaces are protected from damage .
The Contractor shall store components in such a manner that the freshly galvanised surfaces are protected from the attack of white rust .
. . NOT USED ERECTION .
GENERAL .
Erection of steel railing shall comply with the requirements of AS . . After fabrication all weld splatter and slag shall be removed by suitable mechanical means and all sharp edges and rough welds rounded off. . TOLERANCES .
The finished railing shall be erected to the tolerances set out below a .
Variation from true plan positions of posts mm b .
Variation of dimensions in elevation mm c. Variation of line of rails from specified vertical and horizontal profile mm .
The final appearance of the bridge will depend very much on the profile of the railings and therefore in addition to the above tolerances the Contractor shall take every care to ensure that the railings are erected to smooth curves which reflect the design profiles of the bridge .
In particular the Contractor shall ensure that a smooth profile is maintained in the top rail after all site connections have been completed .

and should be varied as required to suit .

should generally be retained unless the Contract is for erection only . .
REMOVAL OF EXISTING BALUSTRADE Clause . .
If the Contract includes the removal of existing balustrade Clause .
should be included in the CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS. . Where necessary this clause can be edited to include the storage site for the removed balustrade if salvageable for reuse or disposed to an offsite tip. . SHOP DRAWINGS .
Shop drawings provide an assurance that the requirement for vertical posts and balusters and smooth profiles of rails have been interpreted correctly and adequately detailed . .
This requirement is generally necessary in urban bridges but generally not necessary in straight rural bridges in which case Clauses .
to .
may generally be deleted and references to Australian Standards no longer relevant should be deleted .

Associated Materials .
REMOVAL OF EXISTING BALUSTRADE .
The existing posts and balustrade shall be removed from the bridge one side at a time in conjunction with the replacement of the overlay in such a manner as to minimise damage and allow the reuse of the materials .
Removal .
The removed materials shall be transported to a storage yard of the Principals nominated by the Superintendent .

SCOPE The work under this specification consists of the surface preparation galvanising and application of coating systems for the protective treatment of steelwork .

DEFINITIONS .
Definitions of painting terms contained in AS shall apply where used in the Specification or when used in relation to the Works .
Terms Unless otherwise specified all work required to achieve the specified protective treatment of steelwork in the completed structure shall be carried out in accordance with the recommended procedures and guidelines set out in ASNZS .
and ASNZS .
as appropriate .
Procedures .
PAINT SUPPLY .
All steelwork to be used in the works shall be painted in Australia using a paint system supplied from a company certified to ASNZS ISO .
Specification Protective Treatment of Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All paint products used in the Works shall be approved by the Australian Paint Approval Scheme. . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
COATING SYSTEMS .. GALVANISING .
Galvanised coatings shall be carried out in accordance with ASNZS subject to the adoption of surface preparation or other procedures where necessary to avoid a. brittle uneven andor loosely adhering coatings on flame cut edges b. pinholes in galvanised coatings along welds and c. white rust ferrous rust and other surface contamination or stains which diminish the appearance or function of the galvanised coating. . At least days prior to the application of the galvanised coating the Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent details of procedures which eliminate the above coating deficiencies .
HOLD POINT ..
PAINT COATING SYSTEMS FOR STEEL .
After priming permanently exposed surfaces of ungalvanised steelwork shall be painted with an intermediate coat of paint followed by finishing coats paint complying with APAS . .
The Contractor shall also carry out protective treatment on site using pack zincrich epoxy primer conforming to AS .
for areas of steel members which have been site welded .
Refer also Clause .. . Each coating type shall be of a different colour or shade to ensure adequate coverage and ease of inspection . .
Surface treatment shall be in accordance with the requirements of ASNZS .
and ASNZS .
except as varied by this Specification .
.. SPECIAL AREAS .
Areas in Contact With Concrete Areas of steelwork in contact with concrete in the completed structure shall receive the same surface preparation and shop applied coatings as that employed on adjacent exposed areas for a minimum distance of mm from the exposed surface .
Areas further than mm from an exposed surface shall be left unpainted .
Note Inorganic zinc silicate is not recommended for casting in concrete .
Specification Protective Treatment of Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
FrictionType Bolted Joints The faying surfaces of frictiontype bolted connections designed to AS .
shall be prepared and tested in accordance with Clause .. ASNZS . .
Hollow Members The treatment of hollow members shall be as follows a. Galvanised Members Internal surfaces of galvanised members shall be galvanised according to ASNZS .
b .
Painted Members The inner surfaces of fully sealed hollow sections shall receive no protective treatment except that all surfaces shall be dry and free of all loose materials. . Site Welded Connections Where surfaces are to be welded all surface protection shall be removed for a minimum distance of mm from the edge to be welded in order to prevent harmful effects to welders or to the quality of welds .
Reinstatement is in accordance with Clause .. . GENERAL REQUIREMENTS AND INFORMATION TO BE PROVIDED BY CONTRACTOR .. SHOP AND FIELD TREATMENT .
Shop treatment shall comprise the galvanising or the abrasive blast cleaning of all surfaces plus the application of all paint coatings specified except that a .
Areas adjacent to field welds shall be masked to leave an uncoated margin of mm for the first coat and an additional mm margin for each subsequent coat .
b .
The final finishing coat of a multicoat system on exterior exposed surfaces may be applied on site following the completion of all construction activities that may cause damage to the coatings. . Field treatment shall comprise the application of remaining finishing coats and the repair of the protective treatment at all field weld areas and at areas damaged in the course of construction . .
Prior to the application of any treatment the Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent the proposed details of work to be carried out by shop treatment and that to be carried out by field treatment .
HOLD POINT .
The details shall include a program of the work covering the following Specification Protective Treatment of Steelwork Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name a .
The proposed timing for carrying out repairs to the protective treatment at areas in contact with concrete .
b .
The proposed timing for carrying out protective treatment to the surfaces which are inaccessible in the completed structure and outside of field welds .
..
PAINT .
All paints shall be supplied by a single manufacturer .
Paints shall be Australian Paint Approval Scheme APAS approved products conforming to the nominated APAS Specifications and approved by the Principal for the specified application .
.At least fourteen days prior to commencing the protective treatment of steelwork the Contractor shall submit the following details for the Superintendents approval HOLD POINT a .
Name of paint manufacturer .
b .
Product names of paints .
c. Technical data sheets and hazard information for all paints .
d. Documentary evidence from the manufacturer certifying compliance of paints with relevant APAS Specifications .
..
TESTING .
Testing of the paint to assess conformity to Specifications shall be included in the Contractors Inspection and Test Plan .
