For convenience the full titles are given below MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification BITUMINOUS SURFACING Specification POLYMER MODIFIED BITUMINOUS SURFACING Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES MAIN ROADS Standards GUIDELINES FOR THE TIMING OF BITUMINOUS SURFACING TREATMENTS GUIDELINES FOR THE APPLICATION OF WATERPROOF MEMBRANES TO BRIDGE DECKS . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
STRIP MEMBRANES .
All waterproof strip membranes shall be Bituthene products or similar approved .
An alternative strip membrane with properties similar to that of Bituthene or may be used subject to the approval of the Superintendent. . Waterproof strip membranes shall be applied at the following locations andor as shown on the Drawings a .
To the longitudinal strip between the bridge deck and the mortar bedding to the precast kerbing .
Specification Waterproof Membrane Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name b .
To the back face of all contraction and construction joints in abutments and retaining walls .
c. Locations where precast elements abut or join. . Bituthene shall only be applied to a surface that does not require subsequent asphalt surfacing. . Bituthene shall be applied to the top surface of the bridge deck as shown on the Drawings. . PRIMER .
A water or solvent based primer shall be used to bond the strip membrane to the concrete substrate .
The primer shall be compatible for use with the membrane system and applied in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements .
. . NOT USED PREPARATION .
CLEANING .
The Contractor shall ensure that the minimum concrete curing period has been achieved prior to the removal of the curing method in accordance with Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES . .
The Contractor shall remove all dust loose or adherent matter from the surface of the deck . .
The Contractor shall remove all of the curing agent film or matter from the surface of the deck by an appropriate method .
Curing Agent . . NOT USED APPLICATION .
STRIP MEMBRANE .
The Contractor shall allow the concrete to air dry after removal of the curing material or method prior to the application of the strip membrane system for a minimum period as per the following a .
Where a solvent based primer is to be used as part of the strip membrane system the minimum airdrying period shall be days .
b .
Where a water based primer is to be used as part of the strip membrane system the minimum airdrying period shall be days .
c. Where alternative products require longer airdrying time than specified above then the minimum airdrying time shall be in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements .
Specification Waterproof Membrane Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Prior to the application of the strip membrane the Contractor shall demonstrate to the Superintendent that all curing agent film or matter has been removed and the concrete deck has dried sufficiently to meet the requirements of the strip membrane application procedures of the manufacturer .
HOLD POINT .
The strip membrane shall be applied in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements. . All joints in the strip membrane shall have a minimum overlap of mm . .
The strip membrane shall not be exposed to direct sunlight during periods of hot weather and shall be temporarily covered with a suitable reflective foil laminate to reduce the occurrence of blisters and bubbles developing in the membrane .
Exposure .
If blisters or bubbles are evident in the strip membrane prior to the application of a bituminous seal on a bridge deck they shall be repaired before application of the bituminous seal .
Blistering .
BITUMINOUS SEAL .
If blisters or bubbles are evident prior to the application of bituminous seal on a bridge deck they shall be repaired before the application of the bituminous seal. . A bituminous seal shall be applied by either of the following methods a .
Where conventional bituminous sealing is to be applied a dilute emulsion prime and a waterproof rubberised seal shall be applied in accordance with Specification BITUMINOUS SURFACING and the Drawings .
The bituminous seal shall be applied to the surface of the bridge deck within hours of the strip membrane being placed .
b .
Where polymer modified bituminous PMB sealing is to be applied a dilute emulsion prime and a waterproof seal shall be applied in accordance with Specification POLYMER MODIFIED BITUMINOUS SURFACING and the Drawings .
The bituminous seal shall be applied to the surface of the bridge deck within hours of the strip membrane being placed .
PMB Seals .
The bituminous seal shall be allowed to cure to remove cutting oils prior to asphalt being placed .
The length of curing will vary depending on the quantity of cutting oil and the weather conditions at the time of curing .
Guidance is available in Main Roads document . . ASPHALT .
If blisters or bubbles are evident prior to the application of the asphalt on a bridge deck they shall be repaired before the application of the asphalt .
Blistering .
Asphalt shall not be applied if blistering is evident in the bituminous seal in areas of the bridge deck to be subjected to vehicle movements .
Specification Waterproof Membrane Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Prior to application of the asphalt the Contractor shall demonstrate to the Superintendent that the bituminous seal has been cured for a sufficient period of time to remove volatile oils .
HOLD POINT . . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED Specification Waterproof Membrane Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name GUIDANCE NOTES FOR REFERENCE ONLY DELETE GUIDANCE NOTES FROM FINAL DOCUMENT .
All edits to downloaded Specifications shall be made using Track Changes to clearly show addeddeleted text . .
If all information relating to a clause is deleted the clause number should be retained and the words NOT USED should be inserted . .
The proposed documents with tracked changes shall be submitted to the Project Manager for review prior to printing the final batch of documents .
When this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off. . Before printing accept all changes in the document turn off Track Changes and refresh the Table of Contents . .
The Custodian of this specification is the Structures Design and Standards Engineer . .
STRIP MEMBRANES .
The description of the extent of waterproofing membranes must be checked against the design Drawings and modified if appropriate. . BITUMINOUS SEAL .
Within Perth and its environs Main Roads WA policy is to apply rubberised seals in accordance with Specification BITUMINOUS SURFACING .
At sites distant from Perth a PMB seal in accordance with Specification POLYMER MODIFIED BITUMINOUS SURFACING may be applied in lieu of a rubberised seal due to the requirement for increased holding times .
At remote sites a PMB suited to site blending may be used .

NOT USED ANNEXURE A Cementitious Materials for Concrete Request for Registration by Manufacturer Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name SPECIFICATION CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS GENERAL .
SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of the mix design the supply and delivery placing compaction finishing curing and protection of concrete for general nonstructural works where normal N class concrete has been specified . .
Concrete for bridgeworks manufacture of reinforced concrete box culverts and other major structures is covered in Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES .
Major Concrete Structures .
REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Methods of Testing Concrete AS Specification and Supply of Concrete AS .
Chemical Admixtures for Concrete mortar and grout Admixtures for concrete AS .
Chemical Admixtures for concrete mortar and grout Methods of sampling and testing admixture for concrete mortar and grout AS Aggregates and Rock for Engineering Purposes Part Concrete Aggregates AS Concrete Structures .
AS .
Formwork for Concrete Part Documentation and surface finish AS Liquid Membraneforming Curing Compounds for Concrete AS General Purpose and Blended Cements AustralianNew Zealand Standards ASNZS Steel Reinforcing Materials Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name Other Standards Australian Technical Infrastructure Committee ATIC Specification SP Cementitious Materials for Concrete MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification QUALITY SYSTEMS Specification FALSEWORK Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES Specification FORMWORK Specification STEEL REINFORCEMENT .
DEFINITIONS .. GENERAL .
Concrete in general shall consist of a mixture of cement water coarse aggregate and fine aggregate .
Constituents .
The strength of concrete shall be defined as the average day compressive strength of a minimum of two standard mm diameter by mm long cylinders taken from the same sample and made and cured and tested in accordance with AS .
Strength ..
FINISHED CONCRETE .
In its finished state the concrete shall be sound dense durable free from honeycombing and shall have the strength and other properties specified .
Finished State .
The exposed surfaces shall be smooth and dust free and conform to the shape tolerances specified . .
Concrete shall comply with AS except as varied by the requirements of this Specification . .
AGGREGATE .
Fine aggregates for concrete shall be natural sand or a combination of natural and manufactured sand and shall comply with the requirements of AS ..
The maximum amount of water absorption for fine aggregates shall not exceed .
percent and .
percent respectively .
Fine Aggregates .
Coarse aggregates for concrete shall be crushed igneous rock or crushed or screened river gravel conforming to the requirements of AS ..
The maximum amount of water absorption for coarse aggregates shall not exceed .
percent .
Coarse Aggregates .
The durability of coarse aggregates shall be assessed according to test methods of AS ..
The acceptance criteria for these tests shall be that for a concrete exposure classification C unless otherwise specified .
Durability Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All aggregates proposed for use in the Works shall comply with the requirements of the AlkaliReactive Materials clause of AS ..
Aggregates that are classified as slowlyreactive or reactive shall not be used .
AlkaliReactive Materials .
The Contractor shall provide proper means of storing the aggregates .
Each nominal size of coarse aggregate and fine aggregate shall be kept separated and suitable precautions shall be taken to prevent the aggregates from being contaminated by the ground or by windblown dust or other foreign matter .
Storage .
The grading of the individual aggregates shall conform to the overall limits for these materials given in AS .. Sampling for the purposes of carrying out tests shall be in accordance with AS Testing .
Aggregates shall meet the durability criteria for concrete exposure classification C of AS ..
Aggregate Durability PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
CEMENT .
Unless otherwise specified all cement used in the works shall comply with the requirements of Type GP cement as specified in AS and Australian Technical Infrastructure Committee ATIC Specification SP .
The Contractor shall provide manufacturers test certificates showing all cement has been sampled tested and conforms in all respects with AS and ATIC Specification SP .
Testing .
Blended cement shall be a combination of Type GP cement and ground granulated iron blastfurnace slag complying with AS .
and ATIC Specification SP .
The densified silica fume to be added to the blended cement shall be finely divided and comply with ASNZS .
and ATIC Specification SP .
Blended Cement .
Cement for manufacture of concrete shall comply with the requirements of ATIC Specification SP .
The Cementitious Material Registration Scheme CMRS shall be used to confirm that the cement complies with ATIC Specification SP .
The standard application form for CMRS registration is given in Annexure A .
Certification .
Prior to manufacturing of concrete the Contractor shall confirm that the cement complies with ATIC Specification SP and shall provide the CMRS registration number for the cement to the Superintendent for approval of the cement .
HOLD POINT .
The Contractor shall use cement in approximately the chronological order in which it is delivered from the manufacturer .
Transportation units and storage bins for bulk cement shall be weatherproof and shall be constructed so that there is no dead storage .
The Contractor shall demonstrate that the storage bins for bulk cement do not have any dead storage .
If dead storage exists the bins shall be emptied completely at least once every three months .
Cement delivered in bags shall be stored in weatherproof structures having floors raised above the ground .
Cement that is more than three months old shall not be used .
Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Concrete manufactured from cement not conforming to this Specification or from cement that has deteriorated and become unsuitable for use shall be rejected .
ADMIXTURES .
Admixtures may be used in concrete to modify workability but will not be permitted for the purpose of reducing cement content .
However the admixture shall have no harmful effect whatsoever upon the quality of the concrete or upon any reinforcement or other fixture embedded therein .
Admixtures Compliance .
Any admixture when tested in accordance with AS .
shall comply with the requirements of and be used in accordance with AS .. . CLASS OF CONCRETE .
The Class of concrete shall be Normalclass as specified on the Drawings .
Normal Class Concrete .
Unless otherwise noted slump and aggregate size is as follows a .
Maximum aggregate size mm Aggregate Size b .
Maximum slump mm Slump .
Specifying Supply Parameters for Normalclass Concrete .
Normalclass concrete shall be specified in accordance with AS including all of the following Concrete Supply a .
Standard strength grade to be designated as one of N N N N or N Strength Grade b .
The slump at point of acceptance c. Intended method of placement d. The maximum nominal size of aggregate and e. Project assessment to provide additional test data if required by the supplier .
. . NOT USED OPERATIONS .
GENERAL .
Requirements for falsework shall be in accordance with Specification FALSEWORK .
Falsework .
Requirements for formwork shall be in accordance with Specification FORMWORK .
Formwork .
Requirements for steel reinforcement shall be in accordance with Specification STEEL REINFORCEMENT .
Reinforcement Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
MIXING OF CONCRETE .
Production and delivery for the concrete shall be in accordance with the requirements of AS except that additional water shall not be introduced into a mixed batch of concrete and the period for completion of discharge from the commencement of mixing shall not exceed minutes .
Batch Plant Transit Mixers .
PLACING OF CONCRETE .
Prior to the placement of any concrete the Contractor must certify to the Superintendent that all falsework formwork reinforcement levels placement procedures and curing procedures to be employed comply with the requirements of the Technical Specification .
HOLD POINT .
Before commencement of each concrete pour the Contractor must demonstrate to the Superintendent that sufficient vibrators and spares are available and tested .
The number of working vibrators required must not be less than one for each cubic metres of concrete placed per hour .
The number of standby vibrators must not be less than of the number of working vibrators with a minimum of one .
HOLD POINT .
Concrete shall be conveyed from onsite mixers to its final position without delay and by methods which will not permit segregation andor loss of material .
All the concrete shall be placed in its final position within ninety minutes of the materials having been placed in the mixer .
Transport Placing .
Concrete shall be placed in a manner which will prevent segregation .
Concrete shall be spread in horizontal layers with the first layer not exceeding mm in compacted thickness and the thickness of subsequent layers limited to of the length of the immersion vibrators used .
Placing shall be continuous between specified or approved construction joints. . During placing concrete shall be compacted using mechanical or pneumatic immersion vibrators to remove all voids and air bubbles .
Immersion vibrators shall have a frequency of not less than Hertz and where concrete Class or finish is specified shall be fitted with approved rubber caps .
The largest practical size of vibrator should be used .
Vibration .
Care shall be taken during placing to see that no foreign substances are included in the concrete .
Foreign Substances .
The location of all construction joints shall be as indicated on the Drawings or approved by the Superintendent .
Construction joints shall be made on true vertical and horizontal planes and the surface shall be roughened to remove all laitance and expose the aggregate to provide a thorough bond with concrete cast subsequently .
The roughened surface shall be thoroughly cleaned with water to remove loose chips and any foreign matter .
Immediately before fresh concrete is cast against the joint the hardened concrete surface shall be thoroughly wetted .
Construction Joints Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
TESTING .. GENERAL .
All minor structural works shall be tested in accordance with sub clauses and below and in accordance with Structural Concrete quality verification requirements in Specification QUALITY SYSTEMS .
General non structural concrete works may be accepted on the basis of project testing certification provided by the concrete supplier .
Testing Requirements .
Sampling and testing of concrete specimens shall be in accordance with AS Parts to .
Concrete test cylinders shall be mm diameter by mm long .
Rubber caps may be used for the capping of test cylinders as allowed in AS .. Sampling Testing .
The Contractor shall have available not less than concrete moulds slump cone and tray and rod .
.. COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH ANALYSIS .
Any batch of concrete shall be deemed to comply with the strength requirements of this specification if Compliance a .
Every concrete test specimen in the batch has a day compressive strength greater than of the characteristic strength and b .
The average day compressive strength of the concrete test specimens in the batch is equal to or greater than the characteristic strength. . CURING AND PROTECTION .
Freshly placed concrete shall be protected from the sun wind and rain and prevented from drying out too quickly. . All concrete surfaces shall be cured by one of the following methods for not less than five days a .
Continuous wetting .
b. Spraying with an approved curing compound complying with the requirements of AS .
Such curing compound shall be applied in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
c. Wrapping with polythene or similar film to provide an airtight cover .
d. Maintaining the formwork in position for the curing period . .
The Contractor shall ensure that the method of curing shall not result in any staining of exposed surfaces of concrete. . CONCRETING IN HOT WEATHER .
The requirements of AS for temperature of the concrete at the point of discharge shall be met for all concrete works undertaken in hot weather .
In addition placement of concrete shall only be permitted providing Placement Temperature Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name a. the concrete mix temperature during placement shall at no time exceed C Mix Temperature AND EITHER b. the ambient shade temperature does not exceed C and is falling Shade Temperature OR c. the ambient shade temperature is less than C and rising provided that the placement can be completed before the ambient temperature exceeds C. .
CONCRETE SURFACES .
The type of formed concrete surface finish shall be as shown on the Drawings and shall comply with the requirements of Section of AS ..
Formed Surface Finish .
The type of unformed surface finish shall be as shown on the Drawings and shall be in accordance with Table .
below .
Unformed Surface Finish TABLE .
UNFORMED SURFACE FINISHES FOR CONCRETE Designated Finish Type of Concrete Finish Maximum Allowable Surface Irregularities U A wood floated finish to produce a uniform surface without surface pitting or cavities mm abrupt or mm in a m template U A high quality steel trowelled finish having a dense smooth impervious finish without surface pitting or cavities Nil abrupt or mm in a m template U A high quality mechanical steel trowelled finish having a dense impervious finish without surface pitting or cavities mm abrupt or mm in a m template U A wood floated surface with a broomed finish mm abrupt or mm in a m template .
CONFORMANCE AND NONCONFORMANCE .
Concrete that shows evidence of poor workmanship such as honeycombing or is porous due to inadequate compaction or due to segregation or concrete that fails to comply with this Specification in regard to strength or tolerances or finishes or other requirements shall be deemed to be nonconforming .
NonConforming .
If at any time the concrete fails to meet any of the requirements of this specification concreting operations shall be suspended until corrective measures are taken at no cost to the Principal .
Operations Suspended Specification Concrete General Works Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name . . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS . . SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of all operations involved in the supply and installation of fencing and gates including concrete footings and fence materials of brick and limestone timber fibre cement sheet metal chainwire and agricultural fencing including electric fencing . .
Locations and types of fencing shall be as specified in Annexure A unless otherwise shown on the Drawings. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Steel tubes and tubulars for ordinary service AS Methods of testing soils for engineering purposes AS The specification and supply of concrete AS Tensile strength AS .
Preservative Treatment Sawn and Round Timber AS Timber structures AS Galvanised railless chainwire security fences and gates AS Timber hardwood visually graded for structural purposes AS Steel nails metric series AS Coated steel wire fencing products for terrestrial aquatic and general use AS Timber softwood visually graded for structural purposes AS Masonry structures Australian Standards New Zealand Standards ASNZS ColdFormed Structural Steel Hollow Sections Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ASNZS .
Built in components for masonry construction Wall Ties ASNZS .
Cellulose Cement Products Part Corrugated Sheets AS NZS Electrical installations AS NZS Electrical installations electric fences AS NZS Zinc and zincaluminium alloy coatings on steel wire AS NZS Steel reinforcing materials AS NZS Hot dipped galvanised zinc coatings on fabricated ferrous articles MAIN ROADS Test Methods MRWA .
Dry Density Ratio MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification GENERAL REQUIREMENTS Specification QUALITY SYSTEMS Specification ENVIRONMENT Specification CLEARING Specification EARTHWORKS Specification MINOR STEEL ITEMS Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS Specification ANTIGRAFFITI . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
CONCRETE FOOTINGS .
Concrete used in the construction of footings and any other concrete elements of fencing shall be in accordance with the Drawings and Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS . .
Concrete shall be Class N unless otherwise specified in the Drawings . .
Reinforcing steel used in the construction of reinforced concrete footings columns coping and any other reinforced concrete elements of fencing shall be in accordance with ASNZS and Specification .
Reinforcing Steel Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
BRICKS .
Bricks used in the construction of panels piers and any other brick elements of fencing shall be clay bricks uniform in shape texture colour and size with sharp arises free from distortion and other defects .
Bricks shall have a minimum compressive strength of MPa .
Brick Properties .
Bricks shall be in accordance with the dimensions and colours as shown on the Drawings .
Dimensions and Colours .
Wall ties shall be in accordance with ASNZS .. . LIMESTONE BLOCKS .
Limestone used in the construction of panels piers or any other limestone element of fencing shall be either sawn limestone blocks or reconstituted limestone blocks .
All blocks shall be of a high standard and supplied from the same source to ensure a uniform colour .
Sawn limestone shall be free from dust topsoil vegetation or fine material .
Limestone blocks shall have a minimum density of kgm .
Limestone Properties .
A degree of chipping to sawn corners and flaws in limestone blockwalls will be acceptable subject to the Superintendents approval and quantified by samples .
Patching or repairs of limestone blocks will not be accepted .
Blocks used for piers and pier cappings shall be selected for evenness of texture colour and hard sharp edges .
Quality .
Limestone blocks shall be in accordance with the dimensions as shown on the Drawings .
Dimensions .
MORTAR .
Mortar shall comply with AS .
Mortar shall consist of part of Portland Cement part of lime putty and parts of yellow builders sand .
The measured parts in mixes shall be mixed mechanically to an even colour and consistency with the minimum amount of water for workability Components and Proportions .
Where specified admixtures shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations. . Mortar colour shall be in accordance with that detailed on the Drawings .
Colouring pigments shall be thoroughly mixed with the cement before adding other components .
Mortar colour for limestone fencing shall match closely that of the surrounding limestone blockwork .
Limestone Fencing .
STEELWORK .
All steelwork used in the construction of steel sheet fencing including panels posts tracks and connection fittings shall be in accordance with the Drawings and the manufacturers published specifications .
Sheets shall have uniform colour shape and size free from defects .
Steel Sheet Fencing Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All steelwork used in the construction of fibre cement fencing including capping verge posts and connection fittings shall be in accordance with the Drawings and the manufacturers published specifications Fibre Cement Fencing .
All structural steelwork used to support pine timber lap panelling shall be in accordance with the Drawings and Specification MINOR STEEL ITEMS .
Pine Lap Fencing .
All steelwork used in the construction of chain mesh and agricultural fencing including wire posts droppers pipe mesh and connection fittings shall be in accordance with the Drawings and comply with the following Australian Standards andor specifications and requirements as may be otherwise noted .
Agricultural and Chain Mesh Fencing a .
Wire products and wire coating to AS .
b .
Steel pipes to AS and AS Steel line posts shall be star pickets punched and pointed finished either galvanised or black varnished and of the length shown in the Drawings .
c. Steel droppers shall be galvanised and of the length shown on the Drawings .
d. All galvanising of components as required to ASNZS and ASNZS .
e. Chainwire to AS .
All wire size and spacing shall be in accordance with the Drawings . .
TIMBER .. GENERAL .
All hardwood timber used in the construction of fencing including strainers rails struts and line posts shall be Jarrah or white gum sound free from knots decay and insect decay in the sapwood .
Hardwood Timber .
Hardwood timber shall be in accordance with AS . . All sawn timber used in the construction of fencing shall be seasoned pine white gum or jarrah and having a minimum Structural Grade F in accordance with AS and AS .
Sawn Timber .
All pine wood material used in the construction of fencing shall be CCA Copper Chrome Arsenic pressure treated in accordance with AS .
unless otherwise stated .
CCA Treatment .
Steel nails shall be manufactured in accordance with AS .
Nails .
All nails shall be hot dipped galvanised to gm coating mass all in accordance with ASNZS .
Galvanising .
Timber shall be in accordance with the dimensions as shown on the Drawings .
Dimensions Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ..
TIMBER TOLERANCES .
Insect Holes Subject to the Superintendents approval clean holes which are isolated and not in groups free from insect life and decay and less than mm in diameter will be tolerated provided the density of the timber is not unduly affected .
Insect Holes .
Gum Veins Subject to the Superintendents approval gum veins will be accepted provided they are clean tight gum veins as distinct from gum pockets or cavities free from decayed tissue and are not closer together than mm .
Gum Veins .
Waney Edges Subject to the Superintendents approval sapwood on the corner of a piece of sawn timber shall not be cause for rejection unless it exceeds mm on either face of the piece .
Waney Edges .
Shrinkage The sizes shown on the Drawings are nominal sizes .
The timber shall have a tolerance on the specified size of mm mm .
Shrinkage .
Deviation Hardwood timber shall not exceed mm deviation from straightness when measured from a stringline or straight edge over the length of the individual element as dimensioned on the Drawings .
Deviation .
FIBRE CEMENT .
Fibre cement sheeting used in the construction of corrugated fencing shall be of a high standard and supplied from the same source .
Sheets shall be uniform in shape colour and size free from distortion and other defects .
They shall consist of Portland Cement ground sand cellulose fibre and water in accordance with ASNZS .
and have a density of .kgm .
Fibre Cement Properties .
Sheets shall be in accordance with the dimensions and colours as shown on the Drawings .
Dimensions and Colours .
ELECTRIC FENCE COMPONENTS .
Components used in the installation of electric fences including but not limited to energisers earth grounding systems leadout cables insulators clamps switches and offset brackets shall be in accordance with ASNZS .
No components other than those detailed in the manufacturers published specifications shall be used without prior approval from the Superintendent .
Electric Fence Components .
GATES .
Gate frames for agricultural and chainwire fences shall be manufactured from circular hollow section steel complying with ASNZS and galvanised in accordance with ASNZS .
Gates for other fence types shall be manufactured in accordance with the relevant manufacturers published specifications . .
Mesh prefabricated wire and other wire products shall be in accordance with Clause .. Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Other minor fittings such as hinges bolts and the like shall be manufactured from steel in accordance with the Drawings and Specification MINOR STEEL ITEMS as appropriate and hotdipped galvanised in accordance with the requirements of ASNZS .
. . NOT USED SAMPLING AND TESTING OF MASONRY WORKS .
BRICKS .
The Contractor shall submit samples of brickwork units with the manufacturers certificate for approval to the Superintendent before placing orders .
The manufacturers certificate shall show compressive strength tensile strength and absorption values of the bricks .
The samples shall indicate the full range of texture and colour and consist of at least six units .
Units built into the Works shall conform to and fall within the range of appearance properties of the approved samples .
HOLD POINT .
LIMESTONE BLOCKS .
The Contractor shall submit samples of limestone block units with the manufacturers certificate for approval to the Superintendent before placing orders .
The samples shall indicate the full range of texture and colour and consist of at least six units .
Units built into the Works shall conform to and fall within the range of appearance properties of the approved samples .
HOLD POINT .
MORTAR .
Samples of mortar shall be prepared for the Works for the approval of the Superintendent .
Mortar used in the Works shall conform to the approved mix and samples .
Samples .
When tested in accordance with AS mortar shall achieve compressive strength of at least .MPa for samples taken from site mixes and .MPa for samples taken from laboratory mixes .
Preparation and Test Results .
A mortar compression test shall be undertaken at the laboratory at the beginning of the Works to establish the compressive strength as required by the Specification .
The Contractor shall undertake mortar compression tests using site mixes on a regular basis to maintain the required compressive strength results .
Frequency of testing on site shall be one test every m of fence or part thereof .
Method of sampling and testing shall be in accordance with AS .
Sampling Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
SAMPLE MASONRY .
The Contractor shall construct a full height sample of masonry fence as part of the Works and for the approval of the Superintendent .
The sample fence shall consist of one full width panel and two piers one at either end to the dimensions specified on the Drawings .
Joints shall be finished in accordance with the Drawings .
The Works shall conform to the approved sample fence .
Masonry work associated with the Works shall not commence until the sample fence has been approved by the Superintendent .
The sample panel and piers may be a section of the fence .
HOLD POINT .
Nonmasonry infill panels are not required to be included as part of the sample for approval .
Infill Panels . . NOT USED EARTHWORKS .
GENERAL .
This Section of the Specification covers clearing and earthworks for the construction of the fencing footings and driving or sinking of strainers and posts and includes clearing excavation foundation improvement and backfilling. . CLEARING AND TOPSOIL REMOVAL .
Prior to the commencement of any clearing operations the Contractor shall certify to the Superintendent that clearing areas are correctly defined .
Trees tagged by the Contractor or the Superintendent for retention shall be confirmed for retention with the Superintendent .
HOLD POINT .
Clearing shall be in accordance with Specification CLEARING. . A nominal width of the work site shall be cleared along the fence alignment prior to starting the fencing works .
The width of clearing for fencing shall not exceed three metres either side of the fence through areas of natural vegetation or as directed by the Superintendent .
Width of Clearing .
Where applicable clearing operations shall be undertaken in accordance with the procedures for dieback control as specified in Specification ENVIRONMENT .
Dieback Control .
Topsoil removal shall be undertaken in accordance with Specification EARTHWORKS. . EXCAVATION .
Excavated material for fencing and foundations shall be stockpiled for use as backfill around the fencing and foundations .
Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Excess material or excavation material which the Superintendent may deem to be unsuitable for use in fence foundations or as backfill around fencing and foundations shall be excavated as directed by the Superintendent and shall be removed to spoil areas in accordance with Specification EARTHWORKS . .
The void created from excavation of unsuitable material shall be backfilled with suitable fill material in accordance with this specification or as directed by the Superintendent and compacted in accordance with Clause .. .
ACCEPTANCE OF BEARING SURFACES TO CARRY LOADS .
Where foundations have been excavated all the soil below the founding level shall be compacted. . Undisturbed soil below footings shall be proof compacted with a plate compactor and disturbed soil below foundations shall be compacted to a minimum dry density ratio of and tested in accordance with WA .. .
When foundations in Perth sands have been excavated the Contractor shall compact the bearing surface and test the compaction with a Standard Perth Falling Weight Penetrometer in accordance with AS F. .
The minimum acceptable blow count is blows per mm for the whole of the first mm depth for all footings . .
If the soil below the founding level does not meet the requirements of this Clause it shall be compacted until it complies or replaced in accordance with Clause .. . FOUNDATION IMPROVEMENT .
If the foundation material is deemed by the Superintendent as unsuitable for fence foundation the soil shall be either replaced as per Clause .
or by compacted layers of sand fill satisfying the requirements of Clause .. .
The thickness of each layer of foundation improvement material shall be limited to enable the specified compaction to be obtained for the full depth of the layer for the equipment being used and in any case shall not exceed mm before compaction . .
The foundation improvement material shall be tested to ensure compliance with Clause .. . PROTECTION OF BEARING SURFACES .
The exposed bearing surface at the bottom of each excavation shall be adequately protected from disturbance by the Contractors operations or by the action of stormwater or ground water .
Protection .
Any material at the bottom of an excavation which becomes unsuitable shall be removed and replaced with fill complying with Clause .
and compacted in accordance with Clause .
or replaced by additional blinding concrete .
Replacement Material Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Any disturbed surface may be lightly watered and compacted with a hand operated mechanical compactor .
Disturbed Surface .
BACKFILLING .. GENERAL .
Backfilling around fencing and foundations shall be in accordance with levels shown on the Drawings using suitable fill material excavated from the foundations . .
The fill shall be placed carefully so as not to damage the fencing and concrete foundations . .
Fill shall be placed in continuous horizontal layers of not more than mm uncompacted thickness and each layer shall be separately compacted to a similar density to the surrounding material .
Layer Thickness ..
SUITABLE FILL MATERIAL .
Suitable fill material shall meet the requirements of Specification EARTHWORKS. . DAMAGED AREAS .
All necessary precautions shall be taken so as to prevent damage to growing trees and shrubs outside designated areas and to selected trees within areas designated for clearing .
In the event of any unauthorised damage to vegetation areas rehabilitation shall be arranged as directed by the Superintendent at the Contractors expense . .
The exact location of all services shall be established onsite prior to the commencement of the Works .
Excavation to locate services shall be by shovel or by hand to avoid any damage or disruption to the service .
Services .
The Superintendent shall arrange for the repair of damage to services not made good by the Contractor and deduct the costs of repair from payment due to the Contractor. . Damage to private property or other public facilities shall be rectified by the Contractor to an acceptable standard at no cost to the Principal .
. . NOT USED CONSTRUCTION .
MATERIALS STORAGE .
All fencing materials shall be stored in a manner that will not damage the material. . EQUIPMENT .
Industry standard equipment shall be provided for the execution of the Works and shall be maintained in a safe operating condition at all times .
Standard Equipment Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The Contractor shall use an approved friction type wire strainer incorporating nonscarring wire grip and a tension gauge with calibrating springs for measurement of tension during straining of wires .
Wire Strainer .
SURVEY CONTROL .
The fence alignment shall be set out in accordance with the Drawings .
The provision of any additional markers and sight pegs shall be the responsibility of the Contractor. . Survey marks shall not be removed or disturbed .
Disturbed survey marks shall be reestablished in accordance with Specification GENERAL REQUIREMENTS and at no cost to the Principal . .
EXISTING FENCES .
Existing fence shall not be cut without first being tied back to a strainer post .
Electrified fences shall be reconnected into existing systems . .
Arrangements shall be made at the Contractors own expense for the removal and disposal of redundant fencing including the pulling out of timber and steel posts stumps and strainers rolling up of all prefabricated wire netting plain and barbed wire into bundles demolition of brick limestone fibre cement and steel sheet fencing excavation of concrete and the complete clean up and removal from site .
Footing post and strainer holes shall be backfilled using suitable fill material to ground level .
Removal .
CONSTRUCTION TOLERANCES .
Sections of fence between changes in horizontal direction shall be straight . .
The fence shall be fully constructed within the road reserve .
No part of the fence shall be constructed beyond the road reserve boundary unless specified on the Drawings . .
The following tolerances shall apply a .
Plan tolerances shall be within mm of the alignment shown on Drawings .
Walls b .
Height mm c. Cross section mm d. Verticality mm per m e. Position in line mm Fencing f. Vertical g. Fabric width mm Chainwire Mesh h. Panel mm i. Vertical Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name j. Footing dimensions mm Footings k. Size mm Limestone Blocks .
WATERWAY CROSSINGS .
Waterway crossings shall be erected at the positions where the fence crosses gullies drains and streams and shall be in accordance with the Drawings. . EARTHING SYSTEM ISOLATION .
Wire fencing in close proximity to high voltage power lines shall be protected with an earthing system isolation in accordance with ASNZS and Western Power requirements as specified on the Drawings or as otherwise directed by the Superintendent . .
CONCRETE WORKS .. GENERAL .
The construction of concrete elements of fencing shall be carried out to the dimensions shown on the Drawings .
Concrete used for the construction of the concrete elements shall comply with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS . .
The Contractor shall advise the Superintendent of the time and date of concrete placement not less than hours prior to any proposed placement .
HOLD POINT ..
STRIP FOOTING CONTROL JOINTS .
Control joints shall be constructed at maximum intervals of metres or at the locations shown on the Drawings. . Materials used for the joints such as dowels grease caps and Fortecon layers and installation details shall be in accordance with the Drawings . .
BRICK AND LIMESTONE BLOCK WORK .. GENERAL .
Bricks and limestone blocks shall be stacked on supports clear of the ground and kept dry free from dust dirt and staining and shall be covered with tarpaulins or plastic sheeting. . Bricks and limestone blocks shall not be laid in wet weather . .
The works shall be set out accurately plumb and properly bonded according to the Drawings with no part rising more than mm above the adjacent unfinished brickwork .
Corners and other advanced rising work shall be racked .
Setting Out .
Bricks and limestone blocks moved after initial laying shall be relaid in fresh mortar .
Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
New brick and limestone block work shall be temporarily braced to withstand lateral loads . .
Unless otherwise shown on the Drawings brickwork shall be built using a gauge of courses to mm. . All walls shall be built in stretcher bond unless otherwise shown on the Drawings .
Brickwork Bond .
The first bed joint shall be laid on footings using a full bed of mortar .
..
JOINTS .
Bricks and limestone blocks shall be laid on a full bed of mortar with frogs if any uppermost and perpends filled with mortar . .
Joints in brickwork shall be formed uniformly in external facework to suit the gauge and match existing joints as follows Joint Finishes a. Facework to be rendered or plastered shall have joints raked to mm depth .
b. Facework to be exposed to view shall have joints raked or rolled as shown on the Drawings .
c. Facework not exposed to view shall have joints cut off flush . .
Joints in limestone blocks external facework shall be formed uniformly to suit the gauge and match existing unless otherwise specified .
Joints shall be worked with the jointing tool to a dense smooth finish. . Mortar joints in limestone blockwork shall be mm nominal depth or width and shall be finished flush with the exposed face of the fence .
..
BRICK FACEWORK .
Facework shall be set out to suit bends and to avoid cutting of bricks. . Facework shall start approximately two courses below adjacent finished ground level. . Facework shall be laid to avoid changes of colour beyond the range of bricks in the approved sample panel. . Perpends in alternate courses shall be kept in vertical alignment .
..
BRICK DAMP PROOF COURSE .
Damp proof courses if required are shown on the Drawings .
Dampproof course additives shall be used in accordance with manufacturers published recommendations . .
Additives shall be mixed with mortar and applied from the footing to the top joint of the first course immediately above ground .
Location Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ..
BRICK AND BLOCK WORK CLEANING .
Brick and limestone block work shall be cleaned on completion in such a manner so as to protect adjacent surfaces including joints from cleaning solutions . .
The Contractor shall seek approval from the Superintendent before commencement of cleaning works .
HOLD POINT .
Joints shall not be scrubbed during cleaning works . .
The brick manufacturer and limestone block manufacturersupplier shall be consulted before attempting to remove any unusual stains . .
Brick and limestone block work shall be washed with water after cleaning and surplus water shall be mopped off with a clean sponge . .
The brick and limestone block work shall first be drenched with water before applying cleaning solution to remove mortar droppings from the facework .
..
BRICK MASONRY CONTROL JOINTS .
Control joints shall be installed at a maximum distance of metres unless otherwise shown on the Drawings. . Control joints shall consist of galvanised expansion ties backing material and sealant as specified on the Drawings. . Materials used for masonry control joints and installation details shall be in accordance with the Drawings . .
TIMBER WORKMANSHIP .. STACKING OF SAWN TIMBER .
Immediately on delivery sawn timber shall be stacked off the ground on suitable bedlogs spaced such as to prevent warping .
Stacking .
Sawn timber shall be stacked so that there is a minimum clear air space of mm between pieces of timber to allow for proper ventilation and seasoning .
.. CARPENTRY .
The whole of the timber work shall be executed to the best standard of workmanship for fence construction and shall be in accordance with AS . .
Unless otherwise specified or shown on the Drawings each piece of timber shall be without joints for its full length and shall have the ends sawn square and wrought perfectly true at all contact surfaces. . FIBRE CEMENT FENCING .
Fibre cement sheets shall be handled and stored with due care to ensure edges and corners are protected from chipping .
Handling and Storage Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Prior to installation the Contractor shall inspect all fibre cement sheeting for damage .
Damaged sheets shall not be incorporated into the Works and be replaced as directed by the Superintendent at no cost to the Principal .
HOLD POINT .
Fibre cement fencing shall be installed in accordance with the Drawings and the manufacturers published specifications .
Installation .
All cutting of fibre cement sheeting shall be carried out in openair situations or in wellventilated space in accordance with the manufacturers published specifications and in compliance with recommended safe working practices .
Cutting .
STEEL SHEET FENCING .
Prior to installation the Contractor shall inspect all steel sheeting for damage .
Damaged sheets shall not be incorporated into the Works and be replaced as directed by the Superintendent at no cost to the Principal .
HOLD POINT .
Steel sheet fencing shall be installed in accordance with the Drawings and the manufacturers published specifications. . CHAINWIRE FENCING .. TUBULAR STEEL FRAMING .
All strainer and post assemblies with inclined bracing struts including fence ends corners other horizontal changes in direction gateways and water crossings shall be erected in accordance with the Drawings. . All unbraced intermediate posts shall be erected in accordance with the Drawings. . All strainers and posts shall be cast in insitu concrete in accordance with the Drawings and shall be capped. . Rails shall be screwed and socketed to strainers and posts in accordance with the Drawings. . All strainers posts horizontal bracing and rails shall have dimensions and spacing in accordance with the Drawings. . Post spacings may be altered by plus or minus .
metre in those sections of ground where localised rock is encountered .
Where large rocks are encountered post holes are to be drilled to the required depth in accordance with the Drawings or as otherwise directed by the Superintendent .
Rock .. CHAINWIRE MESH .
Chainwire mesh shall be fastened to end posts and rails with wire on each diamond in accordance with the Drawings . .
Mesh shall be laced to intermediate posts if on the inside of posts at changes in horizontal direction otherwise all other mesh shall be fixed at mid height with tie wire in accordance with the Drawings .
Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
All chainwire mesh shall have top and bottom selvedges knuckled. . All railless chainwire mesh fences shall have three strainer wires top bottom and central with the exception of mm high chainwire mesh fence which shall have two strainer wires top and bottom .
Mesh shall be fastened to strainer wires with galvanised netting clips .
.. STRAINER WIRE .
Helicoil strainer wire shall be tensioned between anchorage points at all changes in horizontal direction and at maximum spacings in accordance with the Drawings .
End posts shall be propped during tensioning if used as an anchorage point .
.. BARBED WIRE .
High tensile galvanised barbed wire shall be installed and fastened to each post in accordance with the Drawings .
..
TIE WIRE .
Standard galvanised tie wire shall be used for connections in accordance with the Drawings . .
AGRICULTURAL FENCING .. STRAINERS .
All strainer assemblies including end corner single strainers and strainers with inclined compression struts at horizontal changes in directions gateways and water crossings shall be erected in accordance with the Drawings . .
Timber strainers shall be driven sunk or buried into the ground to depths in accordance with the Drawings. . Steel strainers shall be capped and cast in insitu concrete in accordance with the Drawings .
.. POSTS .
All posts shall be erected in accordance with the Drawings .
Steel posts are to be capped. . Posts shall be either driven or sunk into the ground at the minimum depth below natural surface as detailed and spaced apart at maximum distances in accordance with the Drawings .
Depth and Spacing .
Post spacings may be altered by plus or minus .
metre in those sections of ground where localised rock is encountered .
Where large rocks are encountered post holes are to be drilled to the required depth in accordance with the Drawings or as otherwise directed by the Superintendent .
Rock Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .. GALVANISED PREFABRICATED WIRE .
Prefabricated wire shall be fastened to each post at vertical locations with a minimum of three wires tied per post top bottom and central or in accordance with the Drawings. . Bottom wires shall be above the ground surface in accordance with the Drawings .
Where surface irregularities occur additional posts shall be placed between specified post spacings as necessary to ensure clearance requirements for bottom wires as specified are achieved .
Ground Clearances .
Prefabricated wire shall be attached to line posts with .mm high tension standard galvanised plain wire or purpose made tie fasts or post clips in accordance with the Drawings. . Prefabricated wire shall be attached to plain barbed wire or Horse Sighter wire above utilising one coupling clip per span or as otherwise directed .
.. BARBED WIRE .
High tensile galvanised barbed wire shall be installed and fastened to each post in the positions specified in the Drawings .
The strained wire shall be tensioned around the strainer and tied off .
..
PLAIN WIRE .
High tensile galvanised plain wire shall be passed through line posts and strained or fastened to line posts after straining in the positions specified in the Drawings .
..
TIE WIRE .
Standard galvanised tie wire shall be used for connections in accordance with the Drawings .
..
HORSE SIGHTER WIRE .
Highdensity polymer monofilament Horse Sighter wire shall be attached to agricultural fencing where required to protect livestock in accordance with the Drawings . .
Horse Sighter wire shall be fastened to posts in accordance with manufacturers published specifications. . Where Horse Sighter wire is to be threaded through posts protective sleeves shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers published specifications .
.. ELECTRIFIED WIRE .
Electrified wire shall be high tensile galvanised wire unless otherwise specified in the Drawings. . Electrified wire shall be fastened to strainers and posts using approved methods in accordance with the Drawings the manufacturers published specifications and satisfying the requirements of ASNZS .
Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Where erecting electric fencing on the border of a public thoroughfare warning signs shall be installed in accordance with ASNZS and in compliance with local authority regulations .
Warning Signs .
STRAINING OF WIRES .
All horizontal wires shall be strained to tensions specified in the Drawings or in accordance with the manufacturers published specifications using a wire strainer as specified at Clause .. . All wires including prefabricated wire shall be strained up to and shall not exceed the manufacturers recommended maximum tensions . .
The Contractor shall take all precautions necessary to avoid kinking and overstraining of the wire during handling and erection. . GATES .
All new gates or gates to be relocated from existing fences shall be installed at locations in accordance with the Drawings or as otherwise detailed in Annexure A. .
The Contractor shall supply all hinges bolts and the like as required in accordance with the Drawings or the manufacturers published specifications. . Gates shall be consistent with the existing fences on either side of the gate unless otherwise directed by the Superintendent. . Strainers posts columns or piers used to support gates shall be positioned in the ground so that gate panels are able to swing freely in both directions and when brought into line do not overlap nor have a gap wider than mm unless otherwise specified in the Drawings or manufacturers published specifications .

any specialized tools gate keys etc .
to the Superintendent. . ASBUILT REQUIREMENTS .

b .

fence wall retaining wall etc .. Specification Fencing Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name c. Date the structure was constructed or installed .

SCOPE .
The work under this specification consists of all operations in the supply and construction of noise walls including earthworks concrete footings and columns and materials for brick and limestone noise wall infill panels. . REFERENCES .
Australian Standards MAIN ROADS Western Australia Standards and MAIN ROADS Western Australia Test Methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
AS MRS or WA .
For convenience the full titles are given below Australian Standards AS Methods of testing soils for engineering purposes AS The specification and supply of concrete AS Concrete structures AS Masonry structures AS Portland cement AustralianNew Zealand Standards ASNZS .
Builtin components for masonry construction ASNZS Masonry Units and Segmental Pavers ASNZS Steel Reinforcing Materials MAIN ROADS Test Methods MRWA .
Dry Density Ratio MRWA .
Chlorides and Total Soluble Salts in Soil and Water MRWA .
Calcium Carbonate Content MAIN ROADS Specifications Specification QUALITY SYSTEMS Specification EARTHWORKS Specification EXCAVATION AND BACKFILL FOR STRUCTURES Specification FALSEWORK Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES Specification FORMWORK Specification STEEL REINFORCEMENT Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS Specification LIMESTONE RETAINING WALLS Specification ANTIGRAFFITI . . NOT USED PRODUCTS AND MATERIALS .
CONCRETE FOOTINGS POSTS AND WALL PANELS .
Concrete used in the construction of footings and any other concrete elements of noise walls shall be in accordance with the Drawings and Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS . .
Concrete used in the construction of posts wall panels and any other major structural concrete elements of noise walls shall be in accordance with the Drawings and Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES. . BRICKS WALL PANELS AND PIERS .
Bricks used in the construction of panels piers and any other brick elements of noise walls shall be clay bricks uniform in shape texture colour and size with sharp arises free from distortion and other defects .
Bricks shall have a minimum compressive strength of MPa .
Brick Properties .
Bricks shall be in accordance with the dimensions and colours as shown on the Drawings .
Dimensions and Colours .
MORTAR .
Mortar shall comply with AS .
Mortar shall consist of part of Portland Cement part of building lime parts of fine aggregate and colouring pigments as required .
The measured parts in mixes shall be mixed mechanically to an even colour and consistency with the minimum amount of water for workability .
Admixtures only when specified shall be used as specified and in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
Mortar colour shall be in accordance with the Drawings .
Colouring pigments shall be thoroughly mixed with the cement before adding other components .
Components and Proportions .
Mortar mixed on site shall be used within minutes of mixing .
Retempering of mortar shall not be permitted .
Any mortar which has begun to set prior to use shall be rejected .
Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
REINFORCING STEEL FOR CONCRETE FOOTINGS POSTS AND WALL PANELS .
Reinforcing steel used in the construction of reinforced concrete footings posts and wall panels and any other reinforced concrete elements of noise walls shall be in accordance with ASNZS and Specification STEEL REINFORCEMENT .
Reinforcement .
The Contractor shall store reinforcing steel above ground level and shall protect it from damage and deterioration. . Reinforcement placed in the Works shall be clean and free from all loose rust millscale dirt grease and other foreign substances which would impair the bond between steel and concrete. . After being placed in position all reinforcement shall be maintained by the Contractor in a clean condition until it is embedded in the concrete. . LIMESTONE BLOCKS .
The stone used for the retaining walls shall be natural or reconstituted limestone with individual blocks being free from any foreign matter shakes pockets veins or other defects and generally sound and clean and of uniform colour and texture .
Limestone Properties .
Limestone blocks shall also be in accordance with the dimensions and colours as shown on the Drawings and conform to the following requirements Quality a. Calcium Carbonate Content minimum by weight in accordance with WA .
Dimensions b .
Dry Density kgm minimum tested by direct measurement the weight of a known size cubecore after oven drying at degrees Celsius for hours c. Unconfined Compression Strength .MPa for natural limestone and .MPa for reconstituted limestone tested using a corecube sample cut to normal test size to be tested for crushing strength d. Dimensions As indicated on the Drawings with a tolerance of mm .
. . NOT USED SAMPLING AND TESTING .
CONCRETE NOISE WALLS SAMPLE PANEL .
The Contractor shall construct an m long full height sample panel of wall as part of the Works for the consideration of the Superintendent to become the approved sample panel .
Further fabrication or installation of noise walls shall not commence until the sample panel has been approved by the Superintendent .
HOLD POINT Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Concrete testing shall be in accordance with Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES . .
BRICK NOISE WALLS BRICKWORK UNITS .
The Contractor shall submit samples of brickwork units with the manufacturers certificate for approval to the Superintendent before placing orders .
The manufacturers certificate shall show compressive strength tensile strength and absorption values of the bricks .
The samples shall indicate the full range of texture and colour and consist of at least six units .
Test certificates for compliance shall be per bricks .
Units built into the Works shall conform to and fall within the range of appearance properties of the approved samples .
HOLD POINT .
BRICK NOISE WALLS MORTAR .
The Contractor shall prepare samples of mortar for brickwork for the approval of the Superintendent .
Mortar used in the Works shall conform to the approved mix and samples as specified on the Drawings .
Samples .
Mortar shall be prepared in accordance with Clause .. Mortar shall be classification M and when tested in accordance with AS shall achieve sufficient compressive strength to meet requirements of Table .
of AS for characteristic compression strength of masonry .
Preparation and Test Results .
The Contractor shall undertake a mortar compression test at the laboratory at the beginning of the Works to establish the compressive strength as required by the Specification .
The Contactor shall undertake mortar compression tests using site mixes on regular bases to maintain the required compressive strength results .
Frequency of testing on site shall be one test every m of wall .
Method of sampling and testing shall be in accordance with AS .
Sampling .
BRICK NOISE WALLS SAMPLE PANEL .
The Contractor shall construct an m long full height sample panel of wall as part of the Works and for the approval of the Superintendent .
Joints shall be finished in accordance with the Drawings .
The Works shall conform to the approved sample panel .
Further brickwork associated with the Works shall not commence until the sample panel has been approved by the Superintendent .
The sample panel may be used as a section of the noise wall .
HOLD POINT .
LIMESTONE NOISE WALLS LIMESTONE BLOCKS .
The Contractor shall submit samples of limestone blocks with the manufacturers certificate for approval to the Superintendent before placing orders .
Testing certificates for compliance to be per blocks for natural limestone and per for reconstituted limestone .
The manufacturers certificate shall show compressive strength dry density and calcium carbonate content values of the blocks .
The samples shall indicate the full range of texture and colour and consist of at least units .
Units built into the Works shall conform to and fall within the range of appearance properties of the approved samples .
HOLD POINT Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
LIMESTONE NOISE WALLS MORTAR .
The Contractor shall prepare samples of mortar for limestone jointing for the approval of the Superintendent .
Mortar used in the Works shall conform to the approved mix and samples as specified on the Drawings .
Samples .
When tested in accordance with AS mortar shall achieve a compressive strength of at least .MPa for samples taken from site mixes and .MPa for samples taken from laboratory mixes .
Test Results .
The Contractor shall undertake a mortar compression test at the laboratory at the beginning of the Works to establish the compressive strength as required by the Specification .
The Contactor shall undertake mortar compression tests using site mixes on regular bases to maintain the required compressive strength results .
Frequency of testing on site shall be one test every m of wall .
Method of sampling and testing shall be in accordance with AS .
Sampling .
LIMESTONE NOISE WALLS SAMPLE PANEL .
The Contractor shall construct an m long full height sample panel of wall as part of the Works and for the approval of the Superintendent .
Joints shall be finished in accordance with the Drawings .
The Works shall conform to the approved sample panel .
Further Works shall not commence until the sample panel has been approved by the Superintendent .
The sample panel may be a section of the retaining wall .
HOLD POINT . . NOT USED OPERATIONS .
EARTHWORKS .
This Section of the Specification covers earthworks for the construction of the noise wall strip footings and includes excavation foundation improvement and backfilling .
Earthworks item shall be carried out as specified hereafter and as detailed on the Drawings. . CLEARING AND TOPSOIL REMOVAL .
The Contractor shall clear a sufficient width of the work site at the wall location prior to starting excavation .
Topsoil in the cleared area shall be removed to a minimum depth of mm by the Contractor and stockpiled for reuse at a location approved by the Superintendent .
The stockpiled topsoil shall be respread by the Contractor over the cleared area to a minimum depth of mm and surplus removed from site. . EXCAVATION .
The Contractor shall excavate to the lines and grades shown on the Drawings .
The actual dimensions for excavation shall in all cases be no more than that required for the placement of protective works if necessary and any working space required .
Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The Contractor shall stockpile excavated material for use as backfill. . Any excavated material considered unsuitable by the Superintendent shall be removed to the nominated spoil site . .
If excavation below the footing is required it shall be backfilled and compacted with embankment quality material in accordance with Specification EARTHWORKS .
The backfill shall be compacted to at least the density of the surrounding material if not specified on the Drawings . .
ACCEPTANCE OF BEARING SURFACES TO CARRY LOADS .
When foundations have been excavated all the soil below the strip footings shall be compacted by the Contractor .
Bearing Surface .
Undisturbed soil below footings shall be proof compacted by the Contractor with a plate compactor and disturbed soil below foundations shall be compacted to a minimum dry density of to the minimum depth as given on the Drawings and tested in accordance with WA .. .
When foundations in Perth sands have been excavated the Contractor shall compact the bearing surface and test the compaction in accordance with Soil strength and consolidation tests Determination of the penetration resistance of a soil Perth sand penetrometer test as set out in AS The minimum acceptable blow count is blows per mm for the whole depth as shown on the Drawings . .
Testing frequency shall be test per m of wall length or test per wall panel whichever is the greater frequency . .
If the soil does not meet the requirements of this Clause it shall be compacted by the Contractor until it complies unless otherwise directed by the Superintendent. . FOUNDATION IMPROVEMENT .
If directed by the Superintendent the soil shall be excavated and either re compacted by the Contractor if it meets the requirements of Clause .
or replaced by compacted layers of suitable fill satisfying the requirements of Clause ..
The excavation shall be carried out to a depth as directed by the Superintendent . .
The thickness of each layer of backfill material shall be limited to enable the specified compaction to be obtained for the full depth of the layer for the equipment being used and in any case shall not exceed mm before compaction . .
The backfilled material shall be retested by the Contractor to ensure compliance with Clause .. . PROTECTION OF BEARING SURFACES .
The exposed bearing surface at the bottom of each excavation shall be adequately protected from disturbance by the Contractors operations or by the action of stormwater or ground water .
Protection Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Any material at the bottom of an excavation which becomes unsuitable shall be removed and replaced with fill complying with Clause .
and compacted in accordance with Clause .
or replaced by additional blinding concrete. . Alternatively the disturbed surface may be lightly watered and compacted with a hand operated mechanical compactor until it complies with Clause .. . BACKFILLING .. GENERAL .
The Contractor shall backfill around foundations and noise walls as shown on the Drawings using suitable material excavated from the foundations unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent . .
The fill shall be placed carefully by the Contractor so as not to damage the wall and concrete foundations . .
The Contractor shall place fill in continuous horizontal layers of not more than mm uncompacted thickness and shall separately compact each layer to a similar density to the surrounding material .
..
SUITABLE FILL MATERIAL .
Suitable fill material shall meet the requirements of Specification EARTHWORKS. . UNSUITABLE AND EXCESS MATERIAL .
All unsuitable and excess material shall be removed from site and disposed of by the Contractor . .
CONCRETE WORKS .
The Contractor shall carry out the construction of concrete footings to the dimensions shown on the Drawings .
Concrete Classes used for the construction of the concrete footings shall be as shown on the Drawings and conform to AS .
The concrete construction requirements shall comply with Specification CONCRETE GENERAL WORKS . .
The Contractor shall advise the Superintendent of the time and date of concrete placement not less than hours prior to any proposed placement .
HOLD POINT .
FOOTING TOLERANCES a .
Variation of dimensions in plan and elevation mm b. Misplacement of eccentricity of centreline mm c. Variation in specified level mm Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
STRIP FOOTING CONTROL JOINTS .
The Contractor shall construct construction joints at maximum intervals of m and at the locations shown on the Drawings. . Materials used for the joints such as dowels grease caps and Fortecon layers and installation details shall be in accordance with the Drawings . .
CONCRETE NOISE WALL PANELS AND POSTS .
The Contractor shall carry out the construction of major concrete noise wall elements such as panels and posts to the dimensions shown on the Drawings .
Concrete Classes used for the construction of the concrete elements shall be as shown on the Drawings and conform to AS .
The concrete construction requirements shall comply with Specification CONCRETE FOR STRUCTURES . .
CONCRETE WALL TOLERANCES .
Concrete noise walls shall be constructed to the following tolerances a .
Variation from vertical or specified batter mm b. Misplacement or eccentricity of centreline mm c. Variation from specified level of surfaces mm d. Horizontal deviation bow mm over a m straight edge .
CONCRETE WALL PANEL SURFACE FINISH .
Concrete wall panel surface shall be Class grey finish in accordance with AS in the first instance unless specified otherwise on the Drawings .
Initial Surface Finish .
Further surface treatment such as painting shall be preceded by cleaning by water blasting. . Further surface treatment such as painting system patterns textures etc .
shall be specified in detail by the designer to the specific individual requirements of the Project .
Further Surface Treatment .
BRICKWORK .. GENERAL .
The Contractor shall stack bricks on supports clear of the ground and keep them dry and free from dust dirt and staining and shall cover them with tarpaulins or plastic sheeting. . Bricks shall not be laid in wet weather . .
The Contractor shall set out the Works according to the Drawings with no part rising more than mm above the adjacent unfinished brickwork .
Corners and other advanced rising work shall be racked by the Contractor .
Setting Out Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
Bricks moved after initial laying shall be relaid in fresh mortar by the Contractor. . New brickwork shall be temporarily braced by the Contractor to withstand lateral loads . .
The Contractor shall build brickwork having mm bricks to a gauge of courses to mm . .
The Contractor shall build all walls in stretcher bond unless otherwise shown on the Drawings .
Brickwork Bond .
The Contractor shall lay the first bed joint on footings and solid blocks on a full bed of mortar .
..
JOINTS .
The Contractor shall lay bricks on a full bed of mortar with frogs if any uppermost and shall fill perp ends solidly with mortar . .
The Contractor shall form joints uniformly in external facework to suit gauge and to match existing unless otherwise specified and shall work joints with the jointing tool to a dense smooth finish . .
The Contractor shall cut off joints flush in walls that are not exposed to view and will not be rendered or plastered .
The Contractor shall rake out joints to mm depth in brickwork to be rendered or plastered .
The Contractor shall roll joints in facing bricks or walls exposed to view .
Joint Finishes .. FACEWORK .
The Contractor shall set out face work to suit bends and to avoid cutting of bricks .
Facework .
The Contractor shall start face work approximately two courses below adjacent finished ground level . .
The Contractor shall lay face brick to avoid changes of colour beyond the range of bricks in the approved sample panel . .
The Contractor shall keep perp ends in alternate courses in vertical alignment .
..
DAMP PROOF COURSE .
The Contractor shall use Cementaid Everdure Caltite additive to provide a dampproof course . .
The Contractor shall mix the additive with the mortar and apply it from the footing to the top joint of the first course immediately above ground .
Location .. BRICKWORK CLEANING .
The Contractor shall clean brickwork on completion and shall take care to protect adjacent surfaces from cleaning solutions .
Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name .
The Contractor shall not apply cleaning solutions to joints and shall not scrub joints . .
The Contractor shall consult the brick manufacturer before attempting to remove unusual stains and shall obtain approval from the Superintendent before commencing cleaning .
Brick Stains .
The Contractor shall wash brickwork with water after cleaning and shall mop off surplus water with a clean sponge. . To remove mortar droppings from clay brickwork the Contractor shall drench the brickwork with water before applying the cleaning solution .
..
BRICK MASONRY CONTROL JOINTS .
The Contractor shall install control joints at a maximum distance of m or at the locations shown on the Drawings. . Control joints shall consist of galvanised expansion ties backing material and sealant as specified on the Drawings. . Materials used for masonry control joints and installation details shall be in accordance with the Drawings. . LIMESTONE BLOCKS .. GENERAL .
The Contractor shall stack limestone blocks on supports clear of the ground and keep them dry and free from dust dirt and staining and shall cover them with tarpaulins or plastic sheeting. . Limestone blocks shall not be laid in wet weather . .
The Contractor shall set out the Works according to the Drawings . .
The first course of units shall be laid on top of the prepared bedding sand and be levelled and checked for alignment. . Additional courses shall be laid in squared work with joints fully mortared and levelled and checked for alignment . .
The walls shall be laid with a front face batter of HV .
..
JOINTS .
The Contractor shall lay blocks on a full bed of mortar and shall fill perp ends solidly with mortar .
Wall Joints .
Mortar joints shall be nominally mm in width . .
The joint shall be raked back from the block face so that the joint can be faced at a later date with cream coloured mortar to match the limestone colour .
Specification Noise Walls Issued Document No DXXXXXX Page of Contract No XXXXX Contract Name ..
FACING .
The Contractor shall prepare trial mortar mixes for facing to match the limestone colour .
Trial mortar mixes shall be prepared until a suitable match is obtained as approved by the Superintendent . .
The facing shall occur in a single operation after the wall has been completed and all movement has been taken up . .
The exposed face shall be cleaned of all excess mortar as the work progresses .
.. FINISHING TOLERANCES .
Limestone retaining walls shall be laid to the following tolerances a. Horizontal position of any element in plan mm b .
Maximum deviation from plumb mm per m height c. Maximum horizontal deviation mm over a m AS App H edge d. Deviation in any bed joint from horizontal mm in any m or mm total e. Deviation in thickness of bed joint mm or perp end f. Maximum step between blocks mm block to block . . NOT USED AS BUILT AND HANDOVER REQUIREMENTS . . NOT USED CONTRACT SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS . . The proposed documents with tracked changes shall be submitted to the Project Manager for review prior to printing the final batch of documents .
